Summary: Overall an average stay since we spent most of the day at Disneyland/CA Adventures. Beds are comfy but do squeak a lot. Breakfast doesn't have too many options and we ended up eating at Starbucks. For the price and distance to park it's a great stay. Our main complaints was that one not a big deal but the safe didn't work and was broken and there was no turn down service. The biggest caution is to ask for a room not facing the highway since it's very loud at night. We had no idea and were not able to change our rooms.
Room tip: Ask for a room not facing the highway.

Summary: Maritza Rocks!!! Anthony is Awesome!!! Adell is Cool!!!  I needed to have my 3 rooms on the same floor and if possible to have 2 of them connect to each other. I understand how difficult it can be to have connecting rooms so I was hopeful. When I called, Maritza answered the phone and was SUPER friendly and willing to assist. I explained to her that I would be arriving by 2 PM and was hoping for the above as well as at least 1 room to have early check-in. Maritza not only took care of me, she amazed me!! She was able to secure 3 rooms on the same floor all close to each other and 2 of them were also connecting as requested. After that, she informed me that she could have all 3 rooms available for my early arrival as well.   When I arrived Maritza was assisting another guest and
Room tip: Rooms all have fridges so get snacks before coming in. They are close to 7-11, Chevron, and a...
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the excellent feedback. We are happy that you enjoyed your experience with us. Our team always strives to go above and beyond to ensure our guests receive the best possible service they can so it pleases us we were able to do so with you. We'll be sure to share your praises with them. Thank you again for sharing your feedback

Summary Heading: Awful service not recommended foe business.
Summary: Not recommended for business travel.  The good: the room was reasonably comfy, clean, with typical amenities. Reasonably quiet.  The bad: had a reservation and arrived for check in at 5 pm. Exhausted and needed to work before dinner. No rooms available (?!) and had to wait. The lobby is small, cold and uncomfortable, nowhere to sit with phone plugged in. Restaurant closed on Monday. While I waited they checked 2 people in ahead of me. Annoying but whatever they finally check me in. I go To room on 3rd floor and oh great neither room key works &$@#. Back down to get new keys right as the front desk is handing my work colleague her key-for the same room. OMFG. But I am strong, I am patient, I’m not a Karen. So they give me a new room and finally get settled.  After a long work day
Room tip: Avoid for business, no restaurants within walking distance, too far from convention center.

Summary: We stayed 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. The location is okay but not walking distance to the parks. They do have transportation but there is a charge for it. Nothing special about the hotel itself but it was sufficient for what we needed. My only real complaint was they seemed to be hoarding the towels. We checked in and had 3 in the bathroom. The next day I asked the front desk for more towels. I requested 6 because my daughter and I each use 2 and then my husband and son needed 1 as well. I was told they could only give me 4 “since that’s all that’s supposed to be in each room” implying that we had too many people in our room. I was stunned. I’ve never encountered this and thought it was extremely rude. We made so with our 4 towels but come on. Also, they need a pool
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your experience with Sonesta Anaheim Resort Area. Your comments are important to us, as they provide us an opportunity to better serve you. We look forward to ensuring we can exceed your expectations in the future.

Summary Heading: Quite average but practical for Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is very clean and super well located. In addition, the ART shuttle for Disney and other recreational offerings in Anaheim stopped directly at the hotel and was visited frequently.  The bedroom and bathroom are both very large.  The swimming pool is large and clean.  Very close to the freeway, which means easy access but be warned, you can hear vehicles throughout the night.  We did experience some issues : - The wifi is one of the worst I've experienced. It is slow (less than 0.5mbs), and often unavailable altogether. - The walls are not well sound-proofed. Our neighbour set her alarm every night at around 1 am, and we could very clearly hear it. One night, her television was on for hours, and we could hear the words from the show she was watching. The sound issue is
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your experience with Sonesta Anaheim Resort Area. Your comments are important to us, as they provide us an opportunity to better serve you.  I  regret that we were not able to fully meet your expectations. I can assure you your feedback has been shared with the appropriate departments so we can address the issues you experienced.  We appreciate you sharing your concerns, and we look forward to ensuring we can exceed your expectations in the future.

Summary: One of the most beautiful places to visit got in at 1:30 at night staff was excellent on helping me and in the morning hun Tiana Luis that was the staff that attended us at the time friendly willing to help I recommend this place to anyone ask for towels soon as I walked out they were there I could only give it five star cuz that's what they put down but I would give it 10

The room was clean and family friendly. It had a shower, but not a tub. Normally a shower only is fine, but we had little ones that needed a tub. The shuttle was conveniently located and easy to take to Disneyland, but you need to make sure you  download the app prior to using. The staff was very helpful.

Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Here on our Honeymoon. It started off that we had a broken window that would not close. A toilet that was broken. A tap in the bathroom that never runs cold. Oh and we are staying next door to a dog that barks from 4am every morning.   No housekeeping. Had to ask more paper cups. More towels. No one has been over to change our bins/bedding (been here now 4/7 days).   It’s dirty. It’s old. It’s broken.   Location is good - right near Disney.
Room tip: Plan the shuttle bus in advance

Summary Heading: Horrible Stay at the Sonesta Resort Anaheim
Summary: Absolutely the WORST hotel experience I've ever had this past weekend. I suggested my mom book this hotel while visiting me because it seemed nice from pictures and had decent reviews and was a reasonable price........Big mistake. We get there and immediately notice an odd smell coming from our bathroom, seemingly old water from the pipes. We request a new room in the morning and they tell us they might be able to accommodate us and will let us know later that day. We arrive again that evening and they say they're overbooked and can't move us. Meanwhile, the elevator is stuck. It won't move. The manager (idk his name) was clearly trying to fix things, but not addressing anyone trying to get to their room. I watched my mom ask the manager a question and the manager COMPLETELY

I booked a room with this hotel for a 2 day job I had at Angel Stadium. Went to check in and was informed that my Bancorp Bank backed bank account was not acceptable because Chime isnt a major bank and that they considered it the same as paying with Venmo. Nowhere was this stated when I booked the room with this  same debit card. Funny that my bank account was fine to pay for the room with, but not good enough to pay a deposit with. So, my wife calls and offers to use her credit card. They still say that they can't take a deposit because she can't physically show them the card  Because of this I not only have to wait 10 days for a refund. But I also lost  $300+ in wages because I have to cancel my 2nd day of work.   On top of this the entire front desk staff made me feel like I

This place is going Hold triple the amount of your stay for 10 business days. My room was $126 & they are holding a charge for $126 & another for $226, lady said they will release the funds in 10 business days... How can you hold my money for 10 business days

The worst cleaning service I ever received. We were a 4 member family with 2 kids staying 14 days and they only clean the room 2 times even when I called to request a clean service said that they don’t offer that after complain they did 2 cleans because the standard is zero cleaning

Summary Heading: It's more about the location than the amenities
Summary: More of a 3.5 but rounded up. Locations location location. With access to Anaheim Transportation to Disneyland & connecting transportation. No airport shuttle, Lyft can surge to $50 either way from SNA to hotel. Plenty of open self Parking is $12/night. Currently offers dinner at the Burger Place inside hotel from 5pm to 10pm, pool open late. Formally the Holiday Day Inn (ING) (and shows). No hot breakfast option during Covid-19 Restrictions. Very polite & helpful staff. Vending machines on odd floors and in convivence "store" in lobby. Gym & PC's available for use. Had to request coffee cups and a few items for the room. Was provided with fridge, microwave, Kureg and pods, alcohol wipes, hand soap, body wash, shampoo/conditioner and plenty of towels and air dryer, safe, & iron.

This is obviously a new addition to the Sonesta group. Temporary signage, untrained staff, and room without standard items. Our group had 3 rooms and each had missing items like soap, hair dryer,  irons, etc.  One room had to be changed due to a leaking  unit.

Summary Heading: New ownership ruined a great hotel
Summary: I stayed at this hotel under prior ownership multiple times a year for the last few years when visiting Disney.   When COVID restrictions were lifted I booked a trip and didn't think to check and see how my favorite hotel was doing under new ownership.  Sonesta clearly has no interesting in running a quality establishment.  Rooms were not cleaned daily and we were not informed of it.  Lobby, hallways, and Elevators were not cleaned. Dirt and debris everywhere.  Walls were filthy.  Zero carts for luggage on check in or check out.   Fire alarm on our second night required evacuation.  No staff came out to tell us what was going on.  Fire department comes outside and tells us that is okay to come back and the problem was some maintenance issue that they regular have to come to this

Summary Heading: Good Thing We Only Stayed One Night
Summary: 3 of us stayed in a two double-bed room, decent sized room but was a little dirty in the bathroom, and there was no body soap or shampoo in the shower. Went to the lobby bathroom and no soap in any of the pumps.   I don’t know, I’m pretty simple so just clean and well supplied would have been nice.

All around amazing clean rooms, lovely staff, always supper friendly made sure we were well and our stay was going well. This is definitely my to go Hotel when I bring my family to Disney. Loved it!!!

Summary Heading: It's closed for good - your reservation will be a Staybridge Suites Anaheim Resort Area stay.
Summary: Oh the memories. I booked this for one last time and even got a confirmation number, only to find on arrival that Staybridge will service Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort guests... Not that I'm complaining -- I've written a review years ago about how great Staybridge Suites Anaheim Resort Area was, and it's also closing by end of year. When I checked in at Staybridge, the reservation was completely transferred into a new confirmation at Staybridge.  I'm still staying there right now, but letting you all know. Let me know if you have any questions.   Summary: Reservations here will be transferred to Staybridge Suites Anaheim Resort Area, which will later be decommissioned as an IHG property. :(
Manager Response: Hello DisneyPhans,  Thank you for choosing us through the years and for taking the time to leave us feedback. The hotel will remain open and keep all paying reservations until 30 November 2020. You can contact the hotel directly at 714 748 7777 or Sales.HIAnaheim@ihg.com if you have additional questions.   Best regards,  Clayton G. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Family of 4 including 2 adults and a 4yo and 9 yo stayed here from March 7-10th. The kids loved the pool ( its shared with staybridge hotel next door) but it was never full. The breakfast was delicious , for adults you had a choice of an entree or buffet. The kids had their own menu. There is no hotel shuttle to disney but there is a bus stop outside which takes you to disney . Many families used this , i dont know the cost as we had friends drop us off.  The hotel is right off the freeway and there is easy access to anything you can think of. The room are updated and clean and we have zero complaints!

My first time staying at this property, right from the beginning the service was fantastic and very friendly. The rooms are nice, very clean, and the beds are extremely comfortable. We lucked out and got a view of the fireworks at Disney each night at 9:30 pm. The hotel is very close to the airport, was a great deal quieter than I anticipated with all of the families staying there. There are restaurants within walking distance, and we even walked to Disneyland! I never did go in the pool but I did go in the hot tub and it was quite enjoyable.

Great Location ,only 11 miles from the John Wayne Airport and  so closed to free way ,and only 10/15 mins walk to Disneyland  Resort ,and down town Disneyland ,and the  Anaheim Convention Center , very clean family friendly hotel  , around 264 rooms to stay ,they have a good restaurant by the lobby and a small lounge ,only sever  breakfast and dinner only , ( about a years ago ,they change kids  age from 11 to 5 , eat FREE ! that is a lot of saving ! )but they do have a small counter service for  beverages ,and sandwich ,the rooms is very fresh and very comfortable with soft bedding , bathroom is clean and no hairs to be find ,girlfriend#5 very happy with the sizeof the  room , if  people following  my reviews , I do not give out too many 5 stars  (EXCELLENT ) to any hotel in

Very Clean rooms, efficient service, good gym, with nice pool and a good price.     We walked to Disneyland which was super easy and convenient in under half an hour.    Highly Recommended for Disneyland visits.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 days on a business trip.  It was only a short about 20 minutes from John Wayne airport and close to Disneyland.   My company conducted a training at the location.  I had a great check in experience that was fast which is always a plus. Jimmy greeted me at the front desk.  He was friendly and knowledgeable and had the best southern hospitality.  At one point throughout my stay I was in contact with several of the front desk staff and they all had the same professional and friendly attitude.  The banquet set up staff that I worked with, Aaron and Maria were both amazing!  They worked well together and made sure that everything was set up for the training and the snacks/refreshments were stocked at all times.  I'm truly appreciative for the excellent

Rooms were 5 star Staff were friendly and very helpfull Food was fantastic You get a coffee machine in  your room a microwave  The burger resturant was amazing Marsia on the front counter was kind helpfull and her service was 5 Star

From beginning to end I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I love my room to be cold and the AC was able to keep me comfortable !  Not a long Lyft ride to the convention center. Room was clean. I’m a Diet Coke junkie and they kept me happy with a lot of Diet Coke to go cups.

My wife and I stayed here recently while visiting Disneyland.  By far the nicest HI we've stayed.  Clean, modern, super facilities.  A 5-7 minute walk to the park entrance.  Employees were all great, but want to give a special mention to Tyler, at the Front Desk.  Tremendously helpful at check-in, and just a pleasure to visit with during our stay.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Disneyland on a Budget
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights.  Very friendly staff.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Room was small (we had a double stroller and it was a tight squeeze) but what I would expect from a budget hotel.  Kids eat free with paying adult at the hotel restaurant and the food was decent. In the morning there is a coffee stand.  Getting to Disneyland was easy.  ART picks up right at the hotel and is the only hotel stop on the line. You can also buy bus tickets right at the bus stop. Most of the time the drivers went straight to Disneyland with no stops in between.  Same thing going back to the hotel.  I recommend texting ART to find bus times, that seemed to be the most accurate to find out when the next buses were coming.  Best part is this hotel is half the price of many others.  Would

Stayed here for 2 nights as part of an ATI tour. The room was clean and well equipped. The staff were friendly and helpful. The Burger Theory restaurant attached to the hotel provides good but basic menu of burgers, wraps and salads. The main theme of the hotel is Disney due to the proximity to Disney world. So a lot of children and young people use this hotel.

The reception is warm and welcoming. Very cooperative. Rooms are good, clean and cosy. We travelled as a family of 4 so visiting Disney by uber was cheaper than ART. We planned our own breakfast as we prefer Indian food so cannot comment on the food here. It was a great stay.

Currently staying here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. Though this hotel is not within walking distance the ART picks up on the property or for about the same price you can take an Uber or Lyft to the park which we have been doing. Rooms have been recently updated. Beds and pillows are comfy. The AC unit is quite loud so we aren’t running while sleeping. We also had an issue with the thermostat not functioning properly. I informed the front desk this morning before leaving for the park. When we returned this evening it had been replaced and works like a charm. They did offer me the option to change rooms but I really preferred not to. Downstairs restaurant Burger Theory has been excellent both times we’ve eating there (breakfast and dinner). Overall very happy with our

We really enjoyed our stay here while visiting Disneyland.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was very clean and comfortable, and we really enjoyed our dinners at Burger Theory (*Daryl was an excellent waiter!)  We loved using the pool and hot tub too.

Best hotel and staff in the area. Frankie at the front desk make check in easy and simple. The hotel common area and rooms are always clean. The hotel is within walking distance to several restaurants and Disneyland. I would highly recommend.

Staff very polite &courteous, check in quick and easy. Room comfortable, spotless and big. Restaurant attached to hotel offered very good menu, Cafe bar in foyer very good offering snack and drinks.Felt very comfortable in hotel and area

Summary Heading: Lovely Place to stay but NOT an easy walk to Honda center.
Summary: Nice, clean and quiet.  Staff is friendly and helpful. While not within easy walking distance to the Honda Center or Disneyland, they are a short Uber ride away. Parking is difficult to find at times, however, We would stay there again.

Good location for Disneyland.  The rooms were small.  We used the shuttle service from here, which was hit or miss.  The price was reasonable. We would stay here again as it met our goal of spending the maximum time at the park.

Our family of 5 adults stayed in 2 rooms for 5 nights. On arrival, the reception staff were very friendly and organised early check-in to our rooms. Yes, the rooms are dated but we were here to see the sights of Anaheim and LA, not the inside of the room! The fridge and small microwave came in very handy as did the washers and dryers located on Floor 9. There is a small convenience shop located next to reception, very reasonably priced on water, icecreams etc. Reception were always willing to help book tickets and help us with information.  The adjacent restaurant provided us with light meals and breakfast. The hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland if you are reasonably fit or there is a shuttle that will collect and return you to the hotel for $6 each. Plenty of other

Summary Heading: will not be staying there again
Summary: went on a family trip to disneyland august 24th-25th and booked the room through hotwire. the details of our experience are as follows: dirty carpet, dirty bathroom, dirty towels, and i'm hoping the noticeable film in the shower was residue from a cleaning agent versus who knows what. secondly, after i got home and looked at my email confirmation from hotwire, i noticed i was quoted $12 parking fee, but was actually charged $18. not cool. can't really excuse the the negatives of our stay and needless to say, will never be staying with this hotel chain again.

nice, convenient hotel for our Disneyland vacation. Centrally located with shuttle service ($) and a great kid friendly restaurant within the hotel. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The "to-go" options are great if you don't want to sit in the restaurant, my only recommendation would be they open longer hours for convenience. Pool is okay - needs some cleaning.

We arrived and greeted by Jordan who was very friendly and so helpful. My first impression was the exterior of the hotel was great but when I stepped inside it was not welcoming at all . It was not nice. Our guest room was just as bad. Not very clean and very outdated. We had problems with TV we called and someone came to up pretty quick to fix it ... said it was fix but was not. Called again..said it was fixed but was not at this point we just let it be seeing we would not be in the room much. For the price I definitely would not stay here again.

Excellent hotel. Great location to walk to Disneyland. Clean. Great value. Friendly staff. Place we stay whenever we go to Disneyland.  Ask for the penthouse room on the 5th floor. You can see the fireworks.

We walked into the brightly decorated and immaculate lobby equipped with convenient restrooms right at the entrance, a sitting area with comfortable couches and a big screen TV to watch the Disney Channel while you waited for your room, and refreshing pineapple water that was complementary. We received our room in a timely fashion, and we were delighted with the Star War's theme of the room. My teen loved it. The room was equipped with a Kuerig Coffee Maker, microwave, frig, paper plates and utensils, cups, and eating area. The beds were comfy, and we liked the granite counter tops, and good closet space.  The work out room had free weights and cardio equipment. The business center was complementary. There were two pools and a hot tub. One of the pools was heated, and one was

We stayed for 4 nights as a family of 4 and thought that it was perfect. Seemed to be quite a new hotel. Very helpful reception, nice room and lovely pool. Useful to have the ART bus go from the hotel to Disneyland. The on site restaurant was good and reasonably priced with kids eat free.

Stayed for four nights with my daughter. Check-in was very efficient and extremely friendly. All interactions with front desk were positive and very friendly.  Beds were very comfortable with different pillows (soft, firm etc). Fridge and microwave in room.  Walk to Disney was around 15-20 minutes depending on traffic lights.  We liked to walk but did succumb on last day to the ART bus as it was very hot. ART bus is regular and on time at 15 and 45 mins past the hour and 00 and 30 past the hour from Disney (number 12 bus and number 12 stop). Tickets are all day for any route so a good value. Uber have a place outside of Disney do that's cheap and handy too. If there's more than 2 of you it's probably best getting Uber to and from Disney.   I chose this hotel as I did get the

The staff is very happy and cheerful.  We had a GREAT stay!!  The beds were nice and the sofa bed was not the worst.   We were able to take a short walk to Disneyland AND fit our family of 6.   They offer breakfast.  My kids all ate the eggs without complaints. I would recommend it and I would use this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for the price uncomfortable befs
Summary: The hotel is good for the price. Safe, upkept, nice pool and hot tub (but pool is not heated like it states on the website), shuttle does come right into parking lot, free parking (and appears to have plenty of parking), nice front staff, small gift shop for things you may have forgotten (except no cough drops and prices are high but normal for a hotel). The beds are doubles so can be tight for adults but they are also uncomfortable. They are firm beds and the bedding has a cover that they put the opening at the bottom of the bed so you wake up with the actual blanket on the ground. Also, the room is either warm or cold not in between.  When the AC is on it’s really cold but as soon as the AC goes off it starts warming up fast. The ART shuttle does come right into the parking

Friendly front desk - Always greeted us when we arrived/ departed. Used the pool and the hot tub - both are good.  Stayed here when we visited Disneylanfd. Returned to the hotel at nights. Good Stay overall.

The rooms are fine.  The beds are not queens but fulls so it can be a bit small if you have two adults sleeping in bed.   This hotel has terrible customer service. We booked our stay in advance and prepaid for our stay. When I called to confirm our stay the front desk told me what dates they had for us and we were off! Again at the hotel I double checked our dates and asked the hotel if everything had been paid for. They confirmed with me a SECOND time my dates and told me everything was good and paid for. When we got home from our vacation I got an addition charge from the hotel. They told me that the package I had originally booked for didn’t cover one of my nights. I was confused because I had double checked with the hotel TWICE both of which times they had told me the dates

The staff were so friendly and helpful.   The hotel restaurant was quite expensive and the food was average. It's nice that there's free parking - however free breakfast for children and the shuttle to Disney was slightly deceptive on the website.   Rooms were nice and clean.

We were there for one night before continuing on our business road trip. Chose this hotel due to the fact that it was away from the Disney crowds. We arrived at 1:30 ish to be told that there was no early check in. We were told check in was at 4:00 and we would be called when a room became available. On the website check in is 3:00. I was told they were in the process of updating that. I made plans based on the 3:00 check in. We left to eat, returned around an hour later. I approached the front desk to inquire if a room had become available and it had although I received no phone call letting me know this. We were on the West side of the hotel with a distant view of California Adventure. Our room was basic. Microwave, coffee, fridge. Beds were comfortable, shower/tub combo.

Nicely decorated, and well laid out room. We had 1 king bed, there was a small chair for sitting and a big bathroom with walk in shower. Art work was serene, we were there for 1 night for a Ducks vs. Jet's game, and this place was pefect for our stay. Our view was of the free way, but suprisingly quiet. Kind and friendly check in agents, and free parking. Pool area looked nice, did not use. Would definitely recommend and stay again

First time to stay in this hotel. Short walk to Disneyland.Clean, comfy and includes  a full breakfast.Able to leave our car there even after checking out.Will definitely be staying there again.Eady access from the freeway and close to a number of restaurants.

Staff was incredibly friendly, easy check in and out.  The room was nice with a decent view and had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker.  Beds were very comfy and have different levels of firmness on pillows.  I did use the shampoo and conditioner provided and was happy with the quality.  The room could have been swept better as there were random crumbs on the floor when I arrived.  The ART bus picks you up right at the hotel and is a short trip to Disneyland, it’s $5.50 a day for unlimited back and forth trips which I found to be a bargain!  It picks you up approximately every 30 mins.  The only other negative was one night people were slamming their doors for what seemed like all night and I was unable to sleep.  The room doors are heavy and slam as you come and go.

This is the first time I have stayed outside of walking distance from Disneyland when in Anaheim. First up, the pros of this hotel:   Staff was great and super friendly. The hotel was much cleaner than I expected from a Holiday Inn at the price I payed. If you have a rental car, or plan on using ART transport shuttles, I’d consider staying here. Also a great location if you want to explore other parts of souther California, as you are literally right on I-5. Parking is also free, which is rare in the resort area. I never had a problem finding a place to park, but sometimes was in the back of the hotel.  Oddly while the freeway noise was not an issue and I never heard it, I wish I could say the same about noise between walls. Noise travelled so well that at time I was woken by
Manager Response: Hello Kevin,  Thank you for staying at our Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area. We take pride in ensuring that our hotels are always clean, and our staff serves you with a smile. It was good to know that you found our location convenient and parking was never an issue.  IHG will always put our guest needs first. I am sorry that the noise from the other room caused you discomfort and disrupted your sleep. I am advising the hotel of this concern. I know they will consider this for future renovations.    I hope you give us another try if you're back in the area as we'd love to make that next one more remarkable than the last.  Safe travels,  Deborah R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I genuinely can’t say enough nice things about this place. Coming from two nights at the Venetian in Vegas I know where I’d rather stay and it’s not there.  The staff have been amazingly helpful from the moment we arrived and nothing seemed like too much trouble.  The rooms were great, we were really impressed to have a fridge and microwave. The pool was fab and had plenty of loungers and towels to use.  Disneyland was only a 15 minute walk away which saved us a fortune on parking.  Would highly recommend this hotel and will hopefully return the next time we visit the states.

The hotel entrance is an easy 10min walk to Disneyland, 15min to main gate. Its a straight and safe walk.  The walk passes Panera Bread where you can get a packed lunch before heading into Disney. It also passes a few shops and restaurants.  The hotel is clean and the rooms are big. The breakfast is fine, mainly breads, cereals, yoghurt, eggs etc. The pool is better than expected although didn’t have time to use but you look over it from the breakfast room.  I would recommend the hotel if you can get a room on opposite side from the Interstate. Our room 323 was very noisy, we got used to the noise but this would be the one thing putting me off booking here again.

The hotel really does serve its purpose well. It's location to Disney is great, the shuttle bus to and from Disney is very reliable. The rooms were clean and all in all it is really nice and we'll taken care of. Outside is great pool area that the kids will love, especially as it is shaped like Mickey Mouse's head. The one little disappointing part was the breakfast. Our package included 2 breakfasts per day.as a family of 4 we were ok with that, we would just pay for 2. But, when you get down there the breakfast menu was restricted. In a nutshell, the breakfast coupon was not a great feature. The buffet that was an allowed option was not as good as most. It was a good spot though. A car is useful as there is not much around within walking distance.

We have stayed here now for three times. We stayed in September 2018.. We love the friendliness of the employees and the comfort of the rooms. The rooms have always been clean and comfortable. The restaurant is open for breakfast and we have had breakfast as part of our package. The employee's are top notch and are the best...They remembered us from our September trip to when we went back in December. Perfect hotel for a Disney trip.

Summary Heading: A place to stay when in Anaheim
Summary: Friendly and helpful from checkin. Large comfortable rooms,soft pillows. Pool with a heated whirlpool. Restaurant onsite -great food,but did not open at lunch However a snack bar was open at that time Can catch a bus from door to outside of Disneyland gates within minutes.

Great hotel. Very clean. Excellent staff. Good breakfast. Short walk to Disneyland. This was our 2nd stay here and it’s been nice both times. We highly recommend it! We especially like the comfortable beds and large bathroom. Lots of storage space.
Manager Response: Hello delbertcharlenel,  Thank you so much for staying with us again and for filling out our survey.  I really appreciate you sharing such a great review with us all.  I am so glad that you guys really like staying with us.  Please make us your "home away from home" every time you come into Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed here as a part of a conference I was attending at the Anaheim convention center. When I arrived I was actually a little confused because I thought it was closer to Disneyland. This property is about a 30 min walk to Disneyland which isn’t a problem but at night you have to walk through a dimly lighted area near a trailer park which always had me a little on edge. Everything ended up being safe but it’s a little sketchy to walk at night. The only other issue was that restaurants like the garden walk are a good 10 minute walk to any food, unless you eat at the burger theory restaurant onsite. If you plan on walking to downtown Disneyland that’s a good 45 minute walk. As for the pros, the room was clean, and the large jacuzzi felt amazing and it was large enough that even
Manager Response: Hello mikep20182019,  Thank you for staying with us an leaving such a detailed review.  It sounds like you had a nice stay and that you enjoyed the staff, our hotel, our rooms and service, and our food and beverage in the restaurant.  Thanks again.  But it sounds like you would prefer to stay at a hotel just beside Disneyland.  Have a great day.

Summary: We stayed here for 9 nights and booked our stay with getaway today. With getaway today we got a cheaper deal at the hotel combined with park tickets and free breakfast of a $5 upgrade for the buffet.  First of all the check in staff were excellent! We was greeted and given all the information we needed! The bus stop for Disneyland is situated outside the hotel and is shared with the hotel next door. Busses run every hour  from the theme park and hotel. To walk to Disney land it is doable. It took about 30 minutes for fast walkers however the majority of the walk was waiting at red lights to cross. The bus pass costs I think $20 dollars for 5 days. The bus journey takes about 15 minutes to and from and was rather busy the majority of time. We did. Have a few problems with the
Manager Response: Hello Walkerpj93,  Thank you so much for staying with us.  And a special BIG THANKS for sharing your wonderful, detailed, story with us all.  Wow, it sounds like you your family really enjoyed our staff, our rooms, our hotel and our general surroundings.  I really appreciate you pointing out how nice my staff was to you at check-in.  I  am so glad you felt welcomed and informed.  I really hope you guys will stay with us every time you come into Anaheim.

Summary Heading: A bit tired and busy but it served the purpose
Summary: Large facility, outdoor pool (shaped like Mickey) and large hot tub.  Rooms on 3rd floor smelled like a grow operation. The hotel is non smoking but I could tell several rooms around mine spent a bit of their day toking. Personally doesn’t bother me, but families might not dig it. Room was super comfortable and clean. Weird set up for bathroom door. If it was open, anyone walking in the room would get whacked by the door.  Workout facility was worn. Pretty small for the amount of rooms in the hotel.  Being SoCal, it was packed night and day, and had poor ventilation.  Staff was super nice, and there is lots of parking, centrally located so the neighborhood has so much to do and lots of shopping & restaurants.

Summary Heading: Going to Disney... good family hotel
Summary: Stayed here for two nights while visiting Disney. Would stay here again. Room was large but I think the beds were two doubles, not queen sized, as advertised. The room was wheelchair accessible, so the door entry and hallway was wide. No bathtub and the shower sprayed everywhere since the curtain didn’t go to the ground and water went everywhere. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast was nothing great. With our room rate we got two daily buffet breakfasts, and kids could order off the kids menu for free or we could pay $10/each for them to have the buffet. I was surprised the kids couldn’t have the buffet with us. The second day we skipped breakfast and let the kids have the buffet... we just grabbed Starbucks on the road. Kids loved the pool and staff brought
Manager Response: Hello CDNinHK,  Thank you for staying with us and for filling out our survey.  I really appreciate you sharing such a detailed review with us all.  I am so glad that you and your family really enjoyed your stay overall.  I do apologize that there was such trouble getting on the ART shuttle.  We generally don't have any issues with their service, but I am sorry if you guys got bumped off the shuttle at any point.  Please come back and stay with us again.  We would love to have you and your family stay with us every time you come into town.

Summary Heading: Average hotel, would not be first choice in Anaheim
Summary: I stayed in this hotel whilst attending a convention at the nearby Anaheim Convention Centre. As there are myriad hotels in Anaheim for both convention attendees and Disneyland visitors, this would not have been my first choice, but was booked through my company for business travel.   The room was large and had with a desk, coffee machine, microwave, fridge, safe and large wardrobe. Strangely though, the wardrobe did not have a hanging rail, but just a high wire shelf, where there were some hangers - it seemed slightly makeshift! The bed was very comfy with a choice of soft/firm pillows. It did however, face out towards I-5 and the noise of the traffic was very audible in the room. The window seemed to be poorly sealed and draughty - I'd have expected it to be a lot better
Manager Response: Hello fiona1312,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing a detailed review of your stay.  I appreciate all of the feed back that you shared with all of us and will share it with our Management Staff.  I apologize that we did not meet your expectations on this stay.  However, I do appreciate the nice comments about my staff.  I appreciate that through any short comings, you could see how hard they work and again it is appreciated.  I hope you have a great new year and will come back and stay with us again.  Give us a chance to show you that these imperfections were an exception.

Summary: We checked into this hotel at 1:50pm and were told the rooms weren't cleaned yet and they'll call us once they're ready, however the check in time is 4:00pm.  We went out to eat and killed some time around town.  The only phone call we got was to switch our room as a family needed the set up in the room we had booked.  We agreed to give up our room and take another.  Still no room ready.  We arrived back at the hotel at 3:50 and I went up to the counter and was told the room is still not available.  So we sat in the lobby with other travelers that I assume were held up for the same reason.  At 4:02 (12 minutes later) I was called up to the counter and apparently they had lost the signed paperwork in the span of the 2 hours since I had checked in.  So I had to sign everything all
Manager Response: Hello Andrew G,  Thank you for staying with us and for filling out our survey.  I apologize that we did not have the room ready for you to check into early.  We do check in as many people early as possible, but of course we cannot accommodate everyone.  I also apologize if you felt that my front desk staff was rude; again we are happy to check all guests in as soon as the rooms are ready- but we guarantee all rooms should be ready by 4pm.  Please have a great new year.

Summary: SORRY - hotel’s favourite word. Room ready at 8.30am but to access it then, extra USD50, Sorry! Guest laundry app don’t work for non-US residents, Sorry! Room unmade from 9am to 5pm. Sorry, short staff!

A nice hotel. Walkable to downtown Disney (15 mins) where you get easy access to both the parks. Had an outdoor pool which we didn’t use but good if necessary. A local garage about 3 minute walk gave us supplies.  We ate at night in the restaurant which was fine. Good attentive staff.
Manager Response: Hello alisoncl1065AG,  Thank you for staying with us and for filling out our survey.  I am glad you guys had a nice stay and thanks so much for sharing your comments with us.  I appreciate you sharing some details about our pool and location.  I hope you guys will come and stay with us again soon.

Summary: I'm not sure about other rooms but don't stay in 532. The AC must be broken. The noise from it is unacceptable. I feel like I have a generator in the room. It was more horrible when I turned if off but it still ran through out the night. It ran for 30 mins then stopped for 5 mins. Then the cycle started again no matter how I tried to change the setting. Cool or heat or off is all the same. We stayed there 2 nights for Disneyland but couldn't rest. The review is just for the AC. Overall, the hotel is convenient for Disneyland visit and receptionists are friendly
Manager Response: Hello DangD7,  Thank you for staying with us.  I apologize that the A/C was too loud in the room.  We would have liked to try and fix it for you so that your stay would be better.  Thanks for your feedback and please come stay with  us again.

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for a week long holiday. When we arrived we were greeted at reception my Marcellus. He did an awesome job with checkin and whenever we had a question he was always very pleasant and helpful. When he seen us when we came back from an outing he always said welcome back, and asked how our day was. The other front desk staff were very nice too. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Some of the rooms faced the Disney Park so you can see the fireworks. Those rooms were all taken so we could only hear the fireworks at 9:30 from the park. There is also a shuttle out front of the hotel that will take you to Disneyland. We bought a 3 day pass for $14 and my dad who is a senior only paid $5 for a 3 day pass. It gets pretty busy on the shuttle so be there early to make
Manager Response: Hello higgs_mike,  Thank you for staying with us and for leaving such a detailed review of your stay.  It really sounds like you guys had a pretty good stay.  Thanks for pointing out some of the things you liked best and we are pretty busy most of the time.  And I really hope you guys will come and stay with us again too.

Summary: Got in late wasn't able to take advantage of much amenities but it was a standard hotel. I would stay here again, the room was comfortable and clean. Front desk was a little slow there was a line to check-in even at 10pm.

We booked this hotel because I had stayed in the sister property next door the last time I was down there.  The hotel was clean and welcoming.  The room was very nice, very clean and comfortable.  The only issue we had was with a front desk attendant named Ivy.  We asked her for a recommendation on a TAXI and she said she would hook us up with her taxi contact.  She said it wouldn't cost much to get from the hotel to the Honda Center.  She called a Limo service that charged us $30!!! As far as we're concerned, she's a liar and probably getting a cut from her "contact".  I highly recommend staying here while in the area

Just stayed the night because I had a class to take in the area for work. Great location and very affordable. Let me tell you, I will definitely be back the next time I have to work in this area. From the moment I walked in to check in, I was greeted with a warm smile. I was given options of floors and bathroom layouts. I called downstairs for information and was warmly informed about meal times in the restaurant. Then in the restaurant, Guillermo went well above and beyond the call of duty for me!!! Always made sure I had plenty to drink and cleared dishes in a timely manner. All with a smile on his face. It is because of Guillermo’s customer service and the young man at the front desk that I will be back. The room was fine. Clean with decent accommodations, but the customer

Summary Heading: Just fine for a Disneyland Weekend
Summary: I've stayed here twice for a disneyland weekend. This most recent time, We stayed over a weekend in October, checked in friday, checked out Sunday. There is nothing great about this place, but nothing wrong with it either. The rooms are clean- though the bathroom didn't have a vent- that's weird. And when I asked to stay on any floor facing the parks, we were put in an opposite facing room, facing the pool. But it was fine. There is a shuttle to and from disneyland, but with just 4 of us we found it just as cost effective, and much quicker to Lyft to and fro. The pool area is adequate, they provide towels by the pool and noone said anything when we brought in our own beers- i saw one guy wheeling in an ice chest. Free parking makes this place awesome. It is TOTALLY walkable from

We stayed there only one night on the home from NYC to Hawaii. Just wanted to rest and go to Disneyland with my 6years old girl.  Our room was family style room with bunkbed. Enough big for us (2adults,2teenager boy and 6years old)  The restaurant where we had a dinner was very delicious! Front desk staffs are very friendly. We will definitely will back again!

We arrived at 12 and had emailed to request an early check in.  Upon arriving we were told our 2 rooms weren’t ready as they were being cleaned but luckily our request for interconnecting rooms had been honoured which I was happy about as my husband and I have 5 kids and didn’t want to be seperated.  The lady at check in asked if there were two rooms on the same level which weren’t interconnecting but ready earlier, would we like those? I declined and said we would prefer to wait.  Which we did by the pool.  One room was ready early at 2.30, the other room we had to wait until 5.00 for it to be ready! And then, it wasn’t the adjoining one!! I was furious! We had waited an hour past check in, wasted the first day of our holiday waiting for interconnecting rooms only to be told
Manager Response: Good evening,  I want to personally apologize for the issues you faced during the start of your visit. We failed to meet your expectations and promises we had made you and I humbly apologize for that. I am happy you did enjoy your stay and we hope that you will come visit us again so we may redeem ourselves.  Thank you again for sharing your comments with us as we will use comments such as yours to make necessary changes.

Summary: Front desk clerks were amazing. So very friendly and helpful. The burger theory had such great food but wished it was a little cheaper. We only ate there 3 times. All times were great. The first room we were put in smelled funny and felt weird. We were then moved to a higher floor by a front desk clerk to see the fireworks. And the room was so much better and nicer. The only problem was that there were tons of ants on the carpet. We had a gift basket with macaroons delivered to our room and they were filled with hundreds of ants by the second day we had to throw everything out. The pool deck and pool were surprisingly dirty. Location was good because there is a bus right outside that takes us to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hi 884sherryb,  Thank you for your stay and for sharing your experience with us. It is great to read that you appreciated our staff, food selections, and our location.   I'm concerned to learn about the issues you had with the cleanliness of your room and pool facility. As a guest, I know this is not the kind of experience you expect and I am very sorry that we fell short. Our managers have been informed of your situation and have reinforced training to our housekeeping team.   We appreciate you as our guest and hope to get another chance to give you a more pleasurable stay should you be in the area again.   See you soon,   Christian C. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disney and area
Summary: This is a great hotel if you are visiting Disney. You can walk to the parks but I would suggest allow 30 mins. We walked each day and by the time you allowed for the road crossings, most days it was about 30 mins and we walk fairly briskly. Quickest day was 20 mins. They do have a shuttle which costs €5.50. The parking is free. They do a good breakfast. We booked breakfast with our room and we could have either one hot item off the menu or the buffet after 8am. The buffet selection was ok but not the most extensive. The staff were all really friendly. The value was good for the five nights we were here. Overall a great experience.

I stayed in Holiday Inn Anaheim for one night when attending an event in Anaheim Convention Center. The Hotel is very clean. There is a free parking. Although it is a quite far from Disney but there is a free shuttle. Their breakfast is very good.

I had recently stayed for 6 days and 5 nights for the second time at this hotel and its always a great stay!   The staff is always very nice and friendly, and say hi to almost everyone who comes in and out of the hotel. When we stayed they were very busy compared to the last time but the room wasn't very noisy and the hotel over all was pretty quite as well. We stayed for our trip to Disneyland! we had drove so free parking was a plus. The room has a fridge that was very convenient for us.   They offer park tickets prices that are better then purchasing from the park, how ever there weren't any in stock when we arrived but had restocked later in the week! they go fast!   They have a shuttle which is so nice to come back and forth from the parks whenever we like throughout the

Summary Heading: 3rd stay at this hotel because it's awesome!
Summary: Booked this hotel again for the last 5 nights of our trip. Always happy with this hotel. Great location from Disney and local places to eat and shop. Fully equipped room with microwave and fridge, clean and spacious. Burger theory restaurant is great for dining in or even ordering to take up to your room. There's a Grab and Go Cafe for coffee and quick meals and snacks. The hotel's little gift shop has great snacks, and some souvenirs too. Staff is always very friendly and helpful. Probably my go-to hotel to stay in while in Anaheim.

We stayed here for 1 night over the past weekend- arrived super early and was not expecting the room to be ready but it was. Checked in and the room itself was beautiful. Everything in the hotel was very clean and the staff was great. There is a shuttle service offered for $5.50/per person to the parks, but it was just my husband and I so we ubered to Disneyland instead, which was about $8 each way. The only thing I guess I can say was a negative, is they need more than 1 person working their "quick service" coffee bar on a Saturday morning. It took nearly 15 minutes to get a breakfast sandwich and 2 coffees because it appeared there was only 1 person doing all the work. We will definitely consider this hotel the next time we are staying in the area. 100% would recommend.

Was there on a business trip.  Definitely not a business trip hotel.. however I would suspect that most hotels in Anaheim are like that.  Pros:  Staff very friendly. Nice Bar - can’t speak to the food as never ate there Good location  Cons:  Paper thin walls - especially an issue with screaming kids everywhere Bed - Not the best. No Free breakfast like most Holiday Inn’s

Summary Heading: Great location, close to the parks
Summary: We arrived at 8am and asked if we could pre-check in or just park our car while we go to Disneyland. The nice front desk ladies let us check in early! Everyone was so courteous and smiling! Rooms were clean, although the beds were a bit small, they were comfortable. Free parking and free breakfast (for two people only per day) thats okay because we ate most of our meals at Disneyland anyway. Also $6-8 uber ride from the parks, saved us alot of money and time as supposed to paying for parking.  Overall amazing stay!

Summary Heading: Very comfortable place to stay for Disneyland.
Summary: Great location for Disneyland - just half an hour walk and with free parking. Wonderful mattresses. Quiet. Very good Wi-Fi. One of the front desk's personnel told me that due to the fact that we are checking out in the morning of the day we went to Disneyland they can't keep our valuables in the front desk's safe. In the end, there was another lady who did this service for us. Had it not been solved this could have really nilled the advantages of choosing this place for the night.

Summary Heading: Suite we booked was tired and tired, and in major need of updates.
Summary: Room was tired and in need of update. Several problems were reported, including broken drawers, fridge not working, A/C duct rattling, filthy windows, decals missing, a random water bottle stick stuck to the headboard, a random alarm clock with no batteries, careless painting and mismatched furniture. Holiday Inn wrote to me saying they'd look into it after I complained, and they eventually gave me some reward points, but they don't seem to understand this doesn't compensate me for the bad experience in any way. Also the elevator was the slowest I've encountered in the Western Hemisphere. This hotel is brilliantly located and that's the reason they don't need to make any effort with the hotel. They will sell out all the time regardless.
Manager Response: Hello Simon B,  Thank you for staying with us and for leaving a review. I am glad that our location worked for travel needs. However, I am sad to learn that you were faced with some challenges with condition of the room, the AC, furniture and the level of service you received. I am very sorry for we failed to make your stay more comfortable. Your feedback has been taken into account and will be shared with our management team. We are confident that necessary steps will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.    Thanks again for staying with us, we value you as our IHG Rewards Club member.   Best Regards,   John O  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: This hotel is in desperate need of an update and upgrade, especially to the cleanliness. It felt very dirty and dingy. There were hairs on a towel, and stains on the sheets. The carpets were so gross I would not walk barefoot on them at all. As an IHG member I was disappointed and would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Dalezava,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area, CA. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. On behalf of the hotel, I'm sorry we fell below your expectation regarding cleanliness, housekeeping and carpet condition. We will address these concerns. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.   Sincerely,   Orlando   Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights.  We really enjoyed the peace and quiet this hotel offers. It is right off the highway but you couldn't hear the noise.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The room is exactly as pictured and had a microwave and mini-fridge, and coffee. We did try the take-out breakfast from the restaurant and it was pretty good. It was the basic bacon, egg, hash brown and toast breakfast.  The ART shuttle does come to the hotel, but after taking it once filled with passengers, we opted for Uber and Lyft.  An added bonus here is the free parking! We definitely look forward to staying here on our next visit!

Stayed here for one night in October 2018.   Check-In took awhile because there was only ONE person at the front desk at 4.30pm. Really? They know it's prime check-in time, but nope...only one person. After waiting what seemed like forever, I finally got to the counter. The process was seamless and quick and I was assigned a room on the 6th floor.  The room (two full beds) was clean as was the bathroom. The usual toiletries was provided. The air conditioner was effective but the air blowing out mildly smelled of mildew, but if you probably won't notice it if you aren't extremely sensitive to that smell. The room is equipped with lots of outlets, but none dedicated for USBs (use the TV to charge your device). Lots of channels for entertainment and the room is equipped with a
Manager Response: Hello i-gots-wanderlust,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area, CA. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment about the room amenities and for your high rating sleep quality.  On behalf of the hotel, I'm sorry we fell below your expectation regarding your check in experienced and the lack of front desk staff. We will address these concerns. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.   Sincerely,   Orlando   Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Away From the Parks
Summary: This hotel is a gem! They have an excellent staff and the rooms are clean. Bonus, it is a direct ride from the hotel to the parks using the Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) bus 12 and only one stop at the Garden Walk from the parks back to the hotel! The ART bus runs every 20 minutes from 6:20am to 9:30pm

Good location right off the highway and close to Disney and local restaurants. The on site restaurant is also a good place to eat and the staff is great. No resort fees free parking and a shuttle stop out front.

It is a classic mid-range chain hotel with no discernible character and there's no real reason to be in Anaheim except Disneyland/conventions. Not close enough to walk to Disneyland or Convention centre but a short drive and there's a shuttle ($5.50 day ticket) to disneyland etc. Pool is nice; room was spacious with bunks for kids so reasonable value for what it was. Bed large and very comfortable. Staff all really really good (and General Manager v nice) - they try to do whatever you ask and nothing is a problem. Burger theory really good value for kids' food. Food in burger theory is good; beer is good (bit pricey at $7 but it's a hotel). Breakfast buffet is decent value. Pool is good with hot tub. The Staybridge suites next door use the same pool and are under same management
Manager Response: Hi 628richard,  Thank you for your candid review, highlighting not only the bad but also the good points of your stay. We are always grateful when a guest takes the time and effort to acknowledge our staff. We are also delighted to hear you liked your room. It is our goal to consistently provide superior service and accommodations at our hotel and your comments  are very much appreciated. This is one of the ways that let us know where we need to improve.  Again, many thanks for the feedback. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of our road trip so we could do the obligatory Disneyland with the children. The staff were welcoming and helpful. There is a tram service to Disney from right outside the hotel; it is $5.50 for adults and $2 dollars for children under 10(I think) and further discounts for additional days. It runs half hourly there and back and takes you to the door at Disney.  The hotel was a great choice. The rooms are a good size, decent beds, clean and tidy rooms. A large fridge in our room to store our Disney picnic. The pool is Mickey- shaped which our girls loved. Free parking, no resort fees.

Looking for a hotel near Angels stadium - couldn’t get better than this. We could even see stadium from our room! Took approx 2 min by car to get to stadium both ways! Excellent!   Very comfortable clean rooms & quality staff, was busy hotel but quiet. did not have chance to try restaurant or grab n go cafe; which seemed affordable or the pool - all were busy though. Would surely stay again.

Summary Heading: Beautifully updated! Free parking & no resort fees!
Summary: We were very pleased with our stay here. The rooms had been updated since we last stayed a few years ago, and there's free parking and no resort fees! Be aware that if you get 2 beds that they will be full size and not queens. There's no free breakfast offered, but there a little coffee bar in the lobby for a quick grab on your way out. There's Keurig coffee machines in the rooms. The bathrooms are spacious. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly. Also be careful that you are getting this hotel and not the Holiday Inn on Walnut St. behind the parking building which isn't as nice.

Only thing this hotel has going for it, is the location. We had the absolute worst service during our family trip to Disney. One of the nights our room wasn’t even cleaned, we were left with no clean towels, no beds made, and the garbages were never changed. At the front desk, they literally did nothing and just sat there with smiles on there faces in mockery at our complaints. We hope leaving our garbage in the middle of the hotel floor outside our room would send a message. But that also sat there for two nights.... TERRIBLE SERVICE & NOT CLEAN & RUDE WORKERS.... AWFUL
Manager Response: Hello travelbugggsssss,  I appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. I am very pleased to read that you liked our hotel location. I am sorry to read that issues with the housekeeping services were a let down during your stay. Thank you for bringing this to our attention as the feedback we received from our guests like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions and proper training to improve our guest services.  I hope you give us a chance in the future to show you the improvements made.   Sincerely,  Dianne L. Case Manager IHGServices

Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. All of the employees were so helpful and they even gave us a free room upgrade. The room was amazing and the breakfast was so convenient. I would recommend this hotel for everyone.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet and walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: That was a great choice, very quiet, clean and too close Disneyland, approximately 600 meters,   Very helpful staff, a bit limited selection in the breakfast,   you have either valet parking service or self parking at the same cost.   You can book Disneyland tickets from the lobby to avoid long queues or you can get it from the App.   The room was big enough to accommodate the family.   The pool was clean.   Location is very convenient and close to orange outlet if you are shopping fan.   Highly recommended.

We had booked this hotel as a Good Neighbor package through AAA.  We got a fantastic rate.  The room was only a 5 minute drive to Disneyland and very close to many local restaurants. The Burger Theory restaurant on site is very good! I also had the opportunity to try the PricklyPear drink at the bar.  The bartender was great. I accidentally spilled my drink trying to get into the elevator and had to go back for a replacement. He was so understanding. The front office staff was also very friendly.  They were able to upgrade us to a fireworks view room as I wasn't going into Disneyland with my daughters (18 and 15). The room was very clean.  Free breakfast is not offered at this hotel, but parking is free.  They have a small breakfast "cafe" in the lobby where you can order

We booked 2 family rooms and stayed for 4 nights whilst visiting Anaheim & Disney. It was a good location close to the Disney parks, we walked back from the Disney parks which took about 15-20 mins. You can take the Anaheim Disney shuttle which stops in the hotel grounds and takes you directly to Disney, it cost about $15 return for a family of 4. We used this for 2 days. These run every half hour.   The room was spacious with fridge, etc. It was great for what we needed. We used the outdoor pool and hot tub every day. It was great to cool down. Towels were provided by the hotel.  We ate at Burger theory - nachos, chicken, fries, etc. The portions were good and the food was delicious.  We had breakfast included with our stay. It was a buffet for adults or one choice from the

I remember when I was here several years back I noticied that it was very loud and I didn't like it at all. Years have a chance in creeping and I decided to give this hotel a second chance. Boy was I surprised when the baggage cart was broken and we had to wait for a long while.  The gave to us free beverage and dinner but I was happy when the management has changed for the better and noticed that a Spire Elite member is one of the highest members around.  The bad side of this is that all of their rooms are standard size.

We had booked in to stay here for a few nights whilst visiting and chose it mainly because of the location. Whilst we waited to be checked in we wernt acknowledged or nodded at. The guy behind the counter just finished off dealing with another guest and went on the phone. No apology or 'give me a minute' nothing. I thought this was very rude to be honest. Anyway we got checked in and given our room keys.The hotel seemed to be very dated and looked as if it needed some tlc. The room itself was ok, it had the minimum you'd expect and the bed was clean and comfy. As we weren't planning on being in here too much it didn't matter. Car parking is adequate but fills up in the evenings. Don't forget your tag from reception. Disney is literally 10 minutes around the back of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Ideally located for Disney - a 15 minute walk.
Summary: A standard Holiday Inn offering clean rooms, excellent staff and in a good proximity to Disneyland. There’s a shuttle bus (paying) running from the front of the hotel to Disneyland but we just walked. It took 15-20 minutes to walk and was a nice way to start the day. I certainly wouldn’t recommend driving to Disney from here, we did this on day one and were fleeced for the parking charges, to then have to get a shuttle from the parking lot to the park. Walking worked best for us.   On site here’s a ‘burger theory’ restaurant which serves a nice range of beers and burgers.   We didn’t use the pool but it looked clean and well used from what we could see out of the window.   All in all I would recommend this hotel.

I will agree that the location of this hotel is great. However customer service is lacking. We stayed for 4 days and not one day was our room made up. I had to go track down a housekeeper for more shampoo one of the days and told her not to bother coming in anymore since we were now in there to shower and get ready for dinner. Our second issue was that the pool was closed for the ENTIRE duration of our stay. I already messaged head office about this and I did receive a call from the hotel manager who basically told me I’m lying and that it was only closed for one day and asked if I even had proof and a picture of the sign saying the pool was closed. I couldn’t believe it. They can keep my money this time bc clearly they don’t want to credit me anything, but they will NOT be
Manager Response: Good morning,   I want to apologize for the service that you received during your visit. I am very concerned about the service and the pool being closed and how it interrupted your stay with us. If you could please contact me so I can further look into this situation, because I am not aware of any pool closure or to who you may have spoken with.  I can be reached at kim.bixler@ihg.com  Have a great day and I look forward to talking with you.

Summary: When staying at a holiday inn I don’t expect the intercontinental or anything, however this hotel is a nightmare.   Restaurant closes from 12 - 5 everyday and no food is within walking distance. They’re remodeling the floors at the moment and so expect to hear workers drilling and hammering, you will have plastic on the floors, which is not ideal with rolling suitcases, the breakfast buffet has like 7 items to choose from, my door keypad would work about 20 perfect of the time, and the shower is a standing shower and the ground is uneven. So you have water building up and spilling over onto the floor. If you want to charge anything to the room, you will need to fill out a piece of paper every single time. It’s truly an unpleasant stay at this holiday inn.

Summary Heading: Good all rounder and value for money
Summary: Stayed here with a friend for a few nights in April where we planned to visit Disneyland. It was within walking distance to the park which we did both days we went. Easy to get to when driving and free parking at the hotel was easy enough. (Just don't come back really late otherwise you'll walk a way back to reception from the other side of the car park! :D) Rooms were lovely, nice decor and clean. Just what you need. Can't really comment on the pool or communal areas as we were never there to use them! Staff always helpful enough.

Summary Heading: Although we did not visit Disney
Summary: We stayed for one night at this hotel and ate "around the corner" from a small Mexican take-away restaurant.  I believe the hotel is undergoing renovations.  When we were there, you got off at your floor and saw that one side was "blocked" with plastic door (fastened with velcro) to keep dust out of the guests' area and inside the work space.  The entire experience of arriving to the room was off-putting and I suspect it will improve once the work is completed.  Otherwise, the staff were helpful and the breakfast, delicious.  I is a bit of a walk to Disney and, though there is a sort of shuttle servicing the area, we were tired and opted "out" of a walk-around Disney's shopping area (I've visited this park when I was young - many decades ago - and have outgrown themed parks).

Our family enjoyed visiting this hotel while we were on vacation at Disneyland. We didn't have to hassle with the lines or cost of parking a car at the park each day, we just took the ART shuttle from the hotel every morning and back to the hotel every evening. We never had to wait long for the ART shuttle and it was relatively cheap. The hotel had a good pool area and the new pool furniture is appreciated. (new since our last visit before that) We don't eat at the hotel but having the restaurant there for breakfast and dinner is always helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. Rates weren't to bad for the area and the staff at the front desk were really friendly. We will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Free parking, free Disney shuttle and great comfort
Summary: With so many resorts near Disney land this hotel still offers free parking and shuttle service. The beds are comfortable, the rooms clean and there is a microwave and refrigerator in each room. Lovely place to stay.

We stayed at the Anaheim Holiday Inn Resort from May 12 - 16, 2018. There were 3 adults in our family. This is the second time members of our family have stayed here and both times found this hotel to be good value for the dollar. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable with all the basic amenities we needed. We ate our breakfasts at Burger Theory in the hotel and they were good and service was great. The pool area and hot tub was nice at the end of long days. It is a bit farther away from Disneyland than many other hotels but we walked there in 20 - 25 min. or Ubered it in 6 min. for under $10. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would recommend this hotel if your looking for a good hotel that doesn’t require 5 star expectations.

Have been to several hotels in the area and definately prefer this one. Walking distance to Disneyland great staff friendly service, good breakfast included.  Totally recommend my go to hotel for Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Very good option to visit Disney California
Summary: It's a new construction very close to Disney California. Rooms are spacious for families, they clean and quiet. Service is good and have a good free parking. There is a transportation for parks and a restaurant inside.

Summary Heading: The PERFECT hotel for a family Disney trip!
Summary: We booked at the hotel for 4 nights through GetAwayToday. Free breakfast four our family of 4 was included. We also packaged our Disney and ART tickets. The full breakfast was delicious. Choice of bacon or sausage with potatoes, eggs and toast or pankackes with sauces or bacon. Upon check in, Arthur was very friendly and helpful in giving us tips for Disney. I requested a room on a higher floor, but nothing specific, and we were given the top 9th floor with a view of the pool (which was shaped like Mickey ears, heated, salt water) and a view of the jacuzzi. Our room boasted a fantastic view of Disney’s fireworks at night as well. It was a standard double bed room, not a suite of any kind, but it suited us and was well worth what we paid. The ART bus is literally to the right

This hotel is one block from Disneyland so you can walk and avoid parking charges. It’s basic but the beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean and tidy.   The staff are very helpful and professional and the pool is adequate for a quick cool off after walking around the parks all day. Towels are provided around the pool.   My only complaint is the breakfast. Very basic and not a lot of choice and costing you $14.99 for a buffet! Definitely not worth the money. The fruit had been sat there for days and wasn’t that fresh and there was hardly any cutlery and cups. The children could eat for free if they had cereal or pancakes and nothing else, if they ate from the buffet it was $7.49 which meant they had no real selection, kids don’t eat that much so for them to eat from the
Manager Response: Hi Nikki F,  Hello from IHG! Thank you for your candid review. I appreciate you sharing your thoughts about breakfast. I'm sorry for the letdown. This will be shared with the team for further improvements.  We hope to have the honor of hosting you again should your travels bring you back to the area.  Again, thanks for choosing Holiday Inn!  Warm Regards,  Ronald R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I stayed here for a conference March 7-11. My company also rented out a hotel conference room for our annual sales meeting as 25 of us were staying here. This has been the most frustrating hotel I’ve dealt with.   Two days after checking out my credit card was charged unexpectedly. I emailed them asking for a receipt and thought maybe it was additional taxes and fees. No response. I called them and they said there were gift shop fees (not itemized) and “to go food boxes” charged to my room. Sounds tasty but not mine. They transferred me to someone in accounting to discuss and of course they don’t answer and I have to leave a voicemail. I called everyday and left a voicemail for either accounting or a manager. Finally after a week, Leah, a manager called me back. She said they
Manager Response: Hi Collene V,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am sorry to read about the difficulties you had with your bill. Please allow me to follow up on your concerns and have the opportunity to regain your faith in us. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information.   We value you as our guest and looking forward to your response.   Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Excellent rooms and ideal location. Great staff both at reception and in the breakfast area - friendly and helpful. Attractive  lounge area on ground floor. Would definitely stay there again if visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Average Stay - Definitively not my HI first option
Summary: We stayed here as the HIE at 1411 S. Manchester was not available. Not a surprise but definitively it's not walking distance to the park. We took Uber as it was comparable to the cost of taking the bus (2 adults - 2 child) back and forth. The rooms are average and even with IHG Platinum status we were not elegible for an upgrade. The price-value relation is below par. What we found really inconvenient was the lack of having the breakfast included (as is the case of the 1411), as it adds to your overall expenses and time to actually get into the parks.  I recall this hotel advertises as having rooms with kitchen, ours simply had a fridge, mw and coffee machine all piled up.  All in all, definitively will not come back, and suggest other travelers to evaluate other Holiday Inn
Manager Response: Hi themexican,   Thank you for writing us your review and for letting us host your visit here in Anaheim. Your feedback is appreciated especially coming from an IHG Rewards Platinum Elite member. We do the best we can go beyond the standards set by IHG in serving its guests. On this visit, I am sorry to make you feel differently about getting the best of what you have paid for. I understand that our distance to the park was unexpected, same with the room amenities and the availability of a complimentary breakfast.   As one of our respected members, the stakes are high in delivering a consistent level of satisfaction. This has always been our goal to provide and we're up for this challenge. Insights such as this help us a lot in this process and I have shared your comments with our management team to review on these deficiencies.   We hope that you will give us another chance to show you the IHG Brand you know and love. Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us.  Best regards,   Frank A. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Focused on Vacationing Families, Good For Business Travellers
Summary: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort for three days on business. Like most of the hotels near Disneyland, this property primarily caters to families on vacation. However, the amenities provided also make this hotel a good stay for business travellers.  The HI Anaheim Resort is fairly easy to find from the freeway. Having taken an early flight into SoCal, we arrived at the hotel well before the regular check-in time; the front desk pre-checked us into our rooms and stored our luggage in a side-room until we checked in later that afternoon.
