The front desk staff was friendly and helpful; with many hotel guests, the front desk was busy most of the time during our stay. There was a computer center near the front desk with two computers; also near the front desk was a gift shop

First I’ll start with the pros: affordable, close to Disney, nice size rooms, shuttle to Disney, & free parking!  Cons: No bathtub, at least in our room so if you have a little kid that sucks, housekeeping didn’t come for two days until I called so no clean towels, they have false advertising saying free breakfast for kids but I get here and it’s for kids 5 and under! The restaurant is a bit expensive and food isn’t that good, the hotel is in a awkward location (not their fault) but you have to drive all the way around and back on the highway to get to a gas station or a restaurant, nothing is close! They’re on a one way street. Walls are thin so I heard my neighbors most of the night, shuttle cost 5 for adults and 2 for children, Beds were only full size not queens, & Lastly
Manager Response: Hello Monique B,  Thank you for staying with us and for enumerating the good, the bad and the opportunities to improve. While I am pleased that you liked our location, room size and shuttle service, I truly value the negative comments as this gives us the opportunity of improving what we can offer. I am sorry for the shortcomings you have experienced during your stay with us. It is not enough for us to be just good, we want to be exceptional and even though we could not fulfill your expectations this time, we will continue our work to improve all our services.  Thank you for being a part of our continuous efforts of creating great hotels that guests love. Your loyalty is always greatly appreciated and if you might have any suggestions that will contribute to enhancing your stay, please do not hesitate to contact us.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This Holiday Inn in conveniently located close (though not really walking distance) to the Disneyland Resort, the Anaheim Convention Center, Angels Stadium, and the Honda Center. It's right off I-5, so those traveling by car will find it very convenient.  Parking is complimentary and plentiful, even late at night after a long day at the theme parks. There is also an ART bus stop located right outside the hotel - perfect for those choosing to use public transportation to get around.  We arrived a little before check-in time, and woman at the front desk offered to upgrade us to a larger room so we didn't have to wait. The room had a king bed in one room and bunk beds in another room (though we didn't need them since it was just 2 of us).  The room looked quite worn around the
Manager Response: Hi travelteamSDF,  I realize that you have options when it comes to lodging, and I appreciate you choosing our property!  I am glad that you find our location, as well as our welcoming staff efficient. It is also nice to know that our parking posed a positive impression having ample spaces. However, I am sorry that we let you down in terms of the maintenance of the room including the cleanliness of the bathroom. What you described is never in the list of of the observations we wanted you to have of us. Your feedback has been shared with hotel management, and entirety of housekeeping who responded with genuine concern for the impact this had on your stay. They appreciate your sharing your experience, and am confident they will take steps so this doesn’t happen again.    Thanks again for your time, and we would love to welcome you back anytime soon.  Regards,  Anne A Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We couldn’t have been happier with our 4 day stay. Roberto was so helpful and accommodating to our family. We have a special needs daughter and the staff was always there to take care of us. The pirate suite rocks!!  Thank you everybody!

Summary Heading: Good location for Disney or visit to NHL / MLB
Summary: Visiting with a group of friends to watch an NHL game of the Ducks, I booked this hotel because of the location. From there it is rather close to the stadium. Obviously most people stay there to visit Disney.  The hotel serves decent burgers which is nice because there is nothing else close by. Rooms are new and spacious enough.

Location - 4* - conveniently located with easy access to I-5, Convention center and Disneyland - free parking - welcoming lobby - nice workout room  Room - 3* - clean but it can use some upgrades (carpet has stains, entry door had a gap the hallway light can be seen from inside room, dust on the bathroom light fixture)  Staff -3* - could give more personal​ attention to clients
Manager Response: Dear AMOMH,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am glad you liked the facilities we offer and the atmosphere of our hotel. I am sorry for the shortfalls you have noticed with the condition of your room and the service you had from our staff. Your feedback is very important to us as this continually helps us improve the facilities and guest services we offer to our guests.  Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I was really surprised by how nice the holiday inn would be. We usually stay at other hotels but we decided to make a last minute trip to Disneyland and one of our trip goers was on a budget so we decided to go for this hotel as it wasn’t too expensive.   I loved it. It is very close walking distance to the park. They have a small little “kitchen” area that has a sink and fridge. The beds were very comfortable as well.  I highly recommend this hotel.

The location is amazing! You are 7 min away from Disneyland and you can go in the shuttle that it’s 5 dlls round ride.  The best part is that they have burger theory inside the hotel so even if you come to the hotel tired you can eat there and it’s really tasty. Since we did the check out the staff was really nice and helpful.  We have a service dog so they gave us a little magnet that says “pet in room” which I think it can be helpful for the cleaning staff.  The check in was quick and nice, we ask for a room in the floors in the top and facing the pool and they put us in one.  The room is really clean and nice it has a mini fridge, coffee maker and a microwave.  The only thing I didn’t like it’s the water pressure on the shower but probably it’s to save water so I didn’t mind.

Summary Heading: Rooms fine but I wouldn’t eat there!
Summary: The rooms are up to date and clean.  The hallways and lobbies are well maintained.   Couldnt figure out why housekeeping kept putting room temp at 76f,whew it was hot each time I entered.  Do not eat in the restaurant.   Food mediocre at best.  There was actually mold on the bread at the breakfast buffet!  This was after a not so good hamburger the night before in a place that is supposed to be a hamburger restaurant.    Wasn’t overly fond of the view out my window of the trailer court either.
Manager Response: Hello M R,  Thanks for staying with us and for leaving a review. I'm happy that you found our rooms clean. However, it is regrettable that the room temperature and your breakfast experience negatively affected your overall satisfaction. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. We hope to get the opportunity of welcoming you back in the future. Thank you once again for your valuable comment, and if you might have any suggestions that will contribute to enhancing your stay, please do not hesitate to contact us.    Best Regards,   John O  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Nice clean hotel. We did stay in the cooler off season of December 1, 2017 week and the pool was freezing! Weather was around 80 degrees, so warm enough to sit by the pool, but could not enter due to temperature.  Only thing we were disappointed in was there was no continental breakfast. The restaurant in the hotel was very good for breakfast and dinner though.  The shuttle service to Disneyland was every half hour and super convenient. The only recommendation I would provide is for the first bus leaving of the day, make sure to be there at 6:00AM and NOT 6:20AM as they say, because they leave way earlier and you tend to miss the first bus and then have to wait until 7:00am!

Only stayed here one night but it was great! Nice, clean hotel. Despite being close to the highway, it was very quiet. Very well kept and had nice amenities. We also really enjoyed the restaurant. Would stay here again!

This was our fourth time at this hotel, each time for multiple nights. They don't disappoint. Great location to Disneyland or just a relaxing night on a long road trip. We were met with a happy smile and a warm greating at the front desk. We booked the weekend trip thru their website. On arrival check-in was quick and easy. All paper work was exactly as expected to the penny.   Last month we enjoyed three nights at the California Grand Hotel in Disneyland. The room at this HI Anaheim Resort was equally as clean and appointed. I tip my hat to housekeeping. It was nice having a restaurant and full bar on the ground floor for a night cap. Great selection of quality drinks with friendly service. The breakfast was delicious and service was top notch. Thanks for another comfortable

We had a great 2 night stay. We arrived around 10:00 a.m. and Maritza on the front desk was very helpful and made rooms available for us. We had a van with us and parking was easy and free. Rooms are clean and look recently remodeled, and the hotel in general feels welcoming. There is some Disney stuff around the hotel to get you in the Disney mood. Wish breakfast was included. There is a snack bar right next to the lobby and a restaurant with a bar in the hotel, which we didn't try, but looked good.   We chose to go to the parks in Uber since it's cheaper and a lot faster than driving yourself (parking at the parks is a hassle) or the ART bus. The Uber ride was about 6 dlls one way.

This was our first stays of many hotels in USA during our recent trip. We arrived at around 8.30 am on the Saturday 25th November, after our flight in from Brisbane. We were able to check in immediately, which we didn’t expect but we were pleasantly surprised. Great first impression of the USA as other places we stayed weren’t so friendly and provided great service. Our toilet became blocked one morning but it was quickly fixed and staff were very apologetic. Location of this hotel suited us as we walked 15 minutes to the Orange Outlet on the day we arrived and brought bags and bags of shopping due to the Black Friday Sale and had to Uber back as we couldn’t carry all the bags back (best way to overcome jet lag!!!) About a 12 minute walk to Disneyland. There is a shuttle bus

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, great staff
Summary: We stayed at this location while visiting Disneyland for Thanksgiving. The had the room with a queen and kid's room with bunk beds. Our daughter was very excited to have her own space along with her own tv. Each space had it's own a/c unit and thermostat.  The only thing I would change was the bathroom. It was very clean and updated but if your kid is used to taking a bath then you will have to get in the shower with them. There is not a tub.  Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.  The management staff is great. The rooms are clean. The bus/shuttle to Disneyland was decent and on time making the distance from the location and the park a non issue.  We would like to stay again during our next visit.

Our family of four (2 adults and 2 preteens) stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. I highly recommend. It was a very reasonable price yet was everytng we needed. Pool was great, rooms clean and cozy. We didn't eat at the restaurant. There is a nice small pool bar for drinks and snacks, lots of chairs and plenty of towels. The location isn't within walking distance to Disneyland however they do have th ART stop right out front of the hotel. We had a rental car so we chose to drive to the toy story lot and take the shuttle. The toy story lot was a five minute drive and cost us $20 for the day so it was a bit cheaper than the ART. I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Reasonably Priced and Good Value for Money
Summary: I found the Holiday Inn to be great! As soon as I arrived the staff were great and we are greeted with a smile!   Our flight from Australia came in at 6.30am and check in wasn’t until 4pm. The front desk were kind enough to keep our bags until our room was ready and in the interim we were able to see Disneyland for the day.   The bed was comfortable and our room was immaculate! The room service lady (Rosariok) even leaves a card with her name.   On our second night we asked the staff for a recommendation for dinner and they gave us a map with a list of restaurants. Jeremy recommended us the Ranch which was a amazing!   The only thing i didn’t like about our stay was the shower pressure. But given the hotel is in California I think it may have been one of those water saving

Summary Heading: Great room and view but restaurant could be better
Summary: Stayed 2 nights at this prop to visit Disneyland. The family room was big and comfortable. The recep was kind enough to oblige to my request with a view to see the fireworks. Made the stay worthwhile. Great pool with mickey shape. The only setback was the breakfast buffet. Big letdown in terms of variety and quality. I had an incident but luckily rectified by recep but still wish they paid more attention to my booking. There is nothing nearby so it's worth taking the ART shuttle if you're not driving.

My boyfriend and I just stayed here for our little Disney getaway. Everything went smoothly. Love how the shuttle is pretty direct to Disneyland. Only minor issue was the fact that the ice machines were on every other floor. We both agreed that this hotel is definitely an option when we return. Excellent customer service as well!

Friendly staff, clean rooms and great accommodations for dining and leisure. Close to Disneyland with a shuttle that transports you to and from the hotel to Disneyland front gate. A hassle and worry free option for travelers.

Stayed only one night after landing in LA from Sydney before heading off to A the next day. Wish we could have stayed longer. Rooms were were bright and modern and clean, staff friendly and helpful. Pool area was a good size and tidy and Burger Theory was excellent.
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your quick visit to the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. We hope to see you again in the near future should your travels bring you back out to the Anaheim area.

Summary: The Rooms were super nice, the staff was always helpful... The Beds were Long... All the other Hotels we stayed on in Las Vegas And Long Beach were short beds... Not something we expected... On top of this.... The partnership with Burgertheory on the hotel made a Superb Burger... All round.... The other hotels we stayed on were all 5 stars but none could match this place on the whole trip... We missed did place.... Not the last time we will visit this place... But thanks from Denmark... And by the way best value for money is this resort....

The staff is amazing catered to all our needs. The night manager recommended a great restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. The staff is so caring about there customers. A short walk to Disney about 10 minutes. Rooms are clean and spacious. Happy we chose this hotel.

I just checked into the hotel and I must say that the service is excellent so far. Specifically, Marcel at the front desk offered top notch service. I will certainly be recommending this hotel and I hope to come gain for a future visit. The room is clean. Overall five stars. I can't wait to try the food. I had a long flight and I am starving :-)

Summary Heading: Good hotel in resort area (but not "in" resort area)
Summary: We enjoyed staying here with my three kids.  It was a little tight with the 2 beds but we knew that coming into it.  The location is just off of Katella, which for those of you familiar with the Resort area is a main road leading to Disneyland.  However, it's on a one way street so leaving in the morning to the park usually meant driving through suburban areas of Anaheim.  I have been the Disneyland a lot and am pretty good at navigating around but could see how this might be a harder location for some.  It's about 1.5 away from main gate so I don't recommend walking it unless you are kidless.  We didn't use the Anaheim shuttle but it seemed like a regular stop with a kiosk to purchase tickets right on the side of the hotel.    There were a good deal of business people at the

We spent 1 night here and had 2 adjoining rooms. I'm a club-card member so that's why I book with Holiday Inn, and this one is a very nice, extremely clean, hotel. There's really nothing I didn't like about the hotel. Our check-in was very easy, and the front staff was great. I realized when we walked in and saw the Disney characters painted on the wall front and center it was an overnight place for Disneyland visitors - which we weren't: we were headed to a concert at the Honda Center (which was only an 8-minute ride away.) Anyhow,  the beds were comfortable enough, carpets were clean, linens were clean, bathrooms were clean, the room was odor-free, and there was a Keurig in the room (nice touch, but the "all-in-one" coffee accessory packet they provide is outdated in that it's

Summary Heading: Important info  (The Good, The Great, and Why You'd Avoid)
Summary: First off it is close to Disneyland.  You probably knew that which is why you are booking it.  However you need to take a shuttle from the hotel to the park, and of course the hotel charges you.  This hotel is super crowded in the lobby so keep your eye on your belongings and keep an eye on your kids as they can get lost even in a small space.  There is no free coffee in the lobby, there are only two clerks at the front desk so the wait to be helped can be long.  The Good - (Rooms)  Very spacious.  Clean.  They smell good as well.  Beds were comfy, maybe a little outdated.  All in all a comfortable no frills place to stay.  The Great - (Location)  Close to Disneyland, Close to the Freeway.  Easy to get to many locations throughout orange and Los Angeles Counties.    Why You'd
Manager Response: Dear RealAndTrueReviews,    Thank you for sharing your impressions of your recent stay with us and thank you for being an IHG Rewards Club Platinum Elite member.   I am very happy that our spacious and good smelling rooms  as well as the location of our hotel met your expectations. We strive to provide the best possible service as well as experience and it is always great to hear from our valued guests on how we are doing. I also take note regarding your comment that there was no upgrades for Platinum Elite members. We will use your comments to coach our team in order to provide a better experience in the future. I apologize if this might have caused you inconvenience.   Once again thank you for choosing to stay with us.   We would be delighted if you visit us again in the future.   Best Regards,   Ben W. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: 3-night Disney weekend not so great accommodation experiences
Summary: I booked the hotel with reward points by mistakes.  Originally was going to book Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites Anaheim but found out I booked this hotel instead.  We arrived at the hotel at about 8PM after a long 8 hour drive.  The check in was smooth and we were able to check into the room without any issues.  As it was late, we had dinner in the hotel at the Burger Theory.  The food was surprisingly good at a reasonable price at $70 for a family of four including tips, beer and appetizers.  That's where we found a few unpleasant experiences the next few days.  During our stay in Disneyland, apparently the house cleaning was not doing an appropriate job.  Although the bedsheets were "felt" clean, we saw obvious stains on both the pillow and towels in the bathroom.  The hallway
Manager Response: Hi khkchien,  Thank you for your review and for staying with us. Our goal is to ensure that each guest stay is an excellent one. I am glad to learn you you had an easy check-in and enjoyed your restaurant experience. However, I am so sorry for the housekeeping issues you encountered and I apologize for any discomfort these may have caused you. Please be assured that your comments will be forwarded to the housekeeping team to ensure our valued guests' needs and expectations are met in the future.  Again, many thanks for your review. Although we were not able to exceed or at least be at par with your expectations, we hope you give us a chance to change your perception of our hotel.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary: For many years, we have traveled the world and stayed in top of the line hotels; we own two time sharings, but, never in our lives had we experienced a hotel or resort that had such professional and caring staff. Your property is perfect either for a family vacation or for business travelers. You have a beautiful and cozy hotel, super clean, with a great restaurant, a privileged location, very close to Disney, great amenities, and a nice relaxing atmosphere all for a great price. You and your staff made a big difference and everywhere we go, we will now recommend your hotel and the Holiday Inn. The hotel Operations manager, Kim Bixler, went above and beyond, when an unexpected situation arose and we had to change plans. We're definitely coming back!

The main drawback of this establishment is that we booked at peak season- ended up staying in the smoke room. The customer service wasn’t fantastic. However, the pools were quite nice and the hotel over all was pretty nice- good views. The beds dressers etc were new enough . The rooms were pretty clean, but the halls could use an update.
Manager Response: Hi traveltheglobe394,  I am grateful to you for being one of our guests at Holiday Inn  Anaheim-Resort Area CA, and getting out of your way to leave us your feedback. I understand that your stay was not a complete success because of the room assigned was not to your liking and the level of service received was a letdown. IHG sincerely cares about your experience, and I appreciate your taking the time to let us know. I have shared your comments with hotel management and I know they appreciate your sharing your experience and am confident they will take steps so this doesn’t happen again.    Again, thanks for getting in touch with us. If you need anything else just send us an e-mail at ihgservice@ihg.com.  Sincerely,  Ronald R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: My best friend and I stayed here for 3 nights. Excellent customer service at the front desk (Justin is very knowledgeable) and all were a smiling pleasure to deal with. It's not close (walking) to Disneyland but we used Uber $6 takes up to 4 adults, where as the bus is $5 per person. Our only dislike was the shower had very low water pressure and there was no food or drink available when Burger Theory is closed 1-5pm. Clean, great gym and pool with hot tub. Enjoy !

Our room was on the 6th floor with a view of Disney, you could see the Guardians of the Galaxy ride not to far away so we watched the fireworks from or room some nights. The room itself was very spacious and clean. The maid came in every morning to give us new towels and made the bed never moved any of our things either. Check in was quick and easy so was check out. We stayed for 14 nights so they gave us the wifi code but in the second week the code stopped working. I asked at the front desk and they very quickly gave me a new code an apologised. One of the managers even took our change for some toffee peanuts on our last day as we didn't want to take them home with us. Only a 5 minute drive to Disney or you can get the shuttle we didn't as was always going somewhere before or

Had to book a room last minute on our trip to LA and this hotel was in a good location and was priced well so gave it a shot.  Being located near so many attractions and along I-5 made it a great place to stay during our time in Anaheim and LA.  The staff was very friendly and helpful despite arriving to the hotel well after midnight.  The hotel exterior, rooms, common areas, and every thing about the place was very clean, neat, and safe looking and the beds were very comfortable as well.  The restaurant and bar on the 1st floor, Burger Theory, was fantastic along with the staff (both food and bar wise) and was well worth eating and drinking there.  Highly recommend for anyone visiting both Anaheim and LA in general.

This was one of the "Good Neighbor" hotels listed through Disneyland package. PRO:  There was a bus (ART) that ran about every 15 to 20 minutes between the hotel and the Disney Parks.  We bought a pass as part of our package which I think saved us some money but there was a machine at the hotel to purchase ticket for each day. PRO:  This specific hotel and one other location was only stops for this specific bus route.  Heard others complaining about crowded bus or too long between hotel and park due to number of stops but not the case with this line! CON:  Pretty far removed from everything if Disney is your main thing.  Restaurant options limited to the one on site as nothing was close enough to walk to easily - especially with little ones tired from the park all day. PRO:

It was our second time visiting here. We spend 4 nights visited California Adventure, Los Angeles and Seal Beach we had a good stay. We had breakfast and Dinner! The Buffalo Wings are very good! We will definitely come back!

Absolutely NO customer loyalty what so ever. My son had a life threatening emergency when I tried to cancel WELL before check in time. They refused to let me cancel or refund even partial payment. I cancelled my membership with them. I will never book with them again. I will let all of my friends, family, social media and my husband's Marine Corps Base know that the Holiday Inn does not respect family, military or emergency situations and that they have no customer loyalty what so ever. Thank you.
Manager Response: Hi Savannah M,  Thank you for your review and for staying at the hotel. It is truly regrettable to hear that you experienced inconvenience due to the level of customer service received from the hotel regarding your reservation. I understand how frustrating these matters can be and I am sorry our hotel staff was not able to address this issue appropriately. As such, I have sent you a private message regarding this unsatisfactory stay.  Your visit is valuable and I hope you will continue to choose IHG for your future travel needs.  Sincerely,    Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Nice hotel - walked to the game
Summary: Stayed here as our first hotel of a tour.  We were jet lagged when we arrived so we went for a walk to stay awake.  Nice enough walk to the Disney area, but taxied back.  The pool area is nice.  My mate and I walked to the Angels Stadium and it took about 20 minutes.  My wife and friend went to the burger place for dinner and really enjoyed it.  Breakfast buffet was good quality and the wait staff made me some eggs special.  All in all a nice hotel.

Stayed here for 1 night only, after we finished our disney trip.  Location is okay, definitely not walking distance, but they have a bus stop right there for bringing you to disneyland.  Room is pretty okay for that price.  Staff is nice.

Visited for one night and the hotel is ok. rooms are a little small and we asked for a double and a king but we did not get it even if the hotel was not sold out. They do have great transportation to go to the park. You can take the shuttle for $3.50 per adult and $2.00 per kid and it drops you off right in be front of the park. The pool is average but nice. Nothing walking distance so you have to have a car to go to shops or restaurant   Parking is free which is nice
Manager Response: Hi Laure P,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your feedback regarding your experience at our hotel. I am elated to hear praises about our hotel shuttle and free parking amenity and I am happy to read you noticed our pool. Your compliments motivate us to continue to provide excellent quality and service to all our guests. However, I am sorry for the room accommodation you received especially the room type that was assigned to you. We do our best to meet all guest's needs, particularly requests, I am sorry we were not able to provide this during your visit. This is not our usual way of taking care of our guests and your comments have been taken seriously. We aspire to provide you with the highest level of customer service, as such, your concerns will be addressed with our team moving forward.   Again, I appreciate your review. We'd love to see you again soon so we can provide you an amazing experience with us all around.   Regards,    Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: We just returned from a recent stay in this property and as a travel agent by trade I would have no hesitation to recommend this hotel to anyone going to Anaheim to visit Disneyland etc....  The hotel was bright and the room clean and spacious. As a family of 4 we had 2 queen beds in the room. The rooms also had a lovely and clean bathroom, with ample counter top space there too - a must for families!!!  The staff here were wonderful, very friendly at all times of the day and had lots of knowledge regarding the surrounds and things to see and do.   Obviously being in Anaheim; Disneyland and Disney California Adventure Park were on our visit list and they have a shuttle that picks up every 20 minutes to drop off at the bus stops within the park - this came in very handy

This is an old, tired property that has had a little lipstick applied. Nothing special. A few issues:   - Double beds--smaller than full size beds you might have at home--make it almost impossible for couples to share a bed.   - Room configuration is awkward with the bathroom door hitting he closet door and almost the room door.   - Not enough dresser space (3 small drawers for a family)  - Our AC unit rattled & suddenly buzzed loudly at night to where we had to turn it off and open the window, which only opened 3 inches.   - Toilet didn't flush unless you held the lever down for 10 seconds.   - The towels at the pool are kitchen dish-towel size.   - The pool bar closes at 5pm.   The most concerning issue is the hotel is dirty and disorganized and seems understaffed. Housekeeper
Manager Response: Thanks for your time in posting a thorough review about your experience at our hotel and for staying with us. Your comments are very helpful as our goal has always been to provide our guests with the best accommodation and hospitality service. I'm sorry to learn that the overall hotel condition, bathroom cleanliness and mos t of our amenities was a letdown and that you found the staff service less than efficient.  IHG cares about your experience and I realize no words can change your feelings of disappointment, or inconveniences you experienced.  I will make sure to share all your feedback with the upper management for retraining and to our maintenance and housekeeping department to look into areas of improvements. Your review will also remain on corporate file for the periodic review of our property.   Again, thank you for your feedback. We would be honored to host your stay in the future and provide you a more noteworthy hotel experience.    Sincerely,    Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: This place is clean, comfortable and convenient in price and location in the Anaheim area. We booked 3 rooms and requested they be close together. Front desk got us an adjoining room and the 3rd next door. They helped us with directions and long distance phone calls and calling cabs for us.   Only cons I can mention are the AC not working properly in 2 rooms. One of us had to move to another room directly across so was in the same vicinity as the other 2 rooms. The rooms were a bit muggy. The room I had had only a shower with hardly anything to hold toiletries. The doors to the bathroom, front door and adjoining door were very close together so there wasn't much entry room.   Altogether I would still highly recommend this hotel. Safety comfort and cleanliness are definitely

Stayed here with my son and his friend. A great base to explore both the local area and further afield. Staff all very pleasant and polite. Couldn't do enough to help and make sure that all our needs were catered for. Was great to be welcomed back from staff at reception when returning each evening despite the many number of guests. Staff in the restaurant very alert to needs and would appear quickly at table seeming to know what you wanted before you asked i.e refills etc. Small cafe too and again very pleasant staff. Food fairly priced and goid quality.  Rooms cleaned well and beds and towels replaced as and when we required them. Rooms air conditioned. Pool area clean and tidy. Hot tub too which was nice. A small gym but had what was needed. Shuttle service to Disney resort

Summary Heading: I don't know about this place
Summary: I was here for work but checking it out as a potential stay with my family in the future.  My room was good and clean.  I think the only issue I had was the windows are paper thin and I could hear the kids in the pool all day until it closed at 11:00pm.  I was in the tower with the main lobby.  Pool was good, beer and wine in the pool are in the afternoon which is nice.  Onsite restaurant.  When I travel with my family I like to stay closer to the park because I'm not a fan of the ART system but at this hotel it's probably the best set up.  ART pretty much only stops at this hotel which makes for a faster trip.  They have a nice bench at the hotel for sitting and a kiosk to purchase the tickets.  I still prefer to stay closer to the park and be able to walk.  It costed me $5.00
Manager Response: Hello Aprill18,  Thank you so much for staying with us and for taking the time to leave us your feedback. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business. We are thrilled to hear that our rooms and pool facility contributed in making your experience comfortable and memorable. I regret to read that you perceive the noise level in the property too high. Our guest's comfort remains a priority and I am sorry for letting you feel otherwise. I have shared your comments with hotel management, who responded with genuine concern for the impact this had on your stay. I know they appreciate you sharing your experience, and I am confident they will take appropriate steps so this doesn’t happen again.  Again, thank you for making the effort to share your thoughts. We value you as a guest, and do want you to know that your concerns are our concerns. Please stay with us again soon so that we can demonstrate our commitment to your comfort. We look forward to having the opportunity to restore your confidence in our hotel in the near future.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This is the third time that we stay at this hotel. They have kept up with the hotel. They sell Disney tickets at this location and they have a shuttle to and from Disney. They have a restaurant and a little Cafe. There are many restaurants around as well. Such as Bubba Gump, PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory and etc... They also have a Target near.   The hotel has good customer service. The only issue that I had was that after deciding to extend my stay they didn't offer  me a low rate. They actually doubled it!! I guess having a Gold Elite status doesn't really mean anything.

Summary Heading: Nice family hotel convenient to Disney & Knotts Berry
Summary: Spent 2 nights to break the LA to San Diego drive, good location close disney, knotts berry farm and the Outlets store.  Nice pool, convenient shop and decent restaurant.  Disney shuttle is regular and relatively cheap. Staff were friendly and plentiful.

Good hotel location by Disneyland resort area, great swimming pool and hot tub area. can watch the fire works from Disneyland attractions. the staff was accommodating with the room issue and move us to the clean room. Is all about guest satisfaction on guest demand...

Before I get into the bad let me write about the good.  The service at the restaurant was great for breakfast and dinner.  And that is about it about good news. A very basic hotel almost a motel with absolutely no service. They definitely are cashing in on their proximity to Disney Land. I picked this property again because of proximity to my work location. Would I book this for a personal holiday - nooo.  I stayed here or business purposes and expected basic services like room service, laundry etc. None of them existed. Asked for a bottle opener - none available. Can I get some cutlery - oh yes you can get plastic cutlery.  But again the staff at the restaurant and bar were very courteous and friendly.  It's an ok place to stay. Just don't expect any Holiday Inn quality.
Manager Response: Dear ncc2145,   We appreciate you for sharing your review about your recent stay.  We are very sorry that you did not experience an exemplary hotel stay because of the level of service your have received. I apologize for any inconvenience you might have experienced. Please be assured, that we have noted and forwarded your comments about that there was no room and laundry service for the management to review. In the midst of the inconvenience I am glad to know that our service was still appreciated.						   I very much hope that you will grant us the opportunity to prove ourselves again.  Best Regards,  Ben W. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Many of my requests were either ignored or denied. The people who were managing the facility were really rigid towards all kids of requests. The wifi signal in room was very feeble .. this was reported, but was not addressed in 4 days of stay..
Manager Response: Hi Jishith,  I appreciate you sharing your review and for staying with us. I assure you that we are committed to delivering quality in all aspects of the guest experience and appreciate the high ratings you have given towards our rooms and hotel location. However, I am sorry to hear that the  hospitality of our hotel staff failed to meet your expectation as well as apologize for the troubles caused by the WIFI performance. I greatly value your comments as this helps us identify areas of concern and take the necessary steps to remedy the situation. Your concerns have been forwarded to the team and IT department for evaluation.   Thank you for imparting with us your experience. Our team hopes to see you again.    Sincerely,    Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: I stayed in the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort  Area for one night in early June 2017.  The hotel is comfortable and nicely located to the Disneyland area.  The hotel has all the facilities with very comfortable rooms and bathroom facilities. There are coffee / tea making facilities and a frìdge in the room. There is also free wifi for guests.   There is also a buffet breakfast each morning with a wide choice of food options available and at a very reasonable price

Summary Heading: A very good choice to visit Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for two nights with a 7 yr old and a 5 yr old. The room was neat and spacious, very modern, with a clean feel. The front desk staff was very helpful while checking in. They first gave us a room facing the highway, however upon asking they switched it to a room looking towards the Disneyland Park. The Arts shuttle was quite handy to reach Disneyland at different times during the day. The restaurant in the hotel was pretty decent, so that I ate here with my girls in the evening. The breakfast was included in our rate and was offered also in this restaurant. The staff at the restaurant was always kind and accommodative regarding my kids. The only reason for a 4 star is, I asked to book car to reach LAX at a certain time on our departure morning 24hrs in advance and the

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Great service at the desk! Great service from the service man. Our thermostat kept change the temp all on it's own.   The hot tub was great after all that walking!! Beds were very comfortable and very nice decor. We were on the 9th floor and barely heard any people coming and going. The bathtub was a good size.   We never tired the restaurant in the hotel. As we just never around during those times.  This hotel is a fair walk to Disney. I recommend taking the shuttle.

Hotel was nice. Rooms clean and neat. As comfortable as any other. I was there for business so had no interation with Disney orher than being able to hear the fireworks. Rooms are spread out into separate buildings and parking can be a problem. The property is not far from various shops and restaurants. Acess was a little tricky due to road works at the time but that was not the hotel's fault

Summary Heading: Great place to stay to visit Disney
Summary: This is a very new hotel, and only about 1.5 miles from Disney. We weighed up the price of staying next door to the park against the price of car parking, and I'm glad we made this call. Parking and wi-fi are free, there is a shuttle service (paid) to the park, but we just took our car. Hotel to car park was no more than 10 minutes. There's a good restaurant on site and a pool, and staff were very friendly. Our room was very comfortable too...it has persuaded us to use Holiday Inn for future US stays.

Summary Heading: Comfy but need to take a shuttle not included walk is over 30 min, nor breakfast
Summary: Staff is great but there is no extras. No breakast included. You have to take a shuttle which over $5 a day which adds up with a family children at $2 a day rthere are savings for extended days. Has a great pool but time for use is enforced. If you are on a budget would NOT rcommend this hotel

We were very happy to learn that the suite we booked had a King size bed. We did not expect this but it was such a relief! The hotel is great! We love the swimming pool area and spent a lot of time there. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. We did have an issue with billing when purchasing Disneyland tickets from the hotel they charged us $1,766 by mistake. This was all of our vacation spending money. What could have been a very bad experience was handled with care by the Manager Kym. She acknowledged they made a mistake, reversed the charge and credited us 2 nights on our stay. She was very apologetic and did everything she could to make it right. We understand that mistakes happen and we are greatful she took care of the situation. Thank you for a great

Stayed at this hotel because we found a great deal through west jet vacations and the hotel was exceptional!  It was clean and the rooms were modern and comfortable. Housekeeping did a top notch job! Only down side was the restaurant was only open for breakfast and again at 5pm to 10pm. We would have liked to grab a drink during our mid day break, and the pool bar hours were spotty. We took the ART bus which only goes from Disneyland and back, and stops at #12 on the bus que at Disneyland.  It came every 20-25 mins or so.  I do prefer staying within walking distance but it was manageable.  The area surrounding the hotel is safe and comfortable to explore, but it's not a close walk to Disney.  The front desk staff were super helpful and friendly, except at the time they only had

I absolutely loved this hotel. It's so Disney themed, and so family friendly. Great location. The pool is shaped as a "Mickey" head and a few feet from a hot tub. After traveling from state to state, being in a variety of hotels this one gets 3 thumbs up. The desk staff was so accommodating to everyone's needs. Polite, and for me housekeeping did a fantastic job.. which I find lacking in other hotels from 5 star to a few lower ones.  They offer a breakfast and a restaurant  called Burger Theory. They smelled wonderful. Many adventure parks close by and they have a bus that comes to hotel to take you to these parks. The only down point for me was the breakfast staff. several days of unpleasantness. Had incident with food, sent back ... reappeared praying wasn't same food.
Manager Response: Good morning 74lilak,   I am thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I will share your comments with our team, especially the comments regarding the breakfast service you encountered. Your feedback is highly valuable to us as this helps us continually make necessary changes to improve the service and facilities we offer our guests. We look forward to your return and I hope you have a wonderful weekend!

Summary Heading: Good value and great looking hotel
Summary: This was booked via a 3rd party site where the property is revealed after paying. It was a great value even though breakfast was not included. The pool is amazing although it is shared with Staybridge Suites next door so it can get crowded.  The room was nice and the bed was okay. The designers messed up and put the sink/vanity inside the bathroom instead of out in the room. Why is that a problem? When the 4 of you return at midnight from a day in DL and everyone is trying to shower, use the toilet and brush teeth, etc, it's nice to split the space in two.  I recommend a stay as I would be happy to stay again, although I prefer many other nearby properties to this one.  Free parking and no resort fee.
Manager Response: Hello marcjenks!  I would like to thank you for choosing to stay with us and going out of your way to leave you thoughts. I'm happy with your appreciation of the cleanliness and quality of our rooms and pool area. It's also good to know that you approve of the value in our pricing structures. On the other hand, it is regretful to know that there's a bit of an issue with the configuration of our bathroom and vanity area. It is our goal to deliver the most genuine hospitality to all our guests so please know that your remarks will be used to help us further the amenities and services that we are delivering. I hope that we can welcome you back in our hotel so we can make it up to you.   Warmest Regards,   Gian M Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We enjoyed this hotel for our school group from Texas choir competition. Jessica at front desk was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are nice, clean, and bathrooms are spacious for 4 teens getting ready in mornings. However, it gets very loud in the hallways because you can hear every sound coming from inside the rooms! Corner rooms are quiet. We did not partake of the breakfast. Service at the burger restaurant downstairs was slow for takeout. Would recommend for families. Overall, an enjoyable stay and experience.

The hotel is quite near Disneyland and thus saves on travel time. The hotel though does not have suites. There is another property of IHG that does accdg to the frontdesk. They do acknowledge the guest status in IHG and provided us free drink vouchers. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant has good-tasting burgers and fries.
Manager Response: Hi Eugenesmart,   I am glad you stayed with the Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area, CA as Disneyland is about 5 minutes away from this location. We try to keep our loyal guests happy and it's just right that you get recognition as an IHG Rewards Club member.   We understand that your needs may vary in terms of the room set up and we'll keep your feedback in mind for future improvements. We hope that you'll come visit again soon!  Kind Regards,   Anna B Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Clean hotel with good facilities. The bar and restaurant were good as was the breakfast.   Good size pool which was shared with the hotel next door, obviously same company.   Shuttle at the door to Disneyland although not free.   Only observation would be get a guest laundry (unless I missed it).
Manager Response: Thank you helenmiamark for taking the time to review your stay with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am happy to see that you enjoyed your visit. We hope the next time you are in the Anaheim area we will see you again. Next time you do come visit the guest laundry is located on the 9th floor behind the elevators : ) Have a wonderful day!

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights as I visited Disneyland. The hotel was beautiful. Very modern. The rooms were very spacious. My room had a King size bed. Rooms were very clean. Also very quiet. Resturant with breakfast buffet was good, and affordable.  Also a regular menu was offered.  I would stay there again!

We recently stayed here for a family vacation at Disney and we loved it! Clean, clean and very nice rooms! Comfortable beds and pillows with modern, crisp, white linens.  Our room over looked the pool and one night we were even able to watch part of the fireworks. It is not close enough to walk especially after a day of walking in the parks but we did walk on our first night just to Downtown Disney and it is doable.  Take the ART shuttle though that comes every 20 minutes for a very small fee and stops right outside the hotel. The nice thing is that the bus only serves the Holiday Inn and the hotel right beside it so no extra stops just a direct quick drive.  Be careful though when you time going and coming home because the bus can fill up fast and you will end up having to wait
Manager Response: Thank you so much Shelly for sharing your experiences with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am so happy to see that you will be returning to us on your next visit when Star Wars Land will be opening... we are all so excited as well to see it!!!  I hope you have a lovely weekend and we will see you on your next trip!

Summary: The hotel is not walking distance to Disney land but has a shuttle that is very inexpensive. The Burger Restaurant on site is excellent. The Pool area of hotel was perfect for the kids. The pool even had music. Now when we checked in our room was small for 4 people. That said the room was very clean and beds comfortable. I asked the manager for a free upgrade being that we were staying for 7 days. She upgraded us to a family suite. The room had Bunk beds, fridge, coffee, King size bed in bedroom and access to a Xbox.

Summary Heading: Great family stay close to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 5 days at the end of April. It was a great place close to Disneyland Resort. The Burger Theory Restaurant attached to the hotel had fantastic burgers and the service was very good as well! The front desk was very attentive to our stay and satisfied us accordingly. This hotel does not have a shuttle but the ART only costed us $31 USD for a family of 3 for a 3-day pass which was much cheaper than driving to the park, highly recommend!  Our room was cleaned every day and the hotel staff were friendly and kind! Would definitely stay next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at Holiday Inn ANAHEIM-RESORT AREA.  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. We use feedback, such as yours, to continuously make changes to our brand to improve the guest experience. We hope that you will give us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Again, thank you for choosing Holiday Inn, and if I can be of assistance to you, please contact me directly at kim.bixler@ihg.com.  Sincerely, Kim Bixler  kim.bixler@ihg.com

Summary Heading: Huge comfy rooms a short walk from Disneyland
Summary: We had a room with two queens and queen pullout couch. It was quiet and comfortable with a classy decor that made the hotel seem brand new. It was so much nicer to leave the car here and walk to the park rather than pay Disney for that privilege!

Summary Heading: Fast efficient services my room was clean bed comfortable and soft pillows plenty of towels  free fast wifi and cable
Summary: Fast efficient services my room was clean bed comfortable and soft pillows plenty of towels  free fast wifi and cable with all the channels food services within the hotel are limited there is a burger restaurant attached to the hotel and a small food stand .  There nothing within walking distance a five minute Uber ride cost around  5 bucks brings to the outlets and food places. I would stay again
Manager Response: Goo afternoon Soul55,   I am happy to hear that you had a wonderful visit with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. Thank you for reviewing your stay with us and sharing your experiences. We look forward to your return visit!

Summary: Great sized rooms and recently renovated. Huge bathroom, and a fridge and microwave in the rooms which is u usual for a lot of American hotels is a great touch. My daughter and I loved the beds, very comfortable. Huge pool area and hot tub. We have stayed in the Anaheim resort area 4 times over the past 8 years and have always been a lot closer to Disneyland so I find it interesting that any reviews mention how close it is, it is by far the furthest we have ever been from the park, I would guess at least a 30minute walk. In saying that the ART has a stop at the hotel which is extremely convenient. I definitely would not be comfortable walking outside the hotel of a night, but it felt safe in the daylight. The staff were lovely! Thank you :)

Stayed two nights, 2 kids 2 teenagers, one room. Room was spacious and the bathroom was the largest I've seen in a standard hotel.  The walk-in shower was awesome.  Why don't more hotels do this?  Room was nice with microwave and fridge.  WiFi slowed down at night and in the morning.  Staff were ALL friendly, happy, professional and willing to help.  Check-in was a breeze.  Hotel is in great shape and very clean pool is big.  Three things would have made this go from Very Good to Excellent: 1. Free Breakfast 2. Queen beds instead of Full 3. No "tie line" or cord in shower to hang swimming suits  We had a great stay.

Summary Heading: Great service at a fine location
Summary: In a safe hotel area, near to disneyland.  Not walking distance but okay. Very courteous staff at check in. We called about a few issues, for a shower stool, remote control, a phone problem, and towels. All handled quickly and nicely. Hot tub is also a good size. I wish children were prohibited from the hot tub due to age. They splash the adults and there is a large pool for them,  but oh well.

Summary Heading: Changed my opinion of Holiday Inn!
Summary: I never stay or even consider this brand of hotels when traveling-I am primarily use a Marriott property.   I stayed here with another family during a visit to Disneyland.  The property is very nice, the lobby is well decorated, open and comfortable.  The rooms are recently updated and in very good condition.  There is plenty of room to spread out in the two double bed room, the bathroom is spacious and has all the amenities.  They also  have adjoining rooms available. We did not eat at the hotel but other reviews said the food is good.   The grounds are well maintained.  There is a bus transportation to Disneyland in the parking lot.  If you drive to the park, it is 5 minutes away.  An excellent stay, I would come back on a return trip to  the area.   Also, free parking.
Manager Response: Thank you Vitagal for taking the time to review your stay here with us at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. We appreciate your business and I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to your return visits!

Summary: We took a family vacation with nine people to Disneyland. We stayed at the holiday inn and got joining rooms. Holiday inn has a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland. They make it very convenient for families to get in and out of the hotel and to local activities.
Manager Response: Thank you Kim G for sharing your experiences with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am happy that you enjoyed your visit and we hope to see you again!

Summary: I don't mind the short drive to Disneyland, but the hotel is also on the ART route. The rooms are large and comfortable, and I especially appreciated the extra-large bathroom (mine at home is tiny). The convenience of having a small fridge and microwave in the room cannot be overstated! The staff is friendly, patient, and helpful.I plan to stay at this property again.

Used this hotel as part of a 16 day tour of the west coast of America. More than adequate hotel providing a good basic breakfast and a reasonable evening meal menu. Swimming pool area was good (unmanned) and rooms were very good with lots of space. Good location for visiting Disney and the hotel provides a minibus service to the park.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel to stay and relax
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights. Rooms were spacious and clean. We enjoyed our stay at Holiday inn. Staff were very friendly. You can buy tickets to Disney here and also book tours to LA or Sandiego. Restaurant staff is quite friendly and supportive. The resort has nice pool and jacuzzi.  Near to Disney land - there is a direct shuttle to Disney land which takes around 5-8 mins. Very convenient.   Highly recommended for families and kids. Kids eat free at restaurant   Not many options at the restaurant but you can order food. The microwave is provided to heat up food. No lunch at the restaurant.

2nd time staying at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort in a King bed room. Love this hotel! Both the room and the bathroom are very modern and renovated, the bed has nice white bedding, and the decor has a nice, airy feel. There is a CLEAN/brand new and tasteful arm chair to sit at and a stand up shower(no bathtub in my particular room). Very large pool and hot tub are next level--best we have stayed at--resort feel with all the trees and large deck space, ample comfortable lounge chairs, tables and umbrellas, and it stays open until 11pm!! The 3 elevators are fast, lots of free parking, great staff, gym and the ART(Anaheim Resort Transit bus) takes you to/from Disney in approx. 10 minutes for $5.50/day adult unlimited use.  I had a room on the right side/Disney side of the hotel at
Manager Response: Good morning Jen s,   Thank you for taking the time in sharing your experiences with us here at the HOliday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am so happy that you returned to our hotel for another visit and had another wonderful stay with us. We look forward to many more visits from you when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area.

Summary: I must say what a nice surprise and relaxing. I will stay there again for sure the rooms are so clean and feel very new. if your looking to walk to Disneyland this is not your place, but no worries the Art bus picks you up at hotel then takes you to the front entrance to Disneyland. What i like it was it wan on its own street and quit so easy to get in and out of with free parking.front desk very friendly and helpful if your going to Honda Center or The big A just take lyft and it is only 5 minutes away. .

Hotel is close to Disney with a shuttle bus available for a small fee.  Had a great view of the snow covered mountains from the room.  The only draw back is there is no complimentary breakfast offered.  There is a restaurant on the property which was nice after a day at the park where we could go for a drink and relax.  Rooms were nice and clean, staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: REALLY close to Disney land - not a good view of it though.
Summary: This hotel is not kidding when they boast that they're close to Disney Land.  I drove there in less than 10 minutes, I'd say and it was an easy drive.  The view of the park was not great though, an in fact, there is an old trailer park right behind the hotel that kinda messes up the view.  The workout room was above average, though.  And the pool area is nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us here at the Holiday Inn. I am happy that you enjoyed your visit with us and we look forward to seeing you again should your travel plans bring you back to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: I should follow my own advice
Summary: So I stayed here again, without reading my review from last year, so I deserved what I got.  The second time the hotel seemed somewhat better. Things seemed to operate better and, as always, the staff is wonderful. This still is not a hotel for business people or people on vacation that must take care of business. But before I go into the negative, here was what is good. The place looks just as good as last time. It still has the new hotel feel, is very clean and very attractive. Still good for families that will be spending the day at Disneyland or outside at the pool. Now the problems. If it is at all possible the internet is even slower and worse than last year. Why did I come back- because it is a very good value compared to the hotels close to the Convention Center. Why
Manager Response: Hi toooldforthis,  Thank you very much for staying with us and for taking the time to share your recent experience. I am delighted to read that your overall stay was enjoyable and that you found our location commendable. On the other hand, I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations when it comes to our internet connectivity. I do value your feedback as it allows us to identify the areas for improvements. I wish to inform you that we are constantly upgrading our amenities where possible to offer our guests a better accommodation experience.     Once again, thank you for your feedback.  It was our pleasure taking care of you and we are already counting down to your next visit.    Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Very easy going and friendly staff. The rooms were a delights, looks like they had recently been remodeled. They were clean and the bathrooms were in good condition too! Good food and overall a good experience. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Jordan L,  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that you will recommend us to others as well. We hope to see you again should you return to the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary: We enjoyed our time here. Normal amenities and friendly service. It's a practical location excellent for quick uber service to Disneyland. It also served well as our base for travel around the LA area during our vacation. We would stay here again...
Manager Response: Thank you Davis R for your review and sharing your experience with us. We do look forward to your return visit should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary: We stayed here for a week over Thanksgiving. The hotel and room were very clean, comfortable and nicely appointed.  Excellent beds and linens and the bathroom was a good size. When we first got there we were on the 3rd floor (south side I think) but right above the Burger Theory restaurant and the cooling fans were absurdly loud.The front desk was courteous about switching rooms for us. Our package came with a breakfast coupon that was good for a set menu breakfast or a nice break on the price of the breakfast buffet. This worked out well as every morning we filled up at breakfast and didn't really need to eat much until dinnertime. It is NOT within walking distance of Disneyland but the ART shuttle stop is right in front of the hotel. Takes about 10 minutes to ride either way.
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you had a great time with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am pleased to see that we were able to get you moved to a quieter room for you and your family. We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the area.

Summary Heading: GREAT SERVICE, NICE STAFF, CLEAN, GOOD FOOD
Summary: It was my first business trip to Anaheim so I was just picking an available property relative to the Convention Center. It was about 1.5 miles but pretty simple to drive or Uber to. I also walked it once. Plenty of solid places to eat within a mile and very good food at the hotel too. Everyone we interacted with was pleasant and helpful. Everything in the room worked well and it was clean. The gym was adequate but the only area I would give a 3 out of 5 stars to. Still glad they have one and that it included free weight dumbbells.

Stayed here as a family (with our 2 year old daughter) mid-January 2017.  In brief, I would recommend this hotel completely for a Disney trip!  In detail:  We drove down to LA from SF and appreciated the easy free parking.    The hotel is very convenient for Disney and basically there to serve the Disney market, with huge portraits of Mickey mouse etc. on entrance and Disney pictures in the family room!  It has a little Disney oriented shop.  It is of course much more cost effective than a Disney hotel. Getting to the park is super easy from the bus ($5 pp.) and takes about 5-10 minutes outside the hotel restaurant which itself is small but good - Burger Theory (average price bracket burger place with a sports bar in it).   Actually when you look at the map the hotel is closer

Summary Heading: Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area Jan 2017
Summary: The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. The rooms as expected were basic but met our expectations. The pool heater was broken our entire visit and I believe it was broken prior. This was very disappointing as we specifically wanted a pool for our kids. Another disappointment was the restaurant. Apparently the fine print specified that meals were free only for kids 5 and under, something that I missed and I believe many others did as well. One of the reasons I booked at the hotel was the free meals for the kids. The restaurant itself was a mixed experience; the staff were very nice and helpful but orders were incorrect a few times and the coffee was horrible. The burgers were awesome but the breakfasts only so-so. Overall the experience was just fine, but I was a
Manager Response: Dear JBS,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are glad to know you liked the friendliness of our staff. On the other hand, we are sorry for the disappointment you had with our pool facility and the experience you had in our restaurant fell short of your expectations. We want to assure you that our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product. For that reason, the comments are troubling and will certainly be looked into. Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I had to attend year end seminar for work and brought the family with!  The hotel was located off to the side but close to everything.  5 minutes to work as well as Disneyland. My kids loved the hotel Restaurant Burger Theory and our server Maria was great.  Great value and they even had a shuttle pick up that would take you and pick you up from the park.

The room is usually clean enough and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and I always feel very welcome when I stay here. I've only had to call the desk for a problem once and they were very attentive and resolved my issue quickly. The beds smell clean and sheets are very white. The only thing I would suggest is to redo the carpets because they are looking a little worn.

The staff was helpful and friendly.  The place was quiet, clean, comfortable, and the price was better than other Holiday Inn properties in the area.   They don't provide a free breakfast but they offer a breakfast bar and the adjacent Burger Theory restaurant is pretty good for a quick meal.    We would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Good morning jjrides,   Thank you so much for taking the time in reviewing your stay with us here at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your visit. We look forward to your return the next time you are in the Anaheim area.

Summary: Hotel was close for staying at the parks, just a 10 minute shuttle ride away. Clean and inviting. Hotel staff were great. I would recommend this property, especially to anyone with a family. We ate at the restaurant twice during our stay and we were happy with the quality and convenience.

I would highly recommend this hotel.  The staff were super helpful and friendly.  The rooms were clean and a good size.  We also ate at the restaurant Burger Theory on several occasions.  The food was delicious with good choices and excellent staff.  We really enjoyed our stay here and would go back if visiting the Anaheim area.  We used the ART shuttles which were sometimes running outside of schedule, however this is not the fault of the hotel.  Overall a very pleasant experience.

The decor was beautiful.  I love the ocean blue drapes with matching pictures.  It made the room feel more refreshing.  The room itself was very roomy, with mini-fridge and microwave.  They have an in house restaurant.  The food was good, reminds me of Denny's quality, and the price was decent.  The location is very convenient for visiting Disny Land and other local attractions.  Overall this is a very nice place to stay.
Manager Response: Good morning Nate J,   I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit here with us at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. Thank you for the lovely comments. I will make sure to share your comments with our team. We hope to see you again should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary: I was deceived into the kind of room I was getting. I thought but the pictures of the room that it would have a twin size, then buck beds and a queen, only to find just the bunk bed and queen. When brought to the attention to the guy in front he said "that's all the family suite is"  The beds are super hard and uncomfortable, plus one of my kids had to sleep on the floor thanks to the lack of space and for the price I wasn't about to rent a roll a way bed.  The second night the cable in the room with the bunk beds wouldn't work at all, not to mention it had an Xbox but had no kind of controls to go with it.  I will not be staying here ever! Which is sad for them considering we have season passes to Disney so we visit often.
Manager Response: Good morning Sparrowgirl36,   I would like to humbly apologize for the misinformation you received during booking regarding the kids suite. I am personally making sure to contact all company's and having them update our pictures on the websites. I hope that if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area you will give us and IHG a second chance to redeem ourselves.

Summary: We loved our stay at this hotel.   A shuttle stops at the hotel regularly and travels to Disneyland for a few dollars each. Other reviews mentioned that it is within walking distance of shops and Disneyland but it is not a short walk.   The hotel has a laundry which is a must for us. There is a little store in the foyer for snacks and other items such as toiletries.  I though this was a great idea and the prices were reasonable. Our room was spacious and very clean. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice Room for the Price, Close to Disney
Summary: We were visiting Disneyland and the Disney hotels were ridiculously expensive (we were only planning to stay one night). I came across this hotel online and the price could not be beat. Our room was large and clean. Comfortable beds. Front desk staff were courteous and friendly and assisted us with Disney information. We had everything we needed and did not encounter any problems. Ask for a room that does not face the freeway as it is probably a bit quieter.

Stayed for a business trip one night and the rooms were spacious and clean. The location to find it is a bit hidden, but near the other hotels. I didn't come for Disneyland and it seem to be a peaceful hotel. You do hear some noise from the highway nearby, but it wasn't too bothersome. If anything it's the hallways the walls are a bit thin and you can hear people walking or talking by. For a clean and nice space bed though I recommend.

We only stayed one night at the hotel but really enjoyed our time there. The staff bent over backwards to help us and were fantastic. The room was spacious and clean and very comfortable. The hotel is only a short walk to Disneyland and there is a shuttle stop right outside. Excellent hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: A short walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: Lovely hotel to stay, to be near to both attractions : Disneyland and California Adventure.   Very clean hotel, HUGE room... we get microwave, empty refrigerator, and good coffee machine... lovely.  Lobby is wide, breakfast is standard HIE ....  as long as we know HIE and IHG products.... it is hard to complain.  We were just happy... we walk vice versa, and repeated to both attractions.  It is a good holiday memory... places to eat are nearby with several choices establishments.

We stayed in this hotel to be close to Angel's stadium and were really impressed! The location was great, rooms were clean, the pool was nice, and the price was right.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be close to the stadium or Disneyland.

A good place to stay with a family.  Room was clean and all amenities were working.  Factor in the cost of the ART if you are going to Disneyland as the hotel does not provide a shuttle and it is a little to far to walk (though doable if you want the exercise).

My family and I traveled to Disneyland for 3 days; When I booked the hotel in a Disney package I thought that because it was cheaper than Disney hotels was going to have an ugly hotel, but my surprise was that the hotel is very nice and clean. It's a bit far from the park, but not much. In addition, there is a bus stop inside the hotel and it goes straight to the park. My recommendation is that if you are going to Disneyland use this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, very close to parks
Summary: This is a pretty new hotel, and I was incredibly impressed with the staff and the accommodations.  Breakfast was what you'd expect, free flowing coffee is always a plus.  One thing to note, is looking at a map it looks like you can cut through the Marriott parking lots and have a quicker line to the parks, but you have to walk around.  Not a big deal, still only takes about 10 minutes to get to the front gates.  I'd recommend this hotel if your looking for a moderate priced stay close to the parks

We traveled with my parents, grandma & 4 young kids. This hotel is perfect. The swimming pool is nice BUT the water park was a great way to let the kids burn off some extra energy while we relaxed. The hotel is within walking distance & it's closer than the Disneyland parking lot BUT it's a good 10 Minute walk & hard with toddlers. I suggest buying tickets to the tram! That was the best purchase we made! We enjoyed our stay & will stay here again.

Arrived with our party of 8!! Everything was super super clean and smelled good too. Looks like it's been recently remodeled. Rooms were great, beds comfy, sheets a little scratchy. Shuttle was perfect to Disneyland. Loved that I could by my Disneyland tickets at the front desk. Customer service was great and Amy at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Our family had yummy breakfasts at the restaurant every morning before we went to the park. Plus kids are free which was a bonus. We absolutely loved Burger Theory for dinner (the restaurant where we are breakfast)! I would stay here again for sure.

Warm and friendly welcome at the reception. Very helpfull staff at any time of the day or night. Nice, clean room with all accomodation available. Quiet and comfortable.  The beds are good quality and comfortable. God size bathroom. When the occasion occurs, i go back.

While this hotel is close to Disney I will say that you still have to take a bus or drive there. Breakfast isn't free so you're on the hook for that. Overall it was a good hotel, bed was comfy and the amenities were good for what we paid.

We checked into the Holiday Inn on Thursday 12/8/16 as we went to Disneyland on Friday. The hotel doesn't have a shuttle service but there is a public transportation service provided by the city of Anaheim. I google it and I think it was ART or something...Prices were reasonable like $5 per person per trip and they stop at the hotels and eventually at Disneyland. The buses run every 15-20 minutes and the latest one runs when the park closes, and around December that's midnight. My family and I had a horrible customer service experience at the hotel's restaurant called "Burger Theory". I'm not allowed to discuss the incident in this review as per trip advisor's strict guidelines in writing reviews from a third person's experience since the incident happened to my husband.  I will

We booked the room for 2 nights. It was a very comfortable king size bed with wonderful bedding. The room was very comfortable with a great lounge chair with an ottoman. Our room just had a shower (no bathtub). Our only criticism was the tiny shelf in the shower. There wasn't room to put our full size bar of soap (brought from home) and shampoo. Otherwise, the bathroom, towels, and large counter were fine. There were plenty of outlets to recharge our electronic devices. The front desk help was always helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and that was wonderful. Lots of choices. They also provide in-room meal service. I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great b-day present for husband and son!
Summary: This hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly. You canot walk to Disney from here, however it is very close.  There is a Disney parking lot less than a mile away that cost 16.00 a day.  You could leave out and come back into the lot. There is a bus service outside of the hotel for 5.00 adults and 3.00 kids.  I did not use the bus service because we rented a car.    I chose this hotel because ofor the Clarion having bugs.  I quickly changed to the Holiday Inn and this was a great choice. There is a hot tub and pool. As far as restaurants, there is a burger place, which I only ate breakfast there once.  The breakfast was ok.    You will be happy at the hotel!

Had a very good stay. The reception staff were awesome. They treated my kids like gold. I would plan my day with them and they would even give us coupons to save on meals etc when we went out. Very short bus ride to Disneyland. The pool and whirlpool were well kept. The service was great at the Restaurant. My kids loved the breakfast, and it was great they were able to eat free. Saved us a bit of money. I would highly recommend staying here.

The family suite has a TV and Xbox for the kids and a door to close off the parents room. After a noisy day at Disney, Knott's, or Universal it was nice to be able to close the door for some quiet time. There is also a small fridge and microwave in the room. The salt water pool is heated. The restaurant was good, but it has a small menu. Kids eat free. We also pre-purchased our breakfast buffets which was a good deal. The hotel is a little too far to easily walk to Disney but there is an ART bus stop directly at the front of the hotel which drops you off closer to Disney than if you drive yourself (also goes to Knott's Berry, transfer at Disney).
