Easy access to the I-5 if you're driving to San Diego. The hotel was very clean and we'd definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Amazing location for a Disneyland trip!
Summary: From the moment we arrived the staff was so attentive and friendly.  The rooms are up to date and clean, nothing bad to say the overall hotel.  We ate at restaurant in hotel and the food was great, kids eat free which is always great after spending too much money in Disneyland.  I loved the location since it was super convenient to get to and from Disneyland.

Was under  construction  reception  was all being  fixed.  looked carpeting  had been changed as it has glue smell. A lovely  setting inside and outside.  Spacious  great rooms with microwave refrigerator in room. i liked it a lot. Nothing  amiss here.  The restaurant  is so so with breakfast  menu or buffet that I always  avoid. Macdonald  is really  not far. The Disney  bus leaves hotel  each 30 mins or so . Just  buy your  transport  pass and you are good to go back and forth. Lovely location. U may not be able to walk  to Disney. Good reception  staff that was disjointed  due to renovation but they tried their  best. Yes i wd come back. Quiet location as i recall. I have  no qualms...

We came to visit family for the Thanksgiving holiday and go to a hockey game. The stay at the Holiday Inn was very nice. The people at the front desk 11-25-16 were polite and warming.  The place was clean. Our room was very clean and had no problems. We were on the 9th floor. I would stay at that Holiday Inn again.

My wife and I stayed here for a week in September while on vacation. Everything about the hotel was great! The building itself was clean, modern and nicely laid out. The rooms were very clean and comfortable; the beds were very comfy (I usually have a hard time sleeping in hotel beds), but no troubles here. The staff at the hotel were amazing; everyone was so friendly and helpful whenever we had questions or needed help planning our days. The onsite restaurant, Burger Theory, was also really nice; good food, fair prices and great staff. The location is also perfect; our main purpose was Disneyland and this hotel is only a 10 minute ride on the ART buses. This hotel is doing everything right and I'll definitely being staying here on future trips to Anaheim!

We did a 5 day Disneyland trip and the hotel was perfect for a family on a budget.  The rooms were clean! The staff was friendly and the Burger Theory restaurant was probably the best thing next to the dole whips at Disney that we ate all week!!  Did I mention Kids eat free! We are a family of five and the rooms were spacious included with a refrigerator, Microwave , and my favorite, a Keurig! Bring your favorite k-cups with you or use the ones supplied! You can always ask for more!  They are doing some renovations so, people this place is just going to get better!! The only thing I would change is to include a free breakfast and move the smoking spot!  We always had to walk by  it to get to the ART. Which is not fun for Non-smokers with allergies and kiddos!

Summary Heading: Nice stay since the new remodel!
Summary: We have stayed here twice in the past few years and weren't impressed.  This hotel has recently been remodeled and is so much better now.  We stayed for 3 nights for a Disney trip.  The only thing you will need are earplugs because the AC unit is loud when it shuts off.    The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The pool was heated well so my kids were able to take a swim late in the evening while I relaxed with other parents in the spa.    We drove to Disneyland so I'm not able to comment on the shuttle to Disney.  This hotel is not within reasonable walking distance to Disney which is the only reason it's not #1 on my list.  We got a great rate for it thru Hotwire so I really can't complain about the proximity for the price we paid.  If there's anything they could do to get me

Summary Heading: If there wasn't construction going on...would be fine...
Summary: Standard Holiday Inn...would be fine except we come to check in and they are doing MAJOR construction. I can't be the only one who needs to come back to the hotel midday to give their child a nap..and a jackhammer under our rooms means a horrible night for us. My real issue is that this is CLEARLY planned renovations. When I have stayed at other hotels during their construction the mgmt has messaged us prior to our visit to let us know. We got no such communication and we have had our reservation for over a month. I would have ask to be moved elsewhere (and of course we prepaid so I can't just leave mid stay). We are in a family suite. We have stayed at the other "suite" hotels in the area and I would say that their rooms are a little more spacious, but this is ok. We only have
Manager Response: Dear MattAndEmilysTravels,  Thank you for posting a candid feedback from your recent stay with us. I was concerned to see that you were not impressed with our property due to your disappointment with the ongoing renovations as well as the in room amenities and facilities. I would like to apologize for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you during your stay. Rest assured, your comments will be shared with our management team to properly address your concerns.   Again, thank you for the review and I hope that you would still consider staying with us again in the future.    Regards,    Mike F. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: This hotel was surprisingly nice.  Each room had a microwave and fridge and was quite spacious. Despite being close to freeways, which was convenient, it was not noisy.  Located close to many attractions also and a good value overall.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Experience for Angels/Blue Jays Games
Summary: When we first booked our trip to Anaheim for the Toronto Blue Jays four game series with the Angels on Thursday, September 15th, we wanted a hotel that was in close proximity to Angel Stadium as well as Disneyland. Arriving at the hotel we were about three hours early for our check in and thanks to the front desk staff, they expedited our check in by getting us into our room two hours early.  The room we had booked was with a king size bed and it did not disappoint! The room was large, roomy and exceptionally clean with a huge king size bed. After settling in, we decided to walk around the property and this hotel wouldn't be out of place as a Mexican resort with a very nice pool surrounded by palm trees. Better yet, it appeared for the early part of the day to be the only people

I don't often write a review but I feel this hotel deserves one. We arrived late in the evening and we're given our rooms fast and courteously. There were 3 different families and we were all given rooms on the same floor as requested. In the morning we had breakfast and the children all ate free. The staff in the restaurant are also courteous and efficient.  The ART shuttle to Disney is right outside the front door. Cost per adult is $5/day or $12/3 days to Disneyland. The rooms are well maintained. There is a fridge, micro wave and safe. The pool is heated and therefore quite comfortable to swim in even on a cooler day. There is a "small" gift shop and a lounge area. The burgers from the restaurant are large and very tasty. We definitely would recommend for families travelling

Summary Heading: As a business traveler, pleasantly surprised
Summary: I stayed during a week night visiting a customer.  I didn't realize how close it was to Disneyland.  Lots of families and Disney related stuff.  I was worried that the room, staff, and atmosphere was going to be less par.   However, I got checked in relatively quickly, the room was clean, and without disturbance through the night and morning. I even forgot shaving cream.  They brought some up quickly.    I needed a nice dinner and the restaurant downstairs was both tasty and reasonably priced.   My only complaint was the parking.  It was very full, however I was able to find a space just fine after a little driving.

Property performed much higher than its Star Rating.   Found everything great; location, people, service, value and experience.   Will return to this Holiday Inn next time.  Property is near NEW in condition, maintenance is spotless, bed was great and sleep was perfect.  The front desk staff was friendly and prompt.  And Pricing was also very competitive and better than expected.

We're probably one of the few lots of people staying here not visiting Disney but we had ice hockey and a concert to go to at The Honda Center so it was perfectly located for that too. Hotel is so new and clean and well cared for. Buffet breakfast was lovely. Great big car park. Pool was lovely, great size and lovely area to sit round it and the jacuzzi was a great added bonus. And staff were really friendly. So overall we loved it and for the price its really great value.

The first day when we arrived, we were 6 hours early for check in. The unsupervised concierge who was in training offered to check our bags in storage. My daughters iPad mini was stolen during the 6 hours that it was hidden in my bag under clothing in the locked storage that was only accessible by hotel staff. It's unsettling to think that someone had to go deep through my bag to find it, yet they say that nothing was seen on surveillance. When I brought it up with the concierge the next morning I was told to speak with the manager who was never there during our stay..   I have been home for a week and still haven't heard anything about it. I was contacted by the hotels insurance company the day before we left and haven't heard anything since my reply. I feel like the hotel
Manager Response: Dear nessa86ooo,  We are grateful for your visits at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area, CA and going out of your way to leave your insights. We are sorry to hear that one of your valuables got lost during your stay and was dealt with unprofessionally by our hotel staff. As we are serious on customer retention we have sent you a private message to obtain details of your stay.  Sincerely,  Ronald R. Case Manger IHGService

Summary: Stayed 7 nights..room was nice and clean. Got early check in which was much appreciated after arriving early morning on long haul flight. Staff were very helpful. Burgers at restaurant were yummo! Art shuttle to parks was easy and very conveniant.

Summary Heading: Clean hotel, shame about the wake up!
Summary: Of all the hotels we stayed in on our latest fortnight fly-drive, this one comes out worst for me! Clean as it maybe, there's no breakfast and the restaurant next door is a dive. However, my main reason for rating the place down is because the cleaning staff were knocking on our door trying to wake us up at 8.25am, and again at 8.35am. They wanted to clean our room, even though checkout isn't until 11am!   This was most unwelcome, given we had a flight to catch back to London from LAX in the afternoon, hence we were sleeping later than usual. I suspect staff had been told to wake guests by management and that the hotel had numerous guests arriving that day, or otherwise cleaning staff had not been given information as to who had checked out? Either way, it smacks of poor
Manager Response: Dear 24HoursFromTulsa,  Thank you for the time you invested in posting a review about your visit at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area, CA and for rating our rooms with 4 stars.   We regret though that you were not overly satisfied with your stay due to the scheduled housekeeping and limited dining option.  Your comments will help our management to work better in improving our services.  Sincerely,  Dhang R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: The place is really convenient to move around LA also for heading to San Diego, but the most added values are, if you are visiting Disney parks, it’s a fair 25 mins walking distance or 10 min shuttle bus ride.  Over all is clean, beds and pillows are comfortable, we had a highway facing room but noise wasn’t anything of a problem to get a good rest. Restrooms are clean, no mold spots or bad odors, need more hooks to hang towels though.  Staff is friendly and always on the best disposition to assist. Free parking!! Also free Wi-Fi but is weak in certain areas of the hotel. Burger Theory restaurant in situ is a good place for dinner, food is decent, service is really good, and a variety of drinks to relax. One thing, avoid the breakfast buffet served in the place, that one is

I got a hotwire deal on this hotel and was a little leary to stay here since it was farther from the disneyland park than I'm used to. And i don't think i had ever stayed at a holiday inn!  But once we stepped into the lobby and checked in distance was no longer an issue. Everyone we dealt with at the front desk was nice and helpful. The room was modern, comfortable, and clean! We didnt use the pool or eat breakfast there so i cant comment on that. Parking was free which is a big plus. The art shuttle to disneyland was easy and super convenient too! I just wish the burger place on site kept their bar open a little later... i would definately stay here again!

We loved staying here the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and tidy and was great having the Art bus to Disneyland straight out the front. The pool and spa area were are great place to relax after the park.

Our family of 4 truly enjoyed our first stay at this clean and family friendly hotel. We will definitely be returning to this hotel for future visits to Disneyland! Highly recommended to anyone visiting the Anaheim area.

Our family stayed for 4 nights last week. Our trip started out very poorly at the airport but once we arrived at the hotel it completely turned around. We had arrived two hours before check in and the staff were able to accommodate an early check in for us, which was truly a blessing. Every staff member we met was welcoming and very friendly! The room was very clean when we arrived and the beds were comfortable after a long day at Disneyland. The maid service did a great job and even tidied up our extra shoes and various items! Thank you! We enjoyed a few meals at burger theory. Again overall a great experience and what made it so outstanding was the staff. Food was good, drinks were cold and came quickly. Checking out was a breeze! The only thing I would offer feedback on is

We stayed here October 2nd thru the 15th. The room was very nice and clean. We were on the 6th floor and we could watch Disney's fireworks and actually feel the booms. The room was kept clean the entire time we were there. The only issue we had was the day of check out, housekeeping was trying to come in at 9:30. Check out was not till 11 so it was a bit early. At least give us time to get up and pack. We had the free breakfast vouchers and it was well worth it. The food was good and we were always waited on in a timely manner. We did not have to wait for anything. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant, it was great. We did find that the restaurant did charge our credit card for a diner we did not have there. We do not believe in charging to our room. We did not find this out

Location is decent.  ART runs direct from hotel to Disney.  It's 5 dollars for a day pass. Parking at hotel is free. Most staff is friendly. Breakfast is ok.  They are understaffed in the morning for some reason. There are 1 or 2 of the staff there that could use a lesson or two in customer service.  The biggest issue was with housekeeping staff.  When we arrived in our room, we inspected the bed and there were black hairs all over the pillows and mattress.  We called down to have someone to change the bedding. When they arrived, the lady wouldn't change the bed until we proved there was hair.  Another lady came to help and they were complaining to each other, in Spanish, that they had to change the bed.   The following night, after a long day out at Disney my family and I fell
Manager Response: Dear Barto K,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We are hospitality professionals who pride ourselves on delivering world class experience, however, it appears we fell short of our goal on your visit. We would like to apologize for the level of service you received our from our housekeeping staff and for failing to meet your expectations regarding the room you were given. Your feedback is troubling and will surely be looked into. Rest assured it will be reviewed and most certainly be forwarded to the appropriate departments to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future.  While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we hope to have another opportunity to provide you with a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Joel A Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I had reserved three nights at this property months ago and then realized that we would be arriving in Anaheim early in the morning well before check-in called to have a fourth night added at the beginning of our stay.  I let them know we would not be arriving until about 5AM, as opposed to the night before.  When we arrived, the desk clerk could't find our reservation at all.  I showed her my reservation confirmation and she kept muttering "I don't know what happened".  Eventually she found it and explained that when we added our fourth night the person adjusting the reservation took off one of the original nights and basically messed everything up.  So it took us a very long time to get things sorted out and check-in was mostly stressful and unpleasant.  After that, the hotel
Manager Response: Dear VijogeJoliet_ILUSA,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We would like to apologize for the less than satisfactory experience you had at check-in and for the issues you had with your reservation. Reviews like yours are very valuable as they enable us to target areas we need to improve on. Rest assured your feedback will be forwarded to the appropriate departments for evaluation.  We value you as our guest and hope to accommodate you again for a chance to provide you with a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Joel A Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Central to Everything on our trip!
Summary: Great experience on this trip! If you are coming from LAX during traffic, its about an hour and a bit to the hotel, but once you are there, Downtown Disney and Disneyland are only 5 minutes away. Hotel itself was clean, comfortable and quiet. No complimentary breakfast, but we had a whole food adventure planned throughout Anaheim so it really didn't matter. The room had a mircowave so we could heat our leftovers, so that was convenient. Staff was friendly and area of hotel seems safe. Gas statuons and CVS are close by if you need anything which we always buy bottled water to have in the room, it's much cheaper! All in all our experience was great and we would stay there again. 15 to 30 mintues to Irvine, Huntington, Duamond Bar, some of the places we went, so we found it

Overall I had a wondeful stay at this hotel. I stayed for 2 nights and took the shuttle for getting to Disneyland!! About the shuttle... for paying $5/day you would think it would come on schedule. A few times it took 40mins+ to get back to hotel/park, while other shuttles came back twice for pickup. Other than that,I would say my trip was very nice and I understand the hotel has no control of this. My room was clean and updated, and checkin was easy from friendly staff. I enjoyed my morning coffee both days with the Keurig machine available in the room. This hotel also is close proximity to the Angels stadium.

Let me first start off by saying that I am someone accustomed to staying in luxury hotels/resorts. I was tagging along on a weekend get-a-way, so had no choice in the hotel accommodations. The hotel is decent. The shower in the bathroom was very small and there was not a vent in the bathroom, which I thought odd. Having to keep the bathroom door open to allow for ventilation does not bode well for privacy. The room was clean and had a view of the Disneyland fireworks. Wouldn't say the beds were all that comfortable, but they are better than sleeping on the floor. The plus side was the shuttle service that ran to and from the Disney Resort all day for only $5 and the customer service at the front desk. The hotel is great for a family on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear Dana W,  Thank you for staying with us and for posting a review online. I am pleased to read you found the staff service and shuttle service very well to your liking. However, I am very sorry you were not completely satisfied with the bathroom and size of the bed.  Your comments regarding this have been taken note of and I am confident that our hotel will take the necessary actions to ensure that similar situations can be avoided in the future.   Kind Regards,  Tracy V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Hotel staff was nice and the rooms had a good set up, mini fridge, microwave, closet safe. Our view from the window was of a parking lot which was fine cause we went to sleep right after getting there from Disneyland. They have a wait station for the Disneyland shuttle but you do have to buy a 5 dollar ticket for the day at the stop. Only stayed one night so was unable to try the hotel amenities. Would stay here again.

We visited Disneyland and stayed at this hotel.  Access to the hotel is a bit confusing.  However, by the second trip, we understood how to get there.  Hotel was good for the price.  When returned from Disneyland one evening we found our door closed, but not locked.  Nothing was stolen, but still disturbing that house cleaning does not completely shut the door after they finished cleaning the room.
Manager Response: Dear dougk1953,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent family trip, and for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. I am pleased to read that our convenient location worked well for the purpose of your travel. I do want to take this opportunity to apologize if the housekeeping service did not meet your expectations.  IHG does high service standards, and I am sorry that on this occasion we fell short.  I want you to know that we take each review seriously and respond to each issue addressed. We hope you'll consider staying with us again on your next future visit.  Kind Regards,  Tracy V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price!!
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights and am going back in December for 3 more! Arrived around 11am on a Thursday and my room was ready which was nice after taking a very early flight that morning and having a terrible shuttle experience getting from the airport to the hotel. Room had a keurig and very comfortable beds and pillows. Could see Disneyland from our window on the 6th floor! Only downside was the shower, it was all tile and no tub! Next time I'll for sure be requesting a room with a tub. Absolutely no issues. quiet, clean, safe. It's on the Route 12 ART line and shuttles come every 20-30 minutes and it's the only stop on the line which makes it very nice! Would definitely recommend. And if you're an IHG reward member you can get a late check-out for 2pm!!! They have a breakfast

Summary Heading: Clean and simple budget room close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is just off the freeway. If the parking lot appears full, there's more parking around the back. The front desk was very helpful; when my A/C malfunctioned, they sent someone up promptly and everything was fixed within 30 minutes. There's no view to speak of, and no balcony or outdoor space attached to the room. It's very good for just crashing after a busy day at the Disney parks.  There is a public transit stop right on the property ($5 for a day ticket). Disneyland is about a 20-30 minute walk away.   There's an in-room fridge and coffee maker. Room service is available for certain hours.The breakfast buffet is $13, plus there's a hamburger restaurant on site.  How noisy it is depends on where you are. Next to the freeway? A bit of noise. Next to a family with kids

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disneyland trip
Summary: Spent three nights here for a two day Disneyland trip.  Excellent hotel.  Very clean.  The rooms are small, but since we were awake in the room for maybe a total of 6 hours over the three nights, they were more than sufficient.  The bathroom in our room was great - it's rare to have a large, walk-in shower in what most people would consider a value hotel.  The hotel is surrounded by a busy freeway and streets, but it was hardly a problem since we were dead tired each night.  The burger restaurant in the lobby was very good.  It was especially family friendly with free kids meals and our server was probably one of the best we ran across on our vacation.  I would have loved to have been able to walk to the parks, but using the ART buses was the next best thing.  The staff was

Summary Heading: Great budget, top food, top service
Summary: Location was great, although not in walking distance to much, but with ART who needs to walk, best public transport service I've ever experienced. The wheelchair accessible room was great, fitting two decent size double beds. The pool had a lift seat for easy access to enjoy the Californian summer. The area around the hotel was clean and safe. Service was always great  and the burger theory restaurant was great value for a treat dinner every few nights. We (mother, son and assistant) stayed for 11 nights, and could have easily stayed longer very comfortably. It was such a lovely spot, happy hour by the pool with $4 daiquiri's were the bomb! We could also see some of the nightly fireworks from our room too!

I spent 2 nights at this Holiday Inn and was really happy with it. Check in was super easy and quick and parking was a breeze (& free!). The room was really nice and clean. There were lots of power outlets right next to the bed which was super handy for phones and iPads etc. The beds themselves were comfy and having a fridge and microwave allowed us to make some dinner instead of eating take out which was great.  The only fault was the airconditioning. It kept the room cool enough but was super noisy and seemed to violently cut in and out really noisily. And because it was right next to the bed it was enough to disturb your sleep or at least prevent you from getting to sleep. It may have just been an issue with the room I was in though but that's the only reason I gave this

We Spent 4 Nights .. Everything was fine...room was clean.. beds were comfy..the only thing we notice was a big red stain between the beds..WiFi was terrible during the night! *The Girls at the Desk were very friendly .. we had Breakfast the second & last Day of our stay.. Iliana at the restaurant was amazing!

Don't expect to be able to even send a simple email. Wifi Kept dropping out and couldn't connect after the first attempt to log in. I even sat on phone to IT support for 30 mins trying to sort it. Had to sit in the lobby in my pj's
Manager Response: Dear Jo0,  Thank you for taking time to post a review about our hotel. It is unfortunate to learn that you were not able to fully enjoy your stay due to the internet service. I have forwarded your feedback to our hotel management to work on these points raised in your review to give you the best hotel experience in the future.    Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope you visit us again.   Best Regards,  John O Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Holiday Inn over the weekend.  On Monday, my daughter left some luggage with the bellman while we went into the Park.  On return, we were told that Holiday Inn gave her luggage to someone else.  Its been 3 days, no luggage, no resolution, no customer service.  My daughter is now home in Florida, still without her luggage. Horribly frustrating lack of concern from the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear ChicoGuy,  Thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. It is regrettable to learn about your daughter's luggage. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced. Please allow us to follow up on your concerns and have the opportunity to make it up to you. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information. I look forward to your response.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Just make sure the hotel staff never put you in room 303 as you won't be able to sleep all night. There is a constant whining noise coming from the cooling unit that is placed on the outside wall next to the room. It is impossible for you to do anything about it as a guest. Despite lengthy conversations with 3 members of their team including the manager on duty they said they were unable to move me as the hotel was full. Holiday Inns are in general good value and there are some great properties around the world. Unfortunately no one at this hotel has thought that something like this is worth spending the money to fix - so how much can they care about their guests? They are letting down the good name and brand of Holiday Inn. What a shame that this is allowed to go on.
Manager Response: Dear Chris P,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. Please accept our deepest apology for the unexpected experience you had with the noise in your room and the response you received from our staff. It is with deep regret that we fell below your expectations. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We have sent you a private message to obtain some additional details. Thank you for staying and we look forward to hearing from you soon.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Nice place and very near to Disney Land
Summary: We stayed here for two nights. They have comfortable beds, friendly staff and a good breakfast menu. The staff are super cooperative. They offer free shuttle service within 3 miles. A nice place for a short stay.

Spent one night here for a concert near by. The location in convenient, close to the freeway. Some of the perks are free wifi, free parking & a reasonably priced shuttle service that takes you to the local attractions.  The down side, the carpet in our room was absolutely disgusting. As soon as we walked in we noticed a huge red stain by the trash, then we realized the entire carpet was covered in stains. We had to keep our shoes on because it was also sticky in areas & had a musty smell.  The bathroom looked very nice & updated but that stops at the shower area- which was also dirty.  Most Holiday Inns I have stayed in offer complimentary breakfast- this place does not.  A TV channel guide sheet would be helpful for out of town guest.  There's lots of other hotels to choose
Manager Response: Dear ewright2013,   Thank you so much for staying with us and for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I am pleased to know that you found our beds comfortable and location convenient. On the other hand, I am sorry for the inconvenience our carpet condition may have caused you. I appreciate feedback that we receive, whether positive and negative to ensure we provide the best level of service and facilities that we can give to our guests. This feedback will be shared with the appropriate people that can help us make a difference to ensure our valued guests' needs and expectations are met in the future.   Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We stayed here for three nights as a base for Disney, the room was well laid out with two queen beds, the bathroom was large and the room was cleaned daily to a good standard, the only gripe was that the wifi was hit and miss but we were on the fifth floor.

Summary Heading: Doing something right as third visit in six years
Summary: If you read my other reviews of this hotel, you'll see why we return here compared to others in the area.  Although this isn't in the league of Sheraton and Hyatt, the fact that it's a little tucked away from the action, in my opinion is a good thing.    This hotel is serviced by the #12 ATR bus which runs every 20 minutes to Disney.  Apart from stopping at the convention centre, is a direct route with no other hotels to stop at.    As it's away from the main street, it's quieter during the day and less hassle and fuss compared with other hotels I have stayed in nearer the park.  Slight hiccups on check-in with rooms requested not allocated, albeit booked on their website 8 months in advance, phoned confirmations etc. and all that, yet still we get a view of a trailer park!

Summary Heading: Charming for a large chain hotel
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with prize and convenience of the location of this hotel. I think I checked them all in this area. I love the California feel of the decor. The Disney art in the lobby reminds you of why most of us are visiting this area.   The rooms are well appointed with a fridge and microwave. I always have leftovers so I appreciate these amenities. The decorations are clean and modern. I will definitely stay here again if I'm in the area.

Unbeliebable .....830 pm and room not made... worst of all the excuse is that they are full... I can not accept a responce from an hotel of holiday in cuality that they dont have the capacity to make a room on time...   a shame to the franchise!!
Manager Response: Dear bernardo b,   First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area, CA. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us, especially with housekeeping and customer service. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.    Sincerely,    Orlando A.  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Everything was fine, good location and comfy beds. The walls are super thin though and the morning of checkout a maid woke us up at 7am to give us toilet paper? We were both sleeping and had the do not disturb sign up so, i'm not sure why she thought she could do that. All in all, I would stay again.

The room was clean,  bed was comfy but... In a pathetic attempt to save money,  they have modified their A/C units so that at night,  the differential temperature setting is about 8 degrees off before A/C kicks in.  So,  despite setting room temp at 70 degrees,  at night,  the room gets up to 78 before air conditioning comes on.  And,  because the unit is 20" from the bed,  you are in a constant state of sweating then freezing. .Holiday Inn,  Please,  let the A/C work normally day AND night. . Your system robbed us of a good night's sleep and THAT is why we were there in the first place
Manager Response: Dear r0adrage,  Thank you for taking time to share your experience with us. I am sorry to hear that you did not fully enjoy your time in our hotel. We take comments such as these very seriously and would like to follow up with you. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain more information.    I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.  Best Regards,  John O Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I rented two rooms for myself and friends in order to enjoy a Disneyland vacation. The rooms were absolutely clean and comfortable. We very much enjoyed the comfy beds and pillows. I would definitely consider staying here again. We had walk-in showers, plentiful towels, a K-cup coffee/tea maker, microwave and a small fridge. The upper level rooms have a nice view and the rooms were also quiet.

Hotel was very quiet when we were sleeping. Room itself is very clean and new, including bathroom. Bathroom toilet was running all night, just a little bit though. Burger Theory, the attached restaurant, was great for drinks and appetizers. I don't think the breakfast buffet was worth the $13.99. While the food tasted really good, there wasn't anything special about it. The pool was wonderful! Very clean and warm.
Manager Response: Dear melvin2890,  Thank you so much for staying with us and for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I am pleased to know that you found our hotel and pool nice and I apologize for the shortfalls you have encountered. I appreciate feedback that we receive, whether positive and negative to ensure we provide the best level of service and facilities that we can give to our guests. This feedback will be shared with the appropriate people that can help us make a difference to ensure our valued guests' needs and expectations are met in the future.   Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We were  very happy overall here.  We stayed  four nights. Super comfy beds, very quiet, awesome jacuzzi that saved my tired legs each night. Had a room with a view of nightly fireworks!  The shuttle to Disneyland wasn't quite as reliable as I'd like but not bad. Wifi definitely needs to be improved- very weak and sporadic connection.  I would definitely stay again especially if wifi gets better!

Summary Heading: If you like to sleep on the I5 traffic, be my guest.
Summary: This hotel could be pretty nice, but the front desk does not care for you or your needs.  Most important, this hotel is right on top of the I-5 freeway.  Unless you are from New York, you will get no rest at all.  The traffic noise is unbearable. There is no water pressure in the rooms for a decent shower. Tons of kids and buses pulling in at all times of night or day from Disneyland.  So there you have it.
Manager Response: Dear csolsen2,  Thank you for writing a review on our hotel. Our goal is to deliver exceptional service and comfortable accommodations, and we appreciate your business with us. However, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience the noise challenges and the water pressure may have caused you. It is certainly not our intent to inconvenience our valued guests like you, but to instead provide good value, comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. We have shared your comments with the hotel management and we’re confident that necessary actions will be made, in order to meet our guests' needs and comfort.  Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope this stay experience will not deter you from giving us another opportunity to make your stay as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Grace P. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: First time staying at this hotel and was pleasantly surprised. Didn't get a chance to try the breakfast. Parking was a problem  and had to park at the adjacent hotels parking lot. Room and beds were very comfortable and the price was right. Funny, I added a day which seemed to confuse them as i had booked the original reservation  through this 3rd party so I had to check in and then out. recap liked what little we saw.

Summary Heading: Great prices, staff, food and hotel
Summary: This hotel is about 1.5 miles from Anahiem stadium...which is where we wanted to go. We were able to walk easily. Burger Therory restaurant had a great dinner...prices as expected for hotel. Food was hot and delicious. Room was clean and staff was so friendly. Would stay again!

This is a decent hotel but definitely overpriced unless you get a great deal but I think that's probably the situation anywhere you stay at in Anaheim. I'll start with the pros of this hotel: 1. Great location, right on the i-5 2. ART Shuttle that goes directly to Disney ($5 for adults $2 for children) 3. Kids eat free (menu is very limited to burgers at dinner and a mediocre breakfast buffet for $12.95) 4. Rooms were a nice size and had a fridge n micro which was great for stocking snacks (hotel snacks were very expensive) 5. Decent pool area 6. I liked the bath n body works toiletries  7. Free wi-fi (very very slow in the evening but good late and in the morning) 8. Free parking  Cons: 1. Horrible horrible horrible beds. Hard and very uncomfortable. 2. When you go there they
Manager Response: Dear Larissa L,  Thank you for leaving a comprehensive review, highlighting not only the bad but also the good. We are so pleased to know you liked the convenient location of our hotel and the amenities we offer. On the other hand, we are very sorry for the discomfort you have experienced with your bed and the housekeeping services you received fell short of your expectations. We also apologize for the issues you had with the deposit and with some of our facilities. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. We appreciate the candid feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve. Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Family of 4 stayed at this hotel a week.
Summary: Very disappointed in this hotel. My family saved up for this vacation and this hotel was way to expensive for the services received.  We planned for one day to relax at the hotel and no services were available from 11:00 to 5:00. There is a cabana bar by the pool that is suppose to open at 3:00 everyday. The day we arrived this bar never opened at all. The day we planned to relax at the hotel we had to ask about the bar 3 times and they finally opened 1 hour late. Temperatures were very warm and lots of customers returned from Disneyland for a few hours during the day to cool off at the pool and everyone was very disappointed there was no services available. This hotel is not in a very pleasant area for walking to restaurants. My family had to walk the first day to get something
Manager Response: Dear susanbuckley725,  Thank you for staying with us recently and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. It is truly regrettable that some of our amenities and services did not live up to your expectations. Allow me to apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced due to shortfalls on the overall level service you have received. Let us assure you that we want nothing more than to ensure your satisfaction from the time you arrive, up until you leave our hotel. So we truly appreciate that you have shared your feedback with us. I am confident that our management will continue to do their best to improve in order to accommodate you better in the future and hope you give us the chance.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights in July. The whole trip went smoothly. Room was nice and clean at all times. The pool was very nice to relax in after a long day. Everyone at the front counter was very nice throughout our stay. The area surrounding the hotel seemed very nice! Close to Disneyland! Coming back in October to go to Disney. Will be staying once again!

Summary Heading: More cons than pros but I would return lol
Summary: PLEASE HEAR ME OUT :) We stayed here just over a month ago for a week.. Location was great not a lot of traffic & easy to find.. Our room with 2 double beds was clean & big enough for my 3 children & I.. You could see the fireworks but not that good unless you stay on the highest upper levels.. The pool & jacuzzi were clean but staff didnt restock towels often enough we couldn't find enough towels & sometimes none at all each day of our stay.. The online laundry reviews for the 9th floor I read about wayyy before our stay like 2 months before, I found it annoying, upsetting & ridiculous that they still were not fixed!! I packed light thinking the machines would work by the time of my stay .. Front desk said we could use the next door hotel's laundry room & that was not

this was a sudden change for us, having left a dump we couldn't take anymore- we were skeptical anything would be that much better.   It was great, very clean room, super comfy beds and pillows. very nice bathroom.  Just so happy to have stayed here, we go to Anaheim quite a bit and this is the place we want to stay. the staff is amazing and so nice and helpful. even when we saw one guest bent out of shape because of her own error - they were so helpful and professional to her. the lady that worked the morning cafe was super awesome too!  so happy to have met her and chatted with her awhile, she made me smile the whole day.  if other guests would not slam their doors it would be perfect.  as it is, it isn't the staff's fault others were ill raised.  so this place gets a 5 star

Summary Heading: Comfortable and clean hotel with friendly staff
Summary: We stayed here for a short Disneyland trip and it was just what we needed! It was close to the park, rooms were comfortable and clean, and we didn't have any issues with hotel staff. In fact, the folks at Front desk were always cheerful whether we were checking in/out, dropping by with questions or just passing by. Housekeeping was quite generous when we left a note asking for shampoo. We didn't have trouble with Wifi as many others did. The only minor issue we had was with the safe in our room, which wasn't working.   Burger Theory, the restaurant attached to the hotel, is a decent spot to start your morning especially if you're heading to Disneyland for the day- less crowded than restaurants around the Disneyland area and they offer a breakfast buffet if you're a behind
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable review. We appreciate your kind words about or comfortable and clean rooms, and your good experience with our staff. We look forward to your next visit. Thanks again for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while at Disneyland
Summary: This is a great Hotel.  It is not walking distance from the park but their is a ART bus stop that is on the premises that make getting to and from the park quick and easy.  We were able to spend the day at the park and return for a midday break before we ventured out again.  The pool is a great place to relax they also have a fitness center so that you can get in a workout if you would like.  I had a great time here the room was quiet and the staff was polite.  The Burger Theory restaurant severs great burgers if only it was open later.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback very much. I apologize about our restaurant not being open later, but I will be talking to upper management to see if we can have this change. Thank you again, we hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Overall the hotel was a great place to stay!... The staff was great,the rooms were top notch, and the rates were pretty good.... However, if you expect to get any work done via wifi...forget about it.  It stinks!  The download speed was pokey and the upload speed worse.  The simplest of emails took forever to send.  That's my only beef with the place.  Otherwise, I recommend it highly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable review regarding our experience. We appreciate your wonderful comments about our rooms and our staff. We apologize for the bad experience you had with our WiFi, I'm happy to share with you that we will be upgrading our WiFi pretty soon. I know that this doesn't change your experience, but I hope that if you come back to the Anaheim resort area you give us another opportunity. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Very Good Stay, would recommend if you have a family
Summary: I stayed for 8 nights with my family and stayed in the kids suite (includes an xbox 360).  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  First day I checked in I forgot my sunglasses at the counter only to realize I lost them the next day.  I went down to the counter and asked if they had found any lost sunglasses and they quickly dug them up and returned to me.  I picked this hotel because it's close proximity to Disneyland since we were going to spend a few days there.  Used public transportation - ART bus which comes right to the hotel.  Very convenient and affordable, compared to paying for parking at Disney.  This was nice in that if we wanted to take a break from Disney mid-day and come back we could do that and than return later in the day and not worry about driving and parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us. We are so happy that you found our hotel and our staff highly commendable. It is always motivating on our end whenever the service our people have provided meets our valuable guest's expectations. Thank you again.

Summary: Came down for a 6 day family vacation. The free breakfast and kids eat free dinners was a life saver. I can not even begin to say how great this was. The room was very comfortable the beds soft the pillows soft. After 3 days of walking around disneylsnd from 7am to 12pm the hot tub an pool were very relaxing. The food at burger theroy was amazing out of the 6 days there we ate there 4 times. It is a little bit of a walk to Disneyland so we just took a Uber there an back

Short and sweet review: everything was good except for the WiFi, good location near to Disney, could actually see the fireworks at Disney from our room. It was also very convenient to attend 2 Angels games.

I stayed here for four nights in July for a trip to Disneyland. I booked his room through hotwire last minute. Checking in was a smooth procedure. I had originally two bookings and she combined the dates for me to make it easier.  The rooms were as expected in the pictures. It was a standard and decent looking room with two full sized beds.  We were placed right next to the freeway right above the entrance. Even with the windows closed, the freeway is pretty loud at night. This wasn't an issue for me, but it was for my boyfriend. We both experienced a humid like thick air in the room with or without the ac on.  However, what compelled me to leave this rating was that after a long day at Disneyland; we came back around 11PM. After using the bathroom, it clogged up and overflowed.
Manager Response: Dear Ada W,  Thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to write a detailed review. We work very hard to ensure our facilities and service are superior and we strive to be the best Holiday Inn Resort around. I am glad that you had a smooth check in and check out experience. However, we’re very sorry for the mishaps at the bathroom. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you. Thank you for bringing this to our attention as the feedback we receive from our guests like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to improve our guest services.   As a valued guest, please be assured that all comments will be acted upon and used to continually improve guest satisfaction. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next future visit and see the improvements made.  Sincerely,  Dianne L Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We spent 5 nights here during late July for a family vacation.  Even though the hotel says these rooms accommodate 5 people I would say that if you want to be comfortable I wouldn't go with more than 4 in a room.  These are small rooms.  We brought in a roll-away but it was very crowded in there.  Bathrooms are very clean and modern although there was no exhaust.  After 5 showers it was extremely humid in there.  Rooms have comfortable beds and a very convenient little counter with microwave, coffee and fridge.  Our heating/cooling unit was quite loud - although we were so exhausted every night it really didn't matter to us.  The pool area is amazing.  Very large pool and jacuzzi with very nice seating and tables all around.  We didn't try the restaurant.  Just a few minutes

This place is absolutely awesome. Wish we wouldn't have checked in so late after a long day at Disneyland. Would've  liked to enjoy their beautiful pool. Very clean updated room with wonderful beds. Close to everything. Will definitely stay here on our next time back

Stayed here for a Disney visit.  The hotel is okay, nothing special.  There are laundry facilities on the 9th floor (we were lucky enough to be on the floor), but2 of the stackable units were not working.  Definitely disappointing, since this is the middle of summer and one would expect they would be on top of this during peak Disney season.  The adjoining restaurant (Burger Theory) is very good - one of the best burgers I've had in a while - but the breakfast is not not included in your room price.  Drove down to McDonalds instead  in order to save money to spend at D-Land.  There is a morning/mid-day counter with some items from Burger Theory for a little more reasonable price, so if you don't mind breakfast sandwiches and light items, it may be fine for you.  Everything
Manager Response: Dear cm632000,  Thank you for your recent stay with us, and for writing a candid review. We're glad that the hotel location, room, staff service, and shuttle service contributed to making your vacation a pleasant one. On the other hand, we apologize for the inconvenience caused by issues with the bathroom amenities and laundry facility. We will certainly work on the points you have raised to improve on guest satisfaction. We hope to welcome you back next time so you can enjoy all the hotel amenities.  Sincerely,  Tracy V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We found ourselves without accommodations due to a mix-up.  Holiday Inn central reservations directed us to this location. It was a lucky find.  The staff were amazing, from the grab & go breakfast woman to the poolside bartender to the very helpful front desk staff and friendly housekeepers.  Our room was clean and nicely decorated.  The beds were comfy, although the sheets were a bit scratchy.  Two double beds?  A double was big enough for 2 kids, but not great for 2 adults.    We appreciate included breakfast, and this one wasn't (different reviews said different things).  The 12 pm checkout from the website was 11 per the front desk -- but the lovely woman there gave me a key we could use to avail ourselves of the pool, hot tub, and many loungers and umbrella'd tables

Summary Heading: Front desk Supervisor and Front Desk Team was outstanding
Summary: I stayed here for my conference. Super convenient; great staff especially Front Desk Supervisor I think her name is Leslie. Good breakfast rooms are very nice and Parking is very convenient. Disney and shopping are just a few minutes away.
Manager Response: Good morning Fran,   I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that Leslie and the front desk were accommodating for you. I am sharing your review with my team and will praise them for an excellent job. We hope that next time you are in the Anaheim Resort Area we will see you again!

Summary: Had a great experience during my stay. Loved the room and the hotel overall! Highly recommend it. The location is another plus point as it is very close to the Disneyland.  The staff was great. I would visit this hotel again
Manager Response: Good morning deep52,   Thank you for reviewing your stay with us here at Holiday Inn. I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and like the renovated rooms. We look forward to your return should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary Heading: Nice breakfast, room & short walk to Disneyland
Summary: It is less than a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland bus stops which is where people get off when using Disneyland (off-site) parking. So really easy access to and from the Disneyland park. My room was clean and looked essentially brand-new with new furniture and linen. The continental breakfast was a great start to our day as we were paying for food all day in the park. My only inconvenience was the parking as valet or $15 self-park, not a lot of spots that I saw but I did find a spot easily. All the staff was really nice. Would definitely stay here again!!

Great location.the rooms were big and very clean with two queen beds .The pool and jacuzzi are cute  both designed as a heart shape . Felt like in Mexico with the palm trees . Highly recommended . Close to Disney land. Parking is free. There is also a gym open for 24 hour

First of all, this hotel is very clean! This hotel is a "good neighbor" hotel, so you can purchase Disney tickets here and other necessities for the parks. It also has an Anaheim Resort Transit(ART) stop right outside. The bus picks up there and takes you directly to the parks. So while this hotel isn't exactly within walking distance from Disney, it is extremely easy to get to the parks from here. This is what I love about the hotel. You don't have to worry about driving and parking at the parks. The last ART bus leaves a half hour after the parks close, so it's pretty easy to get back to the hotel as well. The only downside to this hotel is no complimentary breakfast, but there is free parking. The hotel also has a little restaurant that serves breakfast, which was actually
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback about your recent stay with us. We appreciate your kind words and are very happy to hear you had a great experience at our hotel. We look forward to having you back if your future travel bring you our way.

Summary: New property. Stylishly decorated. Huge room. 10 minute walk tomdisney gates. Nice neighborhood. But the staff here is terrific. We ran over a piece of metal about 50 yards from hotel and our tire was hissing air when we pulled in. The guys at the valet and some sympathetic and helpful. They worked with AAA to get us fixed, checked in and off to the park quickly so our day wasn't ruined. Everyone at hotel was understanding and great. I would stay here again when I returned t the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We are very happy to hear that you had a great experience at our property. We hope that when your travels return you to Anaheim, you will give us the opportunity to have you stay with us again.

Summary: This is an excellent hotel with great amenities and a wonderful and extremely helpful staff. It is conveniently located on the ART bus line which is an excellent alternative to driving and parking at the resort. It is currently being freshened so there is some construction going on. the rooms were large, well appointed, clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel. We are very happy to hear that you had a great experience during your stay. We apologize for any inconvenience that our current painting may caused you. We hope you return back to our hotel soon.

Summary: I stayed here with my daughter when I brought her to Disneyland. Staff is very friendly. Parking at the hotel is free. It is about a mile from Disneyland. We took the ART shuttle back and forth to avoid the parking hassle at DL. Day pass for adults Is $5. It is convenient but runs a bit erratically. We actually came back to the hotel area for lunch and a siesta. Hotel has a very large jacuzzi which was soothing after a long hot day in DL.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, would definitely stay again!
Summary: First of all, this hotel is very clean! This hotel is a "good neighbor" hotel, so you can purchase Disney tickets here and other necessities for the parks. It also has an Anaheim Resort Transit(ART) stop right outside. The bus picks up there and takes you directly to the parks. So while this hotel isn't exactly within walking distance from Disney, it is extremely easy to get to the parks from here. This is what I love about the hotel. You don't have to worry about driving and parking at the parks. The last ART bus leaves a half hour after the parks close, so it's pretty easy to get back to the hotel as well. The only downside to this hotel is no complimentary breakfast, but there is free parking. The hotel also has a little restaurant that serves breakfast, which was actually

We only stayed here one night, but it was definitely the best hotel we stayed at during our trip to Cali. It seemed pretty new/updated recently and it was very clean. The staff was very friendly and it was centrally located near Disney, the Angels ballpark and lots of food and shopping. Plus, they had a great continental breakfast in the morning :). Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Though the hotel is not on the streets bordering Disney, it's not too far away either.  The bus line for the Anaheim Resort Transportation or ART that takes you to and from the hotel is super easy, and comes about once every 20 minutes.  I believe that after you get on, Disney is the only stop.  When you ride from Disney, there maybe one other stop, but basically the bus line is dedicated to the hotels by Holiday Inn, and the stop is at the entrance of Holiday Inn.        As for the hotel itself.  Very nice and modern.  Breakfast, unfortunately is not included.  But, they do have a counter that you can grab a quick breakfast on the way to the bus stop.  The room was okay sized, but that is just because the bathroom is so spacious.  They have a very generous walk-in shower, no

Brand new hotel.  Clean and spacious.  Hot food served breakfast.  Friendly staff.  10 to 15 minutes walk to Disney.   Though have to pay for parking, but all the goodies off set this.  A nice buddha status at the entrance adds charms to the hotel.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Vernal,   I am so happy that you enjoyed your stay. I am not sure why you were charged for parking as our parking is free at our hotel.  We hope that your next visit to the Anaheim Resort Area you will come and see us again!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We often stay at this hotel when going to Disneyland. Hotel has shuttle to the themes parks, or you can reach it by car, 5-10 minutes of driving.  Rooms and bathrooms are in a good condition, and you can open window and enjoy fresh air if you're fed up with loud aircon. Don't pay for the breakfast, it's not always good. On our last stay eggs and bakery were like being 3 days old.  And if loundry matters for you - right now it's out of service, so you check it before booking.

Summary Heading: More Pros then Cons, Enjoyed it!
Summary: We just got back from a trip to the Anaheim area, and we really enjoyed ourselves. Some of that had to do with the hotel we stayed at, the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort.   First the pros. The hotel was nice and upgraded. We booked 2 rooms through a 3rd party for a good rate. We have stayed at many hotels in the area, but It was our first time here. The check-in staff was very good considering they were dealing with a recently upgraded reservation system.   The rooms were of decent size and the bathrooms were a bit bigger than I expected. A big plus for us! We stayed up higher, which I requested. The 8th floor was nice. The full beds were comfortable. One small but significant touch was there were sets of soft and firm pillows on each bed, and they were clearly marked by white

Summary Heading: Great Disney hotel for a vacation.
Summary: Well let me start off by saying what a very nice and clean hotel my wife and I enjoyed it one of the cleanest we stayed in at a Anaheim Disney hotel and we have stayed at a lot of them believe me. The only one negative I could really say is that the beer at the bar was very expensive more than any other hotel we ever stayed at, I'm assuming cause it's vacation season but no worries the hotel has refrigerators so you can buy your own beer and a microwave. All and all what a great hotel I would love to definitely would stay here again.
Manager Response: Good morning Sleepy505,   I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us here at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. We look forward to your next visit if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area.

Summary: The hotel is very nice. They have updated their rooms along with the bathrooms. They have a nice size pool with a large jacuzzi. The hotels restaurant let kids eat free from the kids menu with paying adults meals. The restaurant is pretty good, is a burger spot that offers other times on the menu. They have a breakfast buffet along with breakfast from the menu. Rooms were really nice and provided a fridge that had a small freezer, a microwave, and a coffee pot. I would highly recommend staying here, it's also only about 1.5 miles from Disneyland.  They have a shuttle that charges $5 per day for adults and $2 for kids to Disneyland. I hope this review helps others out there.
Manager Response: Good morning,   Thank you for taking the time to review your hotel stay here with us at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and like the amenities that we have to offer our guest. We hope when you return to the Anaheim Resort area we will see you again.

Summary: I dont usually take the time to rate hotels but my boyfriend and i had such a great experience at the holiday inn anaheim resort. This hotel was well worth the price. The room was cheap, renovated, clean, and spacious (Fyi all the rooms are renovated) This hotel is very family friendly, which made me feel safe. Its a very convient location for those who are planning a day at disney land. Outlet mall, target, and walmart are also minutes away. I would definitely recommend  this place. I am a very picky person when it comes to booking a hotel. I just want to say this hotel met my expectations.

Summary Heading: Great location, spacious modern rooms, wonderful service
Summary: Very clean, spacious, recently renovated, modern rooms equipped with fridge and coffee maker. Front desk and housekeeping staff warm and helpful. We've stayed at many hotels in the Disney resort area and this is our favorite. Really like the modern decor throughout the lobby and rooms. Room very well laid out. View of the fireworks at night. ART transit extremely convenient with our stop being the only one. Highly recommended.

Recently my family took a vacation to Disneyland. We stayed at the Holiday Inn, it was great! The room was very updated, clean and quiet. I never heard anyone in the hall way. It's perfect for just sleeping, there isn't any place to sit and relax in the room. We had 2 double beds in the room. I would defiantly stay there again.

Summary Heading: Beautiful new hotel with large rooms! Very clean!
Summary: This location is excellent and the hotel is beautiful.  We had a hwy side room and you couldn't hear it at all.  We walked to the park rather than shuttled, which we normally do from most hotels but this walk is not bad at even at the end of the day.  I'll go back again.  I do wish there was a way to walk through the other hotel parking lots rather than clear around the building.  Ever step counts when you're Disneylanding it ;)

We had already stayed. In the other holiday inn on walnut we loved it but they were booked so i seen a room with bunkbeds an xbox in the room i figured the kids would love it which they did but the room was to smal
Manager Response: Good morning,   Thank you for your review of your hotel stay here with us at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I am happy to hear that the kids loved the room and the xbox, however I am sorry to hear that the size of the room was not up to your expectations.  We understand that you have many options when it comes to lodging and appreciate your business with all of our IHG properties.

Summary: Good value when I got a discounted booking. Close to Disneyland and free parking were two of the criteria I wanted. No free breakfast was one of the downers. The other was that the room size was seemingly very small for a modern hotel. Hotel grounds were very nice and well kept. Rooms and lobby clean. Overall very good.

We had some Hiccups but overall the stay was good.  They have a great breakfast and the rooms are clean and comfortable.  Our problem was that there was a barking dog next door one night and we didn't get housekeeping services one day.  The hotel made it right and all is forgiven.  The pool is great.  The staff was very nice.  The biggest problem with this hotel is the location.  While it is close to Disneyland as the crow flies, because of it being on a one-way, dead end street, it's hard to get in and out in a car.  You have to do u-turns and freeway to get to the Disney parking garage.

Stayed for 2 nights with a friend for a Disneyland trip.  The room was clean and quiet.  Large bathroom with great amenities (Bath&Body Works).  Fridge + microwave in the room is always a plus.    Staff was friendly at check in, which is always appreciated.  No complaints!  I would stay again in a heart beat.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive Hotel with Free Parking near Disney
Summary: The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort is located about two miles from Disneyland. The hotel was clean, family friendly, and (most importantly) had free parking. You can take an inexpensive shuttle from the hotel to Disneyland gate in the morning, or you can walk the two miles to/from. My family did both during our two night stay.   The internet here was fairly slow, but it was free. You could probably get better performance with the paid option. Overall, this was a solid hotel which we might stay at again.

Spent 5 nights for our Disneyland adventure. Accommodations were clean and met our expectations. Service was great. We arrived very early and they were able to get us into a room right away (10:30 am) that allowed myself and my son to rest as we had been up since 3 am. The bus is right outside that we used not just to get to Disney, but to travel down Harbor Blvd. and go shopping and see a little more of the area. Breakfast was great and the restaurant for lunch or dinner was good if a little pricey. Would definitely stay there again.

We booked a room that had a King bed and two bunk beds.  Their suite has two separate rooms. The beds were comfortable and the staff was accommodating.  The weather was a little cool over spring break so we only used the pool once but it was nice when we did.  We did not use the shuttle service to Disney so I can not say how well that works.  It looks like it is more of a city bus thing than a hotel service but again we did not use it.  It took us about 10 min to drive there each day but that was more traffic related than distance.  The restaurant Burger Theory was really good and we ate there quite a few times.  Kids eat free so that was a huge bonus.  The hotel was well kept and clean.  I think the maid service did a good job of cleaning our room everyday, no small task I am

Summary Heading: They can get it together and this place will be great
Summary: For starters, no uber, lyft, or taxi driver can find this hotel. After being taken to the other holiday Inn ON THE SAME ROAD, we finally found our hotel. It was 2am and it took the night clerk, Frankie, at least 15 minutes to check us in. It's beautiful, but i won't stay there again soon.
Manager Response: Dear Ashley B,  I would like to thank you for taking the time out of your day to write your review of our hotel. I am glad that you had a good check-n experience. However, I would like to apologize for any difficulty experienced in finding our location. If you need any assistance, please let us know.     Again, thank you for your valued comments and we hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Stayed here for 6 nights.  Checked-in and was given Handicapped Room without asking me if this was okay.  No desk and no chair.  Internet was so slow I had to use my cell phone as hotspot.  Tried internet in lobby multiple days but not any better.  Toilet barely flushed.  Told front desk and said they would repair...no better.  Restaurant breakfast buffet is $12 and food is luke warm.  Think poor management.
Manager Response: Good morning Brian S.,   I do apologize for the experience you had while staying with us. Your feedback is much appreciated as this helps us to continuously make changes to our facilities and the service provided. We are working on the internet to get it up to fast speeds. I know this does not change your experience you had during your stay and again I apologize for that.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights when visiting Disneyland.  We had a wonderful stay here and the staff was very friendly and very helpful.  The hotel is not within walking to Disneyland but there is a bus  (7 minute ried) that comes every 20 minutes that drops you off right at the entrance of both the parks or Downtown Disney if you are heading there. It is a private bus and was about $40.00 for 4 of us for 3 days transportation.  Very reasonable compared to the price of parking and much closer to the park than walking from the parking structure.  We were able to park our car at the hotel for free and take the bus.  The best part was that parking for our car was free at the hotel. The rooms are very clean and the beds very comfortable.  Would stay here again with the

The hotel was only a few minutes from Disneyland and was very clean. The beds were comfy and the room was a decent size.   The bathroom is a little different. The bathroom door was left open and we banged right into it with the door to the room. The shower isn't very accommodating for people that are larger. It is a funk 'J' shape without a curtain. The bathroom is very nice and big, except for the shower.   Our heater was awful though. We turned it on to warm the room and the noise was very obnoxious. We ended up turning it off and sleeping in warmer clothes. My husband informed the front desk when we headed out the next morning. They said someone would be up to fix it, but I don't think that happened. It was just as noisy when we came back that night.  There is plenty of free
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your hotel stay with us. I do apologize about the heater noise during your stay. I have talked with my Chief Engineer regarding that unit for replacement. I thank you for choosing to stay with us during this visit. I know you have many options when it comes to lodging and we hope to see you again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: I think this would be a great place for a family!
Summary: My friend and I stayed here in July 2014 and really enjoyed it. Our room was clean and nicely furnished, and we loved the pool area. Staff were usually very helpful and we loved the restaurant - breakfast was especially delicious and there was lots of yummy meals to choose from. I would stay here again!

We recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland with young children and adults, ages 1 to 63.  We had a good experience, and would stay here again.  Pros: -Removed more than a mile from Disneyland (beyond comfortable walking distance for young children when they are already walking all day), the property was a nice hotel at the price of a roughly 2-star, not-so-nice accommodation, were it located right at the Disneyland entrance.  The hotel was quiet, the beds were just right, our room was very clean, the pool was the right temperature and well-designed, and the service was excellent.  -With our travel package at least, the stay included free breakfast at the on-site restaurant (Burger Theory).  The food quality was much higher than the a continental

My son had a tournament in the area and this is the perfect hotel for us. Staff are all nice and the hotel is clean. Easy access to freeways. Parking is free. Lots of restaurants nearby. We will stay again.

We had 2 nights at the hotel and whilst most of our time was at Disneyland this hotel was a great place. Good service, comfortable beds, good size room and only a 20 minute walk to the theme parks.  Rooms were reasonably priced. I would highly recommend this hotel

Booked this hotel on Hotwire for a single night stay during a recent road trip. I was crossing my fingers that all of the rooms had been renovated as there are pictures of both new and old looking rooms online. We  were happy to find out upon check in that all of the rooms have been renovated. The woman at the front desk was really nice and accommodating, and was able to give us a king size bed instead of the two queens we had booked. I am admittedly judgemental when it comes to hotel cleanliness and this hotel did not disappoint. Have you ever walked into a hotel room that looks great but totally smells weird (like cleaners or mildew)? It's the worst. You won't find that here! No weird smells to report. :) The room was clean, comfy, and casually chic.  The only downside to the

This hotel has great rates and is close to Disney Land and freeways. Rooms are ok, need to update the furniture a little. Not much of a work station if your here on business. Beds are comfortable. Air conditioner is a little noisy at times. There is a restaurant on the property which is convenient. The front desk personal were awesome, very accommodating. Free parking and internet as well.

Stayed 6 nights and it was well worth it for me.Had a conference to at the Anaheim Convention centre so it was great to be able to walk or catch a bus from the hotel to the venue. If you don't mind walking there are lots of eating places, theres the bus thats $5 for the day you can go a long way for that.Yes the WiFi is very very slow in the rooms by the pool you could not get it at all, the best time is 1am but who wants to stay up until then. Did not try lobby.The exercise room had 2 treadmills but 1 was broken, other equipment ok.Room bathroom clean, microwave tea and coffee and good size fridge.Pool and hot tub was crowded i think the hotel next door share. Staff was very friendly and helpful .

We ended up lucking out with this place on Hotwire and boy are we glad we did! From the moment we arrived, the front desk has done everything to make us happy. Early check in was handled for one of our three room reservation but they made sure all three were adjoining rooms and finished before the regular 4pm check-in. The rooms are clean and nice with comfortable beds, updated decor, and fried and microwave. The ART shuttle picks up right outside the hotel. The pool and hot tub are great and open to 11pm and you get a great view of the fireworks from down there (and some rooms!). We will purposefully stay here next time!

we went to disneyland last month and stayed here for 8 days.  Hotel was pretty decent and was clean, however, it wasn't really walking distance from the park and specially with little kids it is quite far away.  We ended up paying $15 daily for family of 4 to use transit service.  Also, this hotel doesnt offer free breakfast and I had to pay $50 every day for the family breakfast which i could have saved just by staying at a different hotel.  My 3rd disappointment was their wifi.  Their wifi was so slow and I couldn't really do anything I was getting speed slower than 56K modem.
