I tried it on 2 iPads and 2 iPhones and it was equally bad, so it wasn't just a 1 device that was slow.  In year 2016, we all depend on WiFI for just about everything and specially when visiting from
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us regarding your stay. I do apologize for the inconvenience of the Wifi being slow, I am currently working with our tech department to get our Wifi faster. I understand the importance of wifi during travel and can assure you that I am doing my best for you and all of our guests to get this modified as soon as possible.  Thank you again for reviewing our hotel.

Summary: Stayed here many times. Near the freeway. Have to go a little out of the way to leave the hotel, street is a one way. Rooms are clean and modern, beds are comfortable. Only complaint is parking if you arrive late. Make sure you check in before parking in case you have to park in back. The only access is by key card otherwise you have to walk all the way around the hotel.

We stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort from March 18 - 25.  We had 3 booked rooms through Westjet Vacations.  Two of the rooms were fine but the 3rd room we had to change 4 times to get a room that had a safe that operated properly.  After a long day of travel and 3 hungry children it wasn't a great start.  The rooms were good for the children and the pool was fabulous.  A great break from Disneyland in the afternoon.  We at most of the meals at Burger Theory.  It was very good except a few times we were charged for the childrens meals and didn't notice until after we paid.  The kids eat free.  The food was good.  The shuttle is great and picks you up right at the hotel.  We wished the room was higher so we could have seen the fireworks so ask for a higher room if possible.

Fabulousness front desk service,  we were experiencing a not so great visit to Disneyland but Hilda Santana at the front desk turned it all around for us by being friendly, patient and reliable. Our trip was much brighter after that. THANKS

This hotel was very clean friendly staff and I took my entire family there very close to Disneyland amusement parks probably about a five minute drive at a restaurant in the hotel that was very convenient and affordable overall we are very satisfied with our stay

Summary Heading: Very nice modern room with comfortable bed HD Flat TV
Summary: The room was nice and clean with nice towels, linens up to date TV.  My only complaint is that it was a handicap room and didn't have a desk.  About a 20 minute walk to Disneyland or convention center.  Free parking, resort style pool.  Internet works good.

I loved this hotel because the rooms were very clean, walk in showers (unheard of in most hotels), and excellent customer service.  EVERYONE at the front desk was exceptional.  They go above and beyond to make sure their customers are satisfied.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone!  With just a short drive, you can get to katella avenue for dinning, if you choose not to eat at the restaurant.  They offer a bus that gets there every 20 minutes on the dot.  The fireworks from the rooms are probably the best view we have ever seen in any hotel.  Overall this hotel was over the top awesome!!!

Loved staying here. We were early for check in but they were able to get us in early even though we wanted adjoining rooms. All of there rooms have personal safes which was nice for passports and other important stuff. We really enjoyed having breakfast at the restaurant every morning especially when Guillemo was our waiter and kids eat free. Thanks for making our holiday even better.

Summary Heading: A couple of miles drive to Disneyland
Summary: Everything's good about this place except the location. There is nothing close by where one could walk to. In addition it's in dark and isolated area. But no worries most people visiting Disney would be tired by night and snoring in their beds. The hotel has a pool, spa, restaurant, gift shop, ART shuttle stop, training and fitness center, game room and ample parking space. Kids eat free when accompanied by an adult ordering item from regular dining menu. The shuttle picks up every 20 min and passes can be purchased at the kiosk located outside the hotel restaurant. 1, 3 or 5 day adult pass is 5, 12 or 20 dollars resp and for a child is 2, 3 or 5 dollars resp. Kids under 2 ride free. The hotel overlooking the interstate is just a couple of miles drive to Disneyland. $1 each for

Property is nice. Check in was quick and they let me take my luggage up to my room before I had to go find a parking spot. Rooms are nice but a little dull on the decor. Room was very clean upon arrival. Bathroom was clean as well and had plenty of towels. Wifi is on the slow side but does the job. Of course the jacuzzi had just broke the day I got here so I couldn't use it which is why I gave 4 circles instead of 5.  TV could use a little more channel selection. Mini fridge and microwave in room were handy. Despite being busy you couldn't hear anything outside your room which is what I like. I enjoy quiet. Bed was comfy and had plenty of pillows. My room was above the restaurant so it smelled like cooking food most of the night. Lol. This hotel is for families more then

Summary Heading: Nice stay,  not very convenient to Convention Center
Summary: Looking on the map, didn't seem like too much of a walk to the convention center.  It's only a 15 minute walk (walking fast), but it's not through the most pleasant area.  The morning ART bus will take you to the CC out of the way if you ask, so that's nice.  But there is no bus back, so you either walk or taxi/uber.  If I had to do it again, I would stay closer to the CC and pay a bit more.  But the room was good enough.  The people were helpful.  The restaurant Burger Theory, was awesome.  Seems convenient enough for Disney.
Manager Response: Good morning Bruinfan95,   Thank you for sharing your experiences during your visit with us. I am sorry that the shuttle was not there to pick you up on your return back to the hotel. I will contact ART regarding this issue because they are to drop off and pick up at the convention center before and after the Disneyland stop. I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed the Burger Theory.  I hope that we get to see you again in the future if your travels bring you back to our area for business or leisure.

Summary: Close to Disneyland. Average size room, the beds were comfortable and the pool and spa we nice. No continental breakfast, so we went to McDonalds on our way to Disney every morning. There's also a shuttle to disney, we didn't ride it though.

My family stayed here for a week. It was a very nice stay. I've stayed in a lot of hotels around Disneyland and this one would be on my top three list. The hotel staff is very friendly. Our room was very clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice, safe, clean and comfortable hotel that is near Disneyland. A bonus is also the free parking.

The hotel itself is nice while updated and the grounds are beautiful especially the pool area and has a nice Jacuzzi area and also barbecue area. It is also a bargain to have free parking and free Wi-Fi anywhere close to Disneyland it's also close to the Honda center as well as Angel Stadium a few quick rights and your in the story parking lot a few quick rights and you're right back at the hotel amazing to get in and out of.   We had an unfortunate incident with our toilet keep overflowing the maintenance man was very nice very helpful he tried as hard as he could to get the toilet functioning when they finally realized it would not going to need to replace it we were put in a different room grant you this took hours and was an inconvenience however the hotel staff was very

Nice hotel with fantastic helpful staff. Certainly nothing fancy but hotel was clean with a nice pool area and exercise room. Great reasonably priced hotel for a trip to Disney. Ate in the restaurant on site several times with reasonably priced good food.

As a Platinum Spire Business traveler, I have stayed at many different Holiday Inn properties around the country.  I recently stayed at this property the beginning of March. The property is average for being promoted as a resort.  Here are my lists of pros and cons. Pros:    1. Clean and pleasing atmosphere at the front entrance    2. Good restaurant, modestly priced and offering various breakfast choices, including a buffet.    3. Internet was fast enough    4. Was recognized at the front desk as Spire member       5. Pool area, while shared with neighboring Staybridge property, is nice.  Sufficient towels, chairs and sizeable spa. a Cons:    1. Didn't have an upgrade for me but gave me a "family/kids" room with bunk beds and bean bags.  Supposed king bed was a small queen.
Manager Response: Good morning Michael F,   I would like to thank you for taking the time in sharing your comments regarding your hotel stay with us and for being a loyal Spire member to IHG, your loyalty means everything to us and your comments are highly appreciated. I can assure you I am speaking with my executive housekeeping manager regarding your visit and what changes we need to make to ensure this does not happen again. I have talked with my front desk agents about informing guests about the different locations of parking and how to enter the hotel depending on where our guests park. Regarding the fitness center I will be reviewing the room and making necessary changes. Again I appreciate your loyalty and thank you for your comments. I know you have many options for lodging and I hope that we will see you again in the future if your travels bring you to the Anaheim Resort Area again.  Have a wonderful weekend!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our trip to Disneyland for a total of 5 nights. It is a nice hotel. Overall our stay was good with a few small issues but we would probably stay again.   Here's a Pros and cons list from our stay  Pros 1. Nice pool area  2. Restaurant on site was good accommodating for kids (kids eat free with adult meals) 3. Clean  4. Quiet  5. ART bus stops in parking lot  6. Self serve laundry facility on site ($1.00 per wash , 1.00 per dry)  7. Free WIFI ( a bit slow though ) 8. Front desk was accommodating- let us move rooms on same floor due to WIFI ( see Con #1) 9. If you stay on the 9th floor facing the pool ( of that direction ) you get an excellent view of Disney Fireworks ( may get a good view from lower floors as well but we were on 9th)  Cons 1. Don't

Summary Heading: Simple, clean and safe place to stay
Summary: This Holiday Inn is right next to the Staybridge Inn Anaheim (I've stayed there as well). I chose the Holiday Inn as it was quite cheaper than the Staybridge Inn which I usually stay at and really like. I was happy to say that the Holiday Inn was clean and staff very friendly. I felt safe and there was security there at night. The pool is large and nice and the location is great. While there is no free breakfast like next door they do have a great eatery on site called Burger Theory which I tried and had one of the best burgers ever! The only complaint was the wifi was very slow but otherwise a nice and tidy hotel.

Wasn't a bad stay for 4 nights. It was quiet for the most part, spacious room, so glad that I had a microwave and fridge to bring my own food. I'd avoid the pizza if you order it from Burger Theory, the dough tasted like powdered cardboard, the toppings were a bit clunky........but, $12 isn't a bad price for an in hotel pizza.  I've stayed here before, and I would more than likely stay here again.

I was hoping to find something within walking distance of Disneyland at a reasonable price. Came across this Holiday Inn which is over one mile away but turned out to be a good find. It is an easy drive to the Disneyland Parking garage and the hotel offers free parking. Rooms are large and what I liked was electrical outlets everywhere in the room for easy charging. There is a restaurant on site that worked well for evening meals. Rooms were clean with a mini fridge and microwave. Would recommend for a Disneyland visit.

The rooms were a little small. We have stayed here about 7 times and had only 1 problem this time. When we checked in, only 1 of our keycards would work to unlock the keycard lock. The 2nd day we stayed there we asked if they can put the room keys in their machine that makes the cards make the keycard locks only to those 2 cards. Well they put our cards in there, I checked if both of the cards worked, and NONE of them worked. Then I went to the front desk once AGAIN, and I said, "Now both of them don't work." They said, "let's try doing it on the other one" and that stupid problem was fixed. And the ice machine on the 9th floor was broken so you would have to go to the 7th, 5th, or 3rd floors for a soda or ice. Other than that our stay was AWESOME!
Manager Response: Good morning Brandon E,   Thank you for reviewing your hotel stay here with us. I am happy to hear that you are a return guest and have visited with us 7 times. We appreciate your business and your loyalty. I do apologize for the inconvenience with the keys and the ice machine. I can assure you I am taking care of those issues. We look forward to your return visit if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area again.

Summary: The hotel is either new or, what I believe, completely renovated. And, I would say they did a very good job on the surface, The rooms were spacious, attractive (except for the ugly "show no dirt" carpet they all have) and comfortable, with refrigerators in the three rooms I know of. Likewise the grounds, what there is of them, are very well maintained with lush vegetation and flowers for color. But... 1) the internet was SO slow -  I know it is a vacation, resort area but that doesn't excuse internet this slow. 2) printer in the business area didn't work for four days so no printing boarding passes, directions, etc. One day Ok... 3) Staffing - didn't effect me but two mornings in a row there was one person at the front desk about 8:30am when more than a few people were trying to
Manager Response: Good morning Toooldforthis,   Thank you for sharing your experience with us regarding your stay here at Holiday Inn. Your feedback is highly appreciated and I can assure you I take reviews very seriously as this is a way I can see what changes are needed to increase guest satisfaction.  I will be addressing your concerns with all department managers.  Thank you again for your feedback.  Have a wonderful weekend!

Summary: We stayed here for one night when we went to Disneyland as all hotels were sold out due to the music convention that took place. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Sad that Holiday Inn doesn't really offer any platinum benefits. I would have preferred to stay elsewhere but it wasn't bad for the one night.

Stayed here for a few days during the NAMM conference. Great location, clean room, we were on the 5th floor facing the highway & Angel's stadium. Not noisy at all. Great view of the mountains. Would definitely stay here again. Wish the restaurant was open for breakfast, & later than 11pm. Other than that, great place!

Completely  remodeled,  very clean,  service was excellent, comfortable  beds, food on site was very good.  Price was competitive.  Ample parking ( well lit and on site security )  overall a great value.  Amll

Summary Heading: Very nice and relaxing after all day at the parks
Summary: We stayed here Jan 16 - 21, 2016.  It was a great location.  We got a 3 day shuttle pass to Disney for 15 dollars for me and my 11 year old daughter (that was the total price not per person) and the shuttle came every 20 mins or so and dropped us right outside the parks.  The room was nice.  We ended up with a King which worked fine for us.  It was well laid out and had a nice view of Disney's fireworks too yet they were far enough away not to be a distraction.  The room was well decorated and quiet.  Great for relaxing after a day at the parks.   We visited the heated pool and hot tub one night which were clean and nice.  Helped with the achy feet and legs after walking 23k steps at Disney that day.  :)  There is a restaurant in the lobby too - we ate one night.  It was good

We were visiting Anaheim to attend an event at the stadium, and chose this property for its location. It is exactly what you are expecting for a Holiday Inn, a mid-level property that is best (at this location anyway) for families, especially Disney visitors. They are undergoing a remodel now that tips the scales for me to make it 4-star worthy (in terms of satisfaction, I mean - it is still a 3-star hotel) instead of 3-star satisfaction. The new rooms are nicely done, the pool area is very nice and also large, and their gastropub restaurant offers solid fare.   Heads up that the HVAC system in the rooms is loud and may disturb some people's sleep. I turn the fan to the "on" setting so that it can't cycle on and off during the night, and slept quite well - but then again I like

Definately go back to this hotel. Bus/shuttle direct to disneyland outside front door. Buy passes for bus @$3/adult oer day unlimited use..kids @$1/day...we bought a three day pass  $12/adults & $5/kids. Hotel was clean and staff lovely. ...Burger Edge downstairs is the brekkie place too...BEST food...SOOOOO reasonable.  Bar...everything. I could not fault it...perfect for our family holiday!!

Nothing worse than traveling all day to your hotel and they cant find your online reservation. Took almost 1 hour @ the front desk to get it straightened out. The first lady never found it, the manager found in quickly. Will NOT be staying there EVER again...
Manager Response: Good morning 414jeremyw,   Thank you for reviewing your hotel stay with us. I do apologize for the inconvenience that you experienced at check in. I can assure you that we have spoken to all of our agents and are taking this matter very seriously. I can understand your frustration and I do apologize again for the experience.

Summary: Quiet rooms.  able to get an early check in. Free parking. Free wifi . Water was turned pig for several hours, but hotel did a good job of letting the guests know. The room was  a typical clean Holiday Inn that you would expect. The hotel is near the freeway

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Close to Disney Parks
Summary: They have been remolding the hotel.  We got a room that had just been done.  First ones to stay in it.  Done very well - Wish they had 2 queen beds instead of double, but they were comfortable.  They were still doing some remolding so the arcade wasn't open. Just a couple notes - the new bath is a stand up shower only, which is fine, however, with no door or shower curtain could get a little chilly in the shower and no place to hang up washcloths in shower, or even wet swimsuits.  Restaurant attached was nice - friendly staff all around.

Stayed here with our 6 year old twins to go to Disneyland.   The shuttle is super convenient.  Its not run by the hotel so you should know that it costs about $14 for our family of 4 for a day.  Parking at Disney is $17 so it was more economical to use the shuttle.  Parking at the hotel is free.  The hotel has a big pool and is heated so we went in for a swim even   though it was cool outside.  Hotel was super quiet.  We were on the top floor.  Newly renovated.   Big bathroom.   All in all a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Average Property Currently Under RENOVATION, so Beware of Noise
Summary: First off, if you are visiting this hotel as part of a trip to the Disney "resort", just be aware the property is not really walking distance to the park. Shuttle is available, for a fee, so its easier to just drive. Here is what annoyed me the most - construction noise! We were told when we checked in that construction wouldn't begin until 9am. First day was fine, however, on the 2nd morning, we were jolted awake by jackhammer style noise at 0645 hrs ! After a angry call to the front desk X 2, the noise finally stopped after about 30 minutes. In any event, this wasn't the most memorable experience. The room itself was nice (I believe we were in one of the remodeled rooms), comfortable bed, flat screen TV, fast Internet. The room was a bit small. I'm not sure I would stay at
Manager Response: Good morning Craig W,   Thank you for taking the time to review your hotel stay with us. I do apologize for the inconvenience of the noise during your stay especially when it started in the early morning. We are in the process of wrapping up renovations and hope that if your travel return you to the Anaheim Resort Area we have a chance at redeeming ourselves and giving you a memorable visit with us.  Happy Holidays!

Summary: We arrived at lunchtime and wanted to see if we could check our bags in until check in time and the lady behind the desk checked the system for our booking and our room was ready so we were able to check in early with no charge. There were signs everywhere informing of refurbishment going on but we hardly noticed this was happening at all during our stay. I think our room must have been one of the newly decorated ones as it looked and smelled newly decorated and it was lovely. It had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker, and the bathroom was huge.  There is a bus that stops right outside that goes right to Disney that runs around every 20 mins.  There is a restaurant attached which we tried for dinner and it was amazing. There is also a small unit outside which serves a light

My room was newly remodeled. It still had that fresh paint smell! They have a restaurant on the main floor that is awesome! shout out to all the servers there, Vance, the filipino girl that sometimes works at the bar...  Leslie at the desk was always attentive! great staff.   Just pay attention to the signs around the hotel that tell you when they will be shutting water off. It is under renovation so expect so a different experience then if it was brand new....

My family and I stayed here for a couple of days recently. The staff members did an excellent job all around. Each morning we would go downstairs to have breakfast. The employees in the restaurant were very nice and helpful, they always had a smile on their face. One night we ordered from the restaurant and had someone bring it up to our room. I don't remember her name but she really went above and beyond to make sure we had everything that we needed. On our next trip to Disneyland, I will for sure be staying here again. Thank you for making our trip that much better!

My sister and I stayed here from November 3-November 14 while in Anaheim for a disneyland trip.  The check-in was easy and quick.  We had prepaid through our travel agent, and all we had to do was show our id and give our cc for damage deposit.  We had a rental car for just the night and all we had to do was give our car information - no passes, etc required.  Our room was fairly large and very clean.  The bathroom was a great size - enough to spread out all of our stuff.  There was a 3-drawer dresser underneath the tv, as well as a closet with more shelves and hangers.  The beds were double in size (we knew they were doubles after reading other reviews) - for each of us, a double was just fine - I can see where it gets cozy if you have 2 people sharing a bed.  The room was

Stayed here for a couple of days and have nothing to complain. Hotel was clean, bed was very comfortable and room had everything one could need.  We got in a couple of hours early and they let us go up to out room, no extra charge.  We didn't try their breakfast, but there are plenty of diners on the way to the parks.  Second floor room was a bit noisy but we where so tired that wasn't a problem for us. Also, our room was right on top of their burger joint, which meant it always smelled of bacon. Which wasn't great..   Overall would stay here again.

This was our second time staying at this location in the last few months.  The front desk was beyond helpful.  When we had a question about dining at Steak55 in the Disneyland Hotel they called the restaurant for us.    The rooms are a bit dated and the bathroom fan is loud but the room is clean and the price is very reasonable.

Summary Heading: Good deal.  Close to highway, Disneyland, restaurants, entertainment
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel in November 2015.  First thing you need to know is that parts of this hotel are under renovation, and it is expected to be wrapped up by Christmas Eve.  While we heard the construction operations a couple of times, we were not really bothered by it.  We also stayed on a newly renovated floor and were pleased with the quality of the decor in the lobby, restaurant, floor 9, and our room.   The room we stayed in was nice.  Pillows and bedding were comfortable and smelled fresh, the decor and carpet were pleasing, the television worked well, and the bathroom was nice and clean.  The only things we didn't like were the fruit flies that appeared in our bathroom and the low flow modern shower head.    The hotel is close to Disneyland and the
Manager Response: Good morning pastadutchie,   Thank you for sharing your experiences with us while in the Anaheim Resort Area. I appreciate all the lovely comments you left and will be addressing the issue of the fruit flies and the water pressure.  We look forward to seeing you and your family again if your travels bring you back out to the Anaheim resort area.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland visitors, shuttle comes right to the door
Summary: Great budget hotel! ART shuttle comes right to the door by the restaurant, and takes you straight to Disneyland. Staff helped us figure out buses to get to Target when my suitcase was lost by the airline. Overall very helpful staff and great hotel for the price range!

This hotel is clean and well kept. But there is nothing special about it. Very plain pool, small workout room, bar is nothing special. It is very close to Disneyland. It is about a 15 min walk to the park. Inexpensive. Was ok.     Not a real business friendly hotel.
Manager Response: Dear awineguy11,  Thank you for staying with us during your business trip and for writing a candid review.  I am glad you regarded our hotel to be clean and location to be accessible to Disneyland. However, I am very sorry that you found our pool and workout room below your expectations.   Your feedback is highly appreciated as this helps us gauge what we are doing right, and identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. Thank you again for your comments, we hope to have the pleasure of serving you again soon.   Sincerely,  Dianne L. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Great place if you go to Disneyland
Summary: Everything was really great there - room, service, etc. The hotel was not that expensive like hotels just next to Disneyland. You can take shuttle bus to Disneyland or rent a car. There are Wallmarts around and also some outlet shops, so the car would be useful.

Summary Heading: Great property, great location for Disneyland visitors. In need of refresh
Summary: I stayed with my wife on the first week of Nov 15. We were advised with plenty of tie that the hotel was undergoing certain repairs and work was being done in the premises, so we were ready for any disturbances. None of this was an issue with our stay.   We got a room with plenty of space, big bathroom and even what could be called as a kitchenette. Since the purpose of our stay was to visit the theme parks, we didn't really spend a lot of time on the premises, but the little we did, everyone was very welcoming, warm and helpful whenever we needed any help.   If location is important to you in this case, I would totally recommend this hotel. The decor and furniture are definitely in need of a refresh, but its not something that gets in the way of a comfortable stay.

Summary Heading: Not a Business Hotel Nor would I bring the kids
Summary: Reception is slow at check in, 3 times for the key cards to work. Rooms are tired. Nothing in Mini bar, so by definition its a fridge and not a bar! Food is very average. Not even a free bottle of water in the room. Had to unplug TV to find a power point so you can charge a iPad, phone and watch TV is impossible. Really is in the middle of no where with my room over looking a trailer park. Good location for disney, but nothing for kids to do when your in hotel.  i was on business, but if i was going to Disney with the kids i would not bring them either.
Manager Response: Good morning,   Thank you for reviewing your hotel stay here with us. I am very sorry to hear you did not enjoy your visit with us. We are currently going through renovations and are adding multiple outlets in the rooms. I know this does not change your experience you had during your stay, however I hope that if your travels return you to the Anaheim Resort area we have a second chance to redeem ourselves. Have a wonderful Friday!

Summary: Hotel was loud. Hot water took 10 minutes to warm up. Room design was poor. Large doors that block walk ways and don't shut fully.   Furniture in the room is cheap. Plywood chairs and contemporary furniture.   It's a walk in shower without a shower door.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for reviewing your experience with us. I do apologize for the hot water issues you experienced during your stay with us. I will be further investigating the incident to make sure we take care of all issues you had mentioned. I would like to thank you for taking the time to share your experiences and hope that if your travels bring you out to the Anaheim Resort Area again you will give us a chance to redeem ourselves.

Summary: I was here for a week attending a conference, and the first comment I have is how great the staff was!  Thomas on the front desk was awesome as was Vance in the bar!  I recall so many other faces, but I am horrible with names... everyone there was great!  Excellent pool and hot tub, and the restaurant, Burger Theory, had excellent food!  When I return to Anaheim next year, I'll be staying here again.

I was iffy at first about staying at this hotel, because I haven't heard the best reviews about it. To my surprise, the hotel was pretty great! Most hotels do not usually have a microwave in the room, but this hotel did. The hotel was very spacious and well maintained. I picked this hotel since I was going to Disneyland and although it is not the closest to Disneyland they offer transportation from this hotel to the park on location.  My only complaints include that the water was a little cold and took about ten minutes to be manageable to take a shower without freezing. As well, the price for room service was extremely outrageous. I had to pay $11 for one breakfast burrito and that does not include tax or the tip to the person who delivers the food. The burrito was definitely

Overall, we were fairly pleased with our experience.   The staff was nice and accomodating.  The room and pool area were both clean.  Our room was straightened for us daily, which was so appreciated.    The negatives were the room was small, but as somebody else said, it's not made to really be hung out in for extended periods.  The bathroom was ok, but we had trouble twice with our toilet,  which was a pain.  The staff was quick to come fix things for us tho.  The water out of the bathroom tap smelled like sewage and there was no way I was going to drink that!  And like others have mentioned - the double beds were smaller than we'd been expecting.  Although, there would have been NO room if there were two queen beds!  The shuttle to Disneyland was super convenient and free

Value for money and exactly what you expect from Holiday Inn.  However a couple of things,  mike at the front desk ....AWESOME ..... answered every question and direction we needed with confidence and knowledge . WOW.  however evening meals at the restaurant were terrible. Breakfast was upto usual standard from Holiday Inn.  pizzas available In house were great.  Last thing this is a family hotel, not really for guests with no kids, our fault really on this one as we didn't do our homework, not blaming the hotel for this in any way.  Close to Disneyland. And ART shuttle for Disney calls by every 20 minutes.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,   Thank you for taking the time in reviewing your stay with us here at Holiday Inn. Your comments are highly valuable as this assists us in continually making changes needed to improve the service and facilities we have to offer our guests. I will speak with our F&B managers regarding the restaurant for dinner service as well.  I do hope that if your travels bring you back the Anaheim Resort area, we may see you again.

Summary: Contemplated on whether or not to leave this review but I figured it would probably help others who decide to choose this hotel for their next getaway. My husband and I stayed at this resort August 1-5. We arrived a little late at night on the 1st, unloaded our things and call it a night. The next morning we woke up at 7am changed, ate breakfast , and got ready for A day of long walks and adventure at Disney. Before we left I remember closing up our suitcase making sure everything was put away before we left as I knew house keeping would be by. I had a pair of beats wireless headphones in their case with the charger in the desk and I remember telling myself "I need to hide these". So I placed them at the bottom of my bag and threw our snacks and a few things on top hoping no one
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share with us about your visit while in the Disneyland Resort area. I am very sorry that you discovered items missing from your room. We take claims of theft very seriously and always investigate them by reading door locks to see who has been in and out of the room and the questioning of all who made entry. Our housekeeping staff is instructed to not move anything and if an item is not physically in the trash they do not touch it.  I know this does not change your recent experience, but I do apologize that we were not able to locate your headphones.

Summary: Stayed in this place for only one night the room was very clean quiet and well looked after. The staff helped us out , they were all very well mannered polite and very helpful. Would recommend this place. We turned up early and they took our bags and put them in a safe place for us.

I was impressed with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby, hallways and rooms were very clean. My room was very comfortable. I liked that there was a fridge and microwave. I thought the gift shop was really overpriced. It would be a lot cheaper to go to an actual store to buy beverages, snacks and toiletries. It only takes a few minutes to drive to Disneyland. I've stayed at a few of the hotels that are in walking distance to the Disneyland park and they are not as nice as this hotel. Even though this hotel is too far away to walk, I would rather stay here again over the closer hotels. Parking is free here and it's a lot nicer than the other hotels. You can also purchase Disneyland tickets here which is really convenient . The lobby is also decorated in

The staff are simply amazing. Kym, the Operations manager, looked after us so well when there was a booking difficulty which took a little time to sort. She kept us calm and reassured us there would be room for our four night stay. She even threw in some breakfast vouchers for us! Holiday Inn need to be so proud of her - she is a true exemplar of A1 public service and would be one reason we would come back here again and stay. All of the staff on the reception are friendly, helpful and happy in their work. Pool is inviting and has lovely surroundings. Room was clean and beds comfortable. Quiet too which was good. Shuttle to Disneyland a huge bonus. $5 each to be used there and back multiple times and coming every 20 minutes too. We loved our visit here. Thanks for a wonderful

We loved our stay! We spent most of our time at Disney so the construction didn't bother us too much. The double beds are a tight squeeze and it would be nice to have a queen but they were very comfortable. We loved being able to eat a good breakfast before we headed out and the ART bus took us right to the front gate of the parks. All of the staff we dealt with were super friendly and accommodating! They even took the time to rearrange other reservations so we could have adjoining rooms. We will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Not what I expected from Holiday Inn
Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel for a Disneyland trip with the family.  I booked it online thru a website.  My first issue was they only have double beds.  that doesn't work very well when you have kids that end up in your bed.  I've never even seen a Holiday Inn with double beds up until this one, and I've stayed at several in various cities over the years.  That being said, the beds were very soft and comfortable, outside of having to be on top of everyone!  The next complaint was with the room safes.  You shouldn't advertise room safes if none of them are working.  They had signs at the front desk that told you they didn't work, but they look like they've been there for months, so I don't think they'll be fixed anytime soon.  The other issue was with the room keys.  I got 2
Manager Response: Dear Bodiky,  Thank you for posting a review and for staying with us.  We are happy to hear that you that you appreciated our comfortable beds and our friendly staff. However,  we would also like to sincerely apologize for some of the sub-par experiences you encountered, particularly with the condition of the bathroom and the non-working room safe and keys. Kindly note that we will be sharing and discussing this with the concerned departments to ensure that the issues are addressed and rectified immediately to avoid future inconveniences to our guests.  Thank you for being our guest and I do hope we will have the opportunity of welcoming you back to our hotel in the future.  Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed her for 17 nites in march 2015.  we booked as good value via BA web site in combination with flights.  We were very impressed.  Room was a bit dated but very comfortable with a desk and small sofa.  Breakfast voutchers were fab and let us have a good choice for the stay- didn't feel like we were havng the same every day.  Disney shuttle was fab, lovely chaps who run the service really are pleasant and fun, drop you off right out side and collection was always on time.  Even though hotel is out of the centre we found no problems at all getting to stuff just needed to allow time and account for traffic.  could not fault hotel and would love to be going back again.

After a long journey across town we turned up all hot and bothered but when we walked into the hotel lobby we were greeted with a warm smile and welcome. The hotel has free Wifi and parking which we found with all of the budget type hotels in the US.   Breakfast was included and kids under 12 eat free. We asked for things off menu and they were very obliging. We had dinner in the restaurant one night which was good and ate some nibbles in the bar which were also good. The food and drink were also very reasonable.   The pool area was great and we spent a day around it in between Disney.  The hotel runs a free shuttle bus and as long as you book up with the driver they are happy to drop you off and pick you up. Disney is only 10-15 mins away so the hotel is in an ideal location.

We have stayed here a few times, most recently at the beginning of August. I took my son to Knott's Berry Farm before his first day of Kindergarten. The front desk staff at this hotel.... simply put, they are wonderful. Always smiling, always greeting guests coming and going, never missing a beat! And for all the traveling I do with my now 6-year-old son, this is the only place that treats him like a mini adult. He loves it! Most hotels he goes to with me find him brushed aside and treated like an annoyance. NOT HERE!!! I've been ALL over the country with him. This is our go-to in Anaheim no matter what we have planned. We will be staying again. We know there are renovations going on at the moment, but that will not stop us from having a very enjoyable stay. The people working

Summary Heading: Good location easy in and off I5
Summary: Clean rooms and great beds!  The location was close to the park. We were there for 2 Disney runs. I noticed they made arrangements for the runners to get in shuttles for the event. The location was close enough that you could have walked. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. We had our daughter join us after she checked out of another hotel and the staff made arrangements for a roll away. I would stay here again.

The hotel was pretty nice and in close proximity to the Disneyland resort. I would not say that the parks are within reasonable walking distance, but this place is a good choice if you are planning to drive to the Toy Story parking lot which is very close by.   The hotel looks taken care of and the workers I encountered went out of their way to greet me. The room itself was pretty nice. We got a king room on the 8th floor and it was very quiet even though it was right in front of the elevator. I have no complaints about the room for the price I paid. I would stay here again.

This was my family's 3rd visit in 3 years to this hotel.  We stayed mid Aug for 1 week.  Myself, husband and son traveled with 4 other people and we stayed in 2 rooms, the hotel staff were able to get us all on the same floor, and the rooms were fairly close together. The hotel is a quick 5-10 min drive from Disneyland, 30 - 40 min away from countless beaches and walking distance from the Honda Center and Angels Stadium.  They also have a shuttle stop/buses that pass right in front of the hotel.  The Holiday Inn has made some updates since our last visit - New carpets, decor, seating lobby area, a coffee bar and a new Burger restaurant.  The rooms are clean and spacious enough for a week stay! The pool is a great break from the parks during the hot afternoon.  It was hardly busy

We recently spent one night here, and quite enjoyed it. Check-in went very smoothly, and the front desk clerk was very friendly and efficient. Unfortunately, she forgot to make note of our late check out (as an IHG member, late check out is at 2pm), so the next morning the front desk was calling to see if we were checking out or wishing to extend our stay.   The room itself was clean and comfortable and very quiet. Then non-skid surface on the bottom of the bathtub was rather worn off, and should probably be replaced. I also noticed that some of the wallpaper in the bathroom was beginning to peel off.   The pool area at this hotel is surprisingly nice, and there is a bar there, so you can have a drink poolside. I enjoyed lounging by the pool the evening I arrived, and the

This place has spacious rooms with spotless bathrooms and very soft, comfortable bed linens.  It's a short walk to Disneyland, or to various shopping areas and the Cheesecake Factory, and the staff were extremely helpful.  You can buy Disneyland passes at the front desk to avoid the lines at the gates, and front desk staff gave me good advice.  I enjoyed my stay here, it's a perfectly decent, good value place to stay.  I'll stay again next time quite happily.

Room good, comfy beds, microwave, needed a fridge too. Air con was very noisy, Breakfast was good value, a nice buffet. Parking was free on site. The pool was nice. There was a bus to Disney but we were staying in town for a wedding and the hotel was great for that. Perhaps needed a bit more if we had been there on our main vacation.

This isn't a high end property by any means, but it is clean, reasonably priced, and a short drive to local attractions.  It's right off highway 5, so it's easy to get off and back onto freeway.  Parking is a standard open lot, no fee.  The main negative is they have the window like air conditioner units that are noisy vs central AC type.
Manager Response: Dear OBIE1_13,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate that you find our location to be convenient and for your nice comment about cleanliness.  However, we’re sorry we fell below your expectation regarding the noise due to the air conditioning. We will address this concern. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I was a bit worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews but once I arrived I wasn't sure why people had complained. The room was clean and nice to sleep in. The staff were helpful and gave us advice on various things. The pool was lovely and rarely too busy to enjoy.

The location was fantastic because it was about a 10 minute bus trip from the hotel to Disneyland. Staff was helpful. It is easy to get around in the hotel but the pool was very warm and gross. You can get themed rooms at this hotel such as a Jungle, Frozen, Toy Story etc rooms but we just got a normal room. The beds were comfy. Washroom in our room wasn't ideal. Hotel breakfast was very good and you can choose from the buffet or just from a menu. Be careful of the tiles in the lobby and around all the rooms because it can be wet from people walking out of the pool and into the lobby - very easy to slip over. The pool and shower towels were very very small. Overall it was an average hotel.
Manager Response: Dear ellie r,  Thank you for posting a review from your recent stay with us. It is great to see that you appreciated the service provided by our staff and the breakfast options that we have. However, we are saddened to know that you were not impressed with our pool and the shower towels. Rest assured, your comments will be shared with our management team for further review.  Again, we appreciate the feedback and we hope to get another chance to accommodate you again in the future.  Regards,  Mike F. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Small Bed but decent place to stay
Summary: I make this hotel reservation through a private vacation club and now I learned is a mistake to make reservation through this type for reservation because once reservation is being made, no cancellation/exchange which locked you in.  Next time, I will make reservation directly with the hotel after all is not that much saving.    While I review some of the comment through trip advisory, I was really anticipate this hotel is going to be “no good”.  However, while we finally there, I experienced the hotel is not as bad as many of your comment, the only compliant I have was that the bed size is very small for two people.  The bed is firm and is actually not bad but again is too small size for two of us!  I learned next time to make sure ask the bed size.  This is standard size bed
Manager Response: Dear Kitty3Jose,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business with us. We are very happy to read your positive feedback on the property which you find it decent, and well liked the food and service received in the restaurant. However, we are truly sorry if your stay was not a complete satisfactory due to the size of the bed. We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. Rest assured that this will be addressed immediately to the hotel management for review to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that you would consider staying with us again in order to show our improvements.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Great for business travel, dining in-house, though limited. Great for the kids also. Frequent shuttles to Disneyland from the hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Plenty of desk space in the room for the business traveler.

Summary Heading: "A+" for Staff Efforts - But Many Issues
Summary: Stayed 7 nights, in two rooms, in July 2015 during a family visit to Disneyland.  The hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland and is serviced by the ART shuttle buses. There is ample onsite free parking, although when the hotel is fully booked you may have to park at the rear of the hotel instead of the front and side. If travelling with four or more people, it is cheaper and more convenient to drive to one of the Disneyland parking lots ($17 with same day return priviledges) rather than take the ART shuttle bus.  Both of our rooms were identical in layout and a reasonable size with two double beds, two arm chairs, small table, flat screen TV, fridge (not a full size but slightly bigger than a bar fridge), microwave, coffee machine. In one room there was an in-room safe
Manager Response: Dear pyctravellingman,  Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay with us.  We work hard to make your your stay comfortable and pleasant so we are pleased to note that you were satisfied with the outstanding service you received from the staff,  quiet rooms, adequate amenities, plenty of parking space and good location of the hotel.  It seems that we were not able to execute an exemplary hotel stay experience with regard to the WIFI connection, inability to adjust air conditioning unit and bathtub maintenance.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you.  Rest assured that we will address each target area that you raised to us.  Your comments will help us improve our facilities and offer a great experience for our guests.  We value you as our guest and hope you will continue to choose IHG for your future travel needs.  Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for kids close to DisneyLand
Summary: Wanted to stay close to Disney Land in a Hotel we could afford. This Holiday Inn did not disappoint....!! We have 7 & 9 year old boy's and room had bunk beds which was perfect for them. They loved it......!!

Hotel is good.  They were renovating but it did not effect us much.  The Burger Theory and breakfast shop were very good .  The pool is nice and good after a day at the parks.  A short shuttle to Disney is cheap and easy to use.  All staff were good and Jose in the breakfast and Burger Theory was excellent.  Room was clean and they provide a fridge and a microwave.  Only problem was the WIFI was terrible.  One day I could not even get the supplied computer to get online.  It got a little better as the week went on.  Overall I would recommend this hotel.

We booked this hotel last minute since all other hotels were sold out due to Disneyland's Diamond Birthday on July 17th. Upon walking in, our room was very outdated, dirty, and the air conditioner was leaking (room smelled like wet carpet). We didn't even have a bath tub and had a tiny little shower in the corner of the bathroom instead. The next morning, there were ants in the air conditioning unit attached to the wall and on the window sill. We notified the front desk and was assured all would be taken care of.   We come back from Disneyland at 12am and saw ants now on the table and in the bed!!! The phone was not working either so we had to go downstairs, ASK for a room change and were told there may not be rooms cause they were fully booked. Thank god the front desk at least
Manager Response: Dear snf320,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review about your recent stay. It is disheartening to hear that you were not able to fully enjoy your recent stay with us due to our housekeeping service falling below your expectations. We would want to follow up on your concerns as we would love the opportunity to regain your faith in us. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain more information.   I look forward to your response and hope you will give us the chance to further assist you.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I would never book a stay here again! Driving 700 miles to get here and we get stuck in the huge I-15 fire in cajon pass. We were not able to get here to check in Friday night because of circumstances out of our control. They refuse to refund us our money for the night we missed. Our reservation was for a king bed and they stick us in a tiny room with bunk beds! This hotel is dirty, disgusting and needs major improvements. Here is a room tip- book somewhere else this place is a zero in every aspect! Lucky this plac is close to Disneyland or they would be out of business.
Manager Response: Dear jfife5,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor. We value each feedback as this will allow us identify the areas that may benefit from our additional attention. It is disheartening to know that your experience was not as pleasant as it should have been. This is not the customer service we endeavor to deliver our guests and for that, we are truly sorry. We would like to look into this further, thus we sent you a private message to help us get additional information regarding this event.  Again, thank you for your valuable feedback and we hope to hear from you soon.  Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Never again.  We booked a Quadruple room for my daughter's dance competition July 9-14, 2015.  At the Hotel, they said we had a 1 King bed room.  We had 4 people in our party.  They gave us a different room with two full-size beds.  Hotel was damp and the only water source was in the bathroom and we could not use it because of the awful smell from the pipes.  It smelled like a sewer plant.  Had to brush my teeth in the bathtub.  There are no extra plug sockets at the nightstand to charge cell phones, etc. unless you unplugged their alarm clock.  Hotel needs updating.  Pool was dirty.  The front desk personnel were very nice.  The room was very small.  I thought we were getting continental breakfast---NOPE!  No such thing at this hotel unless you pay $$$.  Had to go to the hotel
Manager Response: Dear christak469,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor. We regret to hear that your experience was not as pleasant as we would have hoped. We strive to accommodate all of our guests and their needs and we are disappointed to know that we did not meet your expectations with regards to your room accommodations. We are also sorry for falling short on the level of cleanliness. In line with this, we would like to look into this further and we had sent you a private message to get more information about your stay.  Again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to hear from you soon.  Sincerely,  Ingrid V Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The hotel is nice what you would expect from a holiday inn. Ask for a room away from te freeway. The pool are is fabulous and large. The ART shuttle picks you up In Front of the hotel for a small fee. It picks you up every 20 minuts or so. This is a way nicer holiday inn than the one on walnut. It is very close to the parks.

Summary Heading: Needs to be remodeled, room was outdated and bathtub was terrible
Summary: I was hoping for something so much better than what we got at this hotel.  The service was good and the gentleman up front was friendly and helpful. However, the room was outdated. It was spacious which was nice with a small refrigerator and microwave but the bathtub was terrible. The coating had completely peeled off from the bottom and sides and it was bumpy and gross.  I take a bath every night and my kids do as well and it was disgusting.  I am surprised they allow people to even stay when the shower/bath combo is in that condition. They were sold out or I would have asked to be moved to another room. Disappointed that Holiday Inn offers these types of rooms.
Manager Response: Dear M S,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment about our staff and customer service.  However, we’re sorry we fell below your expectation regarding the room condition and the the bathtub condition. We will address these concerns. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland (which is sublime). The room was small but clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was fine, but this accommodation is not designed for you to spend any extra time in.  An ok place to stay that is clean and safe.
Manager Response: Dear Bigfellaben,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business with us. We are very happy to read your positive feedback on the cleanliness of the room and the comfort of the beds. However, we are truly sorry if your stay was not 100% satisfactory due to some aspects of your stay. We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. Rest assured that this will be addressed immediately for review to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Once again, thank you for staying with us we hope that you will give us another opportunity to pamper you and provide you with exceptional accommodation on your next visit.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The rooms were decently clean and the pool was very nice however, that is all that was good about our stay. Everytime we called the front desk they would not answer the phone. I heard other guests complain of the same problem. We chose onnot to have our room serviced during our stay and would go and get things as we needed them. We would ask the desk and they would send someone up to our room with the things we wanted. But they would only bring some of the things so we would have to call and ask again because they never sent anyone that spoke enough English to understand what we wanted.
Manager Response: Dear kknows,  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments. It is nice to know that you liked the cleanliness of our rooms and our pool. However, we regret that we were not able to provide you with the quality of service and accommodation you deserved during your recent visit with us. Please accept our heartfelt apologies for the inconvenience you encountered with the service provided by our hotel staff. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future.   Thank you once again for your valued inputs and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to our hotel.  Regards,  Mike F. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: A great hotel for a family vacation that won't break your budget
Summary: This hotel was a little dated and was under construction, otherwise I would have rated it excellent. The staff were all cheerful and were always nice and ready to help us or answer our questions, especially Laura. We had a pool view which was cool because we could see the Disneyland fireworks show. The room had everything that a family could need for a comfortable stay. The closet had a shelf system that really helped organize our stuff. The AC worked well and the  room was always a comfortable temperature. The ART bus stopped on the premises and had a quick turnaround to Disneyland. Buying the ART passes onsite is easy. Parking is free and we never had any issues getting a parking spot. This hotel is central to everything and it is easy to get in and out of for daily excursions

Upon entry place looks really nice. Front desk is helpful and courteous.  Elevator works good. Hallways look clean. Room is nice and clean. Bathroom is a nice size and clean. The have a hair dryer and provide soaps, shampoo, conditioner,  and body wash. (All small little bottles). In the room I had 2 twin size beds, microwave, small refrigerator. A closet to hang clothes and to my surprise.... A iron and ironing board. I was so happy for that. A/C works fine. Littler table with a couple chairs. Flat screen television. The bed is very comfortable and has many pillows (love pillows).  So the downfalls are: Breakfast is 14.99. REALLY! For the same ol' I get at other hotels for free. No thank you! You cant even make your own waffles! No thier frozen (thawed out). I stayed away from

I do not understand why this hotel has poor reviews. Kym at the front desk gave us stellar customer service. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We did not eat at the restaurant. The shuttle to Disneyland was wonderful and easy to use. The room had a mini fridge and coffee maker. The beds were extremely comfortable and clean. We had a nice view of the Disneyland fireworks from our room. The ac worked wonderfully. We look forward to our next visit to this Holiday Inn.

Summary Heading: 10 MInutes Drive to Disneyland - Excellent New Restaurant
Summary: My family spent one night at this hotel after having spent the day at Universal Studios. I wanted a hotel close to Disney so we could be there early before the crowds. This place was perfect. The room was clean and quiet with comfortable beds. The bathroom was clean and appeared new. We had a great breakfast in the brand new restaurant which just opened a few days earlier. Disney was still about 10 minutes away by car (longer with traffic) The hotel also has shuttles going to Disney.

This hotel for the price is a disappointment. If you need 2 beds in your room only full side beds, room was full of bugs, bathroom shower very small and water did not drain easily! The only restaurant in site does not provide a variety of food!
Manager Response: Dear Yolie28,  Thank you very much for taking the time to share your comments online. We always strive to provide world class accommodations and outstanding guest experiences. However, on this occasion, it is disappointing to know your stay was not as comfortable as it could have been due to the condition of the room received. I understand your frustrations, and I am truly sorry for the overall dissatisfaction you have experienced with your stay. The situation you have described is definitely not what we expect from any of our properties, nor is it something we take lightly. Rest assured that your comments will be reviewed by our team and take actions accordingly to correct unsatisfactory experiences and to ensure similar inconvenience can be avoided in the future.  Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope this experience will not deter you from giving us another opportunity to make your stay as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: So, first things first. We made a mistake. I didn't realize that there were two Anaheim Holiday Inns near Disneyland. I booked the kids suite with bunk beds and an X-box, but also thought I was getting a kids splash pad and a location that was within walking distance to Disney. Somehow in our research, we merged the two. Oops. So, no splash pad or walking distance to Disney at this one. Also, no kids suite. It was booked. They gave it to someone else. My five year old was crushed. His pouty face got us free breakfast for the week. The next afternoon, we got the kids suite. After a clogged toilet, Xbox controller that was broken and exchanging the movie we were given instead of a game....and the replacement of a fridge that didn't work, things got better. Ha. The staff is very
Manager Response: Dear hotmoltenlava,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent experience with us. I am glad that you found our hotel staff accommodating. On the other hand, allow me to apologize if there were any shortfalls when it comes to our room amenities and breakfast served that may have caused you inconvenience. Your comments are very important to us and we appreciate that shared these with us. Rest assured that we will consider your feedback when making improvements in order to serve you better in the future.  Thank you again for sharing your experience. I do hope you will allow us to provide you with a much desirable stay next time you visit the area.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: After long long long drive from Hollywood. 2-3hrs with traffic. If you have a good driver.  Check In: so prebook and pay with breakfast and 2 beds on high floor. Well after 30 minutes booking finally found but only x1 king bed.   Low floor and no breakfast, but wait it gets better, no food at all or drinks provided in room empty fridge not even milk?. X2 coffee coffee thats in nothing for hot chocolate. Microwave easy to use. Room is nice well, depending which you get on check it. Want 2 beds haha your funny hope others with you don't mind a roll-away bed. But doesn't make for alot of room to move around room. Bathroom is great lots of room. Shower is nice.  Close to Disneyland... as advertised nope its not shuttle or taxis are best way or long walk. Plan to wait for shuttle.
Manager Response: Dear Babybrit,  Thank you for being our guest and for taking the time to write your comprehensive review. We regret that we were not able to provide you with the quality of service and accommodations you deserved during your recent visit with us. We also apologize for the difficulties you had experienced at check-in. Your comments are valued and noted and be rest assured that this will be shared with management to help us determine on what we could further improve on to be able to deliver a highly satisfactory experience.  Again, we thank you for your valued feedback. Despite your disappointments, we certainly hope that you would give us a chance to make your next stay with us, a better one.  Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: A great staff which was very helpful
Summary: I recently stayed here with my wife, my son and his girlfriend and my granddaughter. The staff was very helpful and met every need. We had to change our room and get an additional room and all was accomplished with no problem. All questions were answered and I can't say enough about the staff. The only issue with the hotel is that the rooms are very small. The bed was supposed to be a King but is much closer to a Queen sized bed. The room does have a small fridge and a microwave which is  nice.  The restaurant was under construction so it was set up in the game room  The food was acceptable, service very friendly, and kids ate for free.  We got bus passes to go to Disneyland and that worked very well  It was about a five minute ride  on ART which picks up in the parking lot and

The hotel is very nice.  Check in was easy and quick and the staff were friendly.  The room is very nice and clean.  The only complaint is that the ART bus takes 40 minutes.  It says there is a bus running every 20 minutes, but only 1 bus does the rounds.  I know it's not the fault of the hotel, but they need to let people know it's a 40 minute wait, not 20.  Also, this hotel is not in the resort area.  It's a 30 minute walk from the hotel to Disneyland.  I'd rather stay closer to property to I won't stay here again.  Only because of the distance, not because of anything wrong with the hotel.

Summary Heading: Consistently great staff; quiet and comfortable. Great location for Disney.
Summary: We've stayed here once each of  the last three years when visiting Disneyland. We've always found the front desk clerks friendly, concerned and interested in us having a good stay. Rooms have always been spacious, quiet and clean.   We had a unique personal situation with a family member requiring me to fax a copy of my credit card to another hotel back home. The staff didn't miss a beat and offered to receive and send a couple of faxes.  A bus ferries guests to and from Disneyland, although we prefer to drive the 10 minutes. It's also convenient to local restaurants and a Target is five minutes away if you need to make a store run. I will stay here again and again.

We got 2 double bed it was nice. Room is very clean the beds are comfortable. Service is very good. Close to everything.  We would stay here again . Very quite. The only thing u have to bring ur bags to your room , they don't have bell desk service. We love the room.

Summary Heading: had to resort to staying here
Summary: I usually stay at the holiday in next to Disneyland however my work Colleague made the reservations and booked us here.  It has a nice lobby and a grand entrance.  Normally as an Elite Platinum member I get a choice of points, drinks or a goodie bag plus a room upgrade, but at this location I got the points no choices no room upgrade.  My room was pretty standard it had a great view of a trailer park.  I found out that this is a "corp location" not a franchise and the corp locations don't give you much. My question is why would you get better service from a franchise than a corp flagship store...hummm  The bar/ restaurant was closed for renovations while we were there and the restaurant was relocated to one of the conference rooms. we didn't partake here.  The only on site
Manager Response: Dear Jim K,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. Allow me to apologize for any shortfalls that may have caused you inconvenience. We do strive for improve in everything we do and all of the issues you described obviously do not meet our expectations let alone yours. Please be assured that your comments are taken into serious account. I am confident that our management will continue to do their best to ensure our valued guests are fully satisfied with their stays.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: stayed for 3 days in FEB with family.  over all average - spa was nice and hot- pool was average- restaurant average. staff were helpful and friendly . over all expereince is OK nothing great. mostly for young family with kids visiting disney land.
Manager Response: Dear Ramiah,  Thank you for taking the time for providing us with your candid feedback. I am pleased with your kind comments towards our staff.   It is disheartening that you only found some aspects of our hotel to be at their average best. Nevertheless, we highly appreciate your comments as these are vital to our continuous efforts to improve our amenities and services.  Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to have another chance to host you again in the future.  Sincerely,   Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This hotel is average at best, I was there on a business trip and was not very impressed, the elevators seem to separate the two wings and are very confusing.  It is located very close Disneyland Resort, so expect kid traffic.  Room service took over one hour to get to my room and then the food was lukewarm.  It is located on the same lot as another hotel, close to the Fwy.
Manager Response: Dear M R,  Thank you for staying with us and leaving a review.  We work very hard to ensure our facilities and service are superior and we strive to be the best Holiday Inn around.  It sounds like we fell short of your expectation in a few areas mainly the slow room service and lukewarm food.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you.  Your comments have been forwarded to the hotel management and we are confident they will take necessary actions to improve our guest satisfaction.  We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope you will continue to choose IHG for your travel needs.  Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary Heading: Awesome, wish I had booked the entire stay here!!!
Summary: We got in a day early and stayed here on a whim. Staff was friendly, room was clean and bathroom was clean. Pool was nice, heated, and large. Grounds were very well kept and neat. Beautiful plants all around. Got the kids suite, kids loved it! The x-box was a hit! Our room faced the freeway, but it didn't bother us at all. If i had to knock something it would be the drains were incredibly slow. Overall i wish I booked the entire stay here, unfortunately I prepaid for the other HI location in Anaheim a few weeks before. If you are contemplating between the two, this is the better choice!

We got this hotel for a low price but other than that, that's about the best I can say about it.  The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are worn and in need of renovation.  Carpets are dirty & AC made horribly loud noise that made it hard to sleep even with ear plugs.  I would not choose to stay here again as Anaheim has much better options.
Manager Response: Dear parkerpug,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review following your recent stay. We give the utmost importance to our guest comments as they help us improve, and continually provide the best guest experience possible. We are truly sorry for not living up to your expectations and for not creating a memorable stay for you. We have taken note of your valuable comments regarding the conditions of the room and your comments are instrumental for us to improve on what we can offer to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope your future travel plans will continue to include IHG.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Had a wonderful Disneyland vacation at this hotel. Staff was very helpful and really enjoyed the restaurant. We took advantage of the kids eat free offer, and ate at the restaurant almost every day for breakfast and dinner. Delicious food with huge portions. Service is fast and our kids loved the slushies they got after dinner. The rooms where basic but nice and very clean. The pool was nice and heated and the kids loved the spray park as well. The walk to the tram to Disneyland is about ten minutes. It wasn't' to bad considering we walked back and forth a few times a day. Will defiantly stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

From the very start it was all bad! I never got an email confirmation from them because they wrote down the wrong email. Then when i called to ask what holiday inn i was at, they told me the wrong one, ( after driving 6 hrs you dont want to get back in the car!). After arriving to the Manchester one, we were told that our rooms werent ready, ( after registering online 2 weeks before AND calling to confirm). We finally got sent up to a room, noy once BUT TWICE we were sent up to two different dirty rooms! Its almost like it was done on purpose! No one apolozied or even acknowledged! Then we asked if we could cancel and they said yes! We went to Staybridge and had great customer care and service,  along with a nice, clean room!! Why couldn't we get thar treatment at holiday inn?
Manager Response: Good morning Abbygirl34,   Thank you for taking the time to review your hotel stay with us. It does concern me that you had issues with the service. We pride ourselves on customer service and it is reflected in many of our reviews.  At the hotel we had discussed the issues that you had encountered and we refunded the charge for the extra reservation that was made not directly at the hotel but with central reservations. I am sorry to hear that we did not resolve your issues to your liking and hope that if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area you will give us a second chance.

Summary Heading: Not too bad for a short stay
Summary: Every employee we encountered was super friendly and check-in was a breeze.  We were even able to get a late check-out since we were there for the Disneyland 24 hour celebration.  The room left a lot to be desired though.  The room was clean but in serious need of a makeover.  The only cleanliness issues were some smashed gum on the floor but we just learned to walk around it.  It wasn't even worth mentioning at the time.  The tub bottom was a little iffy as well.  The non-stick area was basically textured paint that was a little rough on the feet.  My girls enjoyed the pool on our last day.  We didn't get a chance to have the breakfast as we left the hotel every day before it started.  The beds were a little firm for my liking and I was surprised they were double beds.  I
Manager Response: Dear  Melissa M,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent stay. It is good to know that you found our staff to be friendly. However, we apologize for the shortcomings regarding our rooms and bathrooms. We understand that these led to your disappointments. Your review has been noted and will be forwarded to our management for future upgrades.  Again, your feedback is very much appreciated and we hope to see you once more for a chance to provide more positive and memorable experience.  Best Regards,  Joel A Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: So my search began with either paying for overpriced motels( yucky) to be right across the street or pay for a very expensive hotel.  Some are reasonably expensive and puts you within a short walk to a nearby park/ride for a shuttle/tram which is likely to be very crowded and can take up to 20 mins to get to your car/main gate.  So I found this for around $100 USD.  The low price reflects It's farther out location and close to I5 proximity location.  But then I heard the hotel has a shuttle/bus stop at the hotel which takes you in 8 mins to the main gate.  It's a public bus/shuttle which runs special lines called ART to all the nearby hotels and shopping/convention center.  I'm not specifically recommending this hotel but if you do a bit of research, you can stay at a nice hotel
Manager Response: Dear Joseph L,  Thank you for your stay and for leaving a review about our hotel on TripAdvisor. It is good to hear that the shuttle service and our room pricing worked out for you. Your feedback is important to us, as this helps us make sure that yourself and all of our guests, love the IHG brand and our hotel. Thank you for the three out of five star rating, we hope to earn those extra two stars with your next visit.  We look forward to hosting you again soon.  Best Regards,  Ingrid V Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We just stayed there for five nights while visiting Disneyland.  We are from Hawaii so after plane tickets and park tickets we were on a budget for the hotel.  This place was clean and updated nicely.  Of course it is no four seasons but at these prices I was surprised how nice it was for the cost.  Rooms were  adequate size bright and welcoming.  We arrived four house before normal check in but after having an overnight flight that was delayed we were exhausted and needed a nap before heading to the park.  They found a room for us and checked us in quickly. We really appreciated that.  The staff was all friendly and helpful.  Will stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello Thrasher family,   I would like to thank you for taking the time to review your hotel stay here with us at Holiday Inn. I am happy to hear you and your family were able to check in early and get some rest before you went to Disneyland. Again I appreciate your review and we hope to see you again in the near future when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort Area.
