Summary: Stayed 4 days for a trade show at the convention center. I wouldn't suggest walking to Disneyland or the convention center as it's a few miles away, but close enough if you have a car. Located right next to I-5 on/off ramp. Never heard any freeway traffic though. Nice rooms. Clean and updated. Everything was as expected. Also was able to use the office center printer without any problem.  Only issue was the "free" breakfast. Tip and surcharge were applied to our room because we left when we were done with our meals. Went the next day and waiter told us that tip and surcharge is expected and that they had to look us up to apply the previous days fees to our room. So, bag the "free" breakfast and go someplace in the area instead. I suggest Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles.

The hotel room was your basic room, but was clean and nicely appointed.   Our room overlooked the swimming pool and hot tub area, with a spectacular view of the nightly fireworks from the magic kingdom. A little trick we had to learn is that the toilets would only properly flush with the lids down. The staff were very friendly and although the restaurant and bar were temporarily located in a ballroom while renovating the real restaurant and bar, the food was still very good. Liked the kids under 6 eat free discount. A shuttle bus takes you to the main Disney gates but you have to purchase tickets at the vestibule with exact amount only. This still was very convenient. The pool and hot tub area were great and it was hard to get the little one out of the water at night. Would

The rooms were clean and nice. They were renovating the restaurant when we visited, but the food was good with excellent staff and good prices. The pool area was okay. Good place for families with young children. Quiet surroundings and easy access to Disneyland with the bus shuttle right outside the hotel. Hotel staff was very friendly and service minded.  The wifi could have been a lot better.
Manager Response: Dear Christina D,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent stay. We are glad to know that you liked our rooms and we are delighted that you found our staff to be friendly. On the other hand, we apologize if the restaurant renovation caused you any inconvenience and we are sorry if we did not meet your expectations about the Internet connection.  Your comments have all been noted and will be forwarded to our management as these will be used in improving the quality and services we offer.  Regards,  Joel A Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We were very impressed with this Holiday Inn property.  It was much better than expected.  Loved the location because property was conveniently off of the 5 freeway and close to an abundant selection of restaurants and stores.  Disneyland and Downtown Disney was minutes away.  The room that we had was amazingly comfy.  Bathroom was spacious and clean.  Room came with a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker.  Beds were awesome.  They were very comfy...  soft yet firm enough to support your back.  For some odd reason, I found the hotel to be quiet and peaceful, knowing that some of the guests were children and teenagers.  Lobby area was quiet.  Staff was very friendly.  Loved the Disney ambiance of the lobby.  Will definitely consider this property the next time we're in

Summary Heading: Due to location and price 4 stars / it's ok
Summary: I had a 4-day training in this hotel in a business room. Right after I've received my room key I went- to my room and in. Unfortunately the room was already occupied. The guest wasn't there. So I called the reception and they found out that everything went wrong. Anyway. This can happen - but I wasn't impressed. The room is - relativ to its price/night - absolutely ok. Most families stay here one or two days for the DIsney attraction nearby. They don't really need a small fridge, something I would have had enjoyed. Anyway. As mentioned in my title everything is fine for that price.

Summary Heading: I wasn't there for a vacation
Summary: Recently back in Anaheim for a week on business.  I decided to go for one of my travel staples, Holiday Inn.  The location of the hotel was perfect for me, I wasn't out walking the neighborhood and it was easy on and off of the freeway.  What I was impressed with was the attitude and behavior of the staff.  Everyone was genuinely interested in making the stay enjoyable.  Mission accomplished!

I had the privilege of staying at this property for a business function for 4 nights. Prior to my arrival, my plans had changed requiring me to shift my arrival and departure dates by 1 day. Unfortunately, there was a marathon at Disney that Friday-Saturday, and the web site showed no rooms available for Friday evening. I called the hotel direct and Mike at the Front Desk was extremely understanding to my plight and was able to accommodate my change request. When I arrived - I was greeted warmly, and upgraded to a 2 room suite for my entire stay. Everyone I encountered at this property (staff) were friendly and courteous . I would like to especially call out "Princess" at the restaurant and Jose at the bar for their excellent service. I will definitely stay here again when my

Summary Heading: This is a decent place... sketchy surroundings
Summary: The hotel itself was decent.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Located close to Disneyland and the Honda Center.  The room was clean overall but there seemed to be a slight musty smell every time I entered the room.  It wasn't that bad as I always got used to it in about a minute but it was noticeable.  The major drawback of this hotel is its proximity to the trailer park.  Late at night after a taxi mix-up I was forced to walk back to the hotel from the main street.  One of the trashy denizens of the trailer park chased me down to ask for a lighter.  It was a terrifying experience, even though it turned out rather benignly.
Manager Response: Dear fuzzypuppy,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. It was a pleasure to have accommodated you recently and I am glad that you found our staff highly commendable.   Allow me to apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced with the unusual smell in the room that was assigned to you. I have taken note of your feedback and I am confident that this concern will be attended to as soon as possible. I am confident that our management is continuously doing their best in order to provide a great stay.  Although I would have preferred you had a better stay, thank you again for your feedback. I do hope you will allow us to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Nice, comfortable hotel. Some renovations going on.
Summary: Stayed here for two nights on business in May 2015.  Upgraded to a king suite (room 500). I'm an ihg platinum member, and I spend > 100 nights a year at their hotels, so I'm fond of their brand.  The room itself was clean and comfortable (consistently comfortable bedding is one reason I frequent Holiday Inn), but it is in need of a little refreshing.   The carpet in the room was worn and frayed but no major problems.  As others have mentioned,  the shower is a walk in. No tub.  Personally,  I prefer this to a tub/shower combination.  Others had complaints about cleaning but my bathroom was perfectly clean.  (If there was an issue, management seems to have addressed it.)  My view of the rooftops of a trailer park across the street; so not much there.  The restaurant/bar was under

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay for trip to Disney
Summary: This was our 1st time staying at this hotel and we were happy with our choice.  The staff is very friendly, checking us in and every time we walked by they greeted us. The room was nice and the bathroom was large and had plenty of space to move around. There were plenty of towels laid out for us and the housekeeping always replaced them when we left the sign on our door. My daughter took her plushie and the housekeeper made the bed and laid him out for her, thought it was a cute touch. The cleanliness was good, no complaints there. There were plenty of TV channels for us to go through (helps when you're not at the parks and just want to recharge/rest). We didn't have any issues with noise. There were a couple times we could hear other people, but other than that, it was really

The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful,  a big plus in my book! They also have a great little store to buy things we left behind,  snacks and souvenirs. The room was a tight fit for a family of 4, but we made it work and we didn't spend much time inside.  Didn't have a chance to use the pool or restaurant. Would stay here again.

Great pool area. Under construction while we were there so access to restaurant not great. Close to Disney and convenient freeway access. Clean rooms, comfy beds. Great for kids...lots of Disney decorations. Will stay again.

Summary Heading: Sadly, Not Leaving the Review I'd Hoped
Summary: This has been our hotel of choice for visits to Disneyland and we stay for a week or more at a time (this was our 4th trip in 5 years). Normally I have rave reviews but this time we were only satisfied, we weren't wowed. We asked for a room overlooking the pool - our wish was granted. Loved this part of our stay. Pool area is great.  The bare minimum in terms of cleaning was done to the room - furniture was not wiped down, shower had yellow "stuff" stuck to the walls and someones hair pins were left in there which leads me to believe it was not cleaned at all. Not sure why they don't double or triple check the rooms. Corners of carpets were fuzzy and had not been vacuumed. I did not sleep well this time, I'm not sure if it were the pillows or the mattress. Wi-fi connection was
Manager Response: Dear Mom2R,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for reviewing our property. Our efforts are always to ensure our guests are satisfied and our hotel is maintained to be comfortable while you are with us. It is disappointing to know that the closed restaurant and the cleanliness of the room fell short of your expectations. We have taken note of your feedback as this will help us to continually improve the services and facilities we offer to our guests in order to meet guests' needs and expectations.  Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope this experience will not deter you from giving us another opportunity to serve you better in the future.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This is a nice hotel, great pool area, pool bar service was awesome. The only thing that was a bit bothersome was the main restaurant was closed for reno's. Its  a bit off the beaten tarck to walk any where, But Ubers were always close by and the transit system stops at the hotel and you can ride for $5.oo a day. Disneyland was only 8 minutes away by bus. I would stay again

We travel a lot for my husband's work and often stay at IHG hotels. This one is pretty shabby and sad. Housekeeping fails to replace toilet paper and tissue. When you get back to your room at midnight, you will have to call front desk repeatedly to get a hold of anyone. Then they will take 20 minutes to get your toilet paper...because, you know, they're so busy at midnight.   Skip the suites and get a standard room. The standards have better views, and I'm pretty sure (or hopeful) that they focus their upkeep on the standard rooms which are popular with Disney visitors. The suite bathrooms only have shower stalls, no tubs. The shower stall is weirdly laid out and has no door. There is no fan or ventilation in the bathroom either. Our faucet leaked at the base, spraying over the
Manager Response: Dear Gabrielle M,  Thank you for being an IHG Rewards Club member and for leaving us a feedback. Kindly accept our sincerest apologies for the unsatisfactory service you received from the staff during your stay. Your comments are being shared with the hotel management and appropriate action will be taken. We appreciate your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This has been one of the best hotel experiences. Very friendly staff who are always available for help. Clean, comfortable rooms with a spacious bathroom. While the restaurant was closed at the time I visited there was a small shop you could purchase snacks from and food places within walking distance. A fabulous hotel for anyone visiting disneyland who wants quality without paying through the roof

Awesome service. Awesome staff. This is exactly what we were looking for. Family-friendly, convenient, available 24/7, etc. My family and I look forward to our next trip very soon and we plan on staying at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: gotta give it 5 stars for service.
Summary: i already did a review of this hotel the last time we were here and right now were staying here again for 4 days. Smooth check in..arrived late and the desk dudes still greeted us with a smile..  Room was okay and this is where i give them high praise, the housekeeping was superb..The lady went over and beyond. took the time to clean...and request done in a snap...we'll be back for sure..comfortable bed..

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Marissa was very helpful, would recommend resort to my friends and family
Summary: did have a good experience with the staff specially Marissa who did helped me on the room change, she was very helpful and concern if I am comfortable to the room I got that she gave me, way to go Marissa, keep up the good work towards your customers!!!

I stayed in this hotel back in January but forgot to review it...so here it is. Our room was very clean and modern. The parking was free which was a big plus, and there is a shuttle that picks up right in hotel parking lot(shuttle is not free,  but cheaper than disney parking). The staff members at the front desk were very helpful and sweet. The room was pretty spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Our room was right in front of the elevator so there was quite bit of noise from excited kids in the morning. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars is because at about 8am the fire alarm went off and the person who was on the loudspeaker that came through our room repeated the same message multiple times that everything was ok and not to worry about the fire alarm, but

Summary Heading: Better places to stay in the area
Summary: Stayed here for one night and glad it was only one night.  Check in was smooth and uneventful.  Once I got to the room and unpacked, I turned on the AC to find out that this AC unit sounds like a Diesel engine.  It was already late, I had already unpacked so I decided to just stay in the room and sleep with the window open.  When I opened the window, I got the loud freeway noise.   Had an uncomfortable warm night with no AC.  It shouldn't be the guest's responsibility to do quality control in the room.  Someone should have caught this.....maybe the maid who is in the room everyday.     Like another reviewer said, the bath tub was slimy and felt slippery.  Not sure what's going on there.    As I was leaving, I saw a big cockroach by the rear door.  I pointed it out to an employee
Manager Response: Dear Erik K,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We just want to assure you that our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product. We are disappointed that we did not meet your expectations on this particular day. Please accept our apologies for the noise challenges that you experienced. Though we would prefer you had a better experience at our hotel, we would like to thank you for sharing your thoughts and we hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Again, thank you for your time and for staying with us.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: My husband and I stayed here the weekend of our first wedding anniversary, we chose this location as it was 10 minuets from Disneyland and close to all our other planned activities.   We were warmly greeted upon check in, I asked for a room that faced Disney so we could watch the fireworks each night and that was not an issue we were happily put into a room so we could watch them.   The staff were always very friendly with us, we inquired about the shuttle to Disney and were given accurate and helpful information (it's the ART shuttle $5 for a full day adult fair, cheaper than Disney all day parking)  I enjoy to swim so I took advantage of the warmer weather and the pool, I did have to ask for them to bring out more towels to the pool which was no problem.  I will say the only

Summary Heading: Return traveller and would Go again
Summary: This is a great hotel for families with young children. The Mickey Mouse shaped pool was a big hit, although I didn't particularly like having to walk through the entire hotel in my bathing suit to get to it. The rooms are average, but clean. We have stayed in the standard rooms and the family suite. The kids enjoyed the "seperate" room and their own tv, but found the beds weren't as comfortable as the standard room's. There is an info centre in the lobby, but beware they will try to lure you to to a time share presentation at a nearby resort. The location is a short drive or bus ride to Disney, but is not really in walking distance to much.  The restaurant can save a lot of money if you stay away from the buffet and take advantage of the kids eat free deal. The food is ok,

The room was comfortable and a great rate for the location. Unless you are travelling with children I would never stay here again.The sheer noise level was awful. Don't choose this hotel if you asre travelling alone or as a couple wanting a quiet hotel.
Manager Response: Dear mvann4,  I appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. We are pleased to read that you have regarded our hotel location to be fantastic, rooms to be comfortable. However, it is unfortunate that issues with the noise disturbances prevented you from fully enjoying your stay. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience these aspects have caused.   We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention.  We have forwarded your concerns to the hotel management and will be a basis for future upgrade.   Once again, thank you for staying with us and we all hope to have an opportunity to serve you again on your next future visit and see the improvements made.  Sincerely,  Dianne L. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I recently stayed at your hotel for food convention and had drinks at the portable bar. the bartender Jennifer made a great cocktail named captain smash for my girlfriend and it was amazing. She then suggested a restaurant for us to go for dinner, it was amazing.  We came back to the bar and she let us have drinks even though it was after 10. she went out of her way to make sure we had a good stay at your hotel. I was very pleased with the service because she made us feel special. In conclusion this is why I will definitely be back at this hotel. I hope you know that your staff shows superb attention to their guests need.

Arrived at hotel before check-in but they had a room ready for us. They have luggage carts available. Came in handy. Our room was clean and quiet. They have little shelving racks in closet to put bags on instead of having them all out in room. A cabinet above microwave and fridge counter. That came in handy. A 17 min. walk to Bubba Gump's (Garden Walk). Walking to Disneyland would have been too much walking for my kiddos, my personal thoughts. We took a cab and paid $10. Hotel does have a shuttle but we didn't wait for it. Our room was 822 and at night we watched the fireworks from Disneyland. My only issue was the tub...it felt sort of slimy. I believe it was due to the slip guard mat that had peeled of on some areas of tub. The ladies cleaning the room not only tidied up and

A very dated HI in need of a full update, not just the lobby and restaurant. Lamps were wobbly and about to come apart, chairs old an worn, but the beds were comfortable. Which was good, because this is a NOISY hotel. Not from outside which is impressive considering the proximity to the interstate. Noise from above, below, left, right and in the hall. Additionally the a/c is the absolute noisiest I've ever had, and I spend a 100 nights a year in hotels. The light switch in the bathroom was shorting out. Both it and a/c noise was reported to no affect. As mentioned in other reviews the food menu is lacking. Del taco is a 10 minute walk, but I encourage you to try the donut shop between Clarion and the gas station. All of their product is great!
Manager Response: Dear Timzr,  Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. We are glad you found our beds comfortable. However, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by the noise issues and we regret that you found our hotel to be dated which prevented you from fully enjoying your stay.   As a valued guest, please be assured that all feedback will be acted upon as we rely on you, our guest, to tell us how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs.   We hope you will consider us again and see the improvements made.  Sincerely,  Dianne L. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We arrived after 10:00pm, following a long day of traveling.  We were tired and a touch crabby.  The front desk staff was the friendliest that I have encountered a in LONG time.  The check in process was quick and easy as well.  The room was very clean and welcoming.  The bed was comfortable ~ I slept like a rock, which rarely  happens in a hotel.  The shower had great water pressure.  We only spent one night at this hotel, as our final destination was San Diego.  But, the brief visit was relaxing and enjoyable.

Summary Heading: 2nd stay at this hotel, great check in experience, and went downhill after that
Summary: This is our 2nd time staying at this hotel. Our 1st experience 2 years ago was splendid - we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite, the breakfast buffet was easy, the staff were happy and very helpful. I gave great feedback 2 years ago, I was very pleased with the staff, I noted of their names and gave positive feedback on their website.  The staff made us feel very welcome and treated us very well despite the fact that I do not have status with the Holiday Inn or IHG.   Fast forward to Jan 30, 2015 - the check in experience was great! Josh the front office manager made us feel very welcome and gave us a room that made the kids feel special - bunk beds and their own TV and Xbox 360! Our stay would be 4 nights this time.  Our in room safe needed repair - the front desk staff had their
Manager Response: Dear endokendo,  Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay with us.  It's great to hear your positive feedback about the clean rooms and friendly staff.  We work diligently to ensure our facilities and services are superior and we try our hardest to provide not just good value, but comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations.  It is regrettable to hear that your stay this time was not as excellent compared to your visit two years ago.  It sounds like you were completely let down by the breakfast experience and housekeeping services.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you.  We value your loyalty to our hotels and  the feedback we receive from you enables us to target problem areas.  We hope to have an opportunity to serve you again in the near future and provide you with the service you deserve and expect from us.   Your patronage and support to the hotel is very important to us and we look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.  Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: Rooms are clean, staff is very helpful and  kids eat free at restaurant! My kids love the chicken strips! and the people at the restaurant are super nice! The pool is huge I guess because the hotel shares the pool with stay bridge (right next door). but in general hotel is good (no luxury or anything) but decent if you want to have a peaceful night!

We arrived here after a 15hr flight from Melb, Aust.  After arriving before 8am (we didn't have check in until 11) we were found a prompt room and even upgraded. Very happy.  The staff were very easy going, and helpful. Big shout outs to Alex at the service desk. We stayed here like many visitors to make our way to Disneyland.  The staff were brilliant during our stay, the restaurant staff were lovely and the meals filling.  My only issue was, being a coffee drinker, a snooty Melbourne coffee drinker, I had to get used to the non espresso variant and starbucks - that happened once.

This hotel is the worst I've ever been to. Don't waste your time. Hotel staff is incompetent and will not help you. Even if you are locked out of the very room you paid for. Don't waste your time on this place. There are plenty of other options.
Manager Response: We pride ourselves on our customer service abilities.  I am very sorry if we fell short while attempting to assist you.  Unfortunately you did not provide us with very much information regarding your incident.  I will say that guests often lock themselves out of their room and request a duplicate key.  We take safety and security very seriously and when making a duplicate key we always ask for identification.   If a guest can not provide proper identification we will not issue a key.  While this may upset some people we do not make exceptions when it comes to someones safety and security.

Summary: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim in April 2014 with the family on our first Disneyland visit. The hotel is great when  travelling with kids and staff are very friendly. Walking distance to restaurants and 7 eleven and other amenities, great view of Anaheim when on top floor. The only let down we felt needs attention is the restaurant as it looks a bit run down and more attention to the quality of food on the buffet as the fruit salad was way past it's due date. Staff were very apologetic which was nice but it's little thing that make a great experience.

We just spent 3 days at this place. First, we arrived late at night, everyone was tired, no bellboys to help with luggage. Once we got in the room, we asked for a cot. The cot was delivered nice and on time but without sheets and blankets. The housekeeper came back with an adult size pillow and an adult size blanket. Just one! not even a sheet! And there are no more sheets in the closet so she had to come back with another adult size blanket. The next morning, the place was evacuated due to a fire alarm that someone activated. We never heard anything until a pitchy noise followed by the voice of the manager said that they were investigating the incident. Five minutes later, the same pitchy noise saying that everything was fine. We tried to have a shower then and there was not
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  I am very sorry that we failed to meet your expectations on a number of levels.  I will share your concerns at our next department head meeting so we can learn and grow from it.  I am confident we can overcome these deficiencies and I hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary: This is a very good hotel. Its quiet and has easy access to Disneyland. A Disney shuttle stops at this hotel.  Our room was on the 4th floor and was clean and spacious.  It had a nice walk-in shower with the large shower head.  The freeway noise was not an issue even though our room was on the freeway side.  The complimentary WIFI worked well.  No complimentary breakfast but MYO coffee in your room.  A restaurant is on site, however we did not eat there.  Free parking and a good value leads me to stay here again.

The beds were great. Its fairly clean unless you want to use the laundry or get ice. I didn't like loosing items from my room. I carried 1 of 3 missing items from home in a carry-on and both of Remember it put in the pantry. Another was taken from my suitcase. The last makes no sense but it was missing less than 24 hours from check in on my extended stay. The manager said most people find they left their items at home. I had not and double checked my home to be sure.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you discovered items missing from your room.  We take claims of theft very seriously and always investigate them by reading the door lock to see who has been in and out of the room and then questioning anyone who made entry.  Our housekeeping staff is instructed to not move anything from the bed such as suitcases or any other belongings and if an item is not physically in the trash can we also do not disturb it.  In addition, there is a safe in each room and safe and safety deposit boxes at the front desk.

Summary: We went to supercross event at stadium. 1 night stay. Hotel was clean and good condition as i would expect from IHG hotel. Little hard to navigate to if your not familiar with the area. You can see it but not easy to get to it your first time. Was close to everything from dinner to shopping and i seen Disney was quite close.

Summary Heading: Great Price and Location for Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed here twice now, both times while visiting Disneyland. Reasonably well priced for the location and has a great bus service to Disneyland which runs every 15 minutes and only costs $5 for one adult per day. The hotel itself is clean and tidy with friendly, helpful staff and the free breakfast buffet is great. I would recommend to anyone needing somewhere to stay while visiting Disneyland - can't go wrong with Holiday Inn!

Comftable rooms with free parking. The hotel isnt a five  star place  but its value for money. Located  near disneyland the rooms are clean and neat.. definitely recomend for couples or a short stay over. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for a trip to Anaheim to visit Disneyland and the Honda Center for Teemu Tribute night.  The hotel was great.  They were quick to upgrade us from 2 doubles to 2 queens because of our IHG member status, and gave us 2 free bottles of water upon check in.  The beds were comfortable, and the room was very spacious.  I loved the shower which had great water pressure, always a plus after a long day walking through the park.   They do charge $10 a day for parking, but that's pretty standard around the area.  They offer a $5 per person shuttle to disneyland, but we found that it's just as easy, and quick to walk there from the hotel.    The hotel also boasts a great splash area for kids, and an awesome outdoor heated pool and hot tub.  The hot tub was much appreciated for

Very helpful staff, stayed there on business but most residents were there for Disney park resorts.Shuttles to all parks leave from the front door so really easy access.Staff always friendly and restaurant on site is okay

It's very comfortable and the staff are helpful. While it is a little further away from the parks the shuttle bus is very convenient and runs about every 15-20 minutes all day and is pretty cheap for a 3 day ticket.

We booked two nights based on the price and location. Rooms were as pictured, facilities also the same. The restaurant served a variety of foods however it was a little overpriced and there was a range of restaurants two blocks around the corner.  Customer sevice was poor. There was a mix up with room keys on the first night and then issues with charging on check out. It all came down to communication and lack of explaining correct payment processes at check in time. This was a little disappointing. All other experiences on our trip have been fantastic.  Simple hotel and reasonably priced, close to the park with easy access via buses.
Manager Response: Dear Angel25081985,  We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to hear you liked our location. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. It is regrettable we fell short of your expectations on some aspects of your stay. Please do accept our apologies for not being able to deliver an exemplary service. Thank you for bringing these to our attention. We will address these with the proper department to improve the quality and service that we offer to our guests.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that we can better serve you next time.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The staff here were fantastic! Helpful, friendly and very accommodating. We were visiting Disneyland during the New Year period and stayed here for 4 nights as part of a package booked through WestJet. We have stayed at many other locations in the Anaheim area before and can honestly say that this was probably the best yet. A 5 minute shuttle bus ride away from the park with a pool and hot tub (due to the weather we did not use either of these!) that looked great. The free Wi-Fi was much appreciated. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Convenient for Disneyland visit, average hotel
Summary: My family and I recently spent six nights here on a Disney trip. Everything was fine.  Pros: The room was clean and comfortable. It was quiet, despite being close to the freeway. The customer service was pleasant. And the ART bus to Disneyland was very convenient.  Cons: The wireless internet was slow. We weren't impressed with the restaurant onsite - the one buffet breakfast we had there was overpriced, even with the kids eating for free. The service in the restaurant was also slow. We actually had less-expensive, better-quality breakfasts at the parks.   Overall, the hotel met our needs, and we were happy with our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Ivanna S,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business with us. We always strive to provide great service to all of our guests, and it is nice to read that you were happy with your stay and your needs was met particularly with the shuttle service provided. However, it is regrettable if the dining experience did not live up your expectations. We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention.  Thank you for staying with us and hope you will continue to choose IHG for your future travel needs.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I am a Platinum IHG rewards member so stay at a lot of hotels domestically and internationally and have stayed at this hotel four times with my family all in the kids suit room and recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues numerous times due to price and proximity to Disneyland.  I requested an early check in weeks prior to the trip as we had had issues checking in previously at this hotel, the round trip from leaving my house to arriving at the Hotel is around 20 hours, so my family is warn out and needs to sleep basically the first day to recover.  I arrived and was told they could not do an early check in which was frustrating but understandable and was told come back at twelve and the room will be ready by Lewis.  We arrived around 9.30am , we caught a cab to a
Manager Response: Dear Shane R, I am sorry this was your experience this time around.  Since you have been with us before and recommended us before, I hope you can understand that this is not the standard of service we want to impose on our guests, especially on our loyal Platinum Members.  We have already addressed this issue with the team member you mentioned so he is given the opportunity to improve.  Thank you for your valuable feedback and I do hope you give us another chance to re-redeem your loyalty.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Met All of My Needs, but Nothing Outstanding
Summary: I needed a comfortable, inexpensive hotel, near my company's location in Orange & this fit the bill perfectly.  They are undergoing renovations, so I expect that the physical plant will be far better in a couple of months.  I was a little bit disappointed by the breakfast setup.  It wasn't poor by any stretch of the imagination, but it was overly expensive for what you get.  I found that the Del Taco around the corner offers a much better offering for the value-conscious consumer. I will likely stay here again, given the price & location.  The amenities are good enough for most travelers & the quality of the mattress was outstanding.
Manager Response: Dear HstnTrvlr,  Thank you for leaving a review, highlighting not only the bad but also the good points of your stay. We are happy to know that our location suited your needs and the mattress was to your liking. It is our goal to consistently provide superior service and accommodations at our hotel and your comments are very important to us. We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. We have taken note of your valuable comments regarding the breakfast and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of product and services we offer to our guests.      Thank you for staying with us, and we hope that you would consider us again on your next travel.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: If I could give it a 2.5 out of 5 I would.
Summary: When we arrived, our shuttle driver said "I have never heard a bad thing about this hotel."  Well after hearing that, I had certain expectations.    The front staff were courteous enough: they were cheerful and checked us in in a timely manner.  When we got to our room, upon entering, the entry hit the bathroom door.  The room had an odd configuration: one had to close the bathroom door completely or risk banging into it every time you entered the room.  Shortly after we checked in, we noticed that the bathroom drain was clogged and drained very slowly.  We called maintenance and were told it would be corrected shortly.  It was - no complaint there.  I went to wash my hands and noticed that the water was not very hot.  I noted that some plumbing had been done earlier that day
Manager Response: Dear lilo33, we did have a problem with the hot water and found the problem in one of our boilers.  It has been fixed.  I can assure you that this is not a regular occurrence for our hotel and the problem has been rectified.   Thank you for your valuable feedback.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: decent hotel relatively close to Disneyland.
Summary: the hotel was well kept and clean. have been to holiday inns in the past that had very soft nice plush beds but this one was just alright, not great. the staff didn't seem very happy to be there honestly. trip advisor said free breakfast included which was not true at all...hotel staff seemed to know several websites list that breakfast is included but it is not. if that is the case it would be nice if the hotel contacts the website to fix it. the hotel is a couple minutes from disneyland if you drive....probably a 30min walk of you decide to do so. there is a shuttle from the hotel at a cost to you. but still cheaper than Disneyland parking.

Friendly Staff and nice curb appeal but not worth the money because rooms are out dated. In the bathroom the shower floor was painted and the paint was peeking out and was dirty. The bathtub had a large chip in it. In the room near the bed on the wall there was large black stain where the wallpaper seams met. This not the standard I expected at the Holiday Inn Resort, it was a big let down. We are checking out tomorrow and finding another hotel with better standards.
Manager Response: Dear Phoenix756, I am sorry that we were not able to meet your standards as  a Holiday Inn.  We are anxiously anticipating a full hotel renovation starting right around the corner on January 19!  This will include a full remodel of our restaurant, public areas and all guest rooms!   I would encourage you to give us another try after the renovation.  I'm sure you will not be disappointed.    Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice comfortable hotel - within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The rooms were large and comfortable. Although there is transport from the hotel to Disneyland, we enjoyed the 1/2 walk to the parks. Near the hotel there are a couple of little stores for breakfast and meals. Better restaurants were located closer to the parks. We would definately return to this hotel.

Found this hotel after negative experiences at 2 other hotels in same night.  Room was clean and did not have a stale odor like previous places. Staff at desk was very courteous and polite. Received directions to room, information on hotel and offered assistance with anything else we might need.  Slept good in clean bed. Recommend hotel for couples or families.  Room had typical wear in bathroom but nothing that was unacceptable.

My girlfriend and I frequent Disneyland and have stayed at many of the hotels in the area, on our last stay I let her pick and we ended up at the Holiday Inn....she no longer gets to pick hotels...we booked after comparing rates of the nearby hotels it was roughly 10$ cheaper than our usual (another chain that starts with H and is close to the convention center). The standard room at the Holliday in consists of two full size beds.... we booked a room that had a king because of it. When we arrived we asked for an early check in and they said they would be happy to accommodate us. They did so by putting us in a standard room, even when we said we could wait for a king they were suddenly sold out.......Now for the room, the room itself was acceptable but just barely. The mini
Manager Response: Dear Sean E, thank you for staying with us and your valuable feedback.  I am glad to see that we were able to accommodate you with an early check in, even though the King room was not available at that time.  In regards to the condition of the rooms, we are aware of the need for a renovation.  Our lobby was just completed last week.  If everything goes according to plan the restaurant will start in January and the rooms start in June.  I do hope you give us another chance once complete.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: With Renovation going on, maybe a discount should have been offered.
Summary: The staff was very friendly and helpful and the sleep quality was great. I have not slept better in years.  Even though I arrived prior to 7 am, after traveling all night, I was allowed to check in, so I was able to make an 8 AM meeting.  This hotel must be kid friendly, as there were a lot of small children running around, all over the place, so if you have a young family, this is a good place to stay.  The hotel was in the process of going through a renovation, but it was still quiet and they provided use of the business center at the sister hotel next door.  Even though this hotel is about a 5 minute drive from Disneyland, there is a bus to Disneyland that stops at the hotel often and you can buy an unlimited day pass for $5.00  There is a huge variety of places to eat,
Manager Response: Dear coachpate,  Your taking some time out of your busy day and your continuous patronage to our brand and hotel is much appreciated. I am elated to see your generous five star rating for the quality of sleep you have had during your stay.  To see and read kind words from our valued guests is always uplifting and a boost for us to further our efforts in attaining and even surpassing our goal of guaranteeing 100% guest satisfaction.  We value all guest comments, may it be negative or positive, as they enable us to further improve our services and to surpass the very high standards our guests expect.  Thank you for your kind regards and we are definitely looking forward to serving you again.   Sincerely,  Glenn M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I was really concerned when reading reviews after I had already booked this hotel. Luckily, I was pleasantly surprised. They are definitely in the middle of a remodel, so the walls in the lobby were stripped, lobby furniture shabby, gift shop closed, etc. but this didn't bother us too much, especially because we got a GREAT rate. Our room was clean and comfortable, though lacking in wall outlets. We had to unplug the alarm clock and some lamps to plug in our devices. Hopefully our room wasn't already updated and this is fixed in the remodel. No tub in our room, which was fine for us but maybe a problem for families with kids.  The hot tub and pool were great. We actually watched the fireworks at Disney from the pool our first night! The ART shuttle drop off at Disney was

I am in my 4th out 5th night here if I hadn't pre paid for all 5 nights I would of left day 1. The bathrooms need attention big time   The tub was painted. And not good at all. See pics. There is blood or something on the walls and the handle broke so we had to jimmy it to get out  talk about stuck in hell. Wall paper is falling off and it seams they have water issues. The gym flooded yesterday and they just throw up fans for a few hours.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay here with us.  I apologize you did not find the room to your liking.  The tubs will be replaced in an upcoming renovation but there is no excuse for spots on the wall.  I will be speaking with our housekeeping team regarding the cleanliness issues you mentioned.  As for the fitness center, yes, there was a leak in the room above it.  We found the guest had allowed a large amount of water to escape on the floor while they were showering.  Once we discovered the source of the problem we put buckets to catch the remaining water and placed industrial fans in the room to help dry the carpet.  Once the carpet is dry a carpet shampoo will be done.  We have a lot of improvements in the pipeline for 2015 and we hope you can give us another opportunity to serve you in the future!

Summary: The pool open until 11pm definitely good after a day at Disneyland. Only half hour walk to Disneyland but taking bus a good option. Buffet breakfast available on weekends but they don't like to let you know that. Service in restaurant good but limited if dining regularly there. They do takeaway so you can have it in your room, but once again they don't tell you that. Friendly staff, clean and tidy rooms and self serve laundry facilities.

Helpful and welcoming staff kinda make up for an out of the way location. Not really central to much in Anaheim, so if you have a car you will be ok, other than that you will be at the mercy of the shuttle bus.  An older establishment going under renovation during my stay. Rooms were of good size and were always cleaned to high standards every day.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review our property.  It's great to hear that you loved the staff!  As you noted the hotel is completing renovations as time goes by.  A full lobby, restaurant and guest room renovation is planned sometime next year.  In the meantime we are taking care of smaller things like pool furniture and hallway carpet.  We hope you get the chance to stay with us in the future so you can see all of the improvements!

Summary: The staff were friendly and very help full with the Disney tickets, gave us  the tips to getting the best value and the best days to go the Disneyland. Location of the hotel was OK, shuttle service only 2 buses call into the hotel: Disney express and the other was for the Sana Shopping center. Taxis were the only other way to get around. Restaurant was good service was fine except in the morning at breakfast lots of people trying to get breakfast before heading out to Disneyland very slow service. Hotel was a little bit too far out from the main part of downtown Anaheim, there no other restaurants close to the hotel. Restaurant was only open for Breakfast and Dinner.
Manager Response: Dear Peter L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I am pleased to know that you had a satisfactory stay at our hotel and are delighted to hear that you found our staff friendly and helpful. I appreciate feedback that we receive, whether positive and negative to ensure we provide the best level of service and facilities that we can give to our guests. Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This place wasn't on the top of my list, but the price is the reason I booked it. I've never really had a bad experience with holiday inn, but this place other then locations and price is the only two things it has going for it. It had old dirty rooms. The bath tubs were gross. Never will I be cheap again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  We have already begun making improvements to the hotel.  We just replaced the hallway carpet throughout the hotel and received all new pool furniture.  In the near future we are planning a full renovation of the lobby and guest rooms.  We hope you get another opportunity to stay with us again so you can see first hand the result of all of the hard work and effort we put back in to the hotel.

Summary: Awsome experience tripple thumbs up. They upgraded our room even though our travel agent made a mistake. The restaurant opened late one night just for us, now that's great service. It was not all perfect but the staff solved any problems and were very friendly. Pool and Spa were great along with kids play room. Nothing better than a spa after a long day at Disney.

Summary Heading: Holiday Inn on Manchester Ave in Anaheim California
Summary: The hotel is close to Disneyland and other attractions. Shuttle service anywhere you need to go. Staff are super friendly and choice of room. We stayed in a family room 2 queens and bunkbeds. The kids loved it cause they also had an xbox and games to use at no additional cost. It was really a fun trip and all were happy we stayed there. Kids eat free with at lest 1 paying adult.  They have a restaurant on site with a bar, they could use a few more waiters and bring back the soups they no longer serve.   Still a good place to stay...

We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Disney Land on a 2day hopper pass. Rooms were ok not very clean though I had a few things in the room which I wont mention that should have been cleaned properly. Lets just say I was glad it was only 2 nights and I was glad that we didn't spend majority of our time in the room, laundry room if that is what you can call it needed to definitely be cleaned and fitted with up to date working equipment. Other facilities - pool, restaurant were good, cheap accommodation but you get what you pay for and I would try somewhere else if I was ever in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review our property.  I am very sorry the room was not cleaned properly.  We pride ourselves on providing top notch customer service as well as having clean well-appointed rooms and I apologize that we failed in the latter.  We continue to improve our property and have a number of projects in the pipeline.  I hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Staff! Cleanliness of rooms not so good.
Summary: The check in was amazing! Desk staff were very helpful and friendly. room service staff was excellent and prompt. Food was palatable; nothing to write home about. Room service was a bit expensive, i wouldn't get it again.  The hotel property is obviously an older one - very little plugs in the room, when you have laptop and phone, etc...  lighting is barely adequate. Worst part was I found many hairs left over from the previous stay.  These were definitely not mine!  Both on the walls of the shower, on the floor in the bathroom, and on one of the two beds in the room (I didn't check them both - I really didn't want to know :) Toilet flush stuck, but that's a minor problem. I was going to mention it to staff at checkout, but there were at least 4 desk folks dealing with another
Manager Response: Dear Jack50, as a Holiday Inn, one of our top priorities is customer service, so I am so glad to hear that you were happy with the service our staff provided.  On another note, cleanliness is another one of our priorities.  As such, I have forwarded your comments regarding your room to our Executive Housekeeper so she may address them immediately.  We are anxiously anticipating a full renovation Jan-Aug 2015, so I do hope you give us another chance once complete.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Anaheim area or even the greater LA area.  We had a car and found we could get to most places in an hour and driving in LA was interesting.  Breakfast was great and the pool was a great place to unwind after a busy day in LA.

We enjoyed our stay, they have a bus system that will pick you up every 15 mins to take you to Disney and if you go anywhere else you are close to the grey line shuttles (if you do use their service I hope you get Charles, fantastic knowledgable) hotel had very friendly staff, great pool, neat arcade and a Restaurant. You are a little distance from Disneyland approx 15mins but we didn't mind that at all. The prices are great for this hotel as well.

Although the hotel is in the process of a remodel our room on Floor 6 was very nice.  Clean and well appointed.  The staff was very friendly.  Anaheim has a bus that you can hop on for Disneyland for a modest fee.  The stop is in front of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Good deal, comfortable hotel, not a great location
Summary: We are a family of 4,  and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.   We were surprised at how far it was from Disneyland. (I was under the impression is was walkable)  Checking in was very fast and efficient.  Luggage carts were provided and we wheeled our items in the elevator. There is ample parking, which was nice.  The room was comfortable albeit on the small size.  We could see the fireworks show out the window, which was nice.  We ended up buying a 3 day bus pass and took the Anaheim Transit back and forth to Disney.  This was very easy and efficient..  There is only 1 stop on the way, and no one was every there.  It is necessary to either get a bus pass or have a car. We didn't want to drive to Disney, so we took the bus.  This hotel is somewhat isolated so there are no nearby

Summary Heading: No concierge but great front desk!
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights in mid September 2014, in middle of their heat wave (38 degrees Celcius +). Caught Disneyland express from and back to LAX, no hassles, drop off at hotel door. Andrea at front desk was fantastic, assisting me with discount for bus trip to Universal Studios. Friendly and helpful staff (housekeeping, front desk, pool staff to replace towels). Clean and comfortably-sized rooms. We could see Disneyland fireworks from our 5th floor room (overlooking pool). Handy having ART bus in hotel car park! (For those with no rental car). Only suggestion would be to have dark curtains to darken room (only had sheer curtains).

Summary Heading: A Great Family Hotel - A Bit Isolated Though
Summary: We stayed here as a family (2 Adults and 2 kids, 11 and 3 years) for 3 nights while visiting Disney and other attractions around LA. There is a lot to like about this hotel.  The staff are very friendly, efficient and polite.  Our room, a Themed Kids Suite, complete with a kids area comprising a bunk bed, TV, twin desk and an Xbox 360 was great for the two boys who wanted to spend more time in the room than they were allowed to. The rooms are comfortable and come with free Wi-Fi a coffee maker, fridge and microwave (see photos).  The rooms were a little bit dated but this was not an issue for us. We had dinner at the American Brasserie Restaurant and Bar located on the ground floor of the hotel on all three nights after returning from a long day out.  The meals were good and

Stayed here for 5 nights in one of the family rooms with the kids.  Staff were very helpful, and the room was clean and serviced every day.  We liked the pool and the happy hour every afternoon.  We ate breakfast in the restaurant, and it was fine with buffets only in the weekends at this time of the year.  All good, would stay there again

Stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim in September for a few nights and found it very good despite some of the less than favorable reviews I had seen.  The hotel is in very good condition and the room was very nice.  We booked a one bedroom suite and enjoyed the additional space.  The room had only a shower (no tub) but that was not a concern.  Living area was adequate and comfortable and nice to relax in.  Restaurant on the property is very good with good food and exceptional staff.  The front desk staff were very helpful and accommodating at all times.  The location is good with great access from the hiway, and about 35 minutes to LAX.  Stayed here a few years ago and will stay again in the future.

We stayed 4 nights with our kids and couldn't be happier.  Rooms were clean and comfortable (will benefit from the upcoming renovation, but fine), included a mini fridge and microwave.  We booked on getawaytoday.com and got a great rate that included a hot full breakfast every morning.  The restaurant staff were fabulous and took great care of us each day.  Had dinner there one night and loved their 1/2 price appetizers during happy hour and the kids ate free.  We opted to take the ART shuttle to the parks instead of parking there and it was really convenient.  The pool area was very nice too. We'd definitely go back!

I stayed here for 2 nights and I only have one complaint. The staff go above and beyond for their guests. The rooms were very clean. Its super close to the Outlets at Orange. My one complaint is the pool noise. My room faced the pool and it didn't close until 11:00 and there are children screaming and loud music playing.

As my title reads, my once in a lifetime holiday to LA with my children as a single mum was disappointing because of our stay at this hotel.  It began the minute we checked in, tired and utterly exhausted from our flight from Australia arriving at 8am we were told to go away for the day & come back at 3pm. When asked where we should go for the day, we were handed a map. We asked where a certain shopping centre was and was informed it was a ten minute walk. Not knowing the area we jumped in a taxi & requested to go to the said shopping centre…40 mins & $100 later we arrived ! Therefore our shopping trip cost us $200 in taxis to return to our hotel. Great first day! When we returned to the hotel the staff and manager could offer no compensation or apology for the misinformation
Manager Response: Dear Keen4travel2014, I am so sorry that this was your experience at our hotel!  I will be sure to address all of your concerns with the appropriate managers right away.  As a hotel so close to Disneyland and the Convention Center, we experience tens of thousands of international guests coming in and out of our hotel.  We understand that flights come in at various times of the day and we do our best to accommodate early check ins.  I apologize that we were not able to accommodate an early check in for you this time.  In regards to the overall condition of the facilities, we are anticipating a renovation to start some time in November.  I know this does not change your recent experience, but I do hope you give us another chance on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Old Hotel but close to Disney
Summary: The hotel is quite old and the beds are not that comfortable.  There is wallpaper stapled to the wall in the ballroom and the toilet handle looks like it will fall off any minute. There is a pool with bar service though and the shuttle to Disney is right there.  It is about a 10 minute ride to the parks.  If you get a good price it would be okay but don't expect too much
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us!  I'm very sorry that you found the hotel "old" and that the beds were uncomfortable.  Both of these issues will be resolved in a pending renovation which will take place sometime in the next 6 months.  We hope that you will have an opportunity to see all of the hard work we put in to making this one of the best hotels in Anaheim!

Summary: We stayed here last weekend and it was a great experience. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, the bathroom was big and the staff were friendly. It's not that close to Disneyland but there are shuttles that pick up from the hotel every 20 minutes for $5 per person. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, staff were great and room was large and very comfortable
Summary: Stayed for two nights while visiting Disneyland. Absolutely great hotel we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Close to everything you need. Pool was great and all amenities fantastic. Would definitely stay there again. It was my  second visit to this hotel.

although a slightly outdated hotel... it still exceeded standards and catered for a great stay in a peaceful layed back hotel that was in good location for an array of places such as visiting L.A and Miami. the fresh water and coffee dispenser in the lobby was by far my highlight. the room was large and spacious, very comfortable bed and big tv.. as well as comfortable lounging chairs - loved the bath and body little miniature shampoo and conditioners that we had refreshed everyday. breakfast was in a small room yet offered a very good choice range for what if was. staff were lovely and friendly and facilities were to standards. one thing I will not miss is that elevator!

Summary Heading: Great Staff and a good stay
Summary: We were a bit worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews however we were pleasantly surprised . Our room was clean and comfortable  the staff were all very  helpful and friendly . We had 2 miner maintenance issues and both were fixed with in 5 minuets of reporting the problem. The pool and spa are kept very clean and we have used these frequently. Keep up the great work team - this hotel couldn't be friendlier . I can definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great place to stay with easy access to Disney parks , the Garden walk shops ,  the outlet mall , and Angel Stadium . We will stay here again

I took a chance on this hotel considering the reviews and I do wish that I booked something closer to the Disneyworld park. Even though their is a bus available it can be a good 20 minute wait and it does get pricey per day for a family of 5. Walking distance approx. 20 minutes or more depending on how fast you walk. I was in one of the rooms with the bunks / family room that holds 5 (Sorry can not remember actual room name). Hotel is clean / staff friendly but the room had a big generator next to it and I don't think we had any sleep. If I new this was the case with this room I would have requested change but limited when their is 5 of us. My youngest also complained that his bed was really uncomfortable. So for the money I paid I guess it was ok as long as you are happy
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  I am not sure how many days you stayed with us but I would like to point out there are multi-day bus passes available at a discount.  At the moment a one day pass is $5 but if you are going three consecutive days you can purchase a three day pass for $12 (savings of $1 per day).  I believe you stayed in one of our Kids Fun Rooms.  In the next six months we are planning a full renovation and will most likely do away with the bunk beds in favor or a larger suite with two double beds that connects to a second room with a King bed.  I'm sorry you did not like the location of your room.  In the future please don't hesitate to inquire about moving to a different room if you are unhappy.  Our goal is to exceed all of the expectations of our guests and if there is anything you are unhappy about please bring it to our attention so we can make it right.   Thanks again for staying with us!

Summary Heading: A little farther away but a quality hotel at a fair price
Summary: We stayed four nights at this hotel while visiting Knott's and the Disney parks. While the hotel was a little out of the way, the ART buses are a convenient, easy way to get to the Disney parks. Right across the street is a Grayline Charter Bus operation that we took to Knott's. I was not impressed with the restaurant on site and there really wasn't much else within a half mile of the hotel so that was a negative but the hotel itself was great. Rooms were clean and quiet. The bathroom was quite large. It had a nice pool and hot tub area and a game room. The staff was probably where this hotel excels, however. I had to ask for new bedding one night after spilling water on the bed and we also needed more towels another time and both times they were delivered within minutes. They

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff - Home away from home !
Summary: The staff at this hotel have all be so very helpful and friendly, I cannot praise them more ! We are in the middle of a 14 night stay here, and have been made to feel really at home.  Yes the hotel is in the middle of having renovations done (a huge job !) and our room is a little tired, but it's clean and comfortable.  Having worked in the hotel industry myself, the first thing I did was strip the bed !!  And they came up trumps - not a mark on the mattress and lovely clean pillows - well done guys!  We also had a couple of minor maintenance issues, and in both cases the maintenance man was knocking on our door within 5 mins! As a smoker, the only let down for me has been the designated smoking area - which is a 2 seat wooden bench near the front of the hotel, and often sees a

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but other than average.
Summary: We stayed here for a few nights in order to go to Disneyland. The staff were very friendly and everything was pretty clean. It was your average hotel, nothing too exciting to report. There is a bus at the hotel that takes you to Disneyland, but you have to pay and often you have to wait a few buses before you can get on because it picks up people from multiple hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Luckycharmchick,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. It is good to know that the service received from our hotel staff was at par with expectations and you found our property to be generally clean. It is always hugely motivating for us to receive commendable feedback from our valued guests like you.  I hope you see us soon should your travels bring you back to the area!  Regards,  Pam G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: My friend and I chose this hotel for our trip with our teen daughters.  After reading the reviews and finding a fair rate, we decided to book the Holiday Inn.  We weren't looking for anything fancy just a clean place to get a good nights sleep to prepare for our daytime adventures.  Check-in gave us our first problem because when I booked through my Expedia account it used my husbands name on the reservation instead of mine.  Because he wasn't with us, I was unable to check-in until Expedia added my name to the reservation because of their hotel policy.  Not really complaining about their policy but mention this to help others plan their trip because it was a major hassle with several calls to Expedia to finally get this resolved and finally checked in.  Then upon entering the
Manager Response: Dear Rani S,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay. We deeply regret to see the malfunctioning air conditioning prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel. We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. We have shared your comments with the staff and we’re confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Thank you again for your comments, we hope to have the pleasure of serving you again soon.  Sincerely,  Adrian D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I can't believe this place has received so many bad reviews.  I thought this place was great. We were upgraded to a suite room upon arrival as were honeymooners, the staff were fantastic!!  The room consisted of it's own lounge room and separate bedroom fitted with a queen bed and French provincial bathroom.The room is certainly to my liking.    There is a shuttle bus that picks you up and takes you to Disneyland from the front carpark of the hotel, however we walked to Disneyland it was only about a 15 min walk and we felt very safe.  The restaurant was nice, equipped with all the Americian food favourites. The brownie dessert is to die for!!   I would definitely stay here again

We stayed a week. Close to Disneyland by bus. Very convenient. We saw the fireworks every night from our room.Hotel was old and carpets were dirty. Bathroom needs updating. Toilets and bathtubs were gross. First night the bathtub did not drain so we had to take a shower with a tub full of water. There were four of us and they would only leave 3 towels. I called the front desk to let them know and every day they would only bring 3 towels. On our last day we returned to our room at 5 pm and our room was not cleaned at all. We had to call front desk for towels and supplies.   TV did not work well it would just turn off. My kids would not go to arcade as it was dirty. Staff was nice but  appears to be under staff. When We called front desk it would take multiple tries as no one
Manager Response: Dear douglas w, thank you for staying with us for your Disneyland vacation.  I'm glad that you found our location and the shuttle convenient for you and your family.  I apologize that other facets of the hotel did not meet your expectations.  Many of the condition items you mentioned will be addressed with our upcoming renovation. The carpets and the bathrooms will be included with the remodel.  For a while, we were understaffed as you mentioned.  We have recently hired 4 additional team members at the front desk.  This unexpected turnover happened during our peak season and I apologize that you were affected by this.  I do hope you still decide to stay with us on your Disneyland vacation!  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely stay here while visiting Disneyland
Summary: This was a really nice hotel we stayed in while visiting Disneyland. Good sized rooms with comfortable beds, internet access and a nice restaurant with nice meals. Is a nice hotel for a short stay if you are wanting to be within the Disneyland area. It was only a short bus ride away to the park, we were picked up and dropped off at our hotel door. Would stay here again if going back to Disneyland again.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite.  The kids room was Toy Story themed with 2 queen beds & our bedroom was Cars themed with a king bed. There is a family room with a flat screen tv & a simple kitchenette separating the 2 bedrooms.  The hotel needs some updating, but our spacious family suite was clean & only about a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland or California Adventure.  We enjoyed our stay in Anaheim.

We stayed her with me, my husband and two boys (6 and 8) this weekend. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms and pool area were clean. Gift shop had very reasonable prices.  The breakfast was free and even though it wasn't the best it was definitely edible and super convenient. The shuttle to Disneyland runs every 20 minutes and is $5/day for adults and $2/day for children. Only about a five minute ride and not having to fight the traffic was priceless.  I booked this hotel with Disneyland tickets through Get Away Today and was worried that it wouldn't be very nice due to the low prices but it was great and we're planning to stay here for all of our Disneyland Vacations!

Brought my daughter down for 5 nights. Got to room, it was not clean. The bathtub was absolutely disgusting, we had to wear aqua shoes in the shower in fear of mould. Staff were very nice and helpful, and was convenient to Disney, but the restaurant and lounge were closed after breakfast until dinner. The pool bar didn't open until later, had to order pizza in to get some lunch. Room was never cleaned well, and the cleaners ate all of our granola bars! Should have locked those in the safe as well apparently.   Again, staff was great, but the management is suffering. Would have been happy to share granola bars, if only we were asked.   Was very disappointing as this was our first trip to Disney and the accommodations were less than desirable.
Manager Response: Dear Sue G, I apologize that our hotel did not meet your standards. Unless you have a "do not disturb" sign on your door, your room should have been cleaned.  Furthermore, our staff knows better than to eat our guests food.   I have brought these concerns to the attention of the Executive Housekeeper to ensure the issues are addressed immediately.  Thank you for your valuable feedback.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary: stayed here just 3 days and it was the worse. checked in late and was about to watch tv but it wasn't working so called front desk. the guy said he'll be sending someone right up to look at it minute later the security came to checked on it he probably stayed for a minute told us he can't fix it and we have to wait since theres no maintenance this late and we were fine with that. next day comes we left our do not disturb sign and housekeeping read it perfectly since they didn't come in but maintenance I guess couldn't read and just helped himself in. so don't even bother with the do not disturb sign cause they'll just ignore it.   stayed on the ninth floor their hallways are under renovation they have signs saying they'll be working on the floor but there were no signs that the
Manager Response: Hi cassanndra, I am very sorry that we were not able to meet your standards during this stay.Yes, our hotel is currently undergoing renovation and I apologize for that inconvenience.  I do hope you give us another chance on your future visit to the area.  Our hotel will be brand new and the construction is challenge we are facing to make us better.  I have addressed your concerns regarding the do not disturb sign with the appropriate staff to ensure this does not happen in the future.  Thank you for your valuable feedback.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Still as good as I remember back in 2010....
Summary: My second stay here. The hotel room is big enough for 4 persons. The room was spacious, plenty of towels and extremely clean. Location close to Disney, highway to airport and San Diego. Fantastic location overall, friendly staff and great food in restaurant.

We got a great rate, clean room, comfortable beds, and enjoyed the pool. This hotel is a super quick ride away from disneyland. It was wonderful stating so close. We liked the staff and our experience as a whole.  We be back next year when we visit d-land.

Well I had read the reviews 6 months before we arrived..  Some of the reviews were right, with the place needing a freshen up..... But however that's where the negatives comments end.....  The staff are so sweet, and the rooms are great...clean and icy cold air conditioning.  The shuttles do run every 20 mins and at $5 a day and $2 for kids,it's so much cheaper than cabbing in to Disneyland...$2 dollars will do your washing a laundry on the 9 th floor which was for a family of 3 for around 4 days of dirty laundry...  The pools not bad and quiet.....shops are only a 10 min walk...  Great place and again staff are what makes this place....  Well done Holiday inn!  Happy family

My husband and I took our boys ages 14 and 8 to Disneyland and this was very close. We drove our vehicle to the park and it didn't take long at all. We stayed for 2 nights. The room was nice and clean. At night we had an excellent view of the Disneyland fireworks show which was a treat since we loved it in the park, so seeing it the second night was nice. The only thing I didn't like was that our toilet was clogged. My 8 year old went #2 and the toilet wouldn't flush. My husband messed with it and got it to flush very SLOW! I called the front desk and it was fixed by the time we got back to the room. Another thing that bothered me was that we had spent the whole day and night at Disneyland and didn't get to the room until about 2am...I placed the "shhhhh" sign on our door and

Summary Heading: Not a hotel I would recommend to my friends or family.
Summary: I took my girls on a vacation toDisneyland and many other great excursions . I had so many problems with the hotel starting from the cleaning staff leaving my door open all day, we didn't get back to our room until really late and when we got back our door was open. We had previously complained about it and they said they would fix it and they never did! Also the rooms were not fleeced very well, we had our garbage just sitting in he garbage bag beside our suitcase and the cleaning staff left their dirty glove on our chair on top of some cloths. Another thing was our tub plugged and we called he from desk, they said they would send someone up to fix it right away. Well no one came at all so we went to bed, it was 11pm then we hear a knock on the door at 11:30 I couldn't believe
Manager Response: I am very sorry that your door was left open after returning from the park.  We take safety and security very seriously and I am very concerned that an employee may have left the door open when servicing the room.  If you have a moment I would love to speak with you about the incident so I can look into it further.  You can contact me at the hotel directly at 714-489-4004.  I would also like to apologize for the service provided by the housekeeping staff.  Again, if you have a moment I would like to get more information.  We appreciate your feedback as it is a valuable tool in raising the level of service we provide.  I will share your review with our management staff so we can learn from it and prevent it from happening in the future.  I hope that you and your family will give us another opportunity so serve you in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for one night as it was close to Disneyland - as we had travelled from Palm Springs we decided to check-in on our way to Disney to save the hassle later in the evening.  As it was only 10:30 when we arrived, we were told that the rooms weren't available which we completely understood, although room numbers were allocated so all we had to do was collect keys after our day out.
