Some of our party were sidelined by a couple offering them free lunch and $100 to spend in Disneyland - I didn't listen but guessed it was about buying a timeshare as other reviewers have confirmed.  This is the last thing you need when you're checking into a hotel and have limited time - get rid of them!  The shuttle bus arrived shortly after we got to the stop outside the hotel (tickets
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review our property. The timeshare booth you mentioned is no longer at the hotel.  We ended the relationship with them the first week of July based on the feedback provided by our guests.  I apologize that the rooms allocated to you had to be changed.  The summer season is our busiest of the year and while we try our best to accommodate all of the requests made by our guests it is not always possible.  As we all know, technology isn't always perfect but if we experience a "glitch" we try our best to make things right.  I'm sorry we weren't able to get all three of your rooms close together.  I will be speaking with our Executive Housekeeper regarding the water bottles that were found in the room.  There is no excuse for a guest finding items left behind from the previous guest.  I sincerely apologize the room was not cleaned to our company standards.  I believe I spoke to you regarding the pillows.  I have already spoken to our entire management team regarding how to handle such a situation if it comes up again in the future.  I emphatically explained we are never to charge a guest's credit card without their prior consent.  I am very sorry that your card was charged, I understand how frustrating this must have been.  We are planning a number of improvements over the next 6 months to a year.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you in the future!

Summary: Room very small, difficult to accommodate the three of us with suitcases. A lot of door ways at the entrance to the room - bathroom, adjoining room if being used, and storage cupboard.  Too much corridor and elevator noise. Did not realise no room service between 11am and 5pm and no where in easy walking distance for food - not convenient when travelling with kids. A lot of room for improvement with cleanliness such as bins by shuttle bus and laundromat - mostly overflowing during our stay and I did advise to staff on checkout.
Manager Response: Dear DebR402, I'm sorry that you did not have a great stay.  We do have different room types and room layouts available, including some suites that may better suite your party. I do hope you try our other options the next time you are in the area.  You are correct, due to a very low demand for lunch (many people are at Disneyland at this time), our restaurant is closed. However, the front desk is equipped with many restaurant options that deliver to the hotel.  The issue with the trash bins and laundry room has already been addressed with our housekeeping department and they are now cleaning those areas multiple times per day.  Again, thank you for your feedback and I do hope you give us another chance.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary: There must be better options than this for a family holiday to Disney. Front desk staff were overworked and under-skilled to handle the rush of 3pm check-in. Overall the hotel feels tired and grubby & neglected and in need of a good clean. Everywhere feels grubby and damp. Special mention of the laundry room that was disgusting. Its not far from Disney but bank on $5 per day for the shuttle bus. You really need to get rid of the hard-sell timeshare crew in the lobby. Last thing a tired traveller needs. Rooms not too bad. Food and drink not too bad, but the dining room/bar is a depressing horror. Best feature , its relatively cheap but otherwise nothing to recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Keith S, we are aware of all issues you have brought up and are addressing them.  Unfortunately, we've recently had an overwhelming and unexpected turnover of staff at the front desk and most of them are new.  Our Guest Svc Mgr is working very hard to get them up to speed.  The "tired and grubby" feel to our hotel (including the dining room and bar) will be addressed with our much anticipated renovation scheduled to start in just 1.5mos!  The time-share kiosk is already gone, never to return!  Despite your experience this time, I encourage you to come back to give us another try after our renovation!  It will be a brand new hotel!  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location bad rooms and service
Summary: The location is perfect for Disneyland and our daughter's travel softball team. When we checked in a man tried to cut in front of another family in our party. The mom politely said "excuse me we were next" the front deal people were watching all of this happen. The man said "oh you don't have to be rude about it" the mom responded I am sorry if I seemed rude I was just trying to let you know. He than stood back with his two female companions cussing and being rude in front of our three young daughters. He even asked my husband to step outside. I don't blame the hotel staff for the man's actions however I do blame them for not stepping in.  The rooms were fairly clean but the phone cords were severed and there were scratch marks on the walls in the shower. We had prepaid for five
Manager Response: Dear jensplayin22, I'm sorry that your experience was less than perfect with us! I will address these issues with the front desk and maintenance department so we can address it immediately. Thank you for your feedback.  I do hope you give us another chance in the future.  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary: Spent 10 nights here. Found the service was excellent (especially from Jennifer in the bar). Pool area was nice and tidy. Bus to Disneyland every 20 to 30 minutes and close to restaurants at Gardenwalk. Only problem was double bed was more king single bed. Overall very good friendly service in good location.

This was a tidy clean hotel.  Rooms weren't very big but they served their purpose. Quiet location nice pool area. Restaurant in the lobby was very average. Two out of the three things we ordered they were out of, but the obviously dont do too much business there.  Bus ran every 20min -30min to take you directly to Disneyland and was $6 return. The one thing I didn't like was they had a desk down the front that was trying to get you to do a tour of one of their hotels for time share purpose.  They offered you free lunch, coupons to spend in Disneyland etc. They start by saying they can help you with your dining, BEWARE!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We recently hired a new food and beverage director and plan to implement a number of changes in the next few months.  Also, we ended the relationship with the time share booth.  While many of our guests found them to be helpful with directions, local knowledge, etc., we also received negative feedback so we decided it was best to end the relationship.  Thanks again for staying with us.  We have a number of improvements planned in the next 6 months so please come back and visit us!

Summary: The service was excellent. There is someone on the front desk right away. The hospitality host greeted the customers right away and directed them to tourist spots with maps. Room service and cleanliness met my standards. I enjoyed my stay and a wonderful time overall.

Spent 4 nights here. Was a neat room although very average. The king size bed was very comfortable. It is fairly we'll cared to Disneyland and a 25 minute drive to citadel outlet shopping. Not enough dining options here. Has a restaurant downstairs but very average. Only ate there once. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Their recommendations were great for eating and shopping. Probably won't stay here again but a decent no frills accommodation no doubt
Manager Response: Dear Anushka G, I'm glad to hear that you had an overall good stay with us!  If you do decide to visit the area again, please keep us in mind because we are anxiously anticipating a complete renovation of the entire hotel.  No doubt we will be more the just the average hotel anymore.  Thanks for the feedback!  Sincerely, Marilyn A, General Manager

Summary Heading: Vanessa at the front desk was rude and condescending!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for our wonderful family trip to Disneyland. Once we left the hotel I realized I had left my extra pair of shoes, by then we were already headed to San Diego for the day. I called the hotel and they informed me I could come pick them up on my way back through Anaheim. Once I stopped to pick them up, they were apparently locked up in lost and found for the night and I wasn't able to get them because there was no manager on duty. I was obviously frustrated because I was headed home 8 hours north that night and now I would have to get my shoes shipped to me for $20! Angela at the front desk was very sweet and kind explaining to me the situation, Vanessa who also works at the front desk was very rude and condescending to me the whole time Angela was talking to
Manager Response: Dear World_traveles, I am so sorry that situation ruined your trip and your opinion of our hotel.  Please know that I am personally taking drastic measures to address this with the staff member mentioned.  This is completely unacceptable.  I hope you do give us another chance on your next visit to the area and not let this one situation/employee discourage you from trying us again.  Sincerely, Marilyn A., General Manager

Summary: our stay here was great! Asked for a room with a view of Disney so we could see the park at night and got what we asked for. very friendly staff. fresh,clean rest room. great beds and pillows!! we would stay again.

We have been staying at a very nice hotel just around the corner from this and decided to give this one a try.  I am extremely happy with this hotel and the staff.  The facility was nice- it is barely dated since it is only about ten years old.  The front desk said they are just about to be renovated coming up pretty soon.  The mattresses were so extremely comfortable....well worth staying there again!  This gets an absolute thumbs up!!

I have no big complaints about the Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area, but it wasn't very impressive, either.  We checked in Friday night and the staff was very friendly and informative. The room: below average furniture and not enough outlets, especially near the bed. I don't think the window had a black-out curtain, either. The bathroom is bigger than average but the tub had some (rust?) stains. A big plus is that there was a fridge and coffee maker in the room.  I wish the restaurant and bar were open later- we were told it closed at 10PM. There's not much within walking distance except maybe a tiny semi-sketch strip mall that includes a convenience store and a taqueria. It's a few minutes drive to Angels Stadium and Disneyland, but I would prefer to stay at a hotel that's more
Manager Response: Dear militia_m, thank you for complimenting our staff's friendliness as it is one of our top priorities at this hotel. As far as the outdated rooms and furniture, you will be happy to know that we are anticipating a full hotel renovation by the end of this year.  We hope to see you on your next visit to the area!  Sincerely, Marilyn A., General Manager

Summary Heading: Thanks to the GM and Ms. Andrea at the reception
Summary: This hotel is one of the best Holiday inn.  Rooms are clean and people are really amazing  The general manager of this hotel is one of a kind, she is greeting people and so friendly offering help to every one   It is better than many 5 stars hotel   All services and amenities are amazing   Room is spacious and very clean   Andrea at the reception is really so helpful

Summary Heading: They take care of their guests when something goes wrong
Summary: We booked this stay for our vacation to Disneyland and after traveling almost 6 hours with kids we were just ready to relax. We got checked into our family suite and all was good right.....guess again. We got up to the rooms and found that only one was cleaned of the two room suite :( Called down to the front desk and the manager apologized and said that he would get us a new room right away and said to hang by the phone and he would call back about 5 mins later there was a knock on the door and he was there in person to deliver the ne room keys that he personally inspected.....WOW FACTOR!!!!!! That was awesome but the service didn't stop there he also gave us a $20 comp for the restaurant downstairs :) The bus downstairs to take you to Disneyland was convenient 20min wait time

Stayed a week while working in La Palma. Decent location, other than that you can only enter from one side of the road so we always had to take a roundabout way through some neighborhoods to get to the parking lot. We had vouchers for breakfast and they let us get any meal we wanted along with coffee and everything was very good. The front desk attendants were also very helpful with any questions we had.

Summary Heading: Clean, good value, restaurant staff ROCKED!
Summary: Very close to Disney with shuttle service.   Front desk staff were great (but LOSE the time share sales pressure or you WILL lose guests!).  The value in the restaurant was great but above all, the restaurant staff deserve full stars!   Super friendly, attentive and thoughtful.

A hotel starts sucking pretty bad when their own staff are trying to sell you timeshares or investment properties or whatever when you go to ask the concierge a question! We just booked this for one night as we were passing through Anaheim and were going to the baseball (Angel stadium is about 1km away). Rooms are standard "motel" style, heaps of free parking is nice, but don't hold me up in the lobby wasting my holiday time trying to sell me stuff. Lame. Its out in the middle of nowhere as well - Heaps of better options in Anaheim (Hotel Menage was great)
Manager Response: Dear 2Adam2,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay. We truly regret to see you did not fully enjoy your time at the hotel. We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. We have shared your comments with the staff and we’re confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Thank you again for your comments, we hope to have the pleasure of serving you again soon.  Sincerely,  Adrian D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: It's a 5 min walk to Downtown Disney.Staff at the hotel was excellent,there is a full buffet for breakfast with everything from cereal to bacon & eggs. The hotel is clean and we will book here if we come to Disney again.

Very clean.  The staff was pleasant.  We had an electrical outlet problem and a service tech came within 10 minutes.  The shuttle bus stop to Disneyland was on the premises making it easy to get to Disneyland.   Overall a good experience and would return if I'm ever in that area again.

This was not where I would have chosen to stay but I'm traveling on business for a conference and they waited til the last minute. That being said it is right across the street from Disney. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room is clean and the bed is very comfortable. The food in the restaurant is good as well. The only minor issue is the bathroom wallpaper needs to be changed. It's peeling in spots.

Summary Heading: Good choice for our Disneyland vacation.
Summary: Hotel is clean and very well maintained.  It is close enough to Disneyland and other Anaheim attractions. The room was clean and very comfortable as was the bathroom.  Staff was pleasant and friendly.  The restaurant had good food and decent service.  We had one morning when we had to wait almost 20 minutes just to have our order taken, but they were very apologetic and gave us free juice.  The fact that kids eat free was a nice plus as well.  The pool and hot tub were nice.  The only negative was the "activity desk" set up in the lobby.  The lady was nice but tricked us into talking with her by offering our 8-year-old daughter Disney Dollars.  We finally found out it was for the World Mark timeshare down the road and we would have to register to sit through a sales pitch at

We had a great time! We had 2 adjoining hotel rooms. It worked absolutely awesome we had so much space. The Kids hotel room was decorated in Disney Characters. The Hotel was clean, the staff was nice and very helpful. The restaurant was okay. The food was good but there was very few choices on the menu. Only complaint was that the pool was cold! So we only swam once the week we were there. Would stay there again for sure.

I stayed here on a trip to California in June 2011.   The rooms were large and with everything you would expect from a Holiday Inn at home (The UK).   The downside to the stay was the shop onsite... poor variety of things to purchase and prices steeper than normal, which you would expect from an onsite shop. However the staff member that worked in the shop (A lady - which I cant remember her name!!). We asked the best way to catch a day trip to laguna beach & Santa Monica Pier/Venice Beach etc. She offered to take us to all these places over a few days for a much more reduced rate and then pick us up again - great service!!   We also booked a few trips using the shuttle service to visit Hollywood (LA). The drivers do expect tips which is customary in the US. We also ate in the

Summary Heading: Great stay for first time in Cali
Summary: This was my family's first trip to California.  We usually travel to Florida because it's closer but this year decided to try something new.  We stayed six nights in one of the kid suites and had a wonderful time. The beds were comfortable and my kids enjoyed that they had the option to either sleep on the bunk beds or the single twin size bed. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and which made our stay enjoyable.  The room was always clean and the microwave and fridge were a nice extra especially after spending all day at the parks.  My only complaint would be the bathroom, the tub and shower could use a upgrade.  We ordered room service a few times and the food was okay.  The ART is a great way to travel back and forth to the parks and not have to worry about driving.

We had a great stay at the Holiday inn. I will admit that the bathrooms could use some upgrades, but for the price we really had no complaints. Bathrooms were clean, beds comfortable and everyone friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. Appreciated the in room fridge and coffee maker for storing drinks and snacks as well. Great view from the fifth floor of the fireworks at Disney, which was great to avoid the late crowds with young children.

Good hotel for the family not wanting to spend outrageous Dinseyland hotel prices!  Overall, a nice place with very friendly staff. Everyone from the front desk staff to the restaurant staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The showers could use a little work as they were a little moldy in spots (rooms 712 and 714 anyway), but the bathrooms were clean and spacious.   The restaurant was your standard run of the mill Holiday Inn restaurant with ok food. Kids eat free, so keep that in mind if you're there with your family and save yourself money. My booking came with free breakfast for the adults as well, and that's a buffet.... Again, not bad and the price was right.  My only negative comment was the noise. You can hear people in the

Nice hotel, we've been here couple of times.  And keeps coming back.  But this recent visit, I wasn't happy with the housekeeping, come back to the hotel after a long day trying to rest, the room is not clean, it happened 3x in 14 days accommodations.   I have to go to the front desk and complaints 2x regarding the housekeeping.  Otherwise we're very happy with the hotel, except the housekeeping.  The food and the service in the hotel are marvellous, always service with a smile.

This property is clean and reasonably priced. Just far enough from the theme park to escape the hustle of it all yet close enough to see the nightly fireworks from your room or the pool. Shuttle service to the happiest place on earth every 20 minutes also a plus.   The restaurant and food a good but the bartender is awesome. Her name is Jennifer and she is friendly ...pours a great drink the "captain smash" is a grrrreat way to end the day. I actually had another bar tender make one for me on her day off and it was not the same. She was the best part of my 10 day stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us!  We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.  Jennifer has been with us a while and we consider her a great asset to the team.  I will definitely share your comments with her.  Thanks again and hope to see you soon!

Summary: On a recent trip to SoCal, I spent two nights at this hotel. It's located close to Disney and and I-5. The rooms were quiet, the beds comfortable, and close to many restaurants, too. It is also not too far from SNA-John Wayne International Airport and convenient to get to. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a pleasant place to stay while in town.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to leave a review.  We appreciate your honest and straightforward feedback.  We are planning a number of improvements before the end of the year so please keep us in mind in the future!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night while we were visiting Disneyland with some friends. The woman working at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.   The room was clean and spacious. We were on the top floor and we could see the Disneyland fireworks from our window. It was a wonderful view and nice to be able to watch them from the comfort of our hotel.   Having a mini fridge and microwave was great!   I feel this hotel was a good value for the price. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Customer Service at hotel from Desk was bad.
Summary: When I called the booking agency to cancel this hotel due to unforeseen circumstances, I was directed to the hotel in Anaheim.  When I called I was transfer by Vanessa at the front desk three time, once to a voicemail, then to an 800 number where they told me that they could not assist me and then to a regional call center where the lady was very nice and told me to call Vanessa back and tell here I need to talk to someone at the hotel and not to transfer me again, because no one else would be able to assist me, except for them.  So I did, Vanessa informed me that she was just told that under no circumstances that she was allowed to cancel this request. I asked to speak with a manager and Vanessa got me a manager by the name of Jeanette who was more worries about getting me off
Manager Response: There are a myriad of ways to book your reservation at our hotel.  We don't discriminate against any of the booking channels.  The cancellation policy through any of the online sites mirrors that of the hotel.  We offer the flexibility of cancelling your reservation 48 hours in advance or you can save money and book a non-refundable reservation.  The cancellation policy is clearly outlined on all of the web sites and must be agreed to in order to process your reservation.  If at any time you feel the cancellation policy is unclear you are more than welcome to phone the hotel and we can explain it in more detail.

Summary: I was at Holiday Inn Anaheim for business. They were over and beyond accommodating to me. They made this stay comfortable, pleasant, and stress free. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel, an would definitely stay here again. The location also was great.

I went to this hotel with my son and his family.  We were able to get connecting rooms which was great for all of us.  They are lots of nice perks with this Hotel, the staff were friendly, the kids ate free at the restaurant, a nice touch. Free Wi-Fi, a refrigerator and micro-wave and coffee pot.  These a just not available at most hotels without additional cost.   Downside was the mattresses!  They need to be replaced! Rooms were cleaned well and service was awesome.  The shuttle to Disneyland was very accessable and reasonable. We tried parking one day but a long way from the resort - just saved time and money to shuttle.   Overall - would stay again for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We recently added microwaves to the rooms and are in the process of replacing all of the mini refrigerators.  As you confirmed, this is a perk we believe our customers appreciate.  I'm sorry the mattress didn't meet your expectations.  We are planning a renovation later in the year that should address any issues such as that.  Again, thank you for your feedback, we hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, nice staff, comfy bed
Summary: Staying at this hotel was a great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool and hot tub were nice.   When we made our reservations online we let them know that we have an infant. Because of this, our hotel room was away from other guests and they provided a microwave. The room was nice and modern enough for me. The curtains do close all the way, the blackout curtains are located BEHIND the sheer curtains. The bathroom was nice and big and clean and had a walk in doorless shower instead of a tub.   The bed was more comfortable than my mattress at home and the pillows were also very comfy.   The only cons I have are the following:  Not within walking distance to Disneyland  No free continental breakfast  Not easy to get a hold of a human after I left some items in

Summary Heading: Not a good place to visit Disneyland
Summary: First off the place is quite far from the park. The shuttle costs $5 per trip day. But it was the horrible service that did it for us. Kids eat free? Not quite. Kids get a yogurt cup or similar cheap "one off" item. And don't dare offer your child an item off your buffet or the buffet Nazi is there in a flash warning you to stop. Obviously they're on commission because the sales pitch to upgrade the child's buffet never stopped. Also was quoted one rate for an extra room and by the time we checked out it went up $40. Would never, ever go anywhere near this place. Sadly it's made me feel nervous about any Holiday Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback.  Our hotel is located less than 2 miles from the Disneyland main entrance.  While we are not within walking distance many people enjoy being away noise and congestion located nearer to the park.  Around 50 area hotels utilize the Anaheim Transportation Network and we believe the price of $5 for an all-day pass is very reasonable.  The Kids Eat Free promotion offers a variety of choices and all are considered balanced meals.  For example, rather than yogurt and fruit you also have the option of eggs with bacon and toast.  Each meal also comes with a drink such as orange juice or milk.  I apologize that did not receive good service.  I assure you our staff does not work on commission.  If you ever experience an issue please bring it to our attention and we will promptly handle your concern.  Thanks again for staying with us.  We hope your recent experience doesn't deter you from returning in the future.

Summary: Wonderful hotel, close to Disneyland, bus service available for mimimum cost, very convenient. We enjoyed our stay here, clean rooms and comfy beds, laundry facilities were very useful. We would return again.

My son and I stayed here recently.  The room was great.  My airline misplaced my luggage and the girls at the front desk were very accomadating.  They gave us toothbrushes, paste and a comb.  The room was large with two comfortable double size beds with lots of pillows. I would defiantly stay here again.  The ART bus service stops right out front of the restaurant.

we stayed here for 3 nights. and for 3 nights we had a great time. ppl are right nothing spectacular happening but the service is superb. we liked the quick response on asking things. we forgot to ask for a microwave but when we returned after our little trip the housekeeping have seen that we have baby so they've put a microwave in it...thats a plus...thanks guys...   soft bed and we loved our room  we will be back for sure...  definitely NOT a horrible place..  and oh yeah if u want a quiet room ask for a rear facing room coz this hotel is just off from I5...were in 8th floor but were facing on the freeway...you could definitely hear the cars passing but its not a big deal for us coz were not light sleepers....so yeah just giving u guys a heads up.....

This hotel is a great family hotel. My husband was able to check in at 7:30 am and our room was ready. Our room was clean and we loved that it came with a mini fridge. It isn't the most modern hotel but it was clean and for me that is all that matters. We also found the self service laundry really convenient and we also ate at the restaurant in the hotel which was pretty good There is a nice little game room and also a nice pool. We stayed here while attending the Disney Parks. The only negative thing about this hotel is the location, it isn't near any stores or the Disney parks so if you don't have a rental you have to depend on the ART shuttle for everything. We recommend this hotel to families.  Beware of the little corner desk near the Front check in desk. This is another

We had stayed at this hotel once before a year ago. At that time we didn't like the front desk staff and their lack of friendliness and we didn't like the location. But for $100 it was ok.  I had made a booking to stay at the Sheraton Anaheim but they lost our reservation so we were stuck with nowhere to stay at a reasonable price., less than 12 hours before we were to leave. That is the ONLY reason we chose to go back. However we will NEVER  go back again!  Front desk staff……the most unfriendly and rude people in the business. I don't think any of them know how to smile.  Dirty bath……Pubic hair and dirt in bathtub which was covered in this broken up anti slip stuff that was rough and nasty. I would not lie down in that bath.  Dirty room………which reeked of smoke even though it
Manager Response: Dear o2beaway,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel.  The proximity to the parks was great.  Bus service right outside the hotel was so convenient.  Very friendly front desk and restaurant staff.  You can't beat the "kids eat free deal" at the restaurant.  Our shower wasn't draining so we mentioned it to the front desk.  By the time we came back to our room, it was fixed.  The refrigerator in the room was great for stocking up on snacks, drinks and lunchmeat to take into the park and to eat when we were too exhausted to go to a restaurant.  The price was extremely affordable to stay. All in all, we were very happy and would definitely stay here again.

We spent a week at the Holiday Inn in Anaheim.  The location is not great, with no shopping or nearby eating options, although they are relatively easily accessed by catching the ART bus. (5 day pass $20).  This hotel needs refurbishing. We had stayed at the Holiday Inn Vancouver the night before we checked in here, and this hotel was sadly lacking in comparison.  Our rooms were spacious enough, but my bed had a well used depression on one side, and I had to make sure I slept on the other side to avoid waking each day with a sore back.  The other side was very comfortable, and had obviously rarely been used.  (We had double beds, and I was sharing with our adult daughter.)  The bathroom in one of our rooms had a bath, but it had obviously had a few problems and appeared to have
Manager Response: Dear Cyclonic4,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your review is vital for improving the service and quality we offer to our valued guest. I am pleased to know that  our hotel was up to par with your expectations and apologize for the shortfalls you have encountered. It is always hugely motivating when one takes the time and trouble to acknowledge or give points for improvement. We hope to get the opportunity of welcoming you back in the future. Thank you once again for your valuable comment, and if you might have any suggestions that will contribute to enhancing your stay, please do not hesitate to contact us.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Disneyland and we had a very pleasant stay. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was so comfy.  Our room faced the highway and we didn't hear it at all.  All the staff we came across were friendly, polite, and happy to answer our many questions about taxis etc.   Close to Disney, we took the ART bus. $5 return seems liked great value for money.  We also visited the outlet mall and got a taxi there for $10 but walked back.   The breakfast seemed a little expensive, I had to order a la carte since I'm on a restricted diet,perhaps the buffet is a lot better value, it looked pretty appetising!   Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel, good value for money.

We stayed 2 nights while on business, not there for the resorts or Disney. The hotel was a little worn but not bad, it’s tough to find right on the edge of I5 freeway. Staff was nice and helpful, and the pool area was superb, particularly if you have kids. I always choose high floors to keep away from the noise, it works, and our view was not good a mobile home park but it beat the other side that had the freeway. Price was good. Okay at 3.30 pm in the afternoon of a Saturday the restaurant and bar were closed, not even a beer in the shop, and no where locally to get one, I even tried the hotel next door. The bar opens at 6pm and room service does not start until 5 pm, crazy. The restaurant I wrote a separate review was just not good; suggest you go out for breakfast. The hotel
Manager Response: Dear Malcolm F,  Thank you for taking time out of your busy day to leave us a candid review. We appreciate your nice comment regarding our staff and the pool.  However,  would like to offer a sincere apology regarding the restaurant and bar operation hours. We will look into this point. I assure you the feedback of our hotel will be reviewed and most certainly forwarded to the appropriate departments. We take  the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences.  While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: All good, clean room, great bathroom, housekeeping perfect, good price. Room in the fridge is great. Lots of parking, and the gift shop was great prices & selection. Close to Disney - we had a rental car but saw lots of people at the A.R.T. No complaints. If you are looking for a personal butler, then you won't like this place. Everyone else will.

Don't be afraid of the proximity with a highway : believe it or not, but this highway is fairly not used a lot, so no noise at all ! Comfortable rooms, clean, reaching all the standards of a normal new Holiday Inn.  25 mn by walk to the Convention Center, so nice price for the area.

Summary Heading: Perfect for the Theme Park Experience
Summary: Cannot understand the negative reviews, I think the expectations of some people are too high. This is was a great hotel for us although it is a bit far to walk to Disneyland, however, the #12 bus comes every 20 minutes (and departs from Disneyland the same) and delivers you directly to Disneyland!! Our bus company for the Knottsberry Farm and Universal Tours was 100 metres down the road. The restauarant was okay although the service we had there was great - could not do enough for us. Same with people at the front desk. There was 6 of us and the rooms we had were a good size and clean. Some of the furniture/drapes needing updating but that did not interfere with the great time we had. We had a late pickup to fly out and baggage storage was available without any hassle. Would

I was worried about some of the other reviews I read about this hotel. 1. The room was good size and was clean. They say the beds are queen but are more like a full size bed. The curtains in the room do close all the way and does block out the light. Service was great. Easy check in. We were able to check in an hour early. ART bus was awesome. The bus stop is right outside the hotel front door. We ate at the resturant for breakfast one morning and the food was good. I would say like eating at a Dennys. Fair price.. over all had no real complaints other than the beds. Would stay here again for sure. Great price for what u get.

Cheap, easy to get to the park from this property. Staff is super courteous. Like staying here because it is super clean. Weird lay out. Ice on every other floor. Sometimes there are minor issues with maintenance, but nothing so irritating that it upsets me.

We booked this hotel thru Expedia, and paid in full in advance for 2 nights. When we arrived at the hotel they requested a credit card for security reasons which we provided. They took $100.00 out of my account and it has been 11 days and they still have not refunded my deposit. They said the deposit was refundable at check out plus the deposit was suppose to be $50.00. We left the room in good condtion we were hardly there only to sleep. We have called the hotel several times and still cannot get the refund.
Manager Response: Dear olivia h,  Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay at our hotel. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Pam G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The hotel works for the price. The shower had a bathmat laid down to cover what looked like rust in the tub. And there was hair in the shower from whoever was there last.  The air is very loud also. Parking can be a little tricky if you don't get there early. Don't think I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear megand1,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We work diligently to ensure our facilities are well maintained and we try our hardest to provide not just good value, but comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. It's truly regrettable that there were some issues in your room in particular with the cleanliness and noise from air conditioning unit. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience it may have caused you. We take all reviews very seriously and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope you will continue to choose IHG for your travel needs.  Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: This hotel was quite nice, it wasn't anything special but if your looking for a nice, cheap stay thats close to Disneyland than this place is perfect for you! There are lots of families in this hotel so it is very child-friendly, its clean, the rooms are quite big and clean and the service is good. Its very close to Disneyland, although not quite walking distance, but there is a bus that takes people to and from Disneyland every twenty minutes and the fare is quite cheap. I would recommend people to stay here if they want to stay somewhere relatively cheap!
Manager Response: Dear Jessie N,   Thank you for your review regarding your recent visit at our hotel and for providing us with your valuable feedback. We certainly do our utmost to make your stay comfortable and pleasant, so we are very pleased to note that you were satisfied with the level of service, facilities and the location of the hotel. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to improve and continually provide the best experience possible.   Once again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back again very soon.  Sincerely,   Janice A  Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Close to Disneyland, easy to catch ART bus. We arrived 3 hours early and they let us check in. The room is fine and clean, lower level can be noisy from time to time, but they let us switch room. Staff are slow. Needs to update their lobby.

For an over night stay this Holiday Inn was adequate, but if had been for longer stay, we would have changed our room: Positives: Very reasonably priced hotel, short driving distance to Disneyland, loved lay out of "Kids" suite. Had small partitioned area with three cot-sized bunks and own TV.  Negatives: mostly housekeeping issues. Hair on bedspread that was not ours, and stained towels in bathroom. Our room on the second floor(203)might as well have not even had a window. There was a constant buzz from outside and when we looked out all you could see were the,I'm assuming, main A/C units which were walled off so you couldn't even see anything but them. It was loud and ugly. Would recommend this H.I.  for quick budget friendly trip, but check your room.
Manager Response: Dear ksjr2007,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience regarding your stay at our hotel. We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. Rest assured that your input will be taken into consideration in our efforts to monitor and improve the quality and services we offer.  Sincerely,  Joel B Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed in Dec 2013 with my boyfriend for three nights whilst visiting Disneyland for the first time. The hotel was recommended by a travel agent and we decided to stay as the nightly rate was so low. After staying in nicer hotels throughout the USA we regretted our decision to save money as soon as we arrived at the hotel. Front desk was unhelpful from the check-in as they directed us to the wrong floor. Room was unclean and all furniture needed an update. We also couldn't believe that there was no blinds on the windows. Our in room safe also decided not to open half way through our stay. If I was to visit Disneyland again I would stay closer to Disneyland. Would not recommend this hotel to family or friends.
Manager Response: Dear JessicaHHHH,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We’re sorry you received service which was unacceptable. We constantly strive to provide an environment of comfort and value to our guests, therefore, we are sincerely concerned when we fall short of your expectations. We have taken note of your valuable comments and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of services we offer to our guests. This feedback will be shared with the appropriate people that can help us make a difference to ensure our valued guests' needs and expectations are met in the future.   We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: They  remade the bed with dirty hairy sheets from previous customers. I wonder if they cleaned the toilet. So gross! And, very  far from monorail. 1 hour passed and still waiting for them to clean. Beside that, the hotel is not updated and looks dirty.
Manager Response: Dear Mary J,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. We are sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back.  Sincerely,  Ferdinand G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Like many hotels in this area you choose them because of their easy access to Disneyland. We had to catch the ART bus to get there each day but the process was quite easy. We arrived early and they had no problem checking us in. The room is fine, clean, a good size. However the walls are paper thin and our room has an adjoining door which sometimes made it feel like our neighbours were in our room. The front desk were a little surly at times, not always very helpful. The concierge was helpful however having stayed there only 2 nights we were asked 2 times about whether we were old enough to go to a timeshare type meeting, which was a little annoying. They should definitely drop the selling act.
Manager Response: Dear wishwellingtons,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel. I am very pleased that you noticed the cleanliness of the room. However, my apologies for the inconvenience you experienced over the noise from the neighboring room. Please be assured that all your comments are being shared with the management for further discussion. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations.  Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Nice and quiet and good location.
Summary: We chose this hotel when we bought our airline tickets through JetBlue; so we got it for free and are very pleased with this deal because are room was clean and comfortable;th e staff was amicable.  The location was very convenient for us because it's 5 minutes away from Disneyland and only 20 - 25 minutes away from LA and its on the route to go to San Diego (80 - 90 minute ride on a saturday morning).  We highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear ChantoNat,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel your feedback is very important to us. I am very glad to know you had a great stay. It makes me very proud to know that my staff did a great job. Hope to have you as our guest in the near future.

Summary: We were not happy with this hotel. What we liked least was how far away from Disneyland it is. The bus schedule says that the ART buses run every 20 mins on this route, it is more like 30 - 45 mins. During our 5 day stay we never waited less then 30 mins either to the park or from the park back to the hotel.  The rooms were shabby and the beds are very small.  We thought that it was a super deal that the kids eat free at the restaurant, but the food is very bad  below the quality you would get at Denny's. One night my daughter ordered the macaroni and cheese, it was literally from the box. Note to management , get new furniture for the lobby. I have seen better couches in a college dorm room. The price might be right but you will be wishing you spent the extra money for a closer
Manager Response: Dear Dana C,  Thank you for your review of your stay at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area, CA.  We are sorry you did not find our hotel to your liking.  All of our reviews are evaluated by management, and your review is no exception.  Your feedback is very important to us as this assists us in continually improving the services and facilities we have to offer to our guests.  Thank you again for your comments.  Your business is valued and we hope your future travel plans will continue to include IHG properties.  Regards,  Brenda J. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We had a family suite and it was great. There was a queen bed and a room within a room. The kids had a bunk bed and a single bed in their section. As well as their own TV. The room was clean, quiet and very comfortable. It made for a great rest after 2 long days at Disney

Summary Heading: Great Value for couple visiting Disney
Summary: We picked this hotel for the value and that it was close to Disney, but not so close that it was packed with families and lots of little ones. We were traveling as a couple and it was absolutely perfect for us. The room was clean and comfortable. The hot tub was nice after Disney all day (and was open later than most hotels). We had free breakfast coupons from the agency we booked through (Getawaytoday). You get a lot for a standard breakfast, and although we didn't try it, the buffet looked great.  The ART worked great for going to disney and only had a couple stops on the "12" so we were able to get to the park quickly everyday. I would definitely recommend a car if you plan to go anywhere else, as this hotel is a little out of the way.  Great stay! Our only issue was very low
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate the valuable feedback and will definitely share it with our staff.  Next time you are in the area we would love to have you back!  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay, nothing within walking distance
Summary: I only live about 15 minutes away, but the main reason I stayed here last Saturday was to win their special promotion points.  But had a great time with my son.  It was like a mini vacation, or a "staycation"....  The hotel is a decent hotel, nothing fancy about it.  Right off the 5 FWY so its a bit noisy outside, but inside room wasn't too bad.  Most of my stays have been overseas 4-5 stars, and overseas 4-5 stars are really good.  So relative to those, this hotel is a just a decent hotel that provides the basic amenities at a fair price.  The king size room I had was decent, wasn't super big, but certainly wasn't small.  At the room entrance area there was a very small counter area with a fridge.  Its almost like a small kitchen but there was no range or anything so you could

Summary Heading: Good place to stay- Need a vehicle if you want to explore
Summary: We stayed at this location from the 20-29 Nov, 2013. Vanessa from reception was just awesome; you need anything she was the one I went to. The others had the same demeanor too.  We were initially given a stand up shower room but when requested for a bathtub room were provided without hesitation. I was also offered an upgrade  to a children's room  for 2 days as the rooms were free but didn't take the offer as we didn't want to move in 2 days. (at least she offered it to me ).  The location is great if you like going to Disney spending time there and coming home to sleep at the end of the day. If you are planning to go around town etc. get a rental as this location is out of the way.  The hot tub/ pool were clean but the times we went  to use it the pool towels were all used up.

Summary Heading: The best choice in the area for reasonable value
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times, and am delighted to say that never have I been disappointed!  Consistent high standards have been a pleasant suprise for me here!  Always clean, quiet, courteous service, comfortable rooms.  The only negative is the sudden discontinuation of any perks whatsoever for Platinum Elite members!  Rather surprising, not to mention disappointing!

The room was comfortable and housekeeping did great. The restaurant and bar staff was amazing.  Manuel and Jennifer in the restaurant were by far the best. They both were very accommodating and made my staff.  The downside was one of the front desk girls who worked in the morning. I felt that every time it spoke with her she was bothered and I was inconveniencing her. It didn't matter if I asked the time or something I needed she had the same response which was a rude huh and an eye roll.  All of the other staff was very helpful Alex at the front always had a smile and a hello.  Overall it was a good stay.

Summary Heading: Run and don't just walk away from this place...
Summary: I am going to put this in context - I have been an IHG Platinum member for many years and have stayed endless amount of nights in hotel rooms because of my work.  THIS PLACE SUCKS!  One of the poorest performing Holiday Inn in recent memory.  This place is exactly why Holiday Inn brand is losing it's lust and no longer competitive...  1) The hotel is so cheap that they don't even put out hair conditioner in the standard amenity spread.  Why is this an issue?  This chain uses a volumizing shampoo that's very drying and without conditioner, you will end up with stripped and frizzy hair.  All other Holiday Inns provide conditioner without having to ask...  2) They took out the free breakfast perk for Platinum members with no warning.  In fact, there is no recognition of Platinum
Manager Response: I am very sorry that we failed to meet your expectations.  Not only do we value your feedback but as a Platinum member we value your loyalty and hope to keep you in our family for years to come.  You mentioned a number of issues that require our attention and I will be speaking to the appropriate department heads to resolve them going forward.  I would like note that in the coming year we are planning on a number of improvements throughout the hotel.  While we are excited about this, we are aware that no physical improvement can overcome any lack in above-and-beyond customer service.  I have sent you a private message to discuss your experience in more detail.  I am looking forward to your response.

Summary: Stayed here after winning the room on Priceline. Considering what I paid it wasn't too bad. I probably would not be as happy with the stay if I had paid the hotels going rate (even at their 'best available' rate).   Room was a decent size, more on the cramped size (our first room was bigger than our second -- more on that below). Rooms with two beds are doubles, not queens -- I imagine that could be an issue for some people. I would not say the room was immaculately cleaned but it was sufficient. The fridge with small freezer compartment was very helpful.   Our room was at the corner semi facing the pool. You could hear some freeway traffic but it wasn't annoying -- though I can see it would be a lot louder and obnoxious if you are directly facing the freeway, so request a room
Manager Response: Dear cindoids,  Thank you for your stay and leaving us a review. We take all feedback from our guests seriously. It helps us gauge what we are doing right and what we need to improve on. We appreciate you bringing your concern to our attention and apologize for any discomfort you may have experienced. I assure you the feedback of our hotel will be reviewed and most certainly forwarded to the appropriate departments. We take the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences. Thank you again for your comments.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Price is right, transportation to the resort is very reasonable, family friendly
Summary: The staff were extremely helpful. I forgot part of the power cord for my computer. The front desk were happy to lend me one until my stay terminated. Suffice to say they made my experience with them a happy one. The beds and room were spotless. Going to Disneyland is costly enough with grand kids, so, I appreciated the savings and help provided by this property.

Myself, husband and 10 year old son stayed here in Feb-March 2013.  It was a nice quiet hotel the staff was very knowledgeable.  Our room was clean and quiet and over looked the pool. The hotel location was perfect for day trips to Disneyland!  We are planning another vacation to Anaheim the same time for 2014 and are planning on staying at this same location!  The only bad thing was the service in the dinner attached to the hotel, there was no staff and the meals took forever to come, and the food was below average, however I do not hold that against the hotel.  Can't remember what the restaurants name was.  It was free meals for kids, perhaps that is why the food and service was below par.

A comfortable and quiet hotel about 10 minutes walk from Disney. Good, typically American, food in the restaurant. Unfortunately you can't book a table so its pot luck whether you get a meal when you want one or not. We waited over an hour one evening. Since there's nothing else nearby there's little option. Another evening we got a table and then waited 40 minutes for our order to arrive.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. We are glad you found the hotel comfortable and accommodating. Please accept our apologies for the issue that you encountered in our restaurant and we will make to sure to forward your concerns to our restaurant manager so we can avoid this type of issue from happening again and find ways to improve from this. Thank you again for your review and we hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: Stayed two nights on business and have stayed here before.  Rooms on street side get lots of traffic noise from the freeway.  The room was comfortable and had a nice HD TV, however while watching the final game of the world series the signal was lost during the 5th inning and I did not feel like going down to the bar so I missed the last half of the game.  My stay came with complimentary breakfast buffet, not bad but gravy should be "warm" at least.  The staff in both the hotel and the restaurant were friendly and accommodating.  This hotel is close to Disneyland and so is filled with tourist for the most part.  Nothing wrong with that as I met people from Minnesota and Kentucky.  Even with the road noise I did sleep comfortably and would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Paul W.,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback.  I am pleased to know that you had a satisfactory stay at our hotel and apologize for any inconvenience that the T.V. may have caused. I would also like to apologize for your experience with the breakfast buffet and we will make sure to forward this issue to our restaurant manager so we can avoid things like this from reoccurring. Thank you again for your review and we look forward to having you stay with us again.   Thank you,

Summary: The reviews on this place simply aren't fair.  Really gracious check in staff, well lit and lists of parking, cool pool, they sell Disney tickets at the front desk, great AC, flat panel TVs in HD, and a very nice fitness center.  Restaurant looks decent as well.  Thumbs up to this place.  The rooms are only mildly dated, but in a cute late 90s kinda way, they upgraded where it matters anyway.

A good hotel so no complaints from me. Easily accessible to Disneyland you can walk there. A bus ride to Universal Studies if you can put up with the never ending talking of Steve the driver!. I would recommend this hotel and the in house restaurant was good value and staff helpful.

Unfortunately my room was next to the highway with constant traffic noise all night. This meant I had very little sleep. I was able to change rooms the following day and bliss...was able to sleep much better. Both rooms were very big with usual Holiday Inn finishing touches. Big fluffy towels were a bonus.  Location was ok for Disneyland, a bus operated from directly outside the hotel to the theme park. However, for anything else it was a fair distance. I took a trip to Great Universal studios but the bus driver was intense with his commentary barely pausing for breath, his non stop talking exhausted me!
Manager Response: Dear JayneB57,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. Please accept our apologies for the issues you had with the first room you received and any inconvenience you may have encountered. We also apologize for the challenges you had with our Shuttle Service. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. Your review will be used to consider improvements needed and we hope that you can give us a chance to show what we have done.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The rooms were better than I expected. It was wonderful to come back from a long day at Disneyland to find it clean and comfy. It is a few blocks from Disneyland which was not a big deal at all for us. The only thing that was a small disappointment was the breakfast options. I booked through Getaway today and the options were limited. Either pancakes, sausage/bacon, or egg, potatoes/bacon. If you wanted to upgrade there was an additional fee. I was under the impression that all breakfast options were included, which is why I felt it is important to mention on the review. We did have an issue with our toilet and had to call someone to fix it on a few occasions, which they did right away. This place is ok..
Manager Response: Dear Marcela S,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. I am pleased to know that you find our rooms clean and comfortable and our location superb. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I am pleased to know that you had a satisfactory stay at our hotel and apologize for any inconvenience our breakfast menu may have caused you. I appreciate feedback that we receive, whether positive and negative to ensure we provide the best level of service and facilities that we can give to our guests. Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for a trip to Disneyland with family. Staff there was very accommodating. Check was smooth and no problems. Room was more than expected. Had an issue with a leaky shower head and it was fixed right away. There was an issue with someone smoking in their room. However, it could not be identified which room. They did attempt to solve the issue and advised they would try to locate who it was so it can be dealt with as they had received other complaints about it.   The only complaint I have is the hotel does not offer free breakfast as some other hotels in the area do. It would be a benefit to offer this as the hotel next door does offer free breakfast and also shares the pool with the neighboring hotel (Staybridge suites). Both hotels are part of IHG so it is a

Stayed here for a week. Beginning of the stay was starting off well. We got there & I asked for a high floor but didn't get it. That was fine. The room was clean. The bathroom was neat. the fridge was leaking water. Just put towel in there & called to make note. Didn't want to move rooms. Housekeeping went into the room when I had the do not disturb sign on. Customer service wasn't great as I thought! Wanted laundry done they did NOT inform me they had a laundry area. Spoke to a lady & all kept saying is that "my staff would never misinform you, they've been here a while. You didn't read the information we've given you at check in" RUDE!!!! She kept sighing when I'm trying to explain. She didn't even applogized! I spoke to asst. manager janette, she listened but didn't provide a
Manager Response: Dear Miss_snows0808,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Guest comfort and satisfaction are of the utmost concern to us and our hotel is committed to making every possible effort to provide comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. However, it seems that we were not able to execute an exemplary hotel stay experience with regard to customer service. We want our guest to have a pleasant and professional experience when interacting with our staff. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience it may have caused you. Your comments are being shared with the hotel management and we are confident they will take necessary actions to rectify this unsatisfactory experience.   We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope you will continue to choose IHG for your travel needs.  Sincerely,  Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary Heading: Better options available so why settle?
Summary: Not a bad hotel,but not a good one either.  Location too far from Disney and from restaurants, shops, etc, unless you have the luxury of time for travel back and forth.  Good assistance with travel plans.  Can book Disney tickets there, as well as other attractions and tours.  Needs work both on service and on facilities.  Yes, it's "a few blocks" from outside facilities, but in 33 Celsius weather with the Santa Ana winds blowing, four or five blocks to walk to a restaurant is too far.  Restaurant on site isn't open at lunch time.  The ART resort transportation shuttles are excellent and very inexpensive, and they stop right at the hotel, but it can take a very long time to get back to the hotel as this hotel is the last stop on the route.  We had planned two hours of free time
Manager Response: Dear NorthernLights2006,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment regarding the pool and the hot tub.  However, We’re sorry we fell below your expectation regarding customer service, room amenities and our location. We will look into this point.  I assure you the feedback of our hotel will be reviewed and most certainly forwarded to the appropriate departments. We take  the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Good rooms. A bit out of the way
Summary: I chose this hotel for this stay as I was told it was good value.   The rooms are quite good sized. They are also clean and modern.   In room wifi is free but patchy (worked in bathroom but not in bed).  Bathroom a good size but dodgy shower head.  Staff at reception were okay but a bit clueless.  The hotel is a fairly long walk from disneyland and not particularly close to many food outlets.  Overall its ok. Especially for people with kids. If you're travelling alone u would suggest finding something closer to Disney and restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear 83poolie,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our property. We are so glad you liked the cleanliness of your room accommodations. We apologize for the shortfalls you have experienced during yours stay. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. Rest assured that your comments will be looked into and take actions accordingly. Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This hotel was clean, convenient and very comfortable.  The rooms were bright and the beds were unbelievably comfortable.  The pillows were amazing! The pool was wonderful especially after a long day at Disney.  While it's not close to Disneyland, the ART line is right in front of the hotel and very easy to navigate.  The food was great! Almost everything was homemade. Will stay here again.

Would have got a higher rating but toilet blocked first morning and the safe didn't work, they got onto to it fast but left the plunger in the room. The first night we went to the restaurant and were told to sit and wait, even though there was heaps of empty seats, I had to ask if we could sit in the bar area and have a drink, would have been offered. Food was nice and the waiters really friendly and attentive. The staff were always helpful, didn't like the beds too small for my tall family.

Ray at the front desk was very helpful!  He noticed we had a frequency membership and upgraded our room to a suite.  The free breakfast was amazing - we could choose from an excellent buffet or off the menu.  We chose the buffet, and the waiter offered that we could have eggs any style not just the scrambled.  Really better service than the next night at the Disneyland hotel

As someone who works out of a home office, I take at least one weekend overnight trip a month, just to get out of the house.  Most recent trip was to Anaheim to see an Angels game, and I chose this hotel for its proximity to Angels Stadium.  Glad I did!   Easy check in, along with acknowledgment as Platinum IHG member status.  Very clean and modern room.  No freebie breakfast, but low room rate makes up for it.  Ample free well-lighted parking.  Felt safe going to car late at night.  Definitely plan on staying here again.  Thank you!

Arrived to a seamless check in after 11 hour flight from London, Out of town location, but near to Disney, we used route 12 for transfer, nice an cheap, and regular coaches.  Breakfast was OK, free wireless was a great touch, pool area seemed clean.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, good amenities, noisy AC
Summary: I stayed in room 231, which was nice, near the elevator, and had two beds.  Being single I generally prefer a large bed and a chair, but two bed hotel rooms aren't uncommon.  The room had a safe and a refrigerator, both big pluses. The bathroom was good sized, and the motion detection light at the door was handy for nighttime trips.  The TV was a good HD model with cable access to the HDMI ports in the back.  I was able to use the cable I brought to connect it to my laptop.  I played DVDs at night on my laptop, routed into the TV for a better viewing experience. Wi-Fi connection was solid.  I used the pool and hot tub.  Both were clean and larger than most.  The biggest issue I had was the noisy air conditioning unit.  I barely slept at all the first night due to the noise.  The
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey C,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review following your recent stay. It is our goal to consistently provide superior service and accommodations at our hotel and your comments are very important to us. We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. We have taken note of your valuable comments and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of services we offer to our guests.      Thank you for staying with us, and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you again.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This hotel has all the amenities you need while staying in Anaheim to either attend a game, or visit Disneyland.    I did not find it close enough to walk to either, but the ART bus is quick and easy, or rental cars are abundant and cheap.    Hotel was clean, rooms nice, staff helpful and pool fun for the little ones.  Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Ideal for Disney and easy access on/off Interstate 5 ++ Free internet ++
Summary: This was the first stop for our annual holiday and arriving tired from the 10 hour flight and subsequent 3 hours immigration and car hire, was pleased the hotel had two receptionists on duty. This was our second time at the hotel (first stayed 2010) so we knew the layout and features.   Check In was typically American with all the idioms that go with it.  As IHG members we were offered goody bags for the kids and a free starter or pud at the hotel restaurant, so a little something if nothing else. Our room was on the 7th floor and overlooked the pool, with the Tower of Terror in the background (the hotel is that close, but not too close).  A/c loud but thankfully not needed at night as it cools down nicely in LA.  In room fridge was nice, and overall the room was clean and tidy.

Good place to stay in Anaheim for business as well as family trip.  Well connected with the public transport and visit to the Disney Land. Free wifi and other facility was excellent. Near to the Anaheim Convention Center.

Family of 5, Grandpa and Grandma (scooter assisted and Oxygen machine) had room 305 and Family of 3 (one 10 yr old) had room 310.  8 nights spent as we used this hotel as a base for our day tripping.  I will make it simple and review in a list format.  Check in -  Smooth and quick. Friendly and helpful staff no matter what time of the day.  Room 305 (Handicapped Room)   Good   -Adequate room for a scooter and also able to move around freely.   -Shower and bathroom was excellent with the fold down seat and handles.    Bad -Air Conditioner was a little noisy but with being hearing impaired it really did not bother them! and they did not complain.  Room 311.......... Very Loud AC Unit, no sleep at all.  Went down at 5 am to front counter and the lady had us a new room (310) ready
Manager Response: Dear MRTLarry,  Thank you for your review and for enumerating the good, the bad and the opportunities to improve.  Whilst I am pleased with the good comments, I truly value the negative comments as this gives us the opportunity of improving what we can offer. I am sorry for the shortcomings you have experienced during your stay with us and I am relieved that ti was rectified in a timely manner. As we continually strive for excellence in customer service, we maintain the ideal of keeping guest satisfaction as our top priority. This feedback will be shared with the appropriate people that can help us make a difference to ensure our valued guests' needs and expectations are met in the future.   Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: no free breakfast any more even for Platinum Elite
Summary: In previous years, Platinum Elites in the IHG (Priority Club) program staying at this hotel would receive a voucher for the breakfast buffet (which btw didn't include juice, only coffee and water).  I hadn't stayed at this hotel for a while.  I just returned this week (for a one-night stay), and was told they no longer offer any breakfast for Platinums.   As a Platinum, they instead gave me a strange choice of free appetizer or free desert THAT NIGHT in the restaurant (I had to choose without seeing a menu!), but since I'd already had dinner before I arrived at the hotel, this was totally useless to me.  If I'm not going to get breakfast despite my Platinum status, I have no reason to return to this hotel.  I can get no breakfast far cheaper at the Candlewood Suites down the
Manager Response: Dear sdlax,  As an IHG Rewards member you are one of our most important guests, and we greatly appreciate you taking the time to bring this matter to our attention. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. We work diligently to ensure our facilities are well maintained and we try our hardest to provide not just good value, but comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations and for that please accept our sincere apology for the inconvenience the service you received from our hotel may have caused you. Rest assured that these will be shared to our management team for the purpose of bringing improvements needed.  Thank you again for the review and we hope to have the opportunity of welcoming you back and ensuring that you have a hassle free stay with us.  Sincerely,   Krysllin G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Pleasantly surprised, better than I expected
Summary: I have stayed at various Holiday Inn locations over the past few years and I read the reviews on Trip Advisor, so I had pan idea of what to expect.  I was actually pleasantly surprised.  Firstly, we chose this location because pre-conceived expectations.    Firstly, this is one of the few hotels in the area that offer free parking and complimentary Wi-Fi access.  Our room was clean and the carpet was actually of hotel caliber, and *not* like the cheap and musty carpets that are in motels and old casinos.  There was a flat screen tv and fridge and furniture was in good condition.  I also liked the washable bedding.  I have stayed in *other* Holiday Inn hotels where they use the wool blankets and the comforters that I am sure are not washed between guest stays.  We took the ART to

I really loved this hotel, from the staff at the main counter, and we especially enjoyed the hotel's restaurant and staff.  Really good value for money and catered for my and my 18yr old daughters needs.  shopping was great and we walked to the closest shopping center "Garden Walk" and the outlet shopping close by was fantastic.  The buses come to the front of the hotel so getting around was really easy.  I would definitely come back to this hotel again.  Loved that we could use the hotels guest laundry facilities and the shower was good, plus the TV reception was excellent with a wide range of TV channels. Nothing negative to say about this visit.

The hotel was quite, clean, had a good pool and jacuzzi, and shuttle to Disneyland. It also had a good location to Disneyland. The rooms and bathrooms were standad, but a good size and clean. It is a comfortable hotel for families and a good value.

Not much to say about this one. Service was ok. Rooms are showing their age but still functional. Nice fridge in room, no microwave. The WiFi was decent though probably not adequate for long-term streaming. Air conditioner worked ok; not exactly quiet but not super-noisy.  The bathroom had no tub, only a shower. The water pressure was fine but the shower head dirty with grime and several clogged holes. The shower floor was quite sloped so several inches of water collected on one end with no way to drain it other than shoving it toward the drain by hand.  Elevators have scratches. The common areas aren't all that clean but not terrible either. Like I said, "average".  I didn't use the restaurant but it seemed average with average prices and food. The resorts bus stops right
Manager Response: Dear Bill G,   Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our property. Your satisfaction is important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. Please remain assured that we have recorded your comments and will forward it to the appropriate departments for future considerations.  Thank you again for your review and we hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,   Karen C Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Beware of time-share people at hotel
Summary: We stayed at Holiday Inn from Monday to Friday while visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is aging and everything in the room is old except the TV. The rooms were far much better when we stayed there 4 years ago.  What really annoyed me were the Time Share people who had a stand or booth right next to the reception area of the hotel, harassing and deceiving hotel residents to sign up and promising people free lunch for a seminar in down town Anaheim. One couple I know nearly fell for this scheme. They got a cab for them to the seminar, gave them lunch and wouldn’t allow them to leave until they signed up, fortunately they kept saying no. Why in the world would Holiday Inn be associated with this? I came for vacation in your hotel and not to be hounded, pestered and harassed by your
