Manager Response: Dear SeattleTravelcrazy,   Thank you for taking the time to post your comments online. We value feedback as it assists us in our never ending task to better ourselves and improve our guest services.   We are saddened to hear the troubles you had during your stay. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any inconvenience this incident has caused you and we deeply regret that your experience was not what you expected.   It is only through valuable feedback we receive from our valued customers that we would be in a position to know where we go wrong and rectify the circumstances or incidents, in order to ensure that we do not repeat the same in the future. We hope that you give us a chance to change your perception of our hotel.  Sincerely,   Dhan M Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: We stayed at the HI Anaheim for 3 nights / 4 days and were happy with the service provided. We got a free upgrade due to Platinum membership with IHG, breakfast was good. Kids enjoyed the swimming pool, which was nice and not crowded. Location great for Disney and near restaurants (Anaheim Garden Walk)

My family stayed here in 6 days 5 nights for Disney vacation. The hotel is standard but the service is very satisfied. After we booked the hotel online, we called hotel before our arrival to request the special quiet room and they fulfilled our request.  We slept well each night after long hours spending in Disney theme parks in the quiet room. There is one day the toilet got clogged and they take care of it immediate without any issue. During our stay, we also purchased discounted Disney theme park ticket from front desk. Though it came with a 3D frame with purchase but it was run out. I checked every day with front desk but they hadn't have it came in during 6 days our stay. But the manager Ray offered to mail to me when they have them come in. And they did!!! Well packed and

My daughter participated in an event held at this hotel.  As hotels go, it's what I would expect from a Holiday Inn. My daughter loved the spa tub in the room. It is probably what separates this hotel from others in the area. The staff was nice and the buffet breakfast was typical. There's lots of restaurants nearby too.   So here's the bad news, the hallway on our floor smelled bad, like sewage.  I think there was a problem in the room across from us. Employees were in and out of there most of the time of our stay.  At one time I saw a man using a shop-vac. Soon after our arrival our sink in the bathroom suddenly filled with blackish water. It wasn't sewage, although I had no idea what it was.  The maintenance guy came right away, along with about 3 other guys after I called.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Stilly09,  Thank you for posting your review on Trip-Advisor. Unfortunately, I believe this was posted at the wrong location, due to not having spa tubs in our guest rooms.   Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: The hotel was a bit worn and needs a bit of work but seen as we spent all our time out sightseeing it was fine to sleep in.  Our room was a kids suite but basically just a normal room with a room divider with animal pictures on it. Beds were comfortable.  The  hotel provides some washing machines for guests to use at a small cost but they are quite dirty, could do with a clean.  Free parking which was great. The shuttle stops right outside the hotel and we used this instead of driving to Disneyland and parking our car.  $5 each for an adult and $3 for a child.  The restaurant in the hotel was nice, staff were very friendly and our kids ate free.  Hotel is great for those on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear Melanie O,  Sorry to hear that your stay was average, we always strive for our guest to have an excellent stay. However, it sounds that our other ameneties were pleasing, and helped to make your stay a little bit better. We are glad to hear, the great things like free parking, our staff, and restaurant helped to make it right. We hope you will give us another opportunity to make it not just an average stay.   Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: We booked the kids suite which was fun! It's a room with a partitioned area with bunkbeds for kids. It has its own tv and xbox. You can check out games and movies at the front desk. The kids were happily busy while my husband and I put our feet up. The restaurant was great and had a kids eat free menu. It was very affordable. There is also a really nice big pool and small arcade. The shuttle is the local Anaheim shuttle and goes directly to Disneyland. Definitely plan on staying here again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest All4TheKids,  Thank you for expressing your feedback on your recent stay with us. To hear that our guest's had a great experience with us brings smiles to our faces! We are so happy that all our amenities made your stay a great one. We really look forward to having you lodge with us again on your next vacation. Thank you for your time, see you soon!!  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: We spent 3 nights at the hotel.  On accident I only booked 2 nights instead of 3. When I contacted Expedia I was informed that any change to my reservation would result in fee totaling my initial reservation.  So we made an additional reservation.  The hotel was very accommodating.  Great shuttle ($5 per person) to Disney.  I just had to take my room cards to desk and check out and check back in.  We were abele to keep the same room.  I was disappointed that the bunk beds in the kids room were smaller than twins and there were only 3 washer/dryers for the whole hotel (1 washer out of service).  All in all a great experience.
Manager Response: Dear Guest ATCDF,  Thank you, for your recent stay here with us at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. We are so pleased that your stay was enjoyable. We would like to apologize for the discomfort of the bunk beds. However, we really enjoy hearing that your overall stay was a good one. Thank you again, for your time. Hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: This hotel is decent. I wouldn't chose them for my first second or third choice....possibly as a last resort. . . Maybe! We had a late check in, the room was "clean" but upon getting ready in the morning I kicked empty beer bottles out from under the foot of the bed. I complained and got "sorry for that".....when returning to hotel it did not get turned down "because it was a late check in we weren't on list"  yet one would think a complaint of beer bottles would be grounds for a cleaning. On second day I complained about the fridge not working and came back to room and found a half consumed bottle of champaign that I had not brought in to the room. The hotel apologized.   I would not recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Disneyfanatic,  Thank you, for taking time to provide your feedback on Trip Advisor. It is unfortunate, that we fell short of your expectations and would like to convey that we deeply apologize, that we did not meet your satisfaction! I would also like to say we have relayed these concerns as noted to the proper departments and will rectify the issues you have expressed.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Enjoyed the free parking for our rental car after having to pay at every other hotel we stayed at on our trip. No help with our bags but did use the bell hop trolley and hauled our baggage and shopping by ourselves even though we were quite exhausted.  Trip to Citiadel for shopping was excellent by the way. Nice pool and huge spa area was great. Enjoyed a spa one night and could see the Disneyland fireworks.  Short drive to Disneyland and in walking distance of 7Eleven and El Taco and some other options for food.  Although a little bit of a dodgy area.  Young Phillapino man in the lobby on the tours information desk was lovely and great to chat to.  Gave us lots of information.  A nice place.  Beds comfy too.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Vickopro,  Thank you, for choosing Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort for your lodging needs. We appreciate, all your kind words regarding your recent stay with us. It was absolutely awesome, to hear all your great feedback and sharing your experience with us. We definitely look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Veronica was an amazing host. I give her an 11 out of 10 for her great personality, and a fantastic woman to work with. Very nice and clean hotel, great pool, and friendly staff. Great gift shop and clean lobby.
Manager Response: Dear Guest David E,  Thank you, so much for taking the time out of your day to provide your feedback on your recent stay with us. Our priority, is providing our guests with a comfortable, pleasant stay while staying with us. We would also like to thank you for your kind words, regarding our staff and ameneties, it is definitely a pleasure to hear that we made your stay with us a great one!!  We hope to see you again real soon.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Wife and I took our daughter, husband, and 3 kids, aged 5 and under to Disneyland and stayed at this hotel. We were all more than happy with the staff, rooms, pool, restaurant. The 3 kids ate free off the kids menu, got another 10% off with hotel "rewards" card. Shuttle service was decent, and not too far to walk for some. Overall staff was freindly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Steve J.  We would like to start off by saying thank you, for your recent stay with us, and choosing our Hotel for your lodging needs.  It is nice to hear that you were happy with our guest rooms, pool, restaurant and staff. It brings great satisfaction to hear that our guests enjoyed everyday of their stay with us. We really our looking forward to having you stay with us again in the future when visiting Anaheim. Thank you again for expressing your feedback on Trip Advisor.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: I wasn't expecting much from this property after reading the mixed reviews, however, I was pleasantly surprised.  The lobby decor was beautiful, the pool area is gorgeous with a hot tub and salt water pool and there is free & easy parking.  Yes, it is not right across the street from Disneyland (about 1.5 miles away) but the ART shuttle comes right to the door and drops you off at the park for a small fee.  The hotel was quiet, clean and the beds were comfy.  There is a refrigerator in the room and also a small cabinet to store food. I was a little disappointed that there wasn't a microwave but overall we were very satisfied with our stay. We are planning a return trip to Anaheim in August and I have already booked a room at this property again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest CA4Fun,  Thank you for your recent stay here with us and providing your feedback on Trip Advisor. We were so pleased to hear, that your stay was great. We would like to apologize for the inconvienence with not having a microwave in our guest rooms. In retrospect, we are so happy to hear we will be seeing you again in August. Thank you again for your time.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: I stayed here during my daughter's sports event being held at both the Anaheim Sports Center and the Anaheim Convention Center over a 4-day period.  The room was clean and fairly up-to-date, having a fair-sized flat screen TV.  The room did NOT have any "decrepit-ness" in it at all.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I didn't use the pool but I did have a pool view and it was very pretty and looked clean and kept-up.  There were a lot of people using the pool at all times of the day and night, so apparently it was as good as it looked!  The room was cleaned daily with no problems OTHER than the 3 long black hairs that  I found on the third day in the bathroom AND upon clean-out of the refrigerator on my way out the door.  Since we are all blondes I was definitely certain that
Manager Response: Dear Guest Tabijo3,  I would like to start of by saying thank you for your recent stay with us. We have read your feedback regarding your stay, and would like to apologize for all your inconvienences you had while lodging with us!Please know, if we would of known of your concerns we would of gladly rectified your issues quickly and would of made it comfortable for your time with us. We really strive on guest satisfaction, and know we will be addressing these issues with our different departments. Thank you for providing your honest feedback on Trip Advisor.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend trip to Disney Land. It's very convenient to I-5.  We arrived around 0900 and were told we couldn't check in yet, but they would be happy to hold our luggage if we were not comfortable leaving it in the car (we were). We were able to purchase tickets on the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) to take us to Disney (about a 10 minute drive, traffic dependant) for a nominal cost (around $5/day for adult, cheaper if 3 day pass, $3 for a 3 day pass for children). There was also a restaurant on site, but we did not eat there (we were told it was included, but apparently it was only included for children with adult purchase).  The rooms were clean with lots of space and we had a great view. We were at the parks during fireworks, but would have been able
Manager Response: Dear Andrea464,  Thank you for your recent stay with us, and for sharing your feedback with us. We would like to apologize ,for not being able to check-in when arriving. Also sorry to hear about the driving game not working properly we have replaced the game with another. Also with the  issue of  the used pool towels in the game room has been addressed as well.  On a good note we were pleased to hear that your room was to your satisfaction and that the ART shuttle was to your liking. I hope in the future you will be staying with us again, so that you may be able to use all our ameneties of the Hotel.   We thank you for your time. IHG Staff

Summary: This is a good hotel to consider for the Disneyland/Angel Stadium area.  It offers free parking, which many of the other hotels in this price range do not.  It's also on a bus route to get you to Disneyland without having to pay parking at the resort.  Had a very nice fitness room.  I felt the rooms were a nice size, and clean.  Small fridge, coffee maker.  My rooom faced the freeway, and I could hear some freeway noise at night, but it was more of a background noise.  If you think it will bother you, ask for another loctation.
Manager Response: Dear Guest LindaSK,  Thank you, for taking the time to give your feedback on Trip Advisor. We would like to say thank you, for staying with us. In regards to the noise, we are sorry about the background noise from the highway you heard in your room. Just know, on your next visit we will be more than happy to accomodate you to a quite area. In retrospect, we were so happy to hear that your overall stay was satisfactory. I hope you will give us another opportunity to make it a GREAT stay for you and your family.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary Heading: Economical stay if going to the angels game.
Summary: It's a holiday inn, so don't expect frills. It was clean and the stay was friendly. The pool area looked nice, and free parking! We stayed here because we were going to the angels game. The hotel isn't as close as it is listed on the website. I originally booked The hotel so we could walk to the game. We decided to drive and park, ample parking around stadium for $10. $12 can ride each way.
Manager Response: Dear Guest A K,  Thank you for your recent stay with us. We value your feedback and apologize, for any inconveniences you experienced with the distance to your destination. In retrospect we are happy that your were able to visit Anaheim Stadium and watch your game. I hope you will give us another opportunity to have you stay with us again in the future. Thank you for your time!  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: We booked with Hotels.com.   I've learned you get what you paid for. We visited the hotel on 6/6/13-6/14/13.  The rooms were ok. We always had this weird odor smell when they sprayed our room.  The shower we felt at times that it might cave in on us. The pool was like ice cold but the hot tub was good.  The restaurant was ok we only went there once. The hotel was close to disneyland and other amusement parks.   The hotel staff was ok too. There was a time when I checked out.  I asked a hotel lady where is a luggage carrier she acted as if I had to get it myself.   Would I recommend this hotel to others. Id say maybe on a short visit.   Would I come back to this hotel again probably not.
Manager Response: Dear Guest d10davidd,  Firstly, I would like to thank you for staying with us. Secondly, I would like to apologize for all your problems you endured while staying with us. We strive to bring our guests comfort while being away from home. I hope you will give us another opportunity to make you feel that way. We appreciate your honest feedback, as this helps us to work on improving our guest satisfaction!  Thank you for your time, IHG Staff

Summary: If you plan on being a Disneyland form dawn til well beyond dusk this is a great place to stay.  The rooms are smallish, but it wasn't like we were going to be in the room all day we used them sleep, shower and store our stuff.  The beds are great, we all slept really well while we were there. The rooms are very clean and housekeeping is very respectful of your stuff.  The bathroom was very large and did take up a lot of space from living area, but when you have a wife and teen daughter that bring all their "stuff" you are grateful for the larger bathroom. The hotel is just about a mile from Disneyland, and getting to there is quick and easy regardless of whether you drive over or take the shuttle. The staff at the hotel was always very helpful and the front desk will bend over
Manager Response: Dear Guest Alberto L,  I would like to start off by saying "Thank You" for choosing Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. I'm so glad to hear that your stay was a pleasant one, and that our Hotel amenities were pleasing to you and your family. I'm glad you know that you can count on us for a clean and comfortable stay. We look forward to having you stay with us on your next outing with your family while in Anaheim!   Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Booked through Hotwire so didn't really choose this hotel but we were glad we got it. The room was great. Plenty of room and the fridge was nice to have. Since we booked through Hotwire we didn't get to pick the bed situation but Vanessa at the front desk totally helped us out by comping a rollaway which made our stay better. Having a shuttle pick us up and drop us off at the hotel was a plus. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Michael D,  It's great to know, that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. We are so pleased to hear that our front desk agent Vanessa took great care of and provided great customer service. We try our very best to ensure that our guest's are taking care of and provided with great customer service. We here at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort  look forward to serving your family again when visiting Anaheim. Thank you so much, for your kind comments and for taking the time to post your feedback on TripAdvisor.  Sincerely, IHG, Staff

Summary Heading: Doubt I would stay here again 2013
Summary: We booked this hotel for 2 main reasons: close to Disneyland and the kids eat free all meals! For a small fee you ride a shuttle to the door of Disneyland-great. The "free" meals for the kids were very limiting, 3 choices only.  We ate there the first night and my granddaughter couldn't eat her meal. My husband ordered steak and veggies but didn't finish his meal either. The reason kids eat free are the adult prices were a little high to make up for it.  We tried the breakfast 2 mornings then gave up. All four of us had a delicious breakfast at a Denny's nearby, bigger portions, and cheaper than the hotel. We stayed 5 days but found it was better to eat out. We planned on staying 6 nights but checked out early-FIVE mornings in a row we were awaken by crying babies and their
Manager Response: Dear Guest Shelly511972,  I would like to start by saying we do appreciate you taking the time out of your day to post your feedback on Trip Advisor. Secondly, Holiday Inn Anaheim would like to sincerely apologize for your concerns you endeavored while lodging with us. We take everyone's issue's very seriously and will be looking into your concerns. We hope that you will give us the another opportunity to have you stay with us again. Please know, we will do everything to make sure your stay with us will be great one!  Thank you, IHG, Staff

Summary: I booked this Hotel thru Get Away today in Ogden Utah  This hotel has been less than satisfactory the two rooms the Hotel assigned us one of them looks out to a wall Great view we can live with that because we know not all the rooms have a great view the second room looks out to the roof of the restaurant ventilation system again I could live with that because I know not all room have a great view the problem is the vents from the restaurant blow right into our room our room smells like you have been living in a barbeque grill and all out clothes smell like that as well we have to keep a blanket over the air conditioner so the smell is not so strong or we have to have the AC on all the time to keep the smell out. The Hotel or Get Away Today didn’t seem to care about our problems
Manager Response: Dear Guest Alan B,  We would like to extend our apologies, to you and your family for your uncomfortable stay with us! Please know that these issues will be addressed about your room smelling like barbeque. We feel horrible that this was not addressed and taken care of when needed. I will be giving this information to our Guest Service Manager so that he may look into this issue. Again, please accept our sincere apologies.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: As far as hotels go this is right around normal, the rooms are ok but starting to show signs of wear and tear. We chose a family room which had a 'separate area' for the kids beds, not really a separate area (they make it sound better than it is) but there are small walls that create the division. It was still better than having two kids share a double bed though! The hotel was clean over all and the public areas were well maintained.  The pool was quite enjoyable for the family, was clean and well maintained.  Their restaurant had friendly staff and good food, although the dinner menu is a little limited. Breakfasts were also good with a choice between the buffet or off the menu ordering.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thanks for your recent stay with us, and for providing your input on Trip Advisor. We are always open for suggestions from our valued guests. We are so sorry, to hear about your room accomodations were not to your satisfaction for you and your family! On a good note, we are pleased to hear about your likings to our pool and Restaurant . I hope in the future, when coming for your next vacation you will give us another opportunity to make your stay a GREAT ONE instead of about average one. Thank you again for time, hope to see you and your family again.  Thank you, IHG, Staff

Summary: A really good location and only ten minutes from Disney. Very good rooms, nice and quiet, and a nice pool. Great for the family! Buses run regularly to disney from the front of the hotel, and only five US dollars per person.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Robert G,  Thank you, for taking the time to post your review on Trip Advisor. It's nice to hear, about the great time you and your family experienced while staying at our location. It is always great to hear that our ameneties were to your liking and that your family enjoyed their stay here with us. We look forward to hearing from you again when you come to Anaheim. Thanks again for your review.  Sincerely, IHG, Staff

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights around Christmas Time.  Absolutely loved it!! Beautiful & Cheap rooms, great shuttle service to Disneyland, tickets were able to be purchased at a discounted rate at the front desk! Customer service isn't strong, but they were attentive and were more than happy to hold on to our luggage in a locked room while we visited Disney (this was around 9AM we had an early flight and understandably our room was still in use). The restaurant located in the hotel was wonderful! All the classic American favorites for breakfast buffet! Staff were warm and welcoming in the restaurant.  Really recommend this hotel for family visits to Disneyland!!! Much cheaper than the hotels closer to the park and literally a 5 minute bus ride to the front of the Park!!
Manager Response: Dear Sarahtravel92,  Thank you for taking the time, to express your thoughts on your stay in December. I would like to start off by apologizing for our customer service. Be assured that we will be addressing  this issue and concern. However, on a good note, we are happy to hear about your overall stay was to your satisfaction. We are excited to know that you will be returning soon. Again thank you for your review.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: We picked this place because we've stayed next door at the Staybridge. We love the big pool (shaped like Mickey Mouse's head). Has a restaurant in the lobby. The Disneyland shuttle stops in the front of the hotel. It's quite a walk to Disneyland but doable. We are also owners of Worldmark (which a couple blocks away) and we've walked from Worldmark to Disney a few times with no problem. Plenty of parking the time we stayed. Fitness center was ok and had your very basic machines. Our room was clean and quiet. TV is a big flat screen. Will probably stay here again we come back to watch the A's vs Angels plus Disney trip in July!
Manager Response: Dear Guest Fredrock,  Thank you, for taking the time out of your day to post your feedback on Trip Advisor. We would like to say "thank you" for giving us the opportunity to have you stay with us.  It is a pleasure, knowing that our ameneties were to your satisfaction. We are excited for your next stay with us, please advise if there is anything you need, we would gladly accomodate to your family needs.  Thank you for your time, IHG Staff

Summary: I was nervous about staying at this property after reading some of the negative reviews.  I did not have a choice about where to stay since I was coming with a school group and this was where the group was staying.  I was very pleasantly surprised by the hotel in all respects.  The room we had was very clean and equipped with a good sized fridge, coffee maker, iron etc.  The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Everything functioned well.  The bed was comfortable and there were 4 large pillows on each one. There is a very beautiful nice pool which has lots of nicely landscaped area around it, tables and chairs, shade and sun.  I just can't understand the negative reviews.  I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel and would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest dafnaanfad,  I would like to take the time to say "thank you" for your kind words regarding our Hotel and our accomodating staff!! We strive everyday, to ensure that our guests have a enjoyable stay while staying with us. It pleases us to know that we made your stay a great one! We look forward to having you stay with us again.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: What a shame. This property is in poor condition compared to my stays in 2006, 2005 & 2009. I noticed a few problems during the 2009 stay but with a room change I was able to make it work. This time, I checked May 13 for 1 night via hotwire. The rate was ($67) for a total of $84 with tax & recovery fees. Holiday Inn website quoted $99 a night. The ceiling stucco & wallpaper is peeling, carpets & sheets are stained, doors & furniture are scratched & dented. The air conditioner sounds like a jet engine but I've got to leave it on because the room is very humid. Trying to stick it out because I'm exhausted but I'll never stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are so sorry, to hear about your stay not being to your satisfaction. We do apologize and our very sorry to hear, about all the issues with your room accommodations. Please know we will be taking action to all the issues that you have mentioned, and our very sorry to hear that you will not be staying here again. We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you again in the future. Thank you again for your time and your honest feedback.  Thanks, IHG Staff

Summary: Having read some reviews that were not very complimentary we were a little apprehensive about our stay. We stayed here 3 nights and enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We were able to walk to Disney each night and this took only 15 minutes and even late at night we did not in any way feel at risk and there were wide pavements and plenty of passing traffic. We found the hotel to be quiet , clean and comfortable. We used the pool which was clean and the water was a good temperature. We enjoyed a drink at the bar which was again reasonably priced and had local beers available. We did not eat at the hotel because of the good selection of restaurants within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear ANDY K,  We would like to start off by saying, "Thank You" for giving us the opportunity to lodge with us while in town. We completely understand you being apprehensive about  staying with us, but we are so pleased you that you gave us a chance despite of some negative guest reviews. We are always excited to know that our guests were very satisfied and thouroughly enjoyed all our ameneties we have to offer our guests. We would hope you will come back and stay with us again, when in town. Thank you for your time and feedback on Trip Advisor.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: We stayed here last month when taking a few days break from Arizona , to see the sites of LA California . the hotel was very clean , and comfortable , the staff very helpful, and rooms brilliant .  It was a perfect location to visit Disneyland , although we didn't at this time , but took a tour bus to see the attractions in Los Angeles , which was fantastic , well worth the money spent , as we couldn't have seen half the sites , Hollywood sign , Beverley Hills , Hollywood Boulevard , Rodeo Drive and many more ! . Our only suggestion would be to ask for a room at the back , away from the freeways that run opposite the front rooms of the hotel , as traffic use the freeway ALL NIGHT !!
Manager Response: Dear Guest Valandbry,  Thank you for taking time to express your thoughts on our Hotel. By providing feedback helps us continue to strive for excellence. We are so happy, to hear that your overall experience was a great one. Thank you again for your time, and we hope to have you stay with us again when visiting Anaheim.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Is a excellent hotel. 3 blocks from Disneyland and restaurants for breakfast iHop near. Is near of I-5 Freeway.  Have a shuttle   that take you to Disney for $5 all day. The Orange Outlet is near 5 min by car. Personal speak spanish, Wi-Fi free. Parking Free.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Callejas_Fuehrer,  Thank you very much, for providing your feedback on your stay with us. We are so pleased that your time with us was to your satisfaction! It's always nice to hear that our Hotel, staff and ameneties worked perfect for you. Thank you again for your time and we look forward to serving again while in Anaheim.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: I booked my stay on a discount travel site and was a little nervous that it wasn't on one of the main streets near Disneyland but it was perfect.  Newly renovated - rooms clean, upgraded and comfortable.  Free parking was a plus, I always seemed to find a spot at the end if the day.  This was a great find.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Pamela62,  Thank you for your positive review of our Hotel on TripAdvisor. It brings a smile to our faces, knowing that your stay with us was a great one! We are so pleased to hear, that all our ameneties suited your needs perfect! Thank you again for your time, we look forward to seeing you again when visiting Anaheim.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: The place was nice enough. A bit aged but. The elevator was dramatically slow and kept jumping.. Probably should look into that. The room sizes were nice but the walls are thin, so hearing little kids screaming their heads off from dusk to dawn is a pain in the butt. Downstairs they have a restaurant, the service there for dinner I had was alright, but for breakfast we were continually ignored whilst everyone around us was served, seated and attended to. Dismal effort and really let down our opinion of the place. The front desk staff were helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest TAG_worldwide,  We would like to thank you for your recent stay with us. We also would like to apologize, for the negative experience you had with our elevators, restaurant service and room accomodation. Please accept our sincerest apology for any trouble or inconvenience we have caused you. Again, we highly appreciate your feedback as it will assist us in becoming better at what we do.  Thank you for your time, IHG Staff

Summary: While visiting San Diego, we went for two days to Disney, we got this Holiday Inn thru Hotwire, so we actually didn't really choose it. The hotel turned out to be just what we expected, a simple, clean and safe place where we could have a nice rest.   We had three rooms on the 8th floor and although we asked for two connecting rooms, the hotel was fully booked and they couldn't do it. We were 3 adults and 7 kids.  There is free wireless internet thru the hotel, even inside the rooms. They have vending machines on every odd number floor, which is very convenient.  The only problem we had is that the in room safe got jammed and they had to come open it. Another minor con is that the flat screen TV does not have HD programing so the video quality is not that good, but any way we
Manager Response: Dear Guest Cesarbm,  We would like to thank you for your honest feedback, on your recent stay with us. We recognize, the importance of picking the correct Hotel while on vacation, and we are so happy to hear that we were the perfect Hotel for your family of 10. We are also excited to hear, that we were able to offer a clean, safe place for your family to stay. We hope to see you again soon!  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary Heading: Disneyland Dream Vacation Enhanced by Holiday Inn
Summary: Booked an inexpensive Disney vacation for myself and my 5 year old great-niece. We stayed there from March 16 to March 21st, 2013.   Not going to lie I was concerned about the hotel after the skeptical reviews I read on here. Our room was spotless, our bed comfortable, our TV was new and had great reception. The pool area was wonderful and we spent quite a bit of time out there. There was some jack hammering going on near the pool during the day but I certainly wouldn't let something as trivial as that ruin my vacation.   The staff were outstanding in their treatment of us during and after our stay. I say after because in our hurry to get to our 5:45 shuttle we left behind the prized new Build-A-Bear. We were at the airport before we discovered her missing and immediately phoned
Manager Response: Dear Guest ColleenPalumbo,  Wow, thank you so much for kind words regarding our Hotel and staff. We appreciate you taking the time out of your day to write this great review! It brings a smile to our faces, knowing that you and your great niece had a pleasant stay and enjoyed all of our amenetiesthat we have to offer. Lastly, we are glad to hear that your prized "Build a Bear" arrived safely home where she belongs. We look forward to having you stay with us on your next visit to California.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Hotel was nice but not quite up to most of the Holiday Inns where I have stayed.  The room was satisfactory even though the beds were not as comfortable as I would have liked.  The beds weren't bad, just firm.  The location was outstanding.  Breakfast was not included which was a surprise for me.  Most Holiday Inns that I have stayed at have included breakfast. Overall it was a good experience.  Parking was included which was definitely a perk. Staff was very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Margaretbb,  We would like to thank you for your recent stay with us. So sorry, to hear that your bed was uncomfortable, however on a higher note we are pleased to hear that our staff was very helpful and the perks of our hotel was to your liking. Thanks again for your feedback on TripAdvisor.  Thank You, IHG Staff

Summary Heading: A fine hotel, but not for us
Summary: This Holiday inn is a fine hotel.  The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and it is not too far from Disneyland. With that said, we probably won't stay again, not because it is a bad property or had any major problems.  It is just not the property for us.    Here are some of our top positives: 1. Free parking (this saved us $75 over most other resorts) 2. Lots of parking spaces(The hotel was full over our stay, but,  it was always easy to find a spot) 3. Kids eat free (at least during our stay) 4. Staff was very nice  Here are some of the negatives that we found; 1. We had a room with 2 double beds, it made for a cozy stay for the four of us. (too cozy) 2. It is not super easy to get to, it is on a one way street. (not super hard either, but made you think about how to get
Manager Response: Dear Guest Summertravel999,  Firstly, we would like to say thank you, for staying with us.  Thank you for providing all your great feedback with the pros and cons of our Hotel. It helps us to know what are some of the guests issues and concerns that we need to impove on. We would also like to extend our apologies for all the negative experiences during your stay. We are sorry to hear, that we are not your future hotel choice when traveling, but hope that you will consider giving us another opportunity for your lodging needs.  Thank You, IHG Staff Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary Heading: Not bad, but kids "room" not a room
Summary: Kids room walls don't go all the way to the ceiling and there is no door on it. We booked it so that we could keep the TV on and stay up with lights on in another room and not keep my son up.  Also, there is a mirror on the wall placed just so that they can look from the top bunk into the mirror and see you sitting on your bed watching TV. Too many distractions and noise for him to sleep.  He thought it was a blast, but it wasn't what we had thought it would be.  Cute idea, just should be closed off.   Also, room 201 has NO view at all. It looks out to air conditioning units on the roof. That is all that you can see.   Other than that was an ok room and good service. Close to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Jen131,  I would like to thank you, for bringing your concerns to our attention. We are disappointed, that your room accomodations did not meet your needs. We also would like to apologize, for your not so good room view, however the next time you stay, we will definitely try our best to put you in a room with a view. Thank you again, for your time to relay your feedback.  SincerelyI IHG Staff

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: I think some reviews below mistaken this Holiday Inn to another one (perhaps Holiday Inn Express) that is closer (walking distance) to Disneyland. This Holiday Inn (Anaheim Resort) is NOT walking distance to Disneyland, so if you are planning to walk to the park--this might not be the hotel for you. With that said, I stayed at this hotel during Spring Break and everyone knows how crazy it can get during this time!  so finding the right hotel to suit my needs and convenience were extremely important.  Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort deserves a 10 out of 10 from me and my family and here's why:  Pros:  -The staff were super friendly and helpful -Shuttle bus (ART) takes you to and from Disneyland within 10 minutes (Bus runs every 20 minutes) and is conveniently located right in front of
Manager Response: Dear Guest Christine S.  Thank you for the positive review of our Hotel. We are very pleased to hear that your stay was a great one! It's nice to hear great feedback from our guests, and we look forward to seeing you again the next  time you are in Anaheim.  Thank you, IHG Staff

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights I wish I could have switched hotels the 2nd day we were there. We had to change rooms the 2nd day because our room smelled like pot, that was due to someone in another room smoking & it was now in our room. My son is highly allergic to any kind of smoke, they offered to change rooms but it was a hassle because we had to pack everything up only to move a few doors down. We were on a NO Smoking floor but I guess that doesn't matter. The beds were double which were basically a glorified twin bed. Housekeeping wasn't very good, they didn't even take out the trash!! The carpets were sticky so we had to wear shoes at all time. Oh & part of our package was breakfast, I should have read the fine print. It was a complimentary breakfast so we had 2 choice & the
Manager Response: Dear Guest Jen G.  We would like to apologize, for all your problems your family endured while staying with us! Unfortunately, we ran into a problem with the rule of "no smoking" and I am so sorry for that!  Please accept our sincere apologies for all your inconvienences.   Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary Heading: Bed bug bites all over my face!
Summary: Was in Anaheim for a customers dealer show at the convention center.  This was one of their recommended hotels to stay at. After r the first night at the hotel I awoke with three red bumps on my face.  Being 50 and not having acne or pimples, knew something was strange but went on with my trade show.  The next morning I awoke with two more bites on my face and anther twelve on my arms and legs.  I went to the front desk and was switched to the room next to my first room.  After looking up symptoms of bed bugs on my IPad. I realized bed bugs were the cause of my bites. I went back down to the front desk who confirmed that they did indeed find dead ebb bugs in the room.  Other then that they did want to give me anymore information of their findings.  They  did not want any of the
Manager Response: Dear LETHAL64,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, CA.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and 5 min to Downtown Disney
Summary: This was one of the nicer Holiday Inns I've stayed at - probably because of the location. I had a conference at Disneyland Hotel but wanted o save a bit of money and got this during spring break time for under a hundred bucks - what I thought was a good deal.  If all you're looking for is a nice room and convenient access to the resort, this will work great.  They have a restaurant at the hotel that I didn't eat at but which offers some convenience and looked decent.  There is a shuttle service that operates regularly and stops right in the parking lot of the HI - not sure what the cost is but takes the headache out of commuting to/from Disney.  There is a "resort planner" right in the lobby that can buy tickets and prepare park plans - basically listens to what you want to
Manager Response: Dear Guest Wmchale,  Thank you, for choosing Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort for your recent stay while in Anaheim. We appreciate all your feedback regarding your stay with us. I am glad to hear you enjoyed all our amenities we offer. I hope to have you stay with us again while visiting Anaheim. Thank you for your time.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Our family of four stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area for three nights over mid-winter brake in February.  We booked our mini-vacation through Southwest Airlines which I must day was a very pleasant experience and extremely easy.  When going to Disneyland I do not know if it makes sense to stay at the Disney hotels as you spend most of your time at the park anyway.  We decided to stay at the Holiday Inn because we have had good luck with their hotels in the past.  Well, this Holiday Inn is just "OK" in my opinion.  There is nothing special to it, the staff was not all that helpful let alone excited about their job and the folks pushing the Wyndham thing on you would not take no for an answer.  When I am on vacation at Disneyland, the last thing my 12 year old wants to
Manager Response: Dear Guest Eric Bellevue,  Thank you, for taking time to provide your feedback on Trip Advisor.  It is unfortunate, that we fell short of your expectations and would like to convey that we deeply apologize, that we did not meet your satisfaction! I would also like to say we have relayed these concerns as noted to the proper departments and will rectify the issues you have expressed.  Sincerely, IHG Staff

Summary: Terrible location (one way street) difficult to get to, bar and resturaunt  rarely open overpriced menu poor service, inconsistent room cleaning schedule and no complimentary coffee in the lobby or resturant, not worth the money.  Stayed in many hotels at this price range this was by far the worst......no more Hilton's for us.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Tvers,  I would like to extend my apologies to you, for your unpleasant stay. I am so sorry that our Hotel and amenities was to your dissatisfaction. I would like to convey that we have addressed these departments regarding your concerns. Thank you again for your feedback on Trip Advisor.  Sincerely, Christine L.

Summary: I am so grateful that this was the hotel chosen for my daughter's recent school performance tour in Anaheim. I accompanied the group as one of the chaperones, and we had a wonderful time. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and very accommodating throughout our entire stay.  What makes this hotel extra special, though, is that our trip could have been a disaster, but thanks to the wonderful employees at Holiday Inn, it was saved. A vital costume was left behind and needed to be Federal Expressed to the hotel - and FedEx lost the package! Jeanette, Ankur, and even the gift shop manager spent a great deal of time and effort in trying to locate the package - talking with FedEx on the phone, calling hotels to try to find the package, going above and
Manager Response: Dear Guest JulieAnne G,  I would like to thank you for all your great comments, regarding our Hotel staff. It was a pleasure, being able to help in the time of need, and we are so happy we did just that!  We were so excited, to know that you have chosen us to accomodate your lodging needs in the future!  Thank you so much for your time and we look forward to seeing you again soon!  Sincerely, Christine L.

Summary: My wife and I had booked this hotel through Priceline, and based the booking solely on the cost to us. I wasn't sure about it being so close to the 5, but was very pleased when a) there was no highway noise at all in the room, and b) the property was clean, the rooms in great shape and the beds comfortable. The only drawback is that it's a bit far from the resort area for a walk to or from in the summertime (especially with kids), but there's also an Anaheim Resort Transit station right out front, complete with pass vending machine. The ride to and from on ART is less than 10 minutes each way. For the money, it's a very good value.
Manager Response: Dear Steve C.  Thank you for your kind compliments on your stay. I am pleased to hear your stay was to your satisfaction and your accomodations were to your liking. We here at Holiday Inn Anaheim try our very best to provide a comfortable stay. Thank you again for your time and we hope to see you and your family real soon!  Thank you again, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly hotel, but REALLY LOUD
Summary: Stayed here on business for two days. Friendly staff, clean hotel but the rooms are very loud. Get a room away from the highway, or you will be up at night due to all the noise. Rooms is a very convienient location, and staff is very informative. The preferred parking is a nice additional.
Manager Response: Dear Guest  Musjn,  Thank you for your feedback on Trip Advisor. So sorry, to hear about the noise issue when staying with us. We wish we could of had the opportunity to accomodate you with another room, away from the highway. However your stay sounded like a good one, despite the highway noise. We thank you for your time to express your concerns, and hope to see you again!  Thank you for your time, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: Good stay near the Disney Resort So.Cal
Summary: We stayed in a room which had bunk beds for the kids and a queen for the adults...very fun room.  It was a kids themed room.  Very comfortable.  If you are a Priority Awards Platinum Member you receive free breakfast (member only...not family).  We liked the idea of having the "ART" (Anaheim Resort Transportation)....bus...take us to the Disney area...not free so look at the rates but much better than fighting traffic and parking your car for a fee...Back to the hotel: clean, room, great staff...did i say clean...wow...they do it rght.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Joe G.  I would like to say "Thank You", in conveying your feedback on Trip Advisor. We enjoy hearing that you and your family enjoyed their stay here with us. We were pleased to hear about your comfort in the kid's fun room. I'm so glad that you enjoyed your overall stay and really hope when coming to Anaheim you will be lodging with us again!   Thank you for your time, Christine

Summary Heading: If you live in hotels, skip this one
Summary: No traumatic experience or issue to report, but also nothing redemptive. If you're looking for a healthy meal, you not only won't find it on the premises, you won't find it nearby. The lotion in my room had been used. There are no to-go coffee cups in the rooms. I have Priority Club status, but breakfast was not included.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Jesspantano,  Thank you for your feedback on Trip-Advisor. We apologize that your stay was unsatisfactory one. I wish we could of had the chance to rectify all your concerns before you checked out. However if you ever decide to give us the opportunity to lodge with us again, I would gladly see to it that you have a great stay! Please feel free to contact me and I will be sure your stay is a good one!!  Sincerely, Management

Summary: Terrible "hotel". More like a "motel". Claims to be near disney, but is like a 8-10 mile drive. Doesn't offer a courtesy shuttle like the other "disney area" hotels. City bus charges $5 a person each way. Better off js paying for close parking at disney($15). Room was dirty, smelly, and a health risk. Popcorn on ceiling, and patchy drywall definitely not good for people with respiratory difficulties. Requested double beds. And I believe that's the size they were...a double/full. Fridge was dirty and rusty. Carpet was soiled. Whirlpool spa was filthy!! Hotel does not offer complimentary breakfast like most holiday inns. And hotel restaurant is terrible and poorly staffed. Definitely regretted my stay and will definitely do more research prior to booking. Hotel is extremely
Manager Response: Dear Guest Vcardenas4444,  Thank you for providing your comments on TripAdvisor. We do apologize for all your inconvienences you endured while staying with us. We feel just terrible that your stay was not a good one, I will pass this to my General Manager regarding all your concerns.  Thank you for your time, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: Had a good stay, for a good price!
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, Feb 20-23, 2013, while we visited Disneyland/California Adventure.  The hotel/accommodations were clean, the staff was friendly & courteous.  Our room was clean, quiet and they were able to accommodate my request- we had a view of the parks from our room!   The hotel is located just off the freeway, so it's easy access when you need to head out; however, it is a little tricky to navigate the first go around- after that it's easy!   This Holiday Inn is about 1 mile from the park, which is kind of nice, so walking isn't an option; however, if you head out early and park in the Mickey & Friends Parking structure it is worth every penny of $15. (There are trams from the structure, to the park, and back- so no long walks when you're exhausted at
Manager Response: Dear AzJodee,  Thank you for your positive feedback on your stay here with us! It's a pleasure to hear great comments on our Hotel. We try our very best to provide great hospitality to our guests who stay with us, and  it seems that we did just that. We look forward to having you stay with us again on your next vacation. Thank you again, for your time.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: Me & my Family just got back from Disneyland...This hotel is very wonderful,the staff is very friendly & they always greet you with a hello and a friendly smile,even when I went down to the front desk multiple times to ask for stuff they got it with no hesitation...The pool & hot tub very nice,our room was wonderful & the food was TASTY..We would definatly stay here again...
Manager Response: Dear Sara L  Thank you so much  for all your kinds words. It's wonderful to hear that you thourougly enjoyed all our amenities of our Hotel. We hope to see you again real soon. Thank you for providing your feedback on TripAdvisor.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: We booked this hotel for a long weekend at Disneyland with our two year old.  We had considered other properties but since it was a long weekend, many places were full or very overpriced.  My husband travels for work and stays in Holiday Inns often and is a Priority Club member so we expected a certain standard…  We drove from Phoenix and arrived late in the evening – maybe around 11:00 pm.  When we checked in, we were placed in a room with two double beds, even though we had booked over the phone and requested a King.  As soon as we entered the room, my husband called down to the front desk and spoke with a very rude woman who argued with us about what we had booked.  My husband asked for the manager was told that there was no manager this late at night and we’d need to speak
Manager Response: Dear Kathi C.  So sorry to hear about your experience you endeavored while staying with us! There are no words to express our deepest apologies for you uncomfortable stay. We will assure you that we will rectify all your concerns with the cleanliness of our rooms. Our General Manager is aware of these problems that occurred when lodging with us and will see to it all issues stated will be  addressed with our housekeeping department as well as our front desk staff. Again please accept our apologies and we do appreciate your feedback to better serve our guests with proper hospitality.   Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: Pros: Really close walk to Disneyland  Cons:  Dirty bathroom floors before we arrived Poor service-maid does not change towels even when they were put in the designated change towel area. Our dirty towels were put back and folded. Gross.  They do not replace conditioners and such.  Pillows left on floor when they feel on the floor The room has windows that can not be covered so when the sun rises...you are forced to as well  Expensive for the quality of service with better options a bit closer to Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear WorkSucks 78,  So sorry to hear about your experience when lodging with Holiday Inn. We noticed you stated you were within walking distance of Disneyland, however we are approximately 1 mile away from Disney. There is another Holiday Inn located within walking distance to  Disneyland that you must be referring to. On behalf of Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort we do apologize and thank you for you time!  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: This is a simple resort with basic rooms and a decent pool.  You can not walk to Disneyland but there is an easy bus to take to the park.  We stayed in january and the Hotel was nothing special.  The pool hours did not coincide with park hours so it was closed when we got back from the park.  The view on the front of the building is the I5 and the rear has the local trailer park. This hotel is ok if you plan just a Disney visit and a sleep here otherwise it is not a relaxing destination by any means.  Rooms are large enough with a fridge and some have only showers.  The TVs were broken when we were there and no one seemed to care which was more frustrating than anything else.
Manager Response: Dear Kettleking,  So sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. We had an unfortunate problem with signal for the Televisions, we did try our best to fix the problem ASAP, but the problem took longer to fix than antipated. We do apologize for all the inconvienences you endured while staying with us. Thank you for your time!  Take care, Christine Lovell

Summary: the rooms were clean, room service was good, staff was respectful, they checked us in early and our rooms were ready. the lady who worked at the gift shop in the lobby, sherri, was an amazing lady, one of the reasons we want to return there. she was nice to me, my wife, and my four kids. we were really impressed by the hotel service overall, and we cant wait to return back there.
Manager Response: Dear Logine H  Thank you for the kind words about our service, staff, and hospitality. We really appreciate you taking the time to post on TripAdvisor about your stay. We are so pleased to hear you will be staying with us in the future. Thank you again for your time.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: We stayed here for 7 days starting Jan 15, we got a great rate through Westjet Vacations. We didn't realize though that the beds were only doubles, very tight for 4, we had to get a rollaway for one of the kids and DH and I had to sleep in separate beds. There were no larger rooms available for upgrade. i was a little uncomfortable with being in a connecting room since they had people in the room on the other side and i could hear them, i don't think the hotel was full so they probably could have avoided putting people who aren't together in connecting rooms. Mattresses also need replacing, they are worn out and very uncomfortable. Housekeeping does a good job, rooms and hallways are cleaned daily, and they aren't loud or disruptive if you are getting a late start, one little
Manager Response: Dear Guest Friesj,  So sorry to hear about the disappointment you endeavored while staying with us! I apologize for all and any inconvenience that your family had. I wish that we would of known of these issues so that we may have had the chance to rectify any problems that you were having so that your stay was more comfortable. Again, we here at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort apologize and hope you will give us another opportunity to stay with us again. Please feel free to contact me if your planning to stay with us and I will make sure your accommodations are met. Thank you for your time.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: We were travelling to Disneyland with our two young grandsons.  We really were not expecting the great room...separate from the adult bed/tv area, the kids had a set of bunk beds and a tv with an Xbox.  They were pooped at night from the parks but sleeping was a lot easier in their own special space.  The pool was large and heated.  The restaurant was good and the staff at the restaurant and the hotel were very friendly.  Bus service was quick, inexpensive and easy to catch from the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Steve H.  It's nice to hear about your great stay with us. We try our best to provide a comfortable setting for the families on the go. I am pleased to hear about your grand kids enjoying their own space and especially yours. We do hope you will visit us again in the future, and again thank you for all your great feedback on TripAdvisor.   Thank you, Christine Lovell

Summary: Overall a very decent resort Hotel property. My wife, I and two kids (7 & 9) stayed here for 7-nights in Jan 2013. First this Hotel is certainly clean, quiet and comfortable and the entire staff are friendly, competent and helpful...especially Arturo in the restaurant (he was excellent). We used this hotel as a base for a week at Disneyland, however without a car; this hotel is difficult to operate from. The location is 'akward' and on a dead end stretch of Manchester Blvd, not near (walkable) any stores or restaurants. We had already planned on driving to DL everyday, so I did not use the Anaheim ART (Resort Transit) on this trip. we could see DL from our room and watched the fireworks two nights from out of our window on the 7th floor...that is always fun.   Pro's: Excellent
Manager Response: Dear Guest Mathmattx,  Thank you so much for your great comments you posted on TripAdvisor! We always endeavor to meet and exceed our guest's expectations. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your positive experience at our property. Hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: Easy to catch the bus to the park, but not in walking distance to grocery stores etc. My kids enjoyed the kids suite which had their bunk separated from our bed by a wall and they had their own TV. Service was fine and food was what I came to expect from most US hotels (just okay).
Manager Response: Dear Guest TannyDD,  I am pleased to hear your stay was satisfactory. I wish it could of been outstanding instead. However when visiting us again please let us know and we will make sure your stay is a great one. Thank you for your time.   Thank you, Christine Lovell

Summary: From the arrival we were taken care of by Vanessa at the front desk. She helped out a ton when we had to add my mother in law last minute to our room.  The restaurant was great every morning. They provided great help for us when my daughter had a seizure and threw up one morning. Was very grateful for them and the housekeeping staff the whole trip for the help they provided with my daughter having some episodes. Liked the fact that this was far enough away from the park that we didnt hear nightly events at Disney. Good chance that when we travel out to Disneyland next time that we would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear MrBfromSLC,  We appreciate your kind compliments on our front desk agent "Vanessa". She is really great with our guests and goes above and beyond the call of duty, as well as all our front desk staff!  We also want to thank you for all your great feedback and helpful tips, We here at Holiday Inn are really glad to hear that your overall stay was a great one! Thank you again for your time.  Thank you again, Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Quiet b/c it's farther from the park
Summary: The hotel is quiet since it's away from the park which is nice. However, the hotel is away from the park which is a little of a pain since you have to pay for the shuttle (in my opinion should be included).  Room service REALLY FAST and nice, but the food was hit and miss.  The maid service was not great - they changed sheets and towels but didn't wipe down anything (we were there 5 days).  Room has fridge which is nice.  The beds are pretty small but comfortable with lots of pillows. We had a great view of fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: Dear Rudigm,  Thank you for your time in providing your feedback on your stay with us. We do try our best to provide excellent service. I would just like to take the time to let you know that if you do decide to stay with us again, we promise to correct all the mishaps that occurred when you stayed with us. Please feel free to call and ask for "Christine Lovell" I will get with our team to make sure your stay is to your satisfaction!! I hope to hear from you again, thank you for your time.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: began my stay january 2 thru the 5 2013
Summary: I found the hotel to be standard, typical Holiday Inn amenities.  Very clean, very polite staff, and clean spacious rooms, what i didn't like was the use of the lobby computer - 5$ for 5 minutes with extra charges for printing.   I needed a computer really quickly and found that price to be eye opening, then I loved it when my son called me from the hotel room to my cell phone .... less that 10 secs and $4.35!!!  ouch... I should him the price and made him pay me back.  Bus system to Disneyland was good, parking free!!! so overall the hotel was standard and nothing to jump and down about.  I will Never go to Disneyland during a holiday again, but thats another review...
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Maddogron,  Thanks so much for providing feedback on TripAdvisor.  I am glad to hear that your overall stay was a good one, I do apologize for the cost of the lobby computer and the charge for the phone. However to my understanding your visit was a comfortable one, for the future when you are staying with us again I will be more than happy to print any documents you need for free. Just ask for me "Christine" and I would be more than happy to assist you.  Thank you, Christine Lovell

Summary: This is one of the cleanest Holiday Inns I have ever been in.  The bed, bedding and room can be characterized as almost luxurious, and very clean.  There are minor inconveniences, such as when you open the closet door, non of the recessed lights are positioned properly for you to see inside the closet well, and the safe is right in the middle of the closet, making it impossible to hang your clothes.  Also, the hotel provides washing machines and dryers, but only on the 9th floor, and there are only three machines.  One was broken, and the other two were filthy.  The restaurant is decent, though the service is inconsistent.  We got lucky and had an excellent waitress serve us our breakfast most of the time we were there.  The price of the buffet breakfast is very reasonable, and
Manager Response: Dear Funklady9999  We apologize that some of the hotel amenities did not meet your satisfaction. We will be sure to inform our staff about these minor inconveniences that you encountered while staying with us.  In retrospect we are glad that the restaurant was able to provide you with great service. Hopefully the next time you come down to visit us the weather will be suitable for you to be able to enjoy our pool area.   Christine Lovell

Summary: We were here for just one night and were very happy.  We had a suite that was lovely.  Breakfast was great value.  Can recommend this one for a good place to stay and 10mins from Disneyland. It was also very clean.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa B  We are glad that you were able to fully enjoy your stay in just one night. We try and make the hotel as comfortable as possible for our guests, and hope to see you back soon.   Christine Lovell

Summary: We stayed at this hotel in July 2010. Pool and hot tub were great. Room and beds were great. Our room overlooked the pool and hot tub. Free parking and free internet. Only thing missing is free breakfast :). Little store located in lobby is very small and hardly had anything. They did, however, have Dramamine which I was in need of! Quiet hotel. Front desk was more than happy to help with whatever we called down for. Staying here again January 2013!
Manager Response: Dear C C  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. We are glad to hear that you had a comfortable stay and that our hotel amenities where able to make your stay that much better. We take pride in our customer service and guest satisfaction, and we can not wait to have you back this new year!   Christine Lovell

Summary: We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland over Halloween 2012 and booked with a WestJet Vacations Deal. The price was great, so we weren't expecting much. We were happy to find that the hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant was good, and the prices were quite affordable with the kids eat free menu. The pool and hot tub were clean and easily accessible. On the downside, our room backed on to the highway construction, so it could get a little noisy in the mornings. But since we weren't in our room much, (up early and home late) it didn't bother us. The only other downside was that it was a bit farther from Disneyland than we had expected - not in walking distance, so we had to use the ART to get to and from the park. This proved to
Manager Response: Dear Guest Liz D  It was a pleasure having you stay with us, and hear you enjoyed your lodging experience. We do very much appreciate your feedback to better serve our guests, we take great pride in providing excellent service. Thank you again for your time.  Sincerely Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort

Summary: We stayed over the 2012 spring break week, and the hotel was not as crowded, the room was clean, it had a small fridge which was use very useful to store juices and water. Everyday we had clean towels and sheets from the house keeping staff; the pool and hot tub were clean and with good temperature settings. The restaurant was ok but over price. The gift shop was almost empty but the attendant recommended two good restaurants for in room delivery. If you are staying for more than 3 days with kids like us, make use of the supermarket (Vons) only a five minutes drive from the hotel, the front desk gave us good directions on how to get there, we bought everything we needed for an excellent breakfast. Like I said the fridge will come handy.
Manager Response: Dear NicaFeroz,  Thank you for your feedback on Trip Advisor. It's great to hear that you stay was a comfortable one. It is great to hear our ammendities

Summary: we found this hotel very good (booked trough Get Away Today at very good rates), the only comment was the drapes were not ably to be pulled in the room but privacy was not a concern on the 6th floor but the room was light. Breakfast was good with friendly staff and location to disneyland was fine using the shuttles. Friendly Staff would happily return
Manager Response: Dear David I  First of all , I would like to thank you for taking the time to write to us. Please accept our apology for the inconvenience you experienced while staying with us. I assure you that if we would of known of this we would of corrected the problem right away. However I am pleased to hear your overall experience was a great one!  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: Stayed one night and got a good good for a fair price. Spacious and clean. Customer care was very good and kind to give us what we asked for. It's very close to the park and there is plenty to do besides that.
Manager Response: Dear John L  Thank you for your response on your stay with us. It's a nice feeling to hear you your stay was enjoyable. I am pleased to also hear about the great hospitality you were given. We look forward to serving you again while your in town.  Thank you, Christine Lovell

Summary: We stayed two nights during our quick trip to Disneyland during Thanksgiving break. The hotel was easy to find off the freeway, and conveniently located within walking distance of Disneyland. Since our main goal was to go to the parks, we did not use many of the hotel's facilities. I don't believe the hotel offered a free breakfast. We ate dinner there one night and were fairly underwhelmed with both the food and the service. The restaurant was pretty empty even during a busy holiday period, so maybe it just doesn't get much business because it is so close to the park and other restaurants in the area. The room itself was clean and serviceable. The hotel is average. We did not mind a 15 minute walk to the park (yes, even with a 4 year old in tow), so we thought the hotel was
Manager Response: Dear Dcresource,  Thanks for your time to let us know how your stay with us was. It's nice to hear that you enjoyed your stay and everything was to your liking. We here at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort try to give the best hospitality, comfort and conveniences

Summary Heading: can still taste the hot tub....maria birrell
Summary: we stayed for 4 nights  and if we come back i'm not sure if we would stay here again. the staff were very helpful and friendly nothing wrong with the service  the restaurant was very good excellent staff and service we never ate the same thing twice so great selection.  pool and hot tub had scum around the waterline I and my 6 yr old son got sick the day before we left with cough , fever, chills . when i got back to canada i found out it was bacteria and i could still taste the water from the hot tub. 2 courses of antibiotics, 2 ventalin puffers, 1 yeast and thrush infection 2 trips to ER and 1 month off work. not happy memories
Manager Response: Dear Exbellmaria,  Thank you for your feedback on your stay with us, we do want to say we deeply regret for you getting ill on your vacation. It really is unfortunate that your vacation was not a great one. We do sincerely want to say sorry and hope in the future you would change your thought about staying at  Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort.  Thank You, Guest Relations

Summary: We were booking in this hotel by our travel agent as part of a fly-stay cruise we were on. The hotel is quite nice, and well kept with both the public facilities and rooms nice. Our room was situated on the 3rd level facing north-west out towards the highway/freeway that is across the street. At first I thought this was a let down due to the traffic noise. The noise on the first night (a Tuesday night) was VERY loud, added with the lack of curtains (there was only a lace curtain and ornamental drapes (they weren't able to be closed or pulled over) which meant our room was lit up to everyone in the hotel next door and nice and bright when the sun was up) to even try and block the noise out. However the next night there was no noise at all. The restaurant,  American Brasserie
Manager Response: Dear RachelAust,  Thank you for your reply on Trip Advisor. I do want to apologize about the curtain not completely closing, but assure you if we were made aware of the issue, we would of corrected the problem immediately! I was so pleased to read about all the great reviews on the Restaurant and how well you enjoyed the food. We try our very best to provide great hospitality and comfort and hope we will see you again soon on your next vacation to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Guest Relations

Summary Heading: Was pleasantly surprised by this hotel!
Summary: We decided to do a "cheap" trip to Disneyland to see the holiday decor. As part of that, we booked this hotel through Priceline. One our bid was affected, I got very nervous about the reviews as I'm quite a snobby traveler. We often stay in high-end boutique hotels and I'm really picky about linens and bedding.   However, after arriving and inspecting our room, I was pleasantly surprised! Our room was appointed with two double beds, a cabinet with a television, and a table with two chairs. The room itself could not have been cleaner! It was spotless in terms of actual cleanliness. I usually go around the room with my own lysol and clorox wipes, wiping down random things, and there was little to no dirt on my wipes at this hotel. The stress of the hotel lifted off my shoulders
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie C  Thanks for your honest feedback, it really helps when guests provide corrective critisim

Summary Heading: very good for the price you pay
Summary: we got a real bargin, due to the fact the pool and hot tub are closed.  staff very friendly. rooms clean, beds comfy, fridge, coffee pot, tv, free wii fii , what more do you need. Also the ART bus stops right out font the hotel. You can buy your bus pass right out front the hotel as well.. Take teh 12 to disney land, runs every 20 mins give or take. Take the 19 from hotel to take you to the close mall , good shopping and lots of eats.  look up art online,  pay the cash for a weeks pass and use the bus and save your feet the walking  no bed bugs not walking distance to disney
Manager Response: Dear Galvatronic,  So sorry to hear that you were inconvienced while staying with us, do to our annual renovation. However we do appreciate hearing about your comfortable stay in our rooms. We do try our very best to provide comfort to everyone. I am so glad to hear you also enjoyed the ART bus and it was to your liking. We would like to say thank you for your feedback on Tripadvisor.   Happy Holidays from Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort

Summary: We booked this on Priceline, and we felt like we got what we expected. The room was clean and comfortable, had a big fridge, and a walk-in shower. This hotel seems Ideal for large families and it appears that it gets alot of traffic. The pool area was closed for renovations, but it rained all day the day we were there. This hotel is kind of out of the way for dining, there is a restaurant onsite, but it never had anyone in it when we passed by.  Buy the ART passes for $5 a day and leave your car parked. They drop you off 100 yds from the parks, and run every 20 minutes or so.
Manager Response: Dear Baton Rouge Bunny,  Thanks for your responding on Tripadvisor about your stay with us. We apologize for the untimily yearly renovation to our pool area. We  do hope you will stay with us again while in town to experience our new pool deck. We are pleased that you enyoyed yourself while staying with us.  Happy Holidays Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort

Summary: We were there for 8 days. We had a really good experience. The beds were nice and everything was pretty clean. After I booked the hotel I read horrible reviews and did not know what to expect. As soon as I got to the hotel, I told the lady at the front desk about the reviews. She explained to me that there were a couple of Holiday inn in the area and that most of the reviews were for the other ones. I loved the location it was close enough to Disney (not walking distance) and it was close enough to LA and other attractions that we wanted to visit. The restaurant is pretty good. This hotel does not include breakfast and their breakfast buffet is around $13 which is not bad at all and they have a great variety. It was a great experience over all. The only thing was that the carpet
Manager Response: Dear Johana P.  I would like to say thank you for the great review. I am glad you enjoyed your stay,  Holiday inn strives for excellence! Each guest response helps us with our goal of excellence, we need to find out what we can improve on as far a guest satisfaction as well as suggestions. Thank you once again and hope you stay at Holiday Inn in the future.  Happy Holidays- Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort

Summary: When I called the lady said the kids suite was the way to go- bigger nicer room ect.  BS!!!!!  The room is so cramped the bunk beds are so uncomfortable and small a child can hardly roll over not to mention the double bed for mom and dad.  Its a chip board animal painted divider to separate the bunks from the rest of the room and its gaudy as ever! I have long hair and it was still in the tub after the maid was in.
