The taps were Shiney  though!  They never actually made my sons bed. Just threw the covers back up over it and never straightened the sheets out!  They were crumpled at the foot of the bed!!  The toilet ran constantly and actually overflowed at one point!!  Gross!!!!  The TVs are from the dinosaur ages as well as the air conditioner units!  The pool was closed for our
Manager Response: Dear Travelbug20121,   Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. Please accept my apologies for falling short of your expectations. Your comments about the conditions of our hotel has been documented and will certainly be looked into.  We take the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and  work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences.   If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: The hotel was 5 - 10 minutes from Disneyland. You first need to take the public transit bus or a cab going to some places. The hotel has one restaurant but there's no nearby restaurants. And those are the downside of this hotel. The staffs are knowledgeable, helpful, kind and friendly. The room and bathroom were clean and spacious. They have free Wi-Fi and complimentary breakfast. Overall our experience was good. I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Dan0922,  I would like to thank you for staying with us while in Anaheim. Its a great feeling to know that we provided great hospitality! Your feedback about our Hotel was very satisfying and it is AWESOME to know you will come stay with us again. Happy Holidays to you and yours.  From all of us at Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort

Summary: The room was a big one. very specious. I was very dissapointed of the housekeepin. They didn't have daily housekeeping. I had to request to get someone to clean our bathroom, replace towels etc. It seemed like they were always short staff. We stayed 4 nights during our disneyland trip shuttle was very conveniet. overall didn't worth the money we paid.
Manager Response: Dear Anjula75,  Thank you for posting your review, we appreciate your taking the time to let us know about your visit. I will be discussing  these concerns with the Housekeeping Department to ensure all linens are in the room upon check-in and detailed cleaning is done!   Thank you and Happy Holidays, Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Not walking distance to Disneyland or anywhere
Summary: When I booked this reservation I called to ask about proximity to Disney. I was told it was "across the street" and "easy walking distance to Disney."  NOT! it is close to I-5, requires using the ART public transit bus $5.00 per day per adult, $3.00 per child. The bus runs every 30-35 minutes and often filled up before all the hotel passengers were on. They had to wait for the next bus. I was so disappointed, having expected I could walk easily.  During November the weather is foggy in the morning, very warm in the afternoon, and very "cool"  in the evening(I'm from CA so I would call it cold in the evening, but since other travelers were swimming in the pool at 10 p.m. I learned I am obviously more sensitive to cold than most). Not being able to get back to the hotel easily you
Manager Response: Dear family2shop4,  I would like to  apologize  to you and your family for a not so great stay!  We do try our best to provide excellent service to our guests. We unfortunately did not meet your expectations. I will voice your concerns to the General Manager regarding all the issues you have provided. Thank you again for your time.  SIncerely, Guest Relation Manager

Summary: We booked about 16 rooms total for a trip we took last week. We had a large group of over 30 people coming to Disneyland. We work with people with developmental disabilities and you can imagine the challenges we faced in finding the perfect hotel that would accomadate all of our folks with their wheelchairs, scooters, etc. We needed handicapped and adjoining rooms and were booking for 6 days. Annette A. went above and beyond to help me with everything we needed the entire time. Not only was she there to help with the million questions I had along the way, she went as far as to send me maps of the hotel floors, and rooms so that we could make sure everyone was in the rooms that fit their needs and close to their staff. The rest of the staff at the hotel were amazing also. We
Manager Response: Dear Ashleigh G.  We are so very pleased to hear about your stay with us while in town. It is good to hear that our Sales Manager Annette A. went above and beyond the call of duty to assist you with all your needs!!   Thank you once again for your great feedback .    Thank You Management

Summary: I really wish I had somehting better to say... check in was fine room cleanliness and over all product was poor, very disappointing and extremely frustrating. After checking into our room it was one cleanliness issue after another. Our concerns were addressed and well recieved but the issues we had to bring to their attention should have never been an issue to begin with. We unfortunatly will not be returning to this hotel which is really to bad as all the staff we were in contact with from Front Desk to Housekeeping to Maintenance to the Resturaunt (with the exception of the gift shop lady) were super freindly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear BigDTrain,  So sorry to hear your stay was not to your liking! We do apologize for your stay not being a pleasant one. It is unfortunate, but  we do try our best in ensure our guests are comfortable and content. I will be addressing your concerns with my General Manager and we thank you for your time in expressing your concerns.  Sincerely, Guest Relations

Summary: I was in this Hotel two weeks ago and found it perfectly pleasent, i was on a tour so only stayed a couple of nights but it was adequate for what i needed..If you,re a family with kids its close to Disney and there are regular shuttle buses to get you around.
Manager Response: Dear Samab_11,  Thank you for your kind comments on Trip Advisor.  It was a pleasure, reading your feedback and knowing your stay was enjoyable! We were also pleased to hear that  ART transportation helped out with assisting you on your journey to Disneyland. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.  Thank you, Christine L.

Summary: I booked this hotel on Hotwire.  That's always a crap-shoot, and I had thought I came out on the losing end with this hotel after I read the reviews here on Tripadvisor.  However, since my expectations were low, my overall experience at the hotel and the immediate area was not bad at all and I have no major gripes with this Holiday Inn.  I do have a gripe with Hotwire, however. But that is stuff for another review...  My wife, two teenage boys and I had an above average 3-night stay in early October.  This is our 7th or 8th time in Anaheim and we've stayed at properties like Candy Cane Inn, Paradise Pier, and Hyatt Regency in the past, and I cannot rate this experience at the Holiday Inn much lower.  I would rate the property as average on an objective scale; however, I'm sure
Manager Response: Dear Radman,  We would like to thank you for your stay with us while in Anaheim. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. We appreciate the feedback we receive and welcome corrective criticism. Thank you again for your time.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary: I am completely grossed out!! We found bed bugs in our bed room 827. The first night my daughter's said there was a bug in their bed and I ignored them.  The next night there was a bug in our bed. I looked bed bugs up on the Internet and it was an exact match!!! I took a picture of it as proof.  The management moved us to another room and we stripped the beds and found no bugs BUT there was a jug stain on the mattress that is brown like a blood stain!  I am contacting Getaway Today in the morning since I booked through them and I want my $$ back!
Manager Response: Dear 09181975,  I want to generally apologize to your family for the issue with this most hated creature around! Unfortunately, we ran into this problem during your stay and sincerely want to let you know that we have addressed the issue. Again our sincere apology to your family for this unfortunate mishap, I hope the rest of your vacation was great.   Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: Hotel has gone down hill over the years
Summary: On our trip on September 13-14, 2012 the first room we entered smelled of smoke and was dirty so we called the front desk who agreed to change our room. Rather than send up a bellhop to help us move from one room to another I was asked to bring our entire luggage for our family of four back down to the lobby where I was then issued a key for a new room which I then had to take our luggage up to. At no time during my initial check-in or subsequent room change was I offered help with my luggage either by a person or even with a cart, nor did it seem out of the norm for the front desk employees to receive a complaint about a room and just switch you to another one; no apologies for the inconvenience in any way.  Somebody in your staff could have simply acknowledged our
Manager Response: Dear Suzi M.  Sorry to hear your stay wasn't too your satisfaction. We do try our best to provide comfort and great lodging needs for our guests. Unfortunately, we fell a little short to your expectations. I will pass along these issues and concerns to my General Manager. Thank you again for your time.  Thank you  Christine Lovell

Summary: hotel was okay. the people that work there are wonderful. bathtub is very shallow and shower is weak.there is a predator in the lobby that will attack you as soon as you walk in. often at the door to the lobby and try to sell you time share. after a seven hour drive that was not a pleasant introduction to the hotel. would have left on the spot if we did not already pay for our stay.  Location=no shops near by or other restaurants to go to. once you are back , you are back. will i return? not to that hotel.the staff is wonderful again. but no...i will not return
Manager Response: Dear Tucsonfran guest  Thank you for taking time to write your review. I do apologize for your inconvenience you and your family endured while entering our lobby of  the Hotel. I would like to give my sincere apology for your unsatisfactory stay here with us. We are continually  working on striving to improve the services and facilities that we offer our guests.  Again, please accept my sincere apologies for your uncomfortable stay.  Sincerely, Christine Lovell Administative Assistant  Sincerely, Christine Lovell Administrative Assistant

Summary: We stayed here for two nights while going to Disneyland and I don't believe we would ever stay again unless it was a last resort.  Very run down motel, it was clean but not the normal HI standard that I am use to staying in. Walls had marks on them,  bath tub has rust around it, beds were hard and small (double beds instead of normal Queen size)  Not the kind of place you want to go back to after being at Disneyland all day and very tired.  Motel needs a complete remodel
Manager Response: Dear Robin R.  Thank you for your time in providing us with your feedback on our hotel. I would first like to apologize to you and your family for your unpleasant stay. I am certainly disappointed that your stay was not to your satisfaction. I will definitely pass this vital information to my Management Team in regards to your concerns. Thank you again for your time.  Christine Lovell Administrative Assistant

Summary: Jeanette and Vanessa at reception were so nice. I was in the midst of a grueling work travel week, and so I was exhausted. They were very friendly and helpful. Just the right balance of fun, funny, and efficient to get me in my room, with dinner plans and directions, quickly and with a smile on my face. My room was very clean and comfortable - nice work space, good view. Everything was excellent for a business traveler. I cannot commend Jeanette and Vanessa enough. Because of their great demeanor, I will choose this hotel again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Guest (Business T.)   I would like to thank you for your feedback regarding your stay here with us. We are very pleased you enjoyed our helpful,friendly staff (Jeanette and Vanessa). We strive to ensure great hospitality, and for our guest to have a pleasant stay. I would like to thank you again for choosing Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort for your lodging needs.   Thank you, Christine Lovell Administrative Assistant

Summary: Ended up with a room via Priceline.   Room was clean.  Not much in walking distance, so if you need a base while visiting Disneyland, that may be the only reason to stay here.  The Anahein resort shuttle stops at this hotel, so you don't have to drive to the park.  One odd thing:   There was a guy at a desk in the lobby zestfully trying to rope us in to a timeshare sales pitch.
Manager Response: Dear Joef999  I would like to thank you for staying with us, but wish it could of been a better one. We strive to provide great hospitality for all our guests. Unfortunately, we did not meet your expectations. I will pass along the information to our Management team about your concerns. Thank you again for taking time out to write your review.  Thank you, Christine Lovell Administrative Assistant

Summary: After booking this hotel, I read some reviews and became worried. Checking in was quick, and I did ask for a higher floor room to get away from the highway noise. You should know they are constructing a new on-ramp and you can not escape the noise! The first room had a disgusting rotton, rusted bathtub. The second room had the tub replaced with a shower only, better but still had black mold on all corners and edges. Our bathroom sink was cracked, three huge full lenght cracks. We stayed in a kids room with the bunk beds that were so narrow a child over 6 would be squished! The fact that a "kids suite" didn't have a tub, didn't make much sense. The dark hotel carpet must have been filthy because are socks and feet were black! We went to use the pool and hot tub, but they were
Manager Response: Dear Laurie K.  First of all, I would really like to apologize for your discomfort while staying with us. I am so sorry to hear about your overall experience was not  to your satisfaction. I want to let you know I will share all these  important suggestions with our  Management team so that we may improve our overall amenities. Again my deepest apologies  to you and your family!   Sincerely,  Christine Lovell Administrative Assistant

Summary: We stayed here 4 nights for our Disneyland vacation.  It was wonderful!  The rooms were clean and nice.  The separate kids room was ideal to have more personal space, plus it came with an extra bed so all 3 of our kids could have a place to sleep. The mini fridge was huge and there were ample cupboards so we brought a lot of our own food. The staff was helpful and friendly.  The free included hot breakfast was fantastic! (But be aware, they do add an automatic 15% tip for what you would have paid.  But it was well worth it to pay $5 for 5 people to have such a nice breakfast each morning.) The only downside is that it is far enough from Disney that you must drive or use the shuttle, but we used the ART shuttle and it was just fine.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Suzanne S.  Thank you for taking time to post your comments on TripAdvisor. It was nice to hear you enjoyed your stay here with us   I am pleased to hear about our friendly staff and great food. I do apologize for the distance to your destination, but was happy to hear the ART Shuttle took good care of you.  By you providing your feedback it helps us to improve on making our Hotel a great place to bring your family. I look forward to hearing from you again.  Thank you again, Christine Lovell Administrative Assistant

Summary: worst hotel I've stayed at.... the staff are unhelpful and  so rude.   if you want to turn on the aircondition unit in your room make sure you have advil...it is soo loud impossible to have it on and sleep.   we had  someone on our floor smoking something... we called down to the front desk and then followed up.  their response was we couldn't smell it....I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.   and it is far from the park.  the resturant staff are even worst.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback regarding our hotel. I do apologize on behalf of our hotel, and wish your stay with us could have been a great one.  I wanted to assure you that I will acting on your feedback regarding  these issues you have addressed. Once again please accept my apologies and I do hope in the future you could experience the hotel as it was meant to be.  Thank you Christine Lovell

Summary: We stayed there last week.  We started off with a Kid Suite.  The furniture was falling apart and had missing pieces. The room had a horrible odor like it had water damage. The bathroom had broken tiles on the floor and a sink with a crack down it. The room was very small, they took a standard room and put up a partition to make the kids area.  The kids beds are very narrow.  Our first morning we woke up to find that our refridgerator had a trail of ants in it and also on the countertop above.  We complained to the staff (which was very unfriendly) and they ended up putting us in a wheel chair accesible room with a roll away bed.  The shower had a lot of mold growing.  One thing is for sure we will NEVER stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Leslie S,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: we stayed here as part of a fantastic coach tour of california. Unfortunatley the resturant was in chaos on both nights. Shortage, of staff and trying to hoist a luke warm buffet as an alternative to waiting for a freshly cooked meal, made us go elsewhere. Also keep an eye on your valubles and dont leave them in your room.

If it weren't for the location, I would've rate the hotel as a 4 out of 5 (as there were a few updates needed, nothing major - just an update in some wall paper and the couches in the lobby) but we hardly let that kind of thing ruin our holiday unlike some travelers.  We just got back today (September 19th) from a week here. Check in was really quick and the staff were very friendly. All 6 of us (2 to a room) asked for king beds but we all got 2 beds instead - oh well, I definitely don't mind having my own room to sleep lol. Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable, view was of construction and a trailer park - but I can hardly blame them for something like that. I was surprised that there was no bath tub though since this is a family area - not a problem for a few couples

My wife and I stayed there for the first time this past weekend; this is most definitely NOT a resort given its location on a one-way street next to the Santa Ana Freeway .  The desk staff was friendly and the lobby and public areas clean and attractive.  The room was another thing altogether.  We were placed in a handicap access room and although the hotel is non-smoking, someone didn't tell other guests on our floor.  At least one room we walked by clearly smelled of smoke.  Being placed in handicap access meant a larger than normal room, but one with no place to sit other than on the bed or a desk chair.  The television was an old, dying 19" analog in an area where every hotel in the area now has a modern flat screen.  PIllows were weird little things marked "soft" and "firm"
Manager Response: Dear DisneyTraveler25,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Ferdinand G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The bathroom was in need of updating. There was plumbing tape around the shower head which also had mildew on it. During the middle of the night our outdated air conditioner went nuts and sounded like a plane was landing in our room so we had to turn it off. We had to leave the pool area because a bunch of 20 somethings came down drinking and being loud. We didn't get the "free" breakfast because we booked through a third party site. We let the front desk know our concerns and they were nice and apologized but did nothing.
Manager Response: Dear RRed42,  Thank you for your feedback. Guest comfort and satisfaction are of the utmost concern to us and our hotel is committed to making every possible effort to provide comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. I'm sorry to hear that you experienced inconvenience due to the conditions of your bathroom and our air conditioner. Please accept our sincere apologies about the noise. Though I would prefer you had a better experience at our hotel, I would like to thank you for sharing your thoughts as this is our best resource for improving guest services.  Sincerely,   Lera M Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: The staff was friendly and helpful, the restaurant was decent (breakfast), but the room was a little weird. There was just one towel rack on the bathrrom wall, and no shower curtain, so no rod to hang wet stuff on. We had wet bathing suits, wet fitness center clothing, and wet towels. The shower was a walk-in, 90-degree shower with no curtain or door. The room itself was a funky design, with the main door almost hitting the bathroom door if it was left open. Then there were closet doors to walk around before getting to the main part of the room.  Some items, including pictures and the bed headboard, were covering up patches and renovations on the walls. One picture was about three-and-a-half feet up from the floor to cover a patch job. If we had known about the ART buses to get
Manager Response: Dear jmsab23,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our property. I am pleased you liked our helpful hotel staff and breakfast. Please allow me to apologize for the inconvenience and negative impression you may have during your stay due to the interior of the room and condition of the bathroom. We work very hard to ensure our quality and services are superior. It sounds like we fell below your expectations. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously. Rest assured that these issues will be looked into.   We hope to get the chance of hosting you again and show you the improvements made.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHG Care

Summary Heading: Unexpected below avarage stay at Holiday İnn
Summary: Room is very old style and seems that the hotel never been renovated since the opening.. We shocked by the old TV and the bathroom full of stains and cracks at many places.. When we booked this hotel we thought thatwe will enjoy the stay but seems that this was just a dream

Summary Heading: Great stay with one minor hiccup
Summary: We have been to Anaheim multiple times over the years and came here with no intention of doing the Disney or Universal theme parks. As others have mentioned, the Anaheim Resort Transport stops on the property. Depending on how many there are in your group this may well work out cheaper than parking at places like Disney.  I notice that a couple of other reviewers have commented that it is not really close to the local shops and restaurants. I would agree with this (we had rented a car).  Overall the stay was absolutely fine apart from:  The computers in the lobby were not working (not a major issue as I have a smart phone and they provide free Wi-Fi) so when I wanted to print off a booking confirmation I went next door to the Staybridge Suites that is part of the same site (as

The biggest issue we had with this hotel was our room. The cleanliness was terrible. We actually found a hair brush as well as a used kleenex in the hotel room when we checked in. Our entire floor stunk of smoke. We complained to front desk and they said they had temp cleaning staff in and apologized. It is a pain to take the shuttle to the park. Personally we were much happier when we stayed at hotels closer to  the park main gate. I would never recommend or stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear maggie286,  Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay with us. We work very hard to ensure our facilities and service are superior and we strive to be the best Holiday Inn around. It sounds like we fell below your expectations especially on cleanliness, poor housekeeping and poor shuttle service. We will address these points and I hope when you return you will see the improvements made. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: not a safe place to stay, belongings got stolen!
Summary: We placed our spare shoes in a plastic bag, left for disneyland and when we came back in the afternoon, the bag is nowhere to be found! We searched high and low for it but we never found it, we complained to the people in the front desk and to the manager the following day,yeah they said they'll investigate but we didn't feel the concern, we just lost material things which probably costs about $200, it's not about the worth of shoes but the emotional impact it gave to my family, my son was devastated because his favorite jordan shoes was in the bag. It was traumatizing experience to us and I hope they realize it. We'll never stay in that hotel again and God bless to the person who took it.

Not a bad hotel, relatively quite although some residents would do well to realise that there are other residents in the hotel who don't wish to be woken up in the early hours with screaming and shouting. Air con in the room was very noisy so we didn't have it on during the night. Buffet breakfast was reasonable value for money but the restaurant should be open for longer hours. Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Hotel is rather dated and in need of an internal facelift.

I came to California with a tour group and we stayed at Holiday Inn due to the price. The location was rubbish! Unless you're getting the shuttle bus to Disney you will be bored. We only stayed the one night and stop off point on the way to San Diego. The room was clean and breakfast wasn't bad. The hotel shop was basically unattended, half of the things unpriced and when we wanted to pay, the receptionist just said "leave it on the counter" - good thing we didn't need change!   Also, although our fault, we left our coats behind. When we rang to say could you FedEx it to our next hotel in Vegas (and saying we would pay whatever the price!) they made a real issue of it! It was crap customer service. Here we were saying we would pay anything to get our coats back, all you need to
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca_Lobb,  Thank you for writing a review of our hotel. I am glad that our room accommodations were satisfactory to your needs. Please accept my sincerest apology for any inconvenience the staff may have caused. I will follow up with the staff to ensure similar incidents could be avoided.  Again, I do apologize and regret that this impacted your experience at our hotel.  Sincerely,  Pam G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Hotel staff not friendly. I didn't feel welcome at hotel. Not once did the hotel staff smile. Buffet breakfast at hotel was cold numerous times. I informed them about that but nothing changed every morning. Our room wasn't  comfy as it stunck of smoke! Also there was soap left in shower from previous hotel guest when we arrived in room and a kid scribbled on wall in room. Will not stay at hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear Mim2510,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns regarding your stay with us. We strive every day to create special experiences one guest at a time and I am truly sorry we did not manage this for your stay. Please accept my sincere apology for the shortcomings you experienced during your stay and regret the service you received from our staff fell below your expectations. I have taken note and wish to thank you for all your valuable comments. These are of great importance to us and allow us to monitor and improve our service continually.  Sincerely,  Joel B Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I arrived with email confirmation for a king suite.  Received a queen bed with horrible mattress and pillows.  Desk clerk suggested I try the sofa bed.  Next to noisy freeway construction.  Restaurant closed at 10 so no after park snacking.  Bacon at breakfast crumbled into bits.  No preference offered for priority member with 100+ visits/year.  Huge disappointment
Manager Response: Dear elizabeth u,  Thank you for your being a Priority Club Member and for leaving us a feedback about your stay. We are deeply sorry we fell below your expectations.  Our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product and for this reason your comments are very troubling and will certainly be looked into. We’d like to obtain some additional details regarding your experience, so we have sent you a private message.    We look forward to hearing back from you soon.  Sincerely,   Janice A.  Case Manager  IHG Care

Summary: The hotel is close to Disney Land, however, not a walking distance. There is a public shuttle bus at USD 4 per person per day.  Free Parking.  I had a confirmed reservation through booking.com 3 weeks ahead, however, I reached the hotel and found that it’s fully sold-out and I had no room to stay! … A bit shocking (especially that I reached the hotel at 11:30 pm after a long flight and was desperate to sleep). Fortunately they made arrangements at the nearby Sheraton for 1 night which was a much worse hotel.   The morning-shift staff was courteous and refunded me for the 1 night after the trouble they caused me when I was checking-in.  Breakfast buffet is terrible, however, the only resort to have a meal in the morning since there is nothing around the hotel except Disney.  The
Manager Response: Dear se7s,  Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay with us. We work very hard to ensure our facilities and service are superior and we strive to be the best Holiday Inn Resort around. We appreciate your nice comment regarding our morning shift staff.  However, It sounds like we fell below your expectations especially in confirming your reservation, poor breakfast selection and noisy air conditioning. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed her for 2 nights on West coast trip. Rooms spacious. Lobby area small but functional. Restaurant is really part of bar area with reasonably priced basic American food on offer. Pool area outside. Good base for L.A. area and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good place to lay your head!
Summary: We got a really good deal on our last visit to LA and stayed at this hotel.  Because of the excellent price, we expected a dive.  We were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel has a really nice pool, clean large rooms and was pretty quiet - even though it was full.  We used it as a base for our travels up and down the coast, from Santa Barbara to San Diego.  The best part of the hotel was coming home and having a swim in the large pool.  The worst part was the bar with no atmosphere whatsoever, and the fact that you cannot walk anywhere from the Hotel, it is pretty much on a highway.  There are frequest shuttles to Disneyland though - so that should work well for families who are staying there for that.

The hotel is located very close to Disneyland, there is a shuttle you can take to the Disneyland resort that only costs $4. We requested a room away from the freeway becuase we were worried about noise and we ended up with a room facing Disneyland so we could watch the fireworks show from our room. The restaurant has a good breakfast and the bar had decent prices. We didn't have a chance to lounge by the pool, but it was pretty big and there was a large hot tub too, the families that were down there seemed to be enjoying themselves. The only complaint I would have is that the walls were pretty thin, the people on the other side of our wall had a baby and the baby cried all night and we could hear it all night haha.. So bring some earplugs!!

A great location walkable to Disney and the Convention Centre, however the rooms are in severe need of updating.  Peeling wallpaper, and dated.  The mattresses were very worn out as were the pillows.  The kids impression of the pool..."thats not a pool, thats a puddle".  The ac is noisy.
Manager Response: Dear wanderingroots,  Thank you for taking the time to relay your comments regarding our property during your recent stay. We are sorry we were not able to meet or at least be at par with your expectations. I have taken note of your comments regarding your room accommodations. We greatly appreciate your feedback as this gives us the avenue to improve on the quality and services we offer.   Again, thank you for sharing your thoughts and I hope that you give us another chance to change your perception of our hotel.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: clean, nice pool but noisy a/c
Summary: we were fine with our room for 1 night, we got it by bidding. the room had 2 double beds instead of queens. the pool area is nice, the parking is free and so is wi/fi. the a/c turned off and on about every 5-10 min all night and it was really noisy. i don't know if we just got a noisy a/c or if they are all that way and we would have left it off but because the hotel is next to the freeway we had it run to help with the noise.. looking back we maybe should have left it off. i would not pick to stay here unless they fix the a/c. this is also an awkward hotel for getting to the disney parks.
Manager Response: Public Acknowledgement:  Dear klf5,  Thank you very much for taking the time to write your comments. I am pleased yo found the pool to be nice. I understand that having a good night sleep is important and it sounds like we fell below your expectations. I am sorry for any inconvenience you experienced due to the noise.  While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,  Ferdinand G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: It was a very clean and comfortable hotel.  Actually, the only complaint I had was the hotel coffee that was placed in the room  was below standard.

Summary Heading: Perfect location when catching a game at Angels Stadium.
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions when catching an Angels ball game. The hotel is a mile walk from the stadium and we have always found it to be clean, comfortable and convenient. Free wifi always a bonus and the next time we fly in from London we will book this hotel if we find ourselves with Angels tickets.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights.  Our room had two double beds and was very clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was small but it was clean with a bath with a shower over that.  The room were cleaned every day. We ate at the hotel on two evenings.  The first evening we had the buffet meal which was very good with a good choice of foods.  On the second evening we ate from the evening menu and there was a large choice.   Again the food was of a very good standard and there was plenty of it.  Be warned, do not select the large piza unless you are really hungry or are prepared to take some away for tomorrow. There is a gym at the hotel which overlooks the outside swimmimng pool.  We did not use the gym but it looked light and airey.  We used the pool which was of

Summary Heading: The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort on Manchester is the most filthy, disgusting, smelly, poorly-cared-for hotel that I have ever sta
Summary: I have never had such an awful experience as I have had with the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort on Manchester, near Disneyland. I will never stay here again & would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Upon our arrival, we entered room 707, (which is a kid suite with a bunkbed & queen bed), the room smelled like a combination of dog, cigarette smoke & septic. The carpet was wet as well, which led me to suspect that something nasty was recently cleaned up or washed INTO the carpet. After speaking to management, we were moved to room 701 (similar kid suite, a bit smaller in size). The room smelled much better, BUT there was mold on the walls in the kid bunkbed area, the wallpaper was peeling off around the mold, the walls around the queen bed had a white substance that appeared to
Manager Response: Dear eb_oregon,  Thank you for writing us a comprehensive review. I'm deeply sorry the room accommodations fell below your expectations. I do apologize for the experience you had due to the outside noises. I understand the discomfort this has caused you. I would love the opportunity to regain your faith in our hotel and would welcome the opportunity to discuss your stay in further details. I have sent you a private message to obtain additional details regarding your stay. Thank you for staying with us and we hope you give us a chance to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayued at the Holiday Inn for an Angels game in June 2012. The stadium is a mile walk from the hotel and all the reviews said it was a nice place. Our room was on the second floor and had a view of the blowers and a/c on the restaruant attached to the hotel. That night after the game the equipment was buzzing and humming loudly and we could hear it over the room a/c making it hard to get to sleep. The King size bed looked nice, but was hard as a rock. For the price their should have had a pillow top bed. Will stay at the Hilton or Ayres next game. Both are a shorter walk to the stadium.

Stayed here for Disneyland trip July 2011. Room was basic, but clean and comfortable. Staff was fiendly and they've accomodate us by giving us room on side of the hotel without construction going on. Pool was fun for kids. We had a car, but honestly it was almost easier walk to the park then park a car at designated parking lot, from which you have to take shuttle bus anyways. There is a shuttle form a hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay in Anaheim
Summary: Proximity, Convenience, Cleanliness, excellent staff are the reasons to choose this hotel over others if you are visiting Disneyland. Special thank you to "Oreen Gheewala" of the coffee shop for the great service and "Mark", the concierge who knew it all.

Stayed here for our Disneyland trip the end of May 2012 into June 2012.  Our room had a frig and coffee pot.  Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  We had a good night sleep every night.  There was a little construction going on, outside our side of the hotel.  The noise was not  bad in the morning not to mention it was part of our get up and go for the morning.  The room was a little dated and minor repairs are needed.  In the bathroom the wall paper was peeling and by the tub the grout was completely missing and there were gouges in the wall that could have been filled.  The grounds around the hotel were clean and well kept.  We used the spa but on the first night it didn't get very hot.  Used the spa on our last night and it was working properly.  There is a

I've had some bad experiences at some Holiday Inns in the past so I was a little leery of booking this hotel.  The grounds are well maintained, the hotel was clean, and the staff was friendly.  The room was clean and comfortable, but the tv's are outdated and sometimes the smell of deodorizer or carpet freshener takes some getting used to.  The kool decking around the pool could use some help as it's flaking off in some spots but the water was clean and cool.  Skip the restaraunt attached to the hotel.  So would I recommend this hotel to family or friends, yes I would.

Hotel was clean and close to Disneyland. Shuttle service was excellent. Room was tidy and neat. Hotel appearence is very nice and our view was great. We were able to see the fireworks from Disneyland from our room on the 9th floor. The Mickey shaped pool was very cute!

Summary Heading: Good family hotel, not great for business people...
Summary: I stayed here for business a couple weeks ago. Check in was nice they do treat priority club member very well. Oh and a hint for anyone staying at a H.I. join the club, even if you don't have any points you still get a few of the perks on your 1st stay.   Room was fine the room was a good price. Great value for Disneyland area.. But for a business trip it was a little loud. The only major issue was my room was on the third floor and whenever I opened my window I could smell the smoke from the smoking section outside the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear ledieff,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I do apologize for any inconvenience that you have experienced.  We are continually striving to improve the hospitality we offer, and comments from our guests are always welcome.  We appreciate the feedback that we receive as this is crucial for us to improve the products & services that we offer.  Regards, Brenda J. IHGCare

Summary: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel we were a bit wary, specially about the road works being outside,then to find our room was over looking them thought oh no! But it turned out fine as either they weren't working (or worked quietly as we never heard them) The hotel was lovely and clean & the shower fantastic,staff very friendly.Breakfast was great, dinner was okay but once again staff were very friendly.We stayed 2 nights and would definitely stay there again.

Very nice hotel, but walls are thin, so you can hear neighbors.  I stayed in room 311.  There was too much freeway noise.  Ask for a room that is not facing the freeway.      There is a local bus that stops right in front of the hotel.  It goes to Disneyland every 20 minutes.  It costs $4 per person for a 24-hour pass.  Compare that to the $15 parking fee at Disneyland.      Hotel parking and wif-fi is free. .

The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. Everyone has a smile and eager to answer all your questions.  The restaurant was okay. Kids do eat free, but the 18% mandutory gratutity made up for the cost if the kids meal. Food was average hotel restaurant food, burgers, sandwiches, pasta ect. Four different options for kids. Enough choice for everyone. Rooms- our room was a bit beat up. Peeling wallpaper, cracked bathroom sink, and a thick layer of dust on everything. The room does have a safe, and a fridge and coffemaker. It could have been cleaner and better maintained; however, it was an adequate place to sleep. I found toe nails on the bathroom floor that were not ours-and it was after the maid had been in.  There is a shuttle to the parks that picks up at the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Laurie19733,  Thank you for staying with us and leaving such a detailed review.  We are glad you liked the location of our hotel and hope you enjoyed your vacation.  I am deeply sorry you found your room accommodations less than satisfactory.  The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas.  We welcome any opportunity to improve.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask.  Sincerely, Jaime W Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Found the rooms to be clean and spacious. Breaky was great with unlimuted coffee and takeaway cups provided for an extra one on the road.the kiosk downstair was handy and a great shuttle bus outside leaving every 30 mins to disneyland.Would definately return again.

I booked this hotel on the same day through an online service not knowing exactly which hotel I was going to get. I didn't want this one because last time we stayed there we ended up in a smoking room with no option to change. So when I got to the hotel and checked in they said they were a no smoking hotel now so that was nice. I went to second floor and the elevators opened and got a huge whiff of smoke. The front desk said they said they first couple floors were the last to be switched to non-smoking. When I went into my room I was happy to not smell the smoke. It was a nice relief. It was just in the hallway. My room needed a little tlc and I was right over what I think was the front entrance. I heard what I think was the doors all night but I am a light sleeper. The hotel
This hotel was much nicer than I expected.  Staff were attentive and helpful.  Room was clean and nicely appointed.  Bathroom very clean.  Houskeeping was great.

After reading all the other reviews I was a little nervous to stay at this hotel....I could NOT have been more wrong.  After staying at this hotel I came to believe that either the bad reviews are fakes from other hotels or that the people reviewing it expected a five star resort that would be found in a luxurious getaway.    This hotel was great for me, my dad, and my two children.  I loved the set-up with the cabinet above the fridge for storage.  There was also a small counter-top with a coffee maker.  The bathroom was clean and the towels were thick.  I fully expected to pick up a small, limp towel after my shower because of the reviews and instead I picked up a thick, freshly laundered towel.   The pool is big, the jacuzzi is nice sized, and the fitness room was much bigger

Summary Heading: A good place, depending on what you pay
Summary: I paid $75 a nite through Priceline (bidding).  For this price I was satisfied.  The Pros:  The hotel is inviting from the outside with a great pool and spa.  Definitely not what you think of when you think of "Holiday Inn".  The hotel provides several luggage carts to ferry your stuff to your room.  Upon arrival the staff was friendly and we got our room on the 9th floor (the top floor).  I went back to the front desk to ask for another suitcase rack and within two minutes there was a knock on the door and an employee had the extra rack.    The hotel provides some toiletries if needed.  They don't offer to let you reuse your towels to "be green", which to me I like because i want new towels each night.  The A/C unit was top notch and had a digital thermostat on the wall.  The

While our initial greeting was not as welcoming & warm as I would have expected (Ie: a rather gruff, unfriendly employee), subsequent interactions with the staff were pleasant & professional.   The room was comfortable & clean, though the interior design was a little 'tired'.  The halls could have benefitted from a bit more attention from housekeeping, as plates & empty bottles often sat outside rooms for some time.   The hotel should also adjust the room doors so they don't slam, as the noise was sometimes quite irritating.   The restaurant was fine, standard fare & fairly priced, with good service.    All in all the hotel was good & comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear htravelbug,   Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your room accommodations as well as the service at our restaurant.  We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations.  We’re sorry the experience at check in was less than satisfactory.  We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask.  Sincerely, Jaime W Case Manager IHGCare Reference # 27568609

Summary: Stayed here in September for a week long trip to Disneyland and LOVED IT!!    Front desk staff super healpful. Had a 5th floor room facing the pool so it was nice. Rooms were clean as were corridors and entryways. Carpets had just been cleaned so they were "moist".   Room itself had comfortable beds and adequate towels and also shampoos, soaps and the like. Made use of the inroom safe and the seperate enclosed closet as well as dresser were much appreciated for the length of our stay.   While this is a little further from Disney we didn't mind it as we didn't want to be super close to all the "commotion". The ART pickup was right infront of the hotel, well off to the side a little, but on premises and we never had to wait longer then 20 minutes for a bus to the Park. Plus for 20

Summary Heading: Terrible service, bad rooms, stay away!
Summary: I booked an executive suite for my honeymoon and when my wife and I came in the entry way carpet floor was soaking wet, there was no bathtub, there were flies in the room and vacuum lent left on the lamp shade. On top of this when I came back to the hotel later on I checked for parking and there was none in the parking lot nor the shared lot with the neighboring hotel, even though one customer is allowed to take up 4 parking spots with one vehicle. When I confronted the front desk about the issues they said they had nothing to take care of flies and they told me to simply wait my turn at the lobby until a parking spot opened up! I waited 20 minutes to park in my own lot and I had to deal with flies in my face all not on my honeymoon. I didn't pay for this kind of treatment.
Manager Response: ace r,  Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Ben J IHG Care

Summary: It would be unfair to give a lower mark to this hotel as I was the one who chose it for us to go to Disneyland, and, I really did not do enough research. The hotel was nice. Clean and quiet. If I was going to a convention at the Convention Centre I might give it a look.  The restaurant did not provide quality food on either time we visited it. Our dinner one night was very poor and if we had not been meeting some others at the hotel on our last day at breakfast time, we would not have chosen to try it again. Breakfast is pretty simple, but again, not worth the price. In previous stays at Holiday Inn there had been breakfast provided in the price, but not here.  The shuttle to Disneyland was supposed to be on a 20 minute schedule, but it was more like 30 on average and the
Manager Response: Dear GibsonsGolfer,  Thank you for staying with us. I am deeply sorry that the shuttle bus was running a little slow when you stayed. Normal running time is approximately every 20-25 minutes. You comments on the food service will be shared with the appropriate departments. Thank you for your kind words about Caroline, Its always nice for one of our staff to know they are doing a great job.I would love to see you again and restore you faith in our hotel.   Thanks again,  Katie J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: An all-around great place to stay
Summary: We booked this place on Hotwire and were very happy with what we got.  The service was very friendly both at the front desk and on-site restaurant.    The location is close enough to the Disney gates that you can walk if you feel like some exercise (around 30 min) or you can catch an inexpensive shuttle bus from outside the front door to the park gates, which runs most of the time.  Very nice pool area outside; great for families.   Rooms had a mini-fridge.  The place was very clean and pleasant.

I am a Holiday Inn Priority club member and had asked when I booked online for a room that faces away from the Interstate as I'm a light sleeper and the noise would make it difficult to sleep. I was annoyed on check in to find my room faced the Intersate ! The staff were unable to swap rooms. A pair of my ear plugs helped block out some of the traffic noise but not all of it.  The shower tray in our room didn't drain properly meaning after a shower there was always a pool of stagnant water at one end. (The maid did clean and dry this every day.)  Enough of the moans. I have stayed here several times in rooms facing away from the Interstate. On those occasions I had no complaint and would have rated my stay as a perfectly acceptable average (clean, quiet rooms).  I would have
Manager Response: TimHistoryBuff,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us.  The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future.  We appreciate the candid feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Ben J IHG Care

Summary: I recently stayed at the Anaheim Holiday Inn for a business trip. It has certainly seen better days. Not very clean, peeling wallpaper, mildew in the shower and sink. The customer service is spotty. Sometimes the front desk was helpful and other times they were plain rude.   On the positive side my bed was comfortable and the staff in the restaurant was always pleasant and friendly.  It seems that it was once a nice hotel that has been let get dirty and ragged. I cannot recommend this hotel for business travelers or families. There are many other options in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Lovesthebeach1021,  I would like to thank you for your review and apologize that your experience with our hotel did not meet your expectations. I have sent you a private message to obtain additional details about your experience.  Thank you, Brenda J. IHGCare

Summary Heading: Absolute Fail at Communication & Customer Service
Summary: I stayed at this Hotel for five days during the first week of March, staying in room 704. The Hotel itself was fine, room was clean and comfortable, Construction noise wasn't a problem, even though I was on that side of the Hotel. I was in the are working overnight on a project, and sleeping days. Because I was sleeping days, I never had housekeeping come in and clean the room. Most Hotels will at least acknowledge that they came to clean your room by leaving a note that you had the do not disturb sign out, so they respected your wished. I never got anything here, so I don't know that they ever came by for five days. On the morning of the fourth day, I called down to the front desk, to request some fresh towels and shampoo. The phone rang and rang, and nobody answered. I then
Had a great trip. Motel was nice, clean, and comfortable. Food was ok. Taxi/ car to disneyland was only $15 each way. I think the bus was slightly cheaper.

Summary Heading: Not bad for a good price.
Summary: This hotel provides a restaurant sit down type breakfast where even if you get a deal for a free breakfast you have to pay taxes and a tip. But overall nice friendly people and good beds. Room was clean. No shuttle service for Disneyland I think you can use the Anaheim shuttle system. One night we asked for an extra. Lanier and it never came but I would definately consider staying here again.

Summary Heading: Very pleasant stay, if you have a car!
Summary: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here overnight for our Disneyland trip. The hotel is very clean and neat, everything you would expect from a Holiday Inn. The bed was very comfortable and came with a selection of soft and firm pillows. I booked through Hotwire and was originally given 2 double beds. I asked if it was possible to get a King room and was upgraded instantly with no hassle. The room was small, but was suitable for a one night stay. It had a cute little minibar area with a fridge and coffee. They offer a wide selection of TV channels for those who are interested. There is a restraunt downstairs that offers room service. We took advantage of this for breakfast. The cost was not much more than you might expect at Ihop and the service was very quick. The sundries shop

Had an amazing trip! Front desk were always so helpful! Pool/Hot tub was great! Ate at the restaurant once, got take out, food was delicious! The ART is the best thing that was created getting to and from the park! We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and never had a problem. Gym is very clean and have great machines, the arcade was fun for my nephew. The gift shop doesn't have much stuff in it but the basic necessities which was nice. We absolutely loved our time here and can't wait to come back!

I stay at x-mas time, When I got to my room the people next door were smoking in the room, it stank. So call front desk and talk to manager. They move us to a suit on the top floor wich was very, it wasn't there fault that those people were smoking in a non-smoking room. But they try to make it pleasent for us. It's takes about 20 min walk from the disney park wich I tough it was ok the transit was great and sheep! So I keep in mind that I didn't pay high price to stay there so you can't expect to much heither. The one thing that I do have to mention, is when you walk in the looby, in the right corner there is a booth with someone trying to sell you time sheer, that was a pain everthing you walk by they want to talk you. I tough I was in mexico! The inside restaurent was ok not

I have stayed here 4 times during the last 6 times I have been to Anaheim.  My husband and I will be visiting end of February.  I have always had a pleasant experience here.  Lovely front desk people.  The women who works in the gift shop is a hoot and a half.  Nice rooms and great pool/jacuzzi area.  The only negative I have is the distance from Disneyland and anything else really.  There is a nice sized Gas station about half a mile away that you could walk to to get better priced snacks and what not.  Really enjoyable hotel.
Manager Response: Dear teresabutts1,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor. We're so glad you find our property to be to your liking and it's nice to hear that we are you hotel of choice when you are in Anaheim. Thank you also, for you kind remarks regarding our Front Desk staff. They work very hard to meet and exceed our guests' expectations; we're very happy to know they succeeded in your case. Yes, out gift shop lady is a hoot!

Summary: The first time I stayed here was in 2008. The hotel was fairly new. I don't really remember too much about it, but I remember both my husband and I thought it was pretty nice. It has a restaurant, a pool, and a workout area. There is plenty of parking and they don't charge you to park, which I'm sure you know is rare for a hotel near DL. Like I said in the post above, it really is not within walking distance, unless you don't mind a LONG walk. I'd say in the morning it would probably be ok, but at night it would be a long haul. It's somewhat strange to get out of the hotel, because you can only go one way. It makes for a round about way to get to Disneyland.  Fast forward to December 2011. We stayed here for one night, and boy was I glad it was only one night! The hotel had
Manager Response: Dear c_miles2008,  Well, it sounds like your visit here was quite the mixed bag. I certainly apologize for the hairs you found in your room. This really isn't acceptable and I will pass this information on to our Executive Housekeeper so she can discuss this with her entire staff. I am also sorry that your experience was so noisy. Often times if the room you end up in is unfavorable, you can contact the front desk to be moved. I realize this may be an inconvenience, but it might be worth it for a quieter room. It sounds like there were some positives; free parking,  your husband like the fitness center, staff was friendly and a few other things were mentioned. Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor; we always want to hear about our guests' experiences, both the good and the bad.

Summary Heading: Great Price and Value near Disneyland
Summary: Unfortunately, Disneyland  was infested with motorcoach lodges in the parks early days.  Because of this, to stay in a proper hotel you need to venture out away from the resort with a few exceptions.  I lucked out with this hotel as my 3 star pick on hotwire.  I paid $80 inclusive of taxes which was a bargain considering the run down motor inns accross the street from Disneyland were charging $129 base rate.    This is the resort leg of the brand, which really is not a true resort but still very nice. Upon check in I was greeted by a cheerful front desk agent who allowed us to check in at 1PM.  Our room was right outside the elevator so I was a bit worried, but this did not end up a problem. I opened the door and before me was a suprisingly large room.  My room had a large King
Manager Response: Dear Nightro,  Thank you for your kind words on TripAdvisor. Since we are a part of the"Resort" area in Anaheim, the city has the responsibility of providing the shuttle service, and I know that it isn't always very convenient. It does sound like the rest of your visit was positive. We try very hard to make sure our guests' needs are met, and we're happy that was the case for you. We appreciate your taking the time to put your comments on TripAdvisor.

Summary: I read some of the other reviews and was worried about this hotel.  I have to tell you that everything was really good staying at this Holiday Inn.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  However it would have been nice to having a Queen bed as we have King bed at home ,so having a double bed was a little small.  Especially we had both of our boys in bed (2 and 5) with us one night as our five year old fell out of the bunk and got hurt and woke everyone up.  We then also used the ironing board to build up the safety rail to ensure he does not fall out again.    The kids bunks are located in the same room.  We thought (from the pictures) the kids bunks were in a separate room; they are not. They are in the same room, without a door, but blocked off from the main area.
Manager Response: Dear piecowye,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor.  I really appreciate your commenting on some of the things you had read in other reviews and then noting your experiences. We all try very hard to meet and hopefully exceed our guests expectations and it sounds like we did in your case. I'm so sorry your son fell out of the bunk bed! I hope he is okay.  Thanks again for your kind words.

Summary Heading: Cheap?  Yes.  Value for money? NO!
Summary: I'm currently staying at this hotel, this is our fifth night of a 6 night stay here.  My wife and I are experienced travellers in the Orange County area, and have been fortunate to visit annually for the last 6 years.  We have stayed at many of the resorts, including all of the Disney hotels.  Obviously when we booked a Holiday Inn we were not expecting a Disney resort - we went on a budget this year, and are not hotel snobs.  We booked this trip through Westjet and the price was right, we figured that we could live without the convenience of being right on the Disney property - here are my thoughts:  Location:  Brutal.  You are sandwiched between the interstate highway (LOUD) and a lovely little trailer park.  To be fair, the trailer park is fine and was not loud at all.  I

Rooms are nice. Queen size beds would have been nice though when having 3 in a room. Not comfortable sharing a double bed with teenaged kids. Didn't want to squeeze in a cot for $15/ night for a week. Great access to Disney transit system. Breaks at buffet was unimpressive. Wished we figured out that breakfast at Disney was better and cheaper earlier on before dropping $35 every morning ordering off the menu. Good size bathrooms. Would have liked to been able to open the room windows to let in fresh air.
Manager Response: Dear incu,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor. Our entire staff makes every effort to ensure that our guests'  expectations are met or hopefully even exceeded. I apologize that we did not succeed in your case.

Summary Heading: OK to sleep, not for business or pleasure
Summary: This property is wedged between construction, a trailer park and the freeway.  Don't expect any attractive grounds.  The rooms are adequate.  Mine overlooked the scenic trailer park, but was away from the freeway noise.  Room seemed clean and the TV and internet worked fine.  Bathroom was stocked with standard HI amenities.  Shower was a strange walkin shower with no curtain or door.  There was plenty of pressure and hot water which is always good. There were a couple of things that need improvement.  First, there is no business center.  Not business traveler friendly.  There are two computersand printers in the lobby you can use for a charge using a credit card.  Sedond is the restauant which smelled like last nights buffalo wing special...an unpleasent stale odor which made
Manager Response: Dear Triplewin,  Thank you for posting your comments on TripAdvisor. I'm glad the the hotel itself generally met your expectations and am sorry that you were unhappy with parts of your stay. We do try to make all of our guests' stays enjoyable and are disappointed when we hear that we didn't succeed.

Summary Heading: OK but not great budget option for Disney stay
Summary: It's cheaper than a lot of the closer hotels and is usually part of the package air+hotel deals we see here in Canada. And now I can see why. The distance from this hotel to Disneyland makes it a bit too far to walk. You can either take the ART shuttle bus (which would require you to also find a shuttle bus to & from the airport) or take your chances with a rental car. After seeing a few recent un-favourable comments about the reliability of the ART shuttle I decided to chance it with a rental car.  Warning, this hotel is located so close to the highway exit that it is not easy to find. Manchester is a one way street and the only way to get there is by going to the highway exit to San Diego.  There's really nothing around it other than the interstate and a lot of construction.
Manager Response: Dear VivaVacations,  I am so sorry that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. I will pass your comment regarding the front desk agent onto the Guest Service Manager so she can address this with her entire staff. We do have engineering employees available to help with the kind of issue you experienced with the thermostat. We do appreciate your taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor.

Summary: I have stayed at this Holiday Inn twice now and would go back again. The hotel is well maintained and clean. Rooms are a nice size, beds comfortable and a lot of firm & soft pillows. If you don't mind double beds this hotel was great for the 3 nights I stayed there. I would suggest asking for a room away from the freeway as it is close to the 5 and there is a lot of early traffic in SoCal. While Manchester is a marginal road there are quite a few nice restaurants around the corner on Katella as well as a decent restaurant at the hotel. Nice pool, an exercise room with a multi-station machine along with bikes and treadmills and a game room for young and old kids.
Manager Response: Dear chainboss,  Thank you for your very kind review of our hotel. Everyone here makes every effort to ensure our guests' stays are pleasant and enjoyable. We are very glad we succeeded in your case. We appreciate your taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor.

Summary: The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort is anything but a resort. The front desk staff are helpful, but clearly stressed out since it's usually understaffed and they have the onerous task of keeping an eye on the "gift shop" as well. I never saw the line-up at the front desk smaller than four people deep except at 3AM and (thankfully) the moment I checked in.   My room was a basic double. Hoping for a bathtub, but got a walk-in shower. The complimentary toiletries include shampoo, lotion and shower cap. Nothing more. The bathroom was clean, except for the red stain on the wall (lipstick?) and a long black hair in the corner. Housekeeping staff shouls spend less time folding the toilet paper ends into accordians and more time on a final check of the bathroom to make sure guests don't see
Manager Response: Dear drcalberta,  Well, I think all my response can consist of is an apology. I am sorry that you found your entire experience to be so distasteful. Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor. We always want to hear the bad as well as the good.

Summary Heading: Good stay overall but hotel could make some easy improvements.
Summary: We had a good stay overall at this hotel.  The rooms were great especially for the price we got them for. The room was adequately clean but could be deeper cleaned and the bed and pillows were fine. The Noise from I-5 bothered me a little but then we turned the vent fan on all night and that seemed to drown out the traffic noise. The staff were nice and friendly. One of my biggest complaints was the adjoining restaurant.  It was never busy while we were there and yet it took on average 10 minutes to get seated. I don't know if the hostess is doing waitress duties as well but we used it 3 times and never had prompt service. Overall it really was a great hotel considering the price.
Manager Response: Dear RebeccaSaintGeorge,  I'm glad that you found your stay at our property to be mostly a good experience. Our staff works very hard to make sure that our guests' needs and expectations are met. I'm sorry that wasn't the case in the restaurant. I will be passing your comments on to the Director of Food and Beverage so he can address this with his staff.  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor.

Summary: Hotel was located about 20-25 minutes from Disneyland, right off of the I-5 freeway.  The rooms were small.  There was only one microwave for the entire hotel.  The microwave was located in the gift shop on the ground floor.  We did not have any hair conditioner for the entire week we were there and we asked for it every day.  The computer in the lobby was broke the entire week.  Staff was friendly, but I got tired of the guy selling timeshares in the lobby.    The Anaheim Shuttle said it ran every 20 minutes, but it was more like 45 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear jeff71,  I am sorry that you found your stay with us to be so unpleasant. The entire staff makes every effort to ensure that our guests' expectations are met; it's unfortunate that we failed miserably in your case. Thank you for taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a disney vacation
Summary: My husband and I booked this hotel as part of a vacation airline/disney package. Although I wanted to be in the Holiday Inn closer to the park, it was nice being away from the chaos of the main street leading into Disneyland. The staff were very nice, the room was quite clean and restaurant staff attached to the hotel were fantastic. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room, but it served it's purpose quite nicely. We asked to be on the highest floor available, to which they accomodated our request. I figured there were lots of kids in the hotel and we didn't want to wake to the pounding of little feet on our ceiling. We had no noise at all! Forwarned, the ART shuttle is kind of spotty. It's supposed to arrive about every 20 minutes and sometimes it would be spot on and
Manager Response: Dear amfischer,  Thank you for your very nice review of our property. The entire staff works very hard to ensure our guests' expectations are met, and we're very happy to hear that we succeeded in your case. We appreciate your taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor.

Summary Heading: Quite relaxing but could be better
Summary: Recently I was on a business trip to Anaheim & stayed with the property for 3 nights of the weekdays. It looked like the tourist season was over as not much of the happening seen in any time of the day.  As always, the rate was fairly quoted & so was the services offered by hotel. The abnormal thing I have noticed was, room services are no longer offered.. Of course, they charge you with few cents more or a dollar for room service than why not??  If you are typical vegetarian than not left much of the choice for food from the onsite restaurant. I had to order from Pizza Hut & Indian restaurant for all 3 nights (time consuming & really troubling when you are starving).  Some construction work was under way at the neighboring site so little noise during the day time.  But all in
Manager Response: Dear Maulik6676,  Thank you for posting your comments on TripAdvisor. It's good to hear that your stay was pleasant.  Our staff tries very hard to meet the expectations of our guests and we're always happy when we do. I'm sorry that you were under the impression that we don't offer room service. We do, and there is a complete menu in the Guest Services Directory. Perhaps if you stay with us again you can try it out. Our chefs makes a very good pizza here too! Once again thank you for taking the time to post your review.

Summary Heading: Really wanted to rate this place higher
Summary: This hotel has a lot going for it. I appears to be pretty new, and I'll say that the staircases (the fire ones, not mainstream carpeted ones) between floors are the cleanest I've ever seen in any hotel! The hotel is quite clean, the floors and room look nice. The staff were smiling and helpful. There's a nice fitness center and pool area. For a decent price, it's all quite good.  There are just some things that are annoying. Number one is that I was on the fifth floor, a non-smoking floor (at least my "wing"), and you could smell smoke much of the time - in the halls, and in my room. I don't think people were cheating on my floor (but might have been) - my guess is that the odor is wafting either down from the 6th floor or up from the 4th floor. I've never smelled smoke for so
Manager Response: Dear SoCa1l26,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor. First let me apologize for the smoke issue. Our hotel is non-smoking, but unfortunately people often do "cheat". When we are notified that someone is smoking in their room it is immediately addressed with that guest.    We do offer several different types of pillows if the ones in the room are not to your satisfaction. If you contact the front desk and let them know which kind of pillow you prefer, they will have it delivered to your room.  As far as the pins for the fitness machines, I realize that it is inconvenient for our guests to have to ask for the pins. But once again, just like with the smoking, we work on an honor system here, and not everyone abides by that, so we have to keep them at the front desk.  I am glad that you found most of your stay to be pleasant. That's what we aim for. Thanks again for posting your comments.

Summary: Arrival experience was Ok, desk personnel was friendly. Room was on one of the higher floors and was quiet. Good size room with mini fridge. Complimentary WIFI.  No complimentary breakfast, however, Priority Club members get 10% off in the restuarant in the hotel.  We did not eat there this trip but was disappointed with the food fare the previous time we ate there.  Departure experience was not so good.  Since quick check out, with bill delivered to room overnight, is not offered, had to go by front desk to check out.  Checking out by giving name/room was no problem but when I asked desk clerk for a copy of my bill, it took almost ten minutes to get it printed.  The bad part is that the representative didn't say, sorry for the wait, there's computer slowness, etc or anything,
Manager Response: Dear travel447,  Thank you for posting your comments on TripAdvisor. I'm glad that in general your stay was pleasant and very sorry about your experience upon check-out. We do offer quick check-out; I don't know why this wasn't provided to you. I am going to pass your comments onto our Guest Service Manager so she can discuss these issues with her staff. Once again, thank you for your feedback.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, during a recent trip to Disneyland. On our second night we found a bedbug on our daughter's bed. The night manager had us change rooms. We had to pack up our stuff at midnight and move floors. The daytime manager said we could do our own laundry if we needed to, but otherwise said or did nothing else. Ridiculous!!!  This place is a joke. Word to the wise, do not stay here. Bedbugs are beyond disgusting.
Manager Response: Dear Alexi L,  I am so sorry for your experience while staying at our hotel. Unfortunately, the bed bug issue has become very prevalent at many types of businesses, not only hotels. I've even read about theaters having this problem. If there is ever a report of bedbugs, we immediately contact a company who specializes in this kind of treatment. They treat the room in question and also the rooms on either side. I can only imaging  how inconvenient  it would be to have to move everyone and everything to a different room in the middle of the night. I apologize that this situation was not handled in a more courteous and helpful way. I will pass your review on to our General Manager so he can follow-up with the front desk staff.

Summary: the staff were very friendly and helpful, I had just came from a hotel in Hollywood and left our camera there.  They offered to call the hotel and advised us what we should do and who we needed to speak with.  They had a shuttle that ran to Disneyland that was very convenient.  Since I was a priority club, I had 10% off breakfast and free coffee in the morning.  The kids swimmed in their nice pool area (shared with a staybridge hotel) and enjoyed it very much.    thank you all for making our stay enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear Ryan J,  We're glad that we were able to help make your trip to the area enjoyable. The staff makes every effort to assist our guests in anyway possible; it's very encouraging to hear that they did just that in your case. Thank you for taking the time to post your kind comments on TripAdvisor. We look forward to welcoming you back in the not-too-distant future.
