Summary: The service was really nice the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful but the rooms were moderate it was just blah the free wifi was defiently nice and the pool was always nice and clean but there was never a lifeguard which i dident really like but ya... the only bad things were the pool and the rooms the rooms id give a 3 out of five they were nice but just the basics i might stay there again
Manager Response: Dear cadoo5,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor. I'm glad that the hotel met your basic needs and that you found the front desk staff to be nice and helpful. We hope you do stay with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for business or pleasure
Summary: I stay at this hotel for both business and pleasure all the time.  The staff is amazing to work with and always very helpful.  It has a great shuttle to Disneyland and very kid friendly.  A great hotel all around.
Manager Response: Dear olovers,  We are so glad that you took the time to post your comments. Our staff IS amazing; they work very hard to ensure out guests' needs are met. Thank you for pointing that out in your review.

Summary Heading: Great if you want a place to sleep
Summary: the hotel staff were very helpful and always willing to book our tours and taxis, there were informational....the bus to disneyland was great ran every 20mins and started an 1hr before open and till 1hr after close, it was always on time and easy to find. the rooms were nothing special they were very clean and serviced daily.....we had trouble with out room as it was meant to be a king but we got 2 twins (booking agents fault) they tried to fix it however ws unable to due to being 2 busy.....the food at the restaurant was reasonable and tasty
Manager Response: Dear vampslayer01,  We certainly appreciate your positive endorsement of our hotel. The staff works very hard to accommodate our guests' needs, and it sounds like they were successful in your case. I'm sorry we weren't able to change your room; we are always very busy in December.   Thank you for taking the time to post your kind remarks on TripAdvisor.

Summary: In the past, our trips to Disneyland have involved staying at hotels right across from the park. For convenience, they can't be beat. However, it's getting harder to justify what some of them charge. I actually enjoyed this hotel for being slightly away from the hustle and bustle. Shuttle stop is located right out front. We had received this hotel through a discount hotel site and even with the cost of parking at Disney, this hotel was still a value. Rooms were comfortable and clean and I enjoyed that they have interior corridors. The one downfall to our room was that I-5 could be heard and light sleepers might be affected. Also, we did get a little lost trying to find the property as the directions we had were confusing. Next time, we will take them from the hotel's site

Summary Heading: We felt lucky we stayed here
Summary: It always amazes me when I read negative reviews of where we stay -- just what were they expecting? With that statement being said, we loved staying at the Holiday Inn!  The lobby was clean, bright and chocked full of information --- the screen in the lobby even told you of nearby places to eat and more.  We stayed two nights -- midweek -- and never heard any constuction work. (We were third floor of the main tower, overlooking the pool.)  Become a Priority Club member! We got 10 percent off at the restaurant, free US Today every day and a great goodie bag. It's free -- do this!  The shuttle is a bonus. Stops right outside the hotel. Yes, we paid for the pass -- $4 a day, but free parking at the hotel and no resort fees!!! Add it up -- we stayed at the Hyatt last time. Free
Manager Response: Dear Harry M,  Would it be okay with you if we kept your review on TripAdvisor forever? We're so appreciative of your review; as you noted, not all of the comments are always positive. Everyone at our hotel works very hard to make sure guests' stays are as comfortable and pleasant as possible and we're glad you found the accommodations here just what you needed.

Summary: I must say, if I could have bought the bed/pillows from them, I would have!!!! They were soooooo comfortable!!!  Far better then my own!!! :)
Manager Response: Dear mommymimi,  Thank you for the resounding endorsement of our beds and pillows! Obviously, when someone stays in a hotel they want the sleeping arrangements to be comfortable, and now you have told many people that they will get a good nights sleep staying here.  We appreciate your taking the time to post your comments.

Summary: For $50 a night plus tax it was not a bad deal. But when I walk into a hotel, I want it to smell CLEAN and not like "A Taste of India" And that was like this hotel lobby smelled like.  As we entered the elevator area, 2 of elevators were closed due to maintenence. Our room was nice and it was an accessable room.  We were not in wheelchairs but being a "person of size" having the hand held shower spray was a nice touch.   Although, the handle hich regulates the water was in need of a bit of repair.  There were adiquite plugs for our cpap machines and the noise level from our view of Highway 5 was non existant,  The parking is a bit tight but all in all, we had a great stay while we enjoyed our DIsneyland vacation!
Manager Response: Dear never_again01,  I am sorry that the smell in lobby was so disagreeable. Our lobby is cleaned several times a day; I can't imagine where the odor came from.  Other than that, it sounds like most of your expectations were met during you stay. We all work very hard to make our guests' stay as pleasant as possible and I'm glad we generally succeeded in your case.  Thank you for taking the time to post you comments on TripAdvisor. We appreciate all of the nice things you said about our property.

Summary: In the past, our trips to Disneyland have involved staying at hotels right across from the park. For convenience, they can't be beat. However, it's getting harder to justify what some of them charge. I actually enjoyed this hotel for being slightly away from the hustle and bustle. Shuttle stop is located right out front. We had received this hotel through a discount hotel site and even with the cost of parking at Disney, this hotel was still a value. Rooms were comfortable and clean and I enjoyed that they have interior corridors. The one downfall to our room was that I-5 could be heard and light sleepers might be affected. Also, we did get a little lost trying to find the property as the directions we had were confusing. Next time, we will take them from the hotel's site
Manager Response: Dear Blueshirt35,  We're very glad that you found your stay at our property to be comfortable and a good value. We appreciate your taking the time to post such nice comments on TripAdvisor. We hope to welcome you back very soon.

Summary Heading: Husband liked, I'm not so sure
Summary: We placed a bid on a website and this was the hotel that we were booked.  We have looked at this hotel several times, but never booked it as I like to be closer to Disneyland.  It is not within walking distance, unless you don't mind a good length walk so use the ART system (they stop right in front of the hotel lobby).  There were hidden fees that were not disclosed to us until we already placed the bid and the room had no fridge or microwave.  Having no fridge made life interesting as we had to use the ice bucket to keep things cool.    But, the internet was fast and the room was nice and clean.  We were right above the pool and could frequently here the base from music playing out by the pool that made some days not so peaceful.  There were also people smoking below our room

Summary Heading: Fabulous Hotel, clean and good food
Summary: Very good hotel. One of the best in Anaheim at this price. Ok even the building works nearby was tolerable as we were on 5th Floor. Highly recommended place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Cabbage1,   Thank you for highly recommending our property! We always try to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and are happy to know we succeeded in your case. All of the construction is a city project, which, unfortunately, we can't do anything about. Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on Trip Advisor.

Summary: We stayed in this hotel on two separate occasions, the first was just OK - the air conditioner was SO noisy when it cut in and out that it woke us each and every time. All three nights at this hotel were awful with very broken sleep.   On our second visit we ended up walking out and going to another hotel, as they weren't able to put us in a king room - which was ok, however the air conditioner in this room was worse than the previous one and we just weren't willing to put up with three more nights broken sleep. Having said this the manager was understanding and refunded our second stay through our travel agent back in Australia.   On the plus side the pool, spa and restaurant were nice, and the location was also good.
Manager Response: Dear josnlou,  I am so sorry about the air conditioners. Not that this is of any help to you now, but for information purposes we are in the process of replacing all of the old air conditioners, floor by floor with much quieter, more efficient units. It's good to know that the manager took care of everything to your satisfaction. Maybe you can stay with us again after we get all of the new air conditioning units!

Summary: The hotel was very nice ,very close to disneyland .The rooms were nice..and the restaurant red robin was open late till night.love the shuttle bus to disney land and anywhere around 5 miles..we went the to walmart and picked some fruits,water and local stuff which was very convienient,and healthy..Staff was very nice and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Rati83,  We thank you for taking the time to post your comments on Trip Advisor. We're also glad that you found the hotel to be convenient for your needs and that the staff met your expectations. We hope to welcome you back in the not too distant future!

Summary: We stayed at this Hotel due to the fact that we got a screaming deal on Priceline and we knew we wouldn't be in the room except to sleep (went to Disney).  If you are only going to stay here to sleep, this is a great hotel - but I do not recommend this hotel for anything other than sleep.  We went to Disney for 12 hours a day - then came back to hotel and crashed - it served its' purpose.   Hotel is on the Anaheim bus line, we paid $20 for a 3 day pass, and the ride to Disney takes about 10 minutes.  After the second day we walked from the hotel to Disney - took about 20 minutes, but it was a nice walk.  It is next the freeway, but you don't hear the traffic.  Bed was comfortable, carpet was decent, shower was big. We literally slept here - that's it.  If that's all you want to
Manager Response: Dear PTRIPP,  We're glad the our property was able to serve your needs while you visited Disneyland, and appreciate your taking the time to post your review on Trip Advisor. It is nice to see that you found the staff to be friendly; they all work very hard to meet our guests' expectations. Many thanks.

Summary: The location is great especially for visiting Disneyland.  We were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel and loved the Shuttlebus to Disneyland.  Will stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear momtotyash,  Thank you for the very nice review of our property! We try to maintain the hotel to a very high standard, and are so glad you noted this in your review. Thank you for taking the time to post; we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: LOCATION - The hotel is located just off of the interstate 5 & a 10 min drive from Disney & about an hour from Los Angeles  APPEARANCE - Looks a new building. Driveway is lined by trees.  RECEPTION - A bright reception area with a big touchscreen information board. Friendly helpful reception staff. Check in was very smooth.  ROOM - We stayed in room 726. The room it's self was very clean with 2 king size beds. Plenty of power sockets. For me it needs light switches near the beds. The view from our room was of a new road being built and a huge trailer park so we didn't look out too often. The shower was huge which was a plus  BAR - the bar is open until 10pm and is attatched to the restaurant. It has a pool table & tv  RESTAURANT - A fairly good restaurant where kids eat free.
Manager Response: Dear Nicko 1977,  Thank you for the great break-down of all the services we offer at this property. We are pleased that for the most part everything met your expectations. I do apologize for the construction; it is a city project and not much can be done about that. We appreciate your taking the time to post your review and for your recommendation.

Summary: This was a great hotel for family's going to Disneyland, very friendly staff and kids eat for free, clean and well maintained and has a bus going to Disneyland, wish hotels were all like this one.
Manager Response: Dear Shane R,  Thank you for posting your review on Trip Advisor. We are so glad that the property was just what your family needed for your visit to Disneyland. We always try to meet and exceed our guests' expectations, and are so happy we succeeded in your case. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary Heading: Good location and accessible to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed there for family holiday. Shuttlebus to disneyland. Will stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear hmsg128,  Thank you for the brief but very nice review! I'm glad that you found our property to be just what you needed and we look forward to your return.

Summary: Just got back from our Halloween Disney Mini Vacation.. We visit Disney 2 to 3 times a Year, and we always stay at Hotels with-in walking distance form the Park.. This was the first time at this Holiday Inn.. We stayed in room 910 from Oct. 20 - Oct 24. Everything was Perfect. The staff was very professional.. We had one Issue, House Keeping somehow forgot the 9th floor on Sunday, But once they were awhere of the Problem them promptly fixed it.  Some guests were complaining in the Halls about what was going on, but think about it, Do you "Clean" and change your sheets in your home everyday.  I never did ask why this happened.. It was a mistake and things like this happen..   I did have a concern at first about the Distance away from Disney, but For $4.00 a day, the Anaheim
Manager Response: Dear cathomp31,   Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on TripAdvisor.   We're glad that you found everything to your liking, and I do apologize for the housekeeping issue on the 9th floor. Yes, sometimes things just happen but It's kind of you to be so understanding. It's much appreciated. We're also glad to hear that you will be staying with us again. We look forward to welcoming you back to the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Dependable, Clean hotel with good staff.
Summary: I rolled the Priceline dice and got this hotel for a convention in the area. It has 3 stars on priceline.com and I agree with that rating. The rate was fairly low for 3 priceline stars. Here are the ups and downs:   First the bad, let's get it out of the way. You need a shuttle to go anywhere; it's reasonable if you're used to city travel, but if you've got a family, you're looking at $10 per person for a weekend pass. The location of this hotel is off the beaten path compared to the other "disney" or "convention center" type hotels. It overlooks a highway on one side and what appears to be another highway under construction behind it, snaking through a trailer park. So your scenery is zero. But you're not here to look out the hotel windows. My alarm clock had been unplugged, so
Manager Response: Dear andogg,  Well, I'm happy that the bad wasn't very bad. I do apologize for the inconvenience with the phone, and you're right, the highway construction is not attractive at all. I am glad to hear that the property was convenient for your stay and that you found the staff helpful. We always try make our guests' stays enjoyable and I'm happy that we succeeded in your case. Thank you for taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor.

Summary Heading: As long as nothing goes wrong ....
Summary: everything is fine. It's clean and not too expensive. But if you have a problem, forget it. We had a serious maintenance issue in our room. I couldn't call anyone from the room because the phone had no dial tone. What's up with that?  I had to use my cellphone to call the hotel staff. We were told someone would come up to fix our problem. No one ever came. We were checking out that day, so we left in a hurry and I went to the front desk to complain. The clerk at the desk took our phone number and said a manager would call us. No one ever called. There are better places to spend your money. The beds are doubles, not queens, so sleeping wasn't so great, either.
Manager Response: Dear Carotravels,  Please let me apologize for the poor quality of your stay. We try to make sure our guests needs are met, but we obviously failed in your case. I have passed your comments onto our Guest Services Manager so that these omissions can be addressed with the front desk staff. I do thank you for taking the time to post your review; unless we know about the bad things that happen, we can't do anything to fix them.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you hate cigarette smoke
Summary: I really have nothing bad to say about the staff, quality of the rooms, cleanliness, or amenities, but after 1 day here, I feel like I'm going to need a lung transplant. We checked into our non-smoking room (number 308) and immediately smelled cigarette smoke. Only it wasn't from inside the room. As I got closer to the window it got stronger and I realized that I was two stories up from a smoking are close to the front entrance. We were in and out of the building several times, and every time, there were people smoking in that area, mostly employees. I don't know the exact California laws on how far from the front door people have to be in order to smoke, but if you stay here and you are entering the building from the left parking lot, you will walk right by it. It;s
Manager Response: Dear David A.,  First, thank you for bringing to our attention the issues you had with the smoking. I have passed your concerns on to our General Manager and per his instructions we are actively looking at ways we can improve this situation for our non-smoking guests. We will definately be putting "no smoking" signs in the pool and spa area, and we are also working to move the smoking areas 20 feet away from the building, as California law demands. I am happy to learn the staff handled the situation at the spa in a manner you found to be helpful and that overall you found our property to be satisfactory.  We are always looking for ways to improve our guests experiences while staying with us, and your pointing out the smoking issue will help us to make the quality of ALL our guests visits even better.

Summary: just like to say a big thanks to all the staff at the holiday inn for an excellent holiday.Firstly this hotel is an ideal base for a disney holiday with regular buses reasonably priced to take you to the parks or if you wish you can walk in 20 minutes.The hotel room we stayed in was spotless smelled fresh and cleaned daily to a very high standard.After the previous weeks stay in an Las Vegas hotel where standards where rather poor in this area this made a big difference to our stay.The general cleanliness of the hotel was excellent as well ,.the lifts and the corridors being spotless and always smelling fresh.The front desk was friendly and extremly helpful with any questions you may have and helped us book a few trips out which coming from England was very helpful to us.The
Manager Response: Dear Andrew C.,  Thank you for the very nice review of our property, and your helpful suggestions to other future guests. We always appreciate our guests' taking the time to tell about their stay and we're very glad when it turns out that the stay was a good one. We hope to welcome you back to the Holdiay Inn Anaheim Resort sometime in the future.

Summary: This hotel was surprisingly nice for the price. Smelled clean, rooms were nice and well appointed. The public transportation stops here so very easy to get to Disneyland from this location.  Breakfast in the restaurant was fast and reasonable, even on a Saturday morning. I would stay here again, which is saying a lot in Anaheim, where there are literally hundreds of hotels within a stone's throw of Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Victoria E,   Thank you for the really great endorsement of our property! You're correct regarding the number of hotels in this city and we're very happy that you chose to stay with us, and that everything was to your liking. We hope we can welcome you back sometime in the future.

Summary: Was a great place to stay, unfortunately there are roadworks at the back of the hotel  - building an off ramp to freeway and they started working at 7am.  Staff were great  and friendly, rooms were clean and beds comfy.  Certainly worth considering when in the area.
Manager Response: Dear tabullen,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I'm so glad that you found everything within the hotel to your liking. And I do apologize for the construction. This is a city project, and  unfortunately we have no control over their schedule. We hope to welcome you back to the Holdiay Inn Anaheim resort sometime in the future.

Summary: We visited Disneyland from sept 25-30 of this year and this hotel was PERFECT. I have to admit I was nervous after reading some of the reviews if I had made the right decision on a place to stay for my family, but after our stay I am extremly pleased to say that this hotel was GREAT everything from check in to check out was spot on perfect. The staff and house keeping here are all AWSOME the front desk is always there to assist you in what ever you may need and the house keeping was perfect they did a great job in all the cleaning they did. I do believe that the one set back I had and it was very minor was the resturant there for breakfast it is fine but diner was a different story the service was slow and from what I could tell I think there was only one waitress on staff that
Manager Response: Dear Alyssa F,  Wow! Thank you for the amazing review! I'm sorry you found the service to be lacking in the restaurant for dinner. I will pass your observation on to our Director of Food and Beverage; we are always happy to hear any suggestions that will make our guests' visits better. And a big thank you to you for recognizing the staff. Everyone here works very hard to ensure that our guests have everything they need; it's always nice to be recognized for a job well done.

Summary: This was a really nice hotel, and we had no issues. It was definitely the cheapest, closest to disneyland and nicest that we looked at (online). Its super close to disneyland (via shuttle or car) and a short walk to other shops and restaurants. The rooms were clean and we had absolutely no issues with the rooms. The restaurant in the hotel was nice too. The only thing I would fault the hotel is their 'fitness center' - most of the machines dont work and the pins are missing from the weight machines. I guess not a lot of people would go to the fitness center, but it was a bummer for me. No mind though, I just went for a run. That aside, the hotel was great and I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear kristenlees,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I'm glad that most everything was to your liking here at our property. I apologize for the condition in which you found the fitness center. In the future (at our hotel or any other) if you discover something is not working correctly, please advise the Front Desk staff. That way we are aware of the problem and can take the appropriate steps to fix it. Also, at our hotel anyway, the pins for the weight machines are kept at the Front Desk; they tend to "walk away" if left unattended in the fitness room :-)

Summary: We stayed here for sleep only as we made a day trip to Disneyland.  Room was small and hot. But we slept. Staff was amazing.
Manager Response: Dear MeLilMomma,  I am sorry that you found the room to be uncomfortable. If you ever stay with us again, please let us know if something is not quite right; we always would like the opportunity to fix whatever is wrong, if we can. Thank you for the nice compliment to the staff! Everyone here does all they can to accommodate our guests.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay and will be back :)
Summary: I went to visit Disneyland last December and stayed at this hotel with my employee rate. The check in was smooth and our room was nice. There were a couple of almonds/nuts found underneath the furniture when we moved the chair but it didnt bother me. The hotel has a shuttle from the hotel to Disneyland which was reasonably priced and the hotel has a restaurant too. The restaurant is great and food was good. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would return.
Manager Response: Dear Nicolei_07,  We're always happy to welcome one of our fellow co-worker to our property! And we're so glad that everything was to your liking. (Except the nuts underneath the furniture, so sorry!) Thank you for recommending our property in your review. We look forward to welcoming you again.

Summary: We stayed here in late Janurary, 2011 and were very happy with the accomodations!  The room and the bed were very comfortable. We had breakfast at the on-site restaurant, which was a good thing, because  they gave us good information about the shuttle to Disneyland.  We would definately stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear carmine1,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. We're very glad that you found everything at our property to be comfortable and convenient. The entire staff works very hard to make our guests' happy with their visit; we look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: Good luck to finding this hotel first of all - you'll do a pretty good tour of Anaheim first - it's actually on a one way system - if you follow your Sat Nav you'll miss it! We did - I called the hotel and they were able to give us some helpful pointers about where we had turned wrong!  Checkin was quick, efficient and there was plenty of information about the surrounding area.   We picked this hotel mainly because it had a lot of readily available free parking which was helpful for the 6 nights that we were there.   Rooms are large and comfortable with tea & coffee facilities as well as a fridge.   There is a shuttle bus from the hotel (ART) which is reasonably priced and you can buy multi day tickets if that suits you. We also used this hotel as a base for Universal, LA and
Manager Response: Dear sarah031109,  I'm so sorry you had a hard time finding us! It can be a bit tricky, but as you discovered our Front Desk staff is ready, willing and able to help. Thank you for taking the time to post your very nice review of our property, and for including so many good suggestions for future guests. We make every effort to ensure our guests' experiences are positive and are very glad we succeeded in your case.

Summary Heading: hotel was good, but the restaurant was not
Summary: hotel was good, but the restaurant was not. they don´t have variaty in the menu
Manager Response: Dear renedelarosa2005,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comment. We are happy that you found the hotel to your liking. I have passed your comment regarding the restaurant on to our Director of Food and Beverage. We always want to hear suggestions from our guests as to how their experience at our property can be improved.

Summary: We stayed here for just 1 night for a quick Disneyland visit. We have travelled quite a bit and find that with 3 youngish children, accommodation can be quite tricky as it is hard to find somewhere that can accommodate all 5 of us. This hotel did more than that. We stayed in a "KidSuite" which the children adored. They loved the bunk bed and the XBox and wanted to stay longer! We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant which was good and found that the room was very comfortable and we appreciated the free parking. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear 5monkeys,  We are so glad that you found the Kids Suite to be exactly what your family needed! We get many positive comments about them. And we are also very glad that you will be back to visit us again.  Thank you for taking the time to post this nice review.

Summary Heading: Budget conscious, safe, clean, & convenient for a few days stay
Summary: Trip was first week of Sept 2011 for 4 days.  My family and I stay here 3 times a year mainly for the convenience and constant reliability.  The hotel is much better than a motel or the cheap hotels you can get closer to the park.  The room decor and furniture is standard, not updated. The rooms have always been reasonably priced, clean, beds comfortable, and the staff have always been exceptional.  Just for your info, always request a room away from the elevators.  This will cut down on the constant noise from people coming and going at all hours.  The walls are a bit thin but it is manageable.   The beds are doubles not queens for the standard rooms.  A bit small but ok for 3 people.  The bathrooms are very small as well and the vanity/sink area is in the same place next to
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Wow! This just might be the most informative review ever written about our property. Thank you for taking the time to post it. I am glad that for the most part you find our hotel satisfactory and we're very glad that you stay with us so often. As far as the restaurant goes, we appreciate your letting us know about your experiences there; I have passed your comments on to our Director of Food and Beverage. Unless we know about problems, there is no way they can be fixed.  Thank you for being a loyal patron of the Holdiay Inn Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Great base for quick stopover in Anaheim
Summary: We have stayed here multiple times when visiting Anaheim to catch a ball game at Angels stadium. Hotel is well located clean friendly and the beds some of the most comfortable I have used in all my trips to the US. Free 24 hour fitness room a bonus as is the excellent free wifi allowing me to plan my day and skype back to the UK. Next time we are in America, if it clashes with an Angels home game we will be sure to stay here for a decent nites sleep after a great nite at the ballpark
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for posting such nice comments in your review of our property. We aim to please, and are very glad that we were able to do that for you. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are here for an Angels game!

Summary Heading: A great hotel for a quick disney visit
Summary: We spent two nights here and didn't regret it. Nice staff, nice pool, room clean and comfortable. free wifi, free car park and - most important - a 15 minute walk to Disney. Downtown disney is even closer. But aside from official disney hotels you can't get much closer.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for the kind words! We are glad that you had a nice stay here at our property. All our staff tries very hard to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and we are certainly happy that we did so in your case. We look forward to welcoming you back for your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: It's hard for me to write a negative review of this hotel because I found every person working at this hotel to be wonderful. We had stayed the first leg of our trip at a much more expensive, higher starred hotel and I would say the people at this hotel were just as good or better, very accommodating. Plus the prices didnt gouge at all like other brands, the restaurant had kids eat free, the internet was free, the front desk printed my boarding passes complimentary it was all very nice. The room was fine, a bit dated but clean, and the pool area was great and you could watch the disney fireworks from them.   That said I couldn't recommend this hotel for two reasons. 1)The walls are paper thin. When you have families going to disney at 7 am and getting back at 1 am you hear
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. We certainly appreciate the high praise you gave our staff; they all work very hard to make our guests feel at home. I do apologize that you found the rooms to be less to your liking and that the shuttle service was not as prompt as it should have been. Thanks again for the kind remarks.

Summary: Ants in the bathroom - and I was on the top floor, bed so lopsided to one side I had to cling to the wall each night to stay in it.  This place was gross and not worth the money.  The restaurant had terrible service - I waited 20 minutes to be seated and it never happened so I finally left.  I've used many Holiday Inns over the years and have never been this disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  I'm not really sure where to start apologizing for your terrible stay. We do appreciate your comments, we always want to hear the bad as well as the good. When we are aware of specific problems we can then follow up on them. Your comment regarding the restaurant will be passed onto the Food and Beverage Manager for further action. I am sincerely sorry that your stay was so disappointing.

Summary Heading: Living in your car is better than this so called "hotel".
Summary: The conditions were terrible. Outside our window, they kept doing renovations and whenever we opened the window, it smelled like someone poured fifty-year-old coffee into our room. our wallpaper was peeling, the tub had some sort of rusty substance in it and the hot tub and pool was filled with cigarettes and gunk. worst experience in a hotel I ever had
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on Trip Advisor. I am sorry you found your stay at the property so unpleasant. We work hard to make our guests' visits enjoyable and are disappointed we failed in your case.

Summary: Plain and simple,cabinets above had French fry's left over from previous guest,(second shelf) and refrigerator in room was filthy,(dried on food)......room did not appear vacuumed well.....other than that everything else was nice......
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  I am sorry that your experience at our property was disappointing. We always make every effort to meet and exceed our guests' expectations, and when we don't we too are disappointed. Thank you for taking the time to post your comments, it's always good to find out the areas in which we failed our guests' expectations; this helps us to take action to ensure it doesn't happen again.

Summary: This is the second time in 3 years that my family has stayed here to visit Disneyland (both times we got rooms through another site and scored terrific deals).  This time, we brought my parents as well as our young children.  Rooms are comfortable, spotlessly clean.  Maid service is very professional and night staff friendly.  My parents checked in before us and the front desk was happy to accomodate their request for room ajoining ours.  There was construction going on next door, but it was not obtrusive; we could see the Disneyland fireworks easily from the room at night.    Only downside is the property is a hike from the park (about 3 miles) and the ART shuttle does get crowded.  Buy the tickets before boarding.  Also, be aware that the hotel restaurant is now open for
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you so much for the very nice review you posted. We really appreciate your taking the time to do so. Everyone at the hotel from the Front Desk staff to the employees in the restaurant and kitchen, to the housekeeping staff strives to make our guests' experiences pleasant and restful; it's always rewarding to find out we have succeeded. We look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the future.

Summary: We were traveling with our daughter, son in law and grand kids. Hotel was initially difficult to find. Front desk staff was friendly and allowed us to check in early. He even reassigned our rooms so we were on the same floor next to each other. The property is showing some signs of wear and tear. The lobby chairs and couches need replacing as they are all sagging, stained and dirty. The gift shop was not very well stocked. Our rooms were clean but based on the heavy daily usage are in need an upgrade soon. We didn't receive any maid service the first day and had to request a fresh set of towels for the night. There is construction going on behind the property which didn't effect the quality of our stay. The pool and spa are shared by two separate properties (next store) but
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort guest,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I'm glad that you found the Front Desk staff to be helpful and that in general your stay with us was a pleasant one. I am sorry that you did not receive fresh towels on a daily basis. This will be discussed with the housekeeping staff. Once again, thank you for posting your review on Trip Advisor. We always appreciate our guests'  feedback.

Summary: Hotel was decent for what you pay, was comfortable, close to freeway entrance. Good cheaper alternative than the traditional Disneyland Resort hotels.  Restaurant was good too. Bit far from other theme parks such as Universal or Downtown LA and Hollywood. Other than that was good.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Guest,  Thank you for posting your review on Trip Advisor. We appreciate your taking the time to do so. We're glad that we were able to provide you with a comfortable place to stay during your visit to the area and hope to welcome you back next time.

Summary: I was very surprised when I arrived to see the wonderful condition of this establishment because so many other TripAdvisor peeps had bagged it.  This hotel is absolutely wonderful.  From the incredibly helpful and polite staff at both the front desk and the restaurant to the clean rooms with added extras (like a huge closet for storage, a gigantic bathroom and a fridge area for prepping snacks), my family and I enjoyed a superb stay.  The pool was fun and relaxing, and the public spaces of the hotel were inviting and well maintained.   Although located right on the highway, you can barely hear it and the hallways were quiet, even with people traipsing in late after Disneyland.  The ART transit system was great, picking us up right in front of the hotel and dropping us off right
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Wow! Thank you so much for your kind words. We make every effort to provide our guests with quality service and accomodations and it so nice to hear that we absolutely succeeded in your case. We certainly appreciate your taking the time to submit your comments on Trip Advisor. We look forward to welcoming you back as soon as you can make it!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay one of the nicest Holiday Inn's there is.....
Summary: For Holiday Inn this hotel is top notch! Clean, good service by housekeeping and front lobby. Had a real good vacation there and at Disneyland.. Good size pool. For the shuttel bus to Disneyland figure the system out before departing to Disneyland, there is a ticket machine at the bus stop at the Hiliday Inn that you will need to purshes before the first time you get on the shuttle bus. The bus driver dose not take no money.  Got a great price on priceline.... Thank you.....
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you so much for the wonderful comments you posted on Trip Advisor! We always endeavor to meet and exceed our guest's expectations and are very pleased we did so in your case. We really appreciate your taking the time to share your positive experience at our proberty.

Summary Heading: Good location, Not Practical for Us!
Summary: The two of us went to LA and chose to stay at this hotel due to its close proximity to Angels stadium where we would be attending a game. When we arrived at noon, it was still three hours until check in time, but we thought we would see if they'd allow us to check in early. The desk person was very short and stated that we could not. I asked if we could get a King bed, and she told me to ask again when I checked in at 3pm. The lady was not very nice and seemed not to care about us.   Once we checked in at 3pm, we were only able to get a 2 doubles room, but the guy at least tried to find a King room. The hotel was clean and the rooms as well. The beds were a bit hard for us but they worked for just two nights. The maid service was excellent, cleaning the room and vacuuming
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  First of all, let me apologize for your experience at the Front Desk when you first tried to check in. We pride ourselves on good customer service and are very disappointed when we discover we failed. Thank you for letting us know about this; unless we are aware of negative situations we can't do anything to make sure they don't occur again in the future.  I'm glad that once you checked in most everything was to your liking. If you stay with us in the future you can request a king room at the time you make your reservation. This isn't a guarantee, but we can usually accommodate your request.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary Heading: It was Great for Parents, Kids and Grandparents!!!!
Summary: We just stayed with you the 26th and 27th of June 2011.  My family had a great time staying at your Hotel. The rooms were great, thanks for putting us together!  The restaurant was fantastic. The food,( Waiters and Waitresses.) Thank you so much , we will be your guests again very soon!!  Oh and I forgot the shuttle bus , Wow great!!!
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Wow! Thank you for the great comments! We always do our best to try and ensure our guest's have a great stay and are so happy we succeeded in your case.  We certainly look forward to welcoming you back very soon.

Summary Heading: Hotel was fine , location not great
Summary: Went with family, hotel was clean albeit carpet seemed damp and there was a damp smell like if you're in a basement of an older house. Otherwise service was good and everything looked clean. Biggest disappointment was the transportation to Disneyland, you have to take the Anaheim resort transit that stops at hotel. Supposed to come every 20 mins but pretty unreliable as we've waited for longer at times. Was a hassle enough that we took a taxi on several occasions for 10 to 12 bucks each way. If you have young kids like us, they will need naps so we would go in the mornings and have them nap at hotel in the afternoon and head back to disney in evening. Well each trip takes 30mins to 45 mins total including wait time and travel time of 10mins.  If you add it up four trips a day
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to submit your review of our property on Trip Advisor. We appreciate your feedback.   I understand your frustration with the shuttle service; the time it takes certainly would make traveling back and forth to the parks much more time consuming. I'm am glad that you found the hotel to be mostly to your liking. I believe the carpets had been recently shampooed just prior to your visit. I am sorry that they were still wet.   Once again thank you for your comments.

Summary: Very nice for the price. Hotel was accomodating to non-smoking and double beds (me and my daughter for softball).  Rooms were nice.   Booked through Hotwire.com
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review on Trip Advisor.  We always try to meet and exceed our guest's expectations and are happy we did so in your case. We look forward to welcoming you back to our property the next time you are in the area.

Summary: Staff was very helpful, friendly and accomodating. The room just had a feeling of "dirtiness". Would not stay here agin for that reason,.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for submitting your review of our property. We appreciate your taking the time to do so.  I apologize that you found your room to feel "dirty". We make every effort to meet our guest's expectations and are disappointed when we don't. I am glad that you found the service to be satisfactory.

Summary: We stayed here two different times in the last four months. Both times booked thru priceline. The hotel was nice enough. We didn't have an opportunity to use the pool or hot tub, but they looked nice. I asked for two beds and was told that they only had two beds available on the smoking floor at this time, and they were booked full for the night. Interesting since I checked the internet and they had plenty of rooms available for that night. We also were given the same story on our previous visit in February, so I am guessing that they normally give smoking rooms to priceline customers.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Thank you for the nice comments you posted regarding the hotel. I'm happy that you found the hotel mostly to your liking. I do apologize for the situation with the room you requested. I am not aware that smoking rooms are being given out to Priceline reservations, but this is something we will look into. The internet often shows that we have rooms available, however they may not be the specific type of room you had requested.  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments, and I do hope you will visit us again and have time to take advantage of the pool and the hot tub!

Summary: We have taken groups to many places and stayed in many hotels... this one was the worst to work with for feeding our group. We had runny oatmeal one day and cold hard danish the next and were told this was our "hot breakfast" . We had to go out and purchase additional food every day to feed out group - after having to pay for the breakfast the hotel provided.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort guest,  I certainly apologize that you found the breakfast choices for your group to be limited. I did check with our sales department who arranged your group's visit to find out what had happened with your breakfast requests. I was shown your contract where you had approved the meal choices and several emails in which the breakfast choices were discussed and even changed to include fewer items than what had originally been agreed upon.  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on Trip Advisor.

Summary: From the location to the room, and all they way down the list they made my vacation perfect!
Manager Response: Dear Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  Wow! Thank you for the high praise. We always make every effort to meet and exceed our guests expectations and are very happy to have done so in your case.  We hope that you will come back to stay with us again in the not to distant future.

Summary: I got this hotel for a great price on Priceline.   It was modern, clean and the staff was the best.  The free parking was a major plus as was the pool area and gym.  The only negative was the restaurant.  The waiter was extremely rude to us.  My twins are 12 so they should eat free, but he thought my daughter was over 12 and  wouldn't give her a  kid's menu.  I ordered for her from it and he just glared at me.  He also came back every 60 seconds to pressure us in to ordering.  My 2 teenage girls gave up reading the menu and ordered bagels and toast.   I ended up not ordering for me, but did order for the twins because he scared them.   When he left with our order, I told another waiter to cancel our order and we  left.   When I complained to the front desk, she didn't much care
Manager Response: Dear Holdiday Inn Anaheim Resort Guest,  I am so sorry for your experience in the restaurant. This type of situation should never occur, and we always want to know when something like this happens. For future reference there is always a manager on duty. Whether it is in the restaurant or the front desk, management is always available. In the event something like this should ever happen to you again, I would encourage you to insist on speaking with the manager on duty. This is the only way we can make sure to speak with the proper employee to ensure this never happens again with another guest.  I am glad that you found the hotel to your liking; we always endeavor to meet and exceed all expectations and when that doesn't happen we too are disappointed  Thank you for taking the time to tell of your experience.

Summary: Comfortable beds, nice pool area & close to Disneyland.
After reading a few negative reviews I can't believe some people. This place is awsome. Its clean.free parking and for minimal fee.bus rides to disney.
A/C was really loud.  Too far from Disneyland.  Had to pay for a shuttle or drive yourself.  Only one restaurant at hotel, no others within walking distance.  Price was good through priceline.

The place wasn't too busy while we were there and it was a comfortable stay. We went to disney land and it was a short stroll to the park. I would recommend it for couples looking for semi-affordable places to stay while visiting disney. There isn't much else in the area to do..  Really comfortable.. thats about all I can say.

My husband and I celebrated Valentine's Day here. We purchased a Jacuzzi room, with the romance package. The jacuzzi was wonderful, clean, big, and very convenient as it has a door from the bathroom as well as easy access to the bedroom. The romance package was delivered on time, however I don't think I would pay for that again, it came with champagne, strawberries, bubble bath, and chocolate.. I could have bought everything for cheaper than they offer it. The hotel staff were great, and helpful. The hotel and rooms were very clean and newly remodeled. The hotel was conveniently located near a fast food place, and the freeway. We ordered room service for breakfast and it came rather quickly and was very tasty.

Stayed one night so I was close to Disneyland. Overall a good experience. Room was clean quiet and nice. The only complaint was the T.V picture quality wasn't that great but it did have a good selection of stations. Room service menu looked reasonable but didn't order from it based on some of the reviews I have seen on here about the restaurant.
we actually stayed next door at the Staybridge but had about 5 evening meals at the Hoilday Inn restaurant.  Each time the meals were superb and one of the highlights of our stay in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: It would've been cool if I actually went to Disneyland...
Summary: The title of my review expresses the fact that my guy and I were unable to go due to unfortunate circumstances with our admission tickets and a family emergency. So I'm still freshly bitter and saddened by it all. But that is OK- because we can always drive back up and I would definitely stay here again!  I booked through Hotwire and was a bit hesitant with my results. From what I had read, the reviews were mixed but I went with my gut because we would only be there for one night and out the door the next day to Disneyland. Plus, it was an absolutely fabulous deal!  The drive was pretty straight forward, as it can be easily seen from the highway. Be careful if you do decide to take the carpool lanes on the 5-North, you might miss the Katella exit, which is exactly what happened

Why? "Free Internet" is never up. I barely got connected for about 10 minutes max during our four night stay. When complained they said will fix, nothing done.  The shuttle to Disneyland is not free, thats fine. However the issue is it does not come often enough. We could not get in the bus twice, because there were way too many people waiting, so the bus got full. Missing a bus once means you almost waste close to an hour in the lot (with two kids).

This hotel is nearly perfect if you are traveling to the Disneyland Resort.  Rooms are clean and comfortable, and I was amazed at how quiet the hotel was.  The walls seemed to be soundproof.  You could not hear other guests, even in the hallways.  The adults in our group slept very well on the comfy beds.  Our boys enjoyed the 'kids suite' which had a TV and XboX, yet fair warning!  They require a deposit for the use of the Xbox, games, controllers, etc.  *check the fine print before booking that room*  (we brought our own controllers/games so only has to pay $100 deposit)   The room had plenty of storage space to hang clothes, etc, and the bathroom/shower was a generous size  Holiday Inn has an awesome 'conservation' program where they request that you not change linens/towels

Summary Heading: Great place to stay - modern conveniences and friendly staff
Summary: I stay at Holiday Inn's on a regular basis for work and I love them but was extra pleased when staying at this Holiday Inn.  The staff was great - very  friendly and helpful while checking us in and  we loved the modern design of the hotel and our room (we thought it was very new but heard it was about 10 years old).  My wife and I stayed there because we wanted to be close to Disneyland where we were celebrating our granddaughter's 5th birthday and it was very convenient to the "happiest place on earth"!  And we loved that after a long day at Disneyland, the hotel had a great bar where we could have a nightcap.  Our bartender was perfect - she was really sweet and very helpful when we asked about the hotel and places around the area.  We had a really good breakfast in the hotel

Summary Heading: A great place for both vacationer and business traveler
Summary: I picked this HI because of its location to my training. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. The restaurant provided a great breakfast buffet and evening dinners. Angie, the waitress, did a great job getting me that first cup of coffee to get my day started. There is a bar located adjacent to the restaurant which made it convenient to business travelers and frazzled parents. The bartender Jennifer was quick to pour a cold one after my long day of training. The hotel was definitely worth the value. If family or friends are coming along even better since the Anaheim attractions are extremely close. I will definitely be back. I would rate this HI at the top of all the HI’s and HIE’s I have stayed at. Try and get a room that faces Disneyland that way you can watch the fireworks

This hotel itself was nice. It was very quiet. Staff was nice. The only qualm I have was the maid service. We stayed for 6 days. We spent most of our time out of the room at Disney, later in the day, usually after 4 we would come back and kick back for an hour or two before we would head back to the park, the maids still had not come. This happened 3 of the days, one of the days they didn't come at all.  The restaurant was nice, decent food. I loved having free wi-fi. Free paper in the morning and free coffee available downstairs. I would stay here again, but I do hope the maid service impriogves.

Hotel is conveniently located near both I5 and Disneyland Resort.  The staff was very attentive to all our travel needs, everything from an expedited check in to a simple request for extra blankets after a return from the park.  We opted for a Queen bed suite which was spacious and comfortable and very reasonably priced.  The only downside, and a minor one at that, was that the bed was a little hard for my taste.    The restaurant in the hotel was a great place for breakfast and dinner.  There were a lot of choices on the menu and the food was really good and the service was great!  Not to mention the Happy Hour from 5pm - 7pm which was a little easier on the wallet when indulging in a few cocktails after a busy day at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: WORST PLACE EVER!!!! DONT STAY HERE
Summary: THE hotel was FOUL, I took pictures, it was dirty broken, selled gross, graffiti all over, things were broken or missing in the room and the staff was unprofessional. HORRIBLE. I complained to the staff and they tried to charge me for the messed up room.  Then the hotel security came up at 12 midnight while my kids were sleep to take pictures.  They then told me that they were in a high turn over area and that was the reason for the broken unclean room! gross!  When I woke up I found a slip of paper that had rrom charges, well my family and I were out at the park when the $20.00 in charges were made. They took those off. Then I showed the manager the pictures of the room they put us in and even she commented on how gross it was.  DONT STAY HERE!!!  And your custermer serivce was

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice, restaurant need new management
Summary: The rooms are nice. Didn't like the fact that I had a refrigerator, but no micro-wave. Can't warm up left overs (which I always have a lot of).  The restaurant isn't as nice. Got cold eggs every morning and rubber bacon the first morning. Be sure you ask for it crisp, they do a good job of that. And why is it I can not get shredded potatoes when it's pictured on the menu? My steak, mashed potatoes and veggies were barely warm last night.

Summary Heading: Smelled like someone died in the room
Summary: The room we were given smelled so bad that it made us all sick. We told them and they came in and sprayed the room with the thing that looks like what you spray weeds with. We only stayed there for 30 mintues and then left and went to a new hotel. We had to pay for two hotels because we couldn't give are money back but there was no way we could stay there.

Summary Heading: If you have other choices, don't stay in this one.
Summary: The journey starts when three of us took a Disneyland vacation at the end of March, 2011. I simply put them in points. 1. The room smelled like someone had smoked in there although we booked non-smoking room. 2. The mug in the room had a thick white streak stuff in it. 3. We booked "one" room but they gave us a "joined" room which provided "loud and clear" sound effect from another room although we entirely  didn't need during our sleep. 4. Every time the air conditioner started to rumble, it sounded like launching a cannon ball. 5. It says "free internet", we can't get any reception from the room. We had to work in the lobby to have a better reception. 6. Alarm clock and wake up call none of them worked. 7. We spend three days in Disneyland from morning till night, somehow we

Summary Heading: I will never stay here again!
Summary: When we arrived the hotel clerk took our ID and Credit card.  My room was already paid for, so he need a copy for any extras.  I was not aware that this was going to cost us $50 for each room.  We had 2 room!  $100 and we haven't even made it to Disneyland. I cannot tell you how rude the clerks were when we asked about the charges.  I was so disgusted with the front desk service, I never went back up there the whole trip, except to check out. They told me I would get my $50 per room back.."Haven't see it yet."  It is now the March 31,2011.  Also, the breakfast is not free as it said in the package I bought.  I alway had a $10 to $20 charge on my tab.  The food was cold and old. It was nasty!  When we first arrived one of our rooms did not have an Iron.  We had to ask the maid to
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review; we appreciate your taking the time to let us know about your visit. Unless we know about the negative occurrances, we cannot correct them to make sure they don't happen again.  As a matter of information only, regarding what you refer to as the credit card charge, is actually a hold that your bank places against the funds when you use your Debit Card. It is the bank's policy to hold the funds, not the hotels. We do not have any control over the hold placed against the funds on the Debit Card, and we can do nothing to reverse it. Only your bank can do that.

Summary Heading: Very Good Service make up for location
Summary: For our future Disneyland trip we will look elsewhere.  While the ART system provides shuttles every 20 min or so, it would be better to be able to easily walk to and from Disneyland.  We booked our room through Priceline bidding.  Will not do that again as we ended up with a smoking room.  While the Manager did let us "smell" multiple smoking rooms to pick the least offensive, we still were not able to get a non-smoking room due to availability and that we booked a "standard room through a third party".  The restaurant was an average hotel restaurant.  Food was typical, however the service was usually good.  Get a room on the back side as rooms facing the freeway are noisy.
bad timing,weather was horrible,wished we booked a week earlier,or week later,however other than weather stay and attractions were great,especially for a first timer for the area and attractions

Stayed with a friend for six nights. Overall a very nice stay for what one would think of for a Holiday Inn with a few complaints. Very easy check-in and out and friendly, informative desk staff. Basic two-bed room with coffee, fridge, etc... (all the basics) but no microwave. There was one avail 24/7 in the ground floor 'store'. Ice and laundry on our own floor (9th). Large heated pool, hottub, and fitness center. ART (shuttle to Disney and other attractions) was right outside the main door and the ticket kiosk was easy to operate. So my real complaints are here. I had heard a lot of revews praising the on-site restaurant. We had breakfast one day and the food came within two minutes of placing our order. Upon arrival is was only mildly warm, very small portions, and seemed as
Manager Response: It is said, “One should never start a letter with an apology”; however, this is obviously an exception to the rule.  I sincerely apologize for the situations you encountered in the restaurant and with the Housekeeping staff. The appropriate Managers will be informed of what took place during your visit. Our entire hotel is very proud of the service that we offer, and anytime we do not meet and exceed the expectations of our guests we too are disappointed.  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  This will allow all of us to learn from our mistakes and ensure that these situations do not occur again.  We look forward to your return to the Anaheim area, and another opportunity to serve your hospitality needs.

Summary Heading: Good for families, not so great for business
Summary: Good hotel for families going to Disneyland; not great for a solo business traveler.   Rooms and common areas are excellent. The staff is professional and accommodating. Comfortable beds. The hotel is filled with families and children.  Common areas are often noisy and sometimes congested; a little hard to take for this solo business traveler.  Restaurant is a little worn, but reasonably priced and decent service.  Free internet is OK for email, but slow for browsing, and not for videos. Located very near Disneyland with a low cost shuttle.  Not much within walking distance. The hotel fronts the freeway.  The windows do a good job of reducing noise, but ask for a room to the rear.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review; we very much appreciate it. We are sorry that you didn't find our property to be the perfect fit. We always strive to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and are happy that in the grand scheme of things we were able to do that. Perhaps at another time you can visit us for a leisure visit. Once again, thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Great hotel in terms of it's location - hardly 2 miles from Disneyland, Anaheim. Great connections / travel arrangements to reach the resort. Good and helpful staff. Great shopping place within the hotel. Good restaurant; but no breakfast buffet :( great ambiance; Spacious rooms, good and free parking. Must, if you wanna visit Disneyland for two days.

This is a great hotel.  Near Disneyland and during the summer you can see the fireworks from the west side windows.  The personel are very accomodating and helpful in addition to being friendly.  Always a smile and a hello.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - very convenient for business - very good restaurant attached to hotel
Summary: This hotel has very good service.  It is located convenient to multiple areas for business.  The restaurant attached to the hotel is great for business travelers.  Jennifer, the bartender, was very friendly and the food was very good.  The exercise room is also better than average.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review of the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. We are happy to hear that the staff and the hotel itself met your needs and expectations. We will be sure to pass your kind remarks on to Jennifer!  We look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the not too distant future.

Summary: We stayed here from Feb 12-18, 2011.  A wonderful hotel with very helpful staff.  The pool was huge and our kids (7 & 9) really enjoyed it.  Having the bus stop for the Disneyland shuttle and the bus for Sea World and the airport was so convient!  Would stay here again in a heartbeat! Great Experience!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of our property. We're so happy that you and your family had such a good time; we always strive to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and are happy to learn we succeeded in your case.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort in the near future.

Summary Heading: Top notch service all the time.
Summary: Everyone was very friendly and polite throughout the check-in and entire stay. The room was very nice with plenty of room and a desk for me to work at in the evening. The area has plenty to offer with many restruants and activities for entertainment.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review! We very much appreciate your kind words. We always make every effort to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and are happy to learn we succeeded in your case. We look forward to welcoming you back to the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Nice surprise when needed a hotel in a hurry.
Summary: Stayed here while visiting family at a nearby hospital.  Was located close to restaurants and liked the restaurant that was in the hotel as well.  Staff was friendly and price was good.  One of the better Holiday Inns I have stayed at.  Would stay again when in town.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review! We very much appreciate your kind words. We always make every effort to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and are happy to learn we succeeded in your case. We look forward to welcoming you back to the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: The Best Disneyland Area Hotel for a Family with Children
Summary: I have stayed at this Hotel Several times and believe it is the best value in the resort area. The Hotel is always clean, the pool and Hot tub are big, and the food at the restaurant has great food. But I think what makes this the best value is the restaurant. As a single father it is hard to afford a good meal on a budget. Some of the other Hotels offer free breakfast....but at this Hotel the kids eat free for breakfast and dinner. It is a full service restaurant which is easy to keep the young ones close. I plan to go go back to the Hotel in the future.

Summary Heading: great location. great price. friendly staff.
Summary: I couldn't have asked for a better location on a recent business trip to Southern California. The room rate was great, the hotel is located right off of I-5, the staff was tremendously friendly and helpful, and the room was very clean. It is also a 15 miniute walk to a number of nice restaurants, like PF Changs and McCormicks & Schmicks. I would definitely recomend this property to anyone looking for a place to stay in this area.

Summary Heading: Descent hotel, average food but restaurant staff is very friendly.
Summary: It's an OK hotel, very close to a freeway.  Convenient if you are driving.  Very basic, no bells and whistles.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, awesome rooms and great amenities!  I'll stay again!
Summary: This Holiday Inn is a outstanding facility with people who go out of their way to help out!  One of our group got carsick on a day excursion and went looking for some medicine in the gift shop but they did not have any.  The lady went out and got some that night so we could have it for the next day!  Great Service!

Summary Heading: Comfortable and Affordable stay near Disneyland
Summary: We rented a Jungle Kids suite that provided an Xbox for my son during our rest periods from the amusement parks. A great idea. It provided a rest for my wife and I. The room was large enough for the 3 of us to live comfortably for the 10 days of our stay. Some traffic noise from the nearby freeway was noticeable from our room but it was not a burden. Rooms were cleaned and maintained to a high standard especially considering the child market that this room is aimed at. Staff were all friendly and helpful.  We ate the downstairs restaurant most nights and the food and service were of a good quality. One night was rather disorganised when there was an obvious staff shortage but overall an enjoyable place to eat. Perhaps the only drawback of the hotel is the distance to

Pros - awesome walk-in shower.  Great bed.  Lots of power receptacles for my laptop, charger, and CPAP.  Nice, comfy chair.  :)  Great cable channels and nice roomy room.  Ridiculously friendly staff everywhere - no exceptions.  Easy to use free wireless.  Con - no ice machine on my floor, but not a big deal.  No free airport shuttle service to SNA.  Overall this was a great stay, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: To me, this hotel almost ruined the brand of Holiday Inn
Summary: I've never been to an Intercontinental chain hotel feeling being tricked. As a platinum priority club member, I was given two breakfast buffet coupon. However, I was never told I could only use one per day. I have two persons, so of course I had to pay for one breakfast buffet. It is obvious the hotel is trying to trick the customers to have breakfast at the hotel. I was stunned I even experienced this kind of thing at a Intercontinental chain hotel.  On the day of departure, experienced another surprise. There was no business center. Want to print the boarding pass, pay some dollars for 15 minutes to use their computers and pay another $1 for each page to print.  Wife also strongly dislike the hotel due to the above experience. She stayed at Crowne Plaza Anaheim/Garden Grove

Summary Heading: Great Value - Very good experience definetly exceeded expectations.
Summary: From someone that spends nearly 100 nights per year in hotels, the Holiday Inn Anaheim definetly was a pleasant experience. Especially considering its close proximity to Disney, the value was exceptional....very nice newly remodeled rooms.  The restaraunt / bar was solid. I will make this hotel my choice whenever in the area.

The hotel was descent.  We stayed in the kids suite with the bunk beds.  It wasn't exactly what i expected, but the kids enjoyed the area.    The hotel worked out very well with the location and a bus that would take you back and forth from the hotel to the parks.  It was about a 10-15 minute trip one way.  The price for the bus tickets is reasonable.  It sure beats dealing with the price for parking the then being schuttled to the park from where ever they decided to park you.     The restaurant in the hotel has very good food and you can't really beat the kids eat free with the purchase of an adult meal if you are a guest.  You will also get a 10 percent discount if you are a priority club member.  Meals at the restaurant will cost at least half of what you would pay at the

Summary Heading: The  amenities  at  this  hotel  make it exceptional."
Summary: This was our second time to stay at this hotel because of its exceptional service!   The food at  its on-site restaurant  is  delicious. We ate breakfast and dinner at the restaurant and enjoyed  both meals.  It was our son's 10th birthday.  All the waiters/ waitressess  came  to our table and  sang "Happy Birthday"  to him.  The pool is heated  which was perfect for when we went swimming at 10 pm. Prior to our arrival,  I called ahead to make some specific arrangements.  The woman at the front desk was very helpful. One morning,  I informed the front desk of a problem in our room.  When  we returned in the evening,  the problem  was corrected.   Since we rented a kid's suite,  my sons had their own tv and XBox.  They had a blast playing the XBox  games which they were able to

Summary Heading: Nice hotel met all our requirements
Summary: You get it as advertised. Price is right, shuttle is very convenient.  The kids "room-within-a-room" was OK... a little beat up but certainly did not affect our use.  Restaurant is great.  We were a little skeptical on the "kids eat free" deal but it is exactly that.  Portion size did not leave anyone wanting for more.  We would stay here again.
Nice place to stay.  Quiet and the restaraunt onsite is nice to have.  Very close to Disney and the pool and hot tub were great.

I travel on a weekly basis and I have the option to stay at another chain but this is hands down the best hotel in the area for business and pleasure.  Customer service is a top priority and the people are amazing and always willing to help with any needs I may have.  The rooms are always clean, bathrooms are spotless and they have all the amentities of home.  I have to be away from home quite often and they always make me feel welcome.  I wouldn't stay anywhere else, this hotel continues to go above and beyond for the traveler.
Nice hotel and good restaurant.  Cable TV needs ESPN Channel.
My stay was very good. Our restaurant/bar experience was excellent, thanks to service provided by Jennifer. Jennifer was very helpful and accomondating to our needs.
Don't say here!!!!! Bad service and the room was falling apart

Stayed her last May when my fiance took me to Disneyland.   Hotel was great. We got there early and our room wasn't ready so they let us go to the pool area. We also forgot toothpaste which they had for us.  Staff was super helpful.   We weren't really at the hotel much. So much to do in Anahiem, the free parking was a super bonus.  Room was clean, and perfect for us. Were at the end of the hall so quick quiet.   Would stay here again for sure ! Hope to go back again. Love me some Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Incredible value for service and location - A real surprise
Summary: Obviously, I was traveling through an off-month, but for $75 / night I wasn't expecting the location or service that I found in this HI.   It was convenient to HWY 57 and off of Katela Road (the primary road into Disneyland resort area).  It is set up for both the park tourist (Anaheim trolley stop, purchase park tickets and other lobby services for Disney), but also for the business traveler (within a mile from the primary restaurants, easy in and out, and a quiet feel to the floor layouts).  I was especially impressed wiht the hotel restuarant.  Food was excellent and service was better than I had experienced in a long time.  I will stay here for all my future travel to the LA area.
Great people and easy access. Hotel was very pleasant and the restaurant food was great.

Summary Heading: Great location, comfortable and friendly accomodation.
Summary: Great location near freeway to allow travel to whole area near Anaheim.  We would recommend even for travelers not planning a trip to Disneyland.  From front desk to Jennifer in the resturant/lounge, the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: I love your hotel, your staff is like family...
Summary: Manuel and Jennifer are fantastic! I've been staying there since you first opened... Keep up the great work.

Summary Heading: Great stay in prime location with excellent service
Summary: I stayed here by myself while traveling thru the area. The staff was pleasant at check-in, the rooms were spotless, and the bartender Jennifer in the on-site restaurant was wonderful. For being located so close to Disney, there were alot of children and families staying here which generally makes for a noisy experience, but everything was wonderful.

Summary Heading: very nice hotel, however not an easy access to get to from the highway or main streets.
Summary: Very clean rooms, bed was comfortable and bathroom was extremely clean

We stay at this hotel whenever we travel to southern California.  The hotel is always clean and bright and the staff is friendly and accommodating.  I travel a great deal for business and I have a huge appreciation for a comfortable, clean, and safe nights sleep.

A great place to relax whether your on business or with your family, the hotel prides itself on being friendly & courteous to all visitors, rooms are extremely clean as well as the grounds show exactly what the hotel is like.... Clean & Tidy....  I always stay at this hotel when i'm in the great LA area for business, not because it is always close for work purposes but knowing that the resort has very high standards to assist & make sure everyone has a great stay.   The Hotel has a restaurant, buffet in the mornings for breakfast which is fantastic value. The lounge is always a great place to relax for a cold beer or glass of wine after a long day, Jennifer the bartender is and as always been a great host whenever i'm in area. Thanks Jennifer & keep poring the drinks. :)

This hotel is very clean and seems to be very new. I dont know the age, but if its old they have done an excellant job with renovations. The staff is friendly and knowledgable of the area. All in all you cannot find a better hotel for the price in the Disney area of California.
Stayed during the week while on a business trip. I was impressed with the quality hotel & cleanliness of the rooms.
The location is very nice and I enjoyed the stay. The room is complete, with refrigerator and coffe maker. Perfect to stay with child or even a couple. Very clean and confortable.

Summary Heading: Good quality hotel with comfortable rooms and good service
Summary: The hotel was conveniently located near the Anaheim Convention Centre where we were working, about 1.5 miles away and there was a good size car park. Our stay was very comfortable with the rooms being large and clean and the service was good. Breakfast was reasonable but surprised you had to pay for Orange Juice on top of pre-paid breakfast. Hotel prices were reasonable. Lots of reasonably priced restaurants nearby.
My stay at the Holiday Inn was enjoyable. I was given a clean and comfortable room.

I have stayed at a lot of hotels through the years while vacationing at Disneyland, this hotel and its employees were wonderful. Great food service by Manuel and Vira they were the tops. I would recommend this hotel to all...
