Stayed at The Holiday Inn Resort Area Anaheim with my family in January 2011. Conveniently situated and hotel room was clean and of good value. Overall the service was very good. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel  restaurant (American Brasserie) has a fairly good breakfast and dinner menu at reasonable prices. Our waitress, Viri was very friendly and willing to accommodate our needs.The service was quick.
Stayed one-night; room was in good condition; the food at the restaurant was OK for the price plus you get 10% off as a priority member.  I would come back again.

Summary Heading: Not a great place to stay. Hotel was not very clean.
Summary: Pros:  Check in was speedy and simple Free parking $4 per adult for shuttle/ $1 per child Free internet  Cons: A little too far from Disney Land and food (cannot safely walk) Shuttle took about 45 mins to pick us up DIRTY! I am shocked other reviews say this place was clean. I arrived on a Thursday around 3pm and found two dirty wine glasses sitting outside our door (not our glasses). Fast forward to FRIDAY night (about 11pm) and the two dirty wine glasses were still in hallway. I finally moved the glasses to the middle of the hall for someone to pick up. For a hotel to allow dirty dishes to sit in a hallway for two days is pretty disgusting. The toilet was not clean properly. Honestly, I'm not even sure much cleaning was done to the room beyond changing the sheets.

I have mixed feelings about this hotel..The room was decent the bathroom was nice and big .Our room had a view where we could lie in bed and watch the fireworks at Disneyland...that was a plus! Free Parking!The maid service was not good and I even left tips...the room was never vaccumed nor the counters wiped down...the cups were not cleaned my husband even found a big black hair in his cup......yuck! I don't care if the room is old and rundown......cleanliness is number one for us ! And it had an odour of skunk! So, it has its perks but, it also has room for improvement with the maid service.

Literally on a last minute whim on a Tuesday, I decided to take my daughter's to Disneyland that day.  Went online and this was what I got from Hotwire for $50/night.  GREAT DEAL SCORE!  Packed up my daughters and drove down to SoCal.  Not typically known for my spontaneity, I was scoring major points.  When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised.  I'm not big on Holiday Inns, but this was well done.  Everything is quite standard issue about the facilities, but it was much nicer than I recall Holiday Inns ever being.  Bedding comfy, room spacious, pool area nicely done, close in proximity to Disneyland (you could conceivably walk it, however, we did not).  I would certainly not hesitate to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Merry Christmas!  CAN'T WAIT to be there in 95 days!
Summary: As we are enjoying our evening and holiday cheer, we are thinking of all our friends at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort and wishing you all a Merry Christmas!  We are counting down the days until our next stay at your hotel - 95 days and counting!  We simply cannot stay anywhere else.....your hotel is the best Disneyland hotel in the area.  We have stayed with you 5 times in 4 years and we will continue to come back again and again!  This hotel has exceptional service, amenities and hospitality like no other.  Carrie and Caroline, the managers, will help you with all your necessary arrangements while Jose, Patricia, Ankur and Ron will check you in quickly and help you with all your vacation planning.    Sherri, the gift shop manager, is a sweetie-pie and her smile will light up

Stayed here 4 nights and found it to be a perfect hotel for Disneyland and Anaheim area. Front desk staff and housekeeping were so friendly and helpful with any request. Nothing was a problem. Rooms are comfortable, clean and I have to say the beds were so soft and big. Slept the best that I have in a long time here. Didn't find it to far from Disneyland but did drive there only becasue we were staying until disney closed each night. Bonus that there is no charge for parking here at this hotel like closer places. Would stay again here for sure. Thanks for a great stay.

Hotel was OK. Rooms were average rooms showing a little bit of age, Furniture worn, wallpaper starting to wear and peel. Bathroom was OK, not much in the way of provisions only soap and shampoo/ conditioner. They did have a card saying "If you forgot anything they could supply complimentary toiletries" but after requesting some toothpaste (one of the items listed) I never received any.Only Coffee provided in room with powdered milk/whitener as a hot tea drinker this didn't help, had to heat the water thru the coffee machine and provide my own tea bags and buy milk. Safe in room was faulty also. Bit of a walk to theme parks ( which we did do) but Anaheim resort transport at door for $4 per day. Pool looked nice but didn't get around to going for a swim. Guy on front desk was

Summary Heading: Good hotel for the price we paid
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for three night during our stay in California.  The hotel was in a good location, close to Disney and close to restaurants.  The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful,  We arrived at the hotel around 10.30 and were unable to check in so they stored our luggage for us so we did not have to leave it in the car whilst we went out.  The hotel room was a good size and was clean.  There was also a safe in the room free of charge.  There was also a full size fridge in the room, along with a small freezer section.  We had two standard double beds which were a little on the small side, i think if we stayed again we would opt for a King size bed.  he tv was old and not a flat screen but did have lots of channels.  Wifi was free in thr room.  The bathroom was

I stayed here with my son who is stationed in the Marines.  I hadn't seen him in a while and we decided to head to Disneyland.  The resort was perfect.  The rooms were big and very clean.  The American Brasserie had half price drinks and appetizers during happy hour which was great for us on our first night.  The pool area is large and clean.  We loved the snack bag given to us at check (i think it was because we were priority club members).  Most hotels I searched had expensive parking fees, but the parking here was ample and free.  After a long a great day at disney, we were one of the first stops on the shuttle.    It is close to restaurants, convenience stores and it was great to be so close to a Target.  The staff was friendy and check in and out was quick.  I would
Jennifer in the lounge has been on site for years and always has a nice smile to greet us at the end of a long day. The food and service is excellent.

We stayed here for three nights and it was better than our stay at the Hilton Anaheim and the Sheraton LAX.  We had two oversized double beds, a safe that actually worked, a small refrigerator and a view of the fireworks at night.  No charge for parking, shuttle picks you up in the front, restaurant that wasn't overpriced with a lounge and room service too.  The staff were welcoming and extremely friendly.  I understand that they don't provide conditioner with the shampoo but I always bring my own since I'm fussy about my conditioner.  Our room was just as clean as any 4 star hotel we've EVER been in.  The furnishings were also just as well kept as any other higher end hotel.  I wouldn't hesistate to stay here again and am sure we will.  We stayed here three years ago and it's

We decided on this trip to Disneyland that we wanted to stay at a hotel rather than a motel, expecting better quality.  While the room was definitely nicer and cleaner than other locations we've stayed in, we found that this hotel lacked some of the amenities that some of the cheaper motels offer.  For example:  free shuttle to Disneyland, continental breakfast.  They do have a bus to Disneyland that stops outside the hotel, but it costs $4 per person.  While this is certainly cheaper than paying for parking at Disneyland, one would expect a hotel so close to provide a shuttle.    Also, the room did not include hair conditioner.  I have not been to a hotel, in recent memory, that provided shampoo without conditioner.  When I called the front desk to see about availability of
My entire experience at this hotel from chick in to the restaurant service is exceptional.  The staff treats me like a member of the family.

The 4 of us (2 adults, a 12 year old, and an 8 year old) had plenty of room w/ all our stuff (8 days worth of clothes, snacks, & necessities).   Room was clean & had efficiency size refrigerator, closet w/ shelves, small table & 2 chairs.  We didn't always get 4 glasses & 4 sets of towels & had to ask for them but housekeeping came up right away.  Front desk staff did their jobs but did not go out of their way to help you or even say hello.  We asked for directions to a grocery store.  The man acted like it was a bother & gave us the wrong directions.  Fortunately, we had a GPS.  The pool was warm.  The air conditioning worked well except the air blew right on the beds.  We opened the window (highway was really noisy).  Got rooms at a great deal, especially for southern CA -

My spouse and I wanted to go to Disney Land and found a great deal on aa.com. We saw the nice pictures of the property and we decided to book it for 6 nights. We arrived at the hotel, walked into the lobby and saw one front desk rep with two patrons in line. I joined the line, standing there for a good 5 minutes or so. As I was waiting, I've noticed that she didn't looked at me, didn't smile, no eye contact, no welcome, she didn't show me that she acknowledge that I was even there. That ticked me off. I flew all the way from Dallas, Tx on vacation to stay in this hotel, and I can't even get a single "Hello, be with you soon". Going to the front desk felt equivalent to checking out locker equipment at a local school gym. Not professional at all. I've seen time and time again,

Summary Heading: brilliant! clean and quiet rooms, great shuttle for disney.
Summary: we stayed here for our trip to disneyland. after looking at many hotels not sure what to go for, we booked this. we were not dissapointed. after 10 hours on a plane and a 1hour drive through LA rush hour we arrived. the staff were nice and freindly. we booked the kids suite with the jungle theme, which the kids loved. the room was large and clean and we had fresh towels everyday. the shuttles arrive approx every 20 mins for disney and is only about 10 min ride. we would stay here again.

Great hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff very helpful. The restaurant was great ! awesome service and the food was always good and reasonably priced. We stayed here for 9 nights and ate at the restaurant almost every morning.

Summary Heading: Hotel was just okay... nothing more, nothing less.
Summary: The hotel room was nice enough. The staff at both the check in desk and in the (vastly understocked & overpriced) gift shop seemed to be put out when asked any questions. The pool and hot tub were nice but kept having sectioned cordoned off while they were having the trees trimmed. The restaurant downstairs was NOT good. Food was cold and bland. The price was good and the room was pretty clean, although a previous guest had shoved crackers into the A/C vents. We didn't spend much time in the room, so it was just okay.

My husband and I travel to California every October and this is the first time we've stayed at the Holiday Inn there.  We were traveling to see the show Let's Make A Deal and Disneyland.  Needless to say, we had a great time thanks in part to our wonderful stay at this hotel!  The place was clean, the location was excellent, and the staff were very friendly!  We will defenitly come back next year!

Summary Heading: Great Location and Service Staff Was excellent
Summary: Enjoyed my short stay in Aneheim, CA.  Service at the Hotel and restaurant.  Enjoyed the food too at the American Brasserie Restaurant.

It was an absolute pleasure to stay at this lovely hotel. We hired a car and were pleased to find that parking at the hotel is free.  Check in was fast and efficient and the public areas were clean and well kept. Our room was lovely and clean, with air conditioning and a fridge.  Beds were very comfy, with a choice of firm or soft pillows.  An iron and ironing board are kept in the cupboard.  Bath and shower in bathroom, with a hairdrier and the toiletries were by Bath & Body Works.  Lots of local and hotel information was available in the room. Ice machines are available on alternative floors and there is a guest laundry on the 9th floor.  It was a dollar to use the machines and quarters were always available at Reception. I’m a very picky eater, but I absolutely loved the

Summary Heading: this hotel will be the one i return to time and again
Summary: We had been touring CA for 8 days when we arrived at the Holiday Inn Anahiem Resort. I was pleasantly surprised by our entire visit. Checking in (out too) was quick (I even received a goody bag of treats), the staff was friendly and helpful (I had a problem at our last hotel printing our disney tickets). This is the cleanest hotel including the common areas, guest rooms and especially all bed linens. The anaheim resort transit picks up every 20 mins from the hotel - there is a automated ticket machine for transit tickets(only $4) and a covered waiting area outside the hotel door- it was thew first stop so we didn't have to worry about rooom to sit for the short ride. Also the restaurant prices were reasonable. This will be our hotel of choice when traveling to Disneyland

Check-in was a bit lengthy and after getting the key-card and inspecting our room we realized that It hadn't been cleaned since the last person left, so we went down to check-in after waiting again, they gave us another room which was clean.  The hotel has a nice spa and pool and a gym to work out a little.  Location wasn't all that bad if you like walking.  We rented a car so it wasn't bad at all.  The restraunt there is a little expensive, I would recommend eating out cheesecake factory is just around the corner.

We stayed three nights as part of a vacation package. If you stayed at Holiday Inns before this is very typical, Our package included breakfast, food quality  bland average and servings small. The claim that the Disney shuttle runs every 20-30 min is optimistic at best and we had 20 to 45 min waits to get back to the Hotel. I will stay across from or in Disneypark next time. an hour a day wasted on waiting for a crowded city bus. The hotel staff was not helpful and never smiled. We asked for rooms near friends and was told "you get what you will get".  Housekeeping par. beds are not queens they are full size.  there is a small fridge which was helpful. If you are business traveler this fits the bill if you want to relax and play well its just to far. I am not sure I will trust

Summary Heading: The front desk was no where near as helpful as their housekeeping!
Summary: We pulled in to the hotel after my 3 year old managed to get car sick all over herself and her father.  The front desk, to be real honest, didn't help at all.  They acted like they couldn't care less about the situation and their "assistance" was pointing me down the hall to the bathroom off the lobby where I was expected to wash her completely down.  (Apparently if you arrive 1/2 an hour before check in time there is supposedly NOTHING that can be done to get us unto a room with a bathtub.  I'll remember that the next time my child spontaneously throws up in the car.)  As I am trying to figure out how to wash my little girl, her clothes, the car seat and every other target known to her vomit, the housekeeper (Sylvia) saw my situation and ran to get some towels so I wouldn't

We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. We booked through expedia and got a very good deal.   Good points: The check in was very quick. The staff were always very helpful and were very open to answering questions about the area and how to get places. The basics (food, booze, snacks) were all really close, you could walk in less than 10 minutes. Disneyland shuttle was affordable and efficient. We never waited more than 10 minutes at either end for our bus to come.  The pool and hot tub were clean and not very busy. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean. our room was on the seventh floor and we had a great view of the nightly fireworks.   The negatives: The restaurant at the hotel was awful. My boyfriend and I are not picky eaters and rarely complain

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel, didn't like the location
Summary: We were able to book a pretty good deal on this hotel.  Although we would prefer to stay closer to the park, we decided to stay here based on the price.  We stayed for 7 nights.  Positives -The hotel is clean.  Early in the morning, I would walk outside and they were always cleaning to make sure the entry way was well kept. -We were impressed with the overall service from the front desk to the maid service. -We were impressed with the hotel resturaunt.  I was surprised by the quality of food and service.  I stay at a lot of hotels and it was as good, or better than most. -The pool area is really nice.  There is room away from the pool to sit, and it is a nice, large pool.  Negatives -We flew into Anaheim with the intention of taking the shuttle from the hotel, so we didn't rent

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on a buget...excellent service
Summary: We stayed here to do Disneyland.  We were attracted to this hotel because of the kids suites.  Our twin 7 year old girls loved their little suite, complete with an X-Box.  The lay-out does leave the adults feeling a little cramped, and the adult bed is right next to a noisy air-conditioner.  Still, for the money, we were comfortable.  The bathroom is very large and was clean.  The restaurant and staff were excellent and the kids ate free off the kids menu.  We got 10% off also for having a priority card.  Other reviews felt the restaurant was expensive, but we didn't really think so, but coming from Alaska, we are used to higher prices.  All in all, it was a good experience for the money.

We reserved through Priceline and had to pay $105, which was high, but the best I could find.  They put us in smoking rooms and when we asked for non smoking, informed me that they did not have to offer me a non smoking room when I registered through priceline.  The front desk clerk was very condescending and made me feel lesser becasue I got a room through Priceline.  We went to take the shuttle to Disney and it was $4.00 per person.  The rooms were very small and the public areas were less than clean.  They offer shampoo, but not conditioner.  It took  five minutes for the water to get hot in the shower. The only thing good about this hotel was internet access.   I would never stay here again.

I was, pleasantly, surprised by the updated look and feel of this place.  It was nice being close to Disneyland and not have to pay the high prices of staying in/outside the park.  Plus, no additional charges/fees for parking my car at the hotel.  It was clean....the staff was very courteous....really can't complain.

Summary Heading: Don't get full size beds for four people!
Summary: We were able to book this room for a great price through priceline, however, they would only give us full beds for four people.  Very uncomfortable!  Also, not in walking distance of Disney.  Will have to pay for shuttle or pay to park.  No parking fees at hotel, however, which was nice.

Travelled with a friend and we stayed for 5 nights in September 2010. Checking in was a breeze and all staff that we came in contact with were fantastic. Room was very clean and comfortable. Our room faced the pool and we didn't hear much noise - from people or the freeway.   We went to Disneyland for 3 days using the ART bus which was perfect. It enables you to leave the park, come back to the hotel for an afternoon swim, then back to the park at night. So close via bus, but would not recommend walking - enough of that at the park itself in a day.  We hired a car for 2 days - driving to LA/Hollywood and Universal Studios. Not too far of a drive - plus, we wouldn't have liked staying in Hollywood, Anaheim is much nicer!  The pool and spa were great. The spa was great to relax

I just stayed at this hotel for four nights for Disneyland vacation with my 8 year old son. The hotel is very clean, convenient shuttle service to Disneyland all day long, great food with excellent service, great prices for rooms and food, kids eating free is really nice for the wallet.

Summary Heading: Our favorite hotel to stay at when we visit Disneyland!
Summary: My husband and I had annual passes from May 08 to May 09 for Disneyland and once we discovered this hotel, this is where we always stayed. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and great location to Disney make this a great choice. We drove our car, so we didn't have any issues with getting to the park. It is not within walking distance. They don't charge for parking or any other hidden fees. Because we got our hotel price on a bidding site, it was an absolute bargain at about $45/night. We don't spend much time in the room when going to the parks all day - but they were always quiet for the most part. It was raining all day one day that we were there and almost an entire row of parking spaces was flooded. That was the only thing that went wrong!

Annette at front desck was doing extra to make sure we wore please she event help doing our reservation and boarding pass for our flight.  At the restaurant Viri was very quick and efficient to help has we had a handicap traveling with us. We rented 2 rooms and we where 2 adults  and one teennager and one mentally challengeadult.

Summary Heading: This hotel is within minutes to every major Orange County attraction...
Summary: This hotel was a great choice for the teams who all had to play at the American Sports Center. After the games they were able to walk to the Anaheim Garden Walk. Directly from the hotel they were able to ride the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) shuttle to Disney for around $4 for an all day pass. They were able to use the same pass to go to the Block at Orange. The hotel has a half court basketball goal which was great for the teams and the children who traveled with the parents and spectators.

My granddaughter and I stayed for 4 nights during our trip to Disneyland.  We were on the 9th floor and had a good view of the fireworks from Disneyland.  Our rooms were very clean and nice (I'm really picky).  My granddaughter also loved the swimming pool and wanted to swim every day. Excellent value for the money.  Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel. Clean affordable rooms and close to all attractions!
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We spent a couple days at Disneyland and the shuttle service was excellent. We upgraded our room so it was divided between the adults and the kids. The 'kid section' was very cute with bunk-beds, their own TV and video games. The room was clean, the food was good. I would highly recommend it!
I travel to and stay in the Anaheim area quite often. I have always liked the Holiday Inn on Manchester. Not only is it convenient, but the staff it a pleasure to stay there.
Enjoyed both dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant.  Food was good and the service was prompt & polite.

Summary Heading: Good quality hotel at an affordable price
Summary: This Holiday Inn offered a high standard of accommodation and service.  We stay at many Holiday Inns around the world and this was one of the best value for money Holiday Inns that we have found.  The breakfast choice and quality of food was excellent as was the service.  We also enjoyed the health club facilities which were quite adequate for our requirements.  Although we did not get to use the pool and jacuzzi because our stay was too short, this was a pleasant and well maintained area and we will use it next time.  Our only complaint was regarding the attitude of one member of bar staff but this was quickly and expeditiously resolved by the Holiday Inn Management team.

This hotel mostly met our expectations in terms of the location, amenities and room quality.  We were also very satisfied with both the service [Guillermo Villegas], value and quality of the food at breakfast and dinner.  We also enjoyed the health club facilities though the treadmill could do with a service or replacement as it was extremely noisy. If there were any complaints about this hotel it would be limited to one unhelpful member of staff in the bar but this issue was eventually resolved by the duty manager and we received a swift apology from the hotel manager before our departure.

Summary Heading: Fifth stay in four years, and I will keep coming back!! FANTASTIC STAY EVERY TIME.
Summary: We have stayed at this property five times in four years and we keep coming back because the property is immaculate.  The staff have made all the difference to us, from the restaurant, the front desk, housekeeping, gift shop, and management.  We have consistently had our expectations exceeded, the hotel is maintained, clean, quiet, and a complete escape from our everyday lives.  The restaurant is delicious, the rooms are great with comfortable beds, and we even watched the fireworks from our room window!  Enjoyed the full gym and the pool/hot tub was great. From Mansour, Angie, Manuel, Viri in the restaurant to Jose and Patricia at the front desk, Carrie and Caroline the managers, and Sylvie in housekeeping - ALL have made us feel special and gone out of their way and beyond

Summary Heading: Good experience of the Holiday Inn Franchise
Summary: Excellent room, service and surroundings. Everything was immaculate, well presented and maintained. The staff were always extremely helpful and courteous, without being obsequeous. The restaurant was a bit pricey but the selection was adequate.

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Anaheim-Resort Area Holiday Inn
Summary: i travel for business a couple times per month and always try to stay here. The front desk staff is very knowledeable and friendly. The hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland and Anaheim Stadium. There is plenty of parking in the rear of the hotel and the restaurant staff is also very friendly.

Summary Heading: Hotel was clean and comfortable, staff was excellent and great location.
Summary: I've been staying at this hotel regularly for the past three years.  The staff is excellent and extremely friendly.  The location was great, as it is near to various restaraunts and the shuttle system to Disneyland is convenient.  Rooms are clean and comfortable. The restaraunt / bar is great, although it would be very nice if it is open later.  When you're at the bar, ask for Jennifer, she's awesome! Oh, one negative that is kind of annoying, is that ESPN is not on the tv in the guest rooms.  If they get this channel back on their guest tv's, it would be perfect.

Summary Heading: the staff very polite rooms clean
Summary: I found this resort to very clean. The staff very helpful and friendly. I also found this Inn very close to Disneland and only minutes to the beaches. There were plenty of tours although we did not take any the buses were there each morning  loading to go. The hot tub and pool were clean and plenty of towels. We enjoyed our stay very much.  .

Summary Heading: We picked a winner in the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort!
Summary: We are a father & son baseball touring group and had an excellent stay at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort. The staff was outstanding. We've been to a lot of motels over the last 13 years and several of our guys commented on the incredible quality of their bed and the great size of the room.  If you are a baseball fan, the Holiday Inn is 1 mile from Angels Stadium. We walked comfortably. Some of our guys went to Disneyland - it is about 1 mile in the opposite direction of the stadium - some walked and some rode the convenient shuttle.  There is also some good eating within walking distance.  To clarify the voucher about having a business relationship with this hotel. I have no official relationship other than I organize baseball tours around the country and took our tour to this

I visited the anaheim area on business and booked myself at the holiday inn .The ploace is at a great loication a couple off blocks from the block at orange and easy access to fwy and disney.i was very impressed with the hotel staff front desk Jose and Ron,Since i was there a few days i visited the restaurant at the hotel for dinner.Food was great and the bartender Jennifer was very pleasent and attentive.the pool and the small gym was great just perfect for my stay.Rooms very clean and one thing i really was impressed that in the morning when i was leaving for work even the housekeeping staff said good morning . i would book this hotel anytime i am in orange county
I travel all over Southern California and never feel more at home in a hotel then I do here.  The customer service is one of the best.  I can always count on having the best stay when I am there.

Summary Heading: The best place to stay in the Anaheim area if you want top notch service from the best staff possible.
Summary: I have traveled on business for 7 years and the is the best place to stay. The staff always welcomes me and makes me feel that my business is really appreciated. The full service bar and restaurant is top notch and the staff is awesome. The rooms are large and very clean. Free internet is the room is a very nice perk. The hotel being just off the 5 freeway allows easy access for getting around. There are numerous restaurants with 5-10 minures of the hotel. I enjoy every aspect of this hotel and I look forward to my trip because of the staff and service that I receive each and every time I visit.

Summary Heading: Service and Quality hit home at this hotel
Summary: I stay at hotels all over the country but when I am in Southern California, there is no better place for the price. Service in this hotel is priority one. They have what you need and i they don't they often get it for you. Great breakfast and a very good dinner selection with all of the items available in room service suites me well. The staff always make you feel at home and even anticipate your needs. Their kids eat free policy has me staying here when I come with my family as well. For business, it is close to all of the major hiways and for fun your just a short shuttle away from Disneyland. I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel for everyone.

We made reservations with the 800 number and booked a 2 room suite. We were traveling with 2 teenagers. When we arrived at the hotel, they informed us that the room we booked was not available! Never was! The only room available in the whole hotel was a kids suite. We had no choice but to take it. The "kids suite" was no more than a regular room, but with bunk beds, and  enclosure around it, it was the size of a regular room. I wrote an email to customer serivce, since no one at the front desk was willig to help us, and the next day the manager called our room and she found a 2 room suite, (the one we originally booked) so we moved to that room.When we checked out our bill had a charge on it that we had to get reversed, because none of us ordered or ate at the restaurant. They

I have stayed at this location 3 years in a row for business and the hotel has been a fantastic crew to work with! That's the reason we keep coming back. Affordable prices, clean rooms, excellent location - it's everything we are looking for! I like that it's easy to get to, parking is free and it's also easy to hop on shuttles to Disney. Our group has not experienced any issues. I highly recommend the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort!

We traveled with 180 middle school band students.  The staff was more than helpful and very courteous to our parents and students.  This was our 7th stay with Holiday Inn - Anaheim Resort and we will be back in 2011.  The rooms and public areas are very clean.  We love staying here.  The location is good and parking is very easy and FREE.  My family and I have also stayed here and will continue to do so.  The staff is there to help and no question to the front desk is left unanswered.  Great place to stay!

Summary Heading: The best service and value for your trip!
Summary: I have been booking the Holiday Inn - Anaheim for several years now for groups as well as business travel to the area.  I have stayed at several different hotels in the Anaheim area and I have to say, I have been the most pleased with the Holiday Inn - Anaheim rooms, quality of service and price. The hotel and staff are truly a pleasure to work with, efficient and make it easy to book my block of rooms. The housekeeping staff always made sure that the rooms were clean and well stocked.  They make it an easy choice for me when I come to Anaheim.    The pool and workout room was clean and well equipped with everything I needed.   Morning breakfast at the American Brasserie Restaurant is quick and easy and they will even give you your coffee to go if needed.  For a minimal fee, the

Summary Heading: Great location, Great service, Great Hotel!!!
Summary: It is not easy to go on a trip with a large group of people. But at this Hotel the staff made it so easy for me that I had time to also enjoy the trip. When we arrived everything  was ready for us. The rooms were clean and well equiped. The shuttle service to Disneyland worked like a clock. Everything that we asked for was done in seconds. It is a perfect choice at a perfect price!

Summary Heading: Excellentoption away from the Disneyland strip
Summary: We enjoyed our week long stay very much.  We had a one room suite with a separate living room (fold out sofa bed).  It was not real big but big enough since we spent our days at Disney and seeing the sights.  The hotel was very clean and workout equipment was in good working order.  We did not use the pool but plenty of people seemed to enjoy it.  The restaurant food was very good and room service was super fast.  You get a 10% discount on food if you are a Holiday Inn priority club member.  The internet was a little sluggish but it was free, so good enough.  The staff were extremely helpful and responsive to requests for additional towels, directions, etc.  FREE PARKING!!!  Though the hotel is only 1 mile from Disney, I would not advise walking (especially with little kids) as
Don't even bother thinking about looking into this hotel. They didn't even clean the carpet for 3 days.  That said it all....

Got this hotel via Priceline. At check in- was told that all they had was a SMOKING room. They give Priceline guests no guarantee on room - it is basically what ever is left over.  I have a 2.5y/o and smoking room was NOT acceptable. They had the audacity to tell me that the room is aired out. What about third hand smoke??   After long discussion with supervisor - i had pay upgrade to get a kiddy room with two bunks.   Room was small, dark and next to HVAC system.  Fortunately only there for 3 nights.    Elevator sticky with pop residue - never cleaned properly during our stay.   Front desk was uncaring and not friendly.  Mattress was deformed and bed squeaked.    STAY AWAY FROM ANAHEIM HOLIDAY INN.

Was labeled a 3 star hotel and I have seen nicer Motel 6s.  Was told the only room available was a smoking room and because I booked through a third party website (who doesn't?) that there was nothing they could or would do to accommodate.  Room is small, phone was broken, door handle to restroom was broken, dust on the TV was thick,  This place is horrible

Summary Heading: Awful service, lousy location, plywood beds
Summary: Let's start with the staff.  On check-in the counter staff wasn't friendly, it was as if I were bothering them during something important.  Then we forgot something in the room and called the following morning.  The person answering the phone couldn't help us but sent us to the managers voicemail.  After not getting a return call by mid afternoon we went back - we were at a much nice hotel locally - and it took ages for her to locate and return the item. Then there's the location.  By Disneyland and the convention center?  I don't think so.  Not within walking distance, there's a slow, crowded, and expensive shuttle service to both locations.  It took a good fifteen minutes to cover the 2 miles to the park.  Want to drive there?  It's on a one-way street, you have to drive a

Last August we booked a room through Priceline and the room was a mess.  They gave a smoking room to us even though we called ahead and requested otherwise.  I was travelling with my mom who has major problems with smoke filled areas.  We tried to make the best of it, but it was a nightmare.  As we tried to go to sleep, I pulled back the curtains to block the light and found blood or spaghetti splatter all over them.  We called the front desk but they said they couldn't do anything about it because of what time it was.  We later found the same issues with one of the pillows, and the carpet.  Disgusting!  Priceline had this hotel issue us a gift certificate for a future stay so they could rectify the situation.  It has almost been a year and we have yet to be able to use the

The room was spacious with a nice sized refrigerator. The beds were comfortable and the maid service was good. The restaurant on the premises made excellent pancakes and the fried chicken was awesome. My boy ate all his breakfast and dinner; the bottom line critic! The pool area was nice with a large jacuzzi. The pluses are the free parking and the local transit to Disneyland. The fee for an all day pass is $4 for adults and $1 for a child. I would rate this as a true 3 star hotel and more. Very satisfied!

Summary Heading: The property is suppose to be newly remodeled and corporate run!
Summary: We checked in and went to our room. The floor our room was on reeked of cigarette smoke. It was the floor were smokers stay. We noticed the lamp was missing by the bed and informed the hotel clerk. He sent a person dressed as a security guard (late night Hotel engineer). He was same person guarding the cars in th eparking lot. He told us he was going to look for the lamp in our room. He looked in the closet, under the bed, in the bathroom, behind the tv and behind the curtains. He sure made us feel like we stole or hid the lamp. He did not find the lamp and left saying there were no extra lamps in the hotel.The rest of the pictures tell the story of our room.

This was not my favorite place we have ever stayed.  It was not very clean and it was very noisy.  There were many groups of traveling high schools while we were there who were very noisy.  The rooms were run down and the hotel was very noisy.  I was not thrilled by this place, but I guess you get what you pay for.

We stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort for two nights. The service at the front desk was polite but nothing more.   The hotel is located a touch too far to walk to Disneyland or any of the local shops unless you're super keen. There is a sparsley stocked shop on site.  The beds in the room are uncomfortable and small. Other than that, the rooms are a little dated but tidy and of a reasonble size. As seems to be common in this part of the world now, there are no mini bars in the rooms. The attached dinner is ok, the service was good but the food was unexciting.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel With A Wonderful Staff
Summary: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a very warm welcoming.   We had a room on the fifth floor with a great  view of Disneyland firework display.  The rooms was very spacious, clean  and the beds slept  wonderful.   We could not ask for better staff personnel, they went the exact mile to help make our stay perfect.  The pool area was clean and well equiped  with lounge chairs.  The breakfast at the restaurant was great too and the price was adequate.  The transit to disneyland was easy to pickup and drop off at the hotel.  The price for this service was very reasonable.  With the help of the excellent  staff, Devin and Vicki they made our frist trip to disneyland a great success. There is no way you can go wrong with spending your vacation here at this great Holiday

This hotel is awesome!  We stayed there last weekend on a Disneyland weekend trip from Phoenix and wanted something with a two room suite so the kids had their space and we had ours.  We were on the 9th floor, were greeted by friendly and helpful employees at the front desk when we got there and had a perfect room for what we wanted!   This is a GREAT place to stay if visiting Disneyland (only 2 miles away) and we WILL stay there again! Kudos to the staff!

Summary Heading: This hotel is for Disneyland - even the pool is shaped like Mickey's head.
Summary: Transfer from the airport via the "mini-bus" service. These are very well organised and cheap. I considered hiring a car from the airport - but sat in the van in the rush hour, at dusk, and not knowing where to go....NO THANKS! The stree of driving would have been too much, and we'd have probably been in Mexico now as I wouldn't have seen the highway exit.   The hotel is out of the way for any "walking" evenings. You can't take a stroll - well you could but not in the holiday sense, if you know what I mean!  I wouldn't walk to Disney, and there was no need - there was a door to door service every 20 / 30 minutes. Day ticket are obtained at the entrance and naturally this is the reason your'e here - so just do it!  LA is really 38 miles away, so again we did the max tour and

I got this hotel on a successful Priceline bid for a 3-night stay at $41/night.  I think the fact that I was a Priceline customer influenced the room we got.  We were placed on the fourth floor, the smoking floor, and had a disgusting room that wreaked of cigarette smoke.  I requested a non-smoking room with the hotel directly after the successful Priceline bid but apparently there wasn't one available.  When we arrived, it took over 15 minutes to check in, and this was at 10:45 at night with two clerks working, with me as the next person in line.  After check-in the elevators were broken, and we ended up having to hunt down a service elevator to get up to the fourth floor.  The room itself was worse for wear, even ignoring the smoking part.  There was no way to stop the HVAC's

The Holiday Inn was recommended by our travel agent as we didn't want to spend a lot of money on accommodation as it was just a place to sleep but we still wanted somewhere half way decent.  The room was great, two queen/king size beds, very comfortable we would be so exhausted by the time we got back each night we would go straight off to sleep!  Very clean and the bathroom was great.  We liked having the restaurant in the hotel as we had breakfast there each morning before we left, saved us a lot of time trying to find somewhere.  They also had room service so great when we were wanting a late afternoon snack before heading out again.  The staff on the front desk and the restaurant where nice, couldn't help but feel like just another tourist though.  Although in saying that

Summary Heading: Better than the Anaheim Hilton at the Convention Center
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed on April 5-6 to go to California Adventure.  We had stayed at the Hilton in Feb and March and after we were in the room my boyfriend said he'd rather stay here than at the Hlton again. Checking in was fast and easy and the staff was really nice. The room was super clean and the bathroom was huge. Big closet with a in the wall safe and automatic lights that went off by themselves. We had a non-smoking room and it was a very big room. I was a little disappointed that the curtains didn't close but in the morning we were not woken up by the sunlight, I was very pleasantly surprised. The room over all was very comfortable, I don't even remember falling asleep. Checking out was fast and again the staff was very nice. There is a resturant in the hotel but we

Summary Heading: It was an okay place to rest for a few days
Summary: We stayed here for two nights.  It was okay, but nothing stood out.  We had a room facing I5 and could hear the traffic, but I had a small fan and it blocked out the noise.  I stayed here with husband and 2 kids aged 11 and 12.  We were only here at night, in Disneyland all day.  Likes: The beds were very comfortable.  The room was big enough for 4, had a fridge, ironing board and iron. ART bus easy access.  It was $4 adults and $1 for kids, but did not state how old a kid needed to be. This was an all day ticket. Dislikes: I5 next door (not bad).  Cleaning crew did not go out of the way to clean, just the minimal. Did not leave washrags or extra soap.  The pictures in the bathroom were dusty and had stands or hair on them, yuck.  Like I said the bare minimum in cleaning.  My

We picked this hotel because we were able to get it for $74 / nt and parking was free. We drove to Disney 2 days and took ART one. Both are good options depending on whether or not you want the flexibility to leave the park and come back to the hotel at any point. The hotel restaurant had great service, reasonable prices and really good food. Happy hour was a pleasant surprise as well. We would definitely stay here again as it was super convenient and right off of the 5. Take advantage and go to the Block of Orange if you have a car. Good shopping and restaurants.

Stayed here with my husband and 2 kids (3 years and almost 2) for two nights while visiting Disneyland.  This hotel is not walking distance to Disney, there is a bus for a fee but we drove.  No parking fee at the hotel which is huge as little fees start to add up.  We got this room at a GREAT price through priceline.  The room was pretty clean.  The carpet had some stains.  My biggest issue with the room is the walls seem to be pretty thin.  We had pretty loud neighbors (like 3am loud) and it woke me up the first night of our stay.  All in all it was a great hotel for what it is.  Also, the free WiFi was slow but a great added touch.

An old friend and I decided to get together for a Disneyland-Knott's Berry Farm trip.  We both grew up in O.C. and then moved away.  Now we are senior citizen ladies!  We decided to splurge on the 2 bedroom-2 bathroom family room (we were in room #5102).    This is a great room right next to the pool.  Warning:  If the sounds of people having fun disturbs you, don't get this room.  There is also piped music to the pool area that is very audible inside the room.  However, the pool didn't open until, I think, 9 am and closed by 10 pm so it didn't bother my friend and I at all.  In fact, when a song we liked came on, we got up and danced!  We enjoyed the three TV's, the fairly large refrigerator, the sink and counter area.  A desk in the main room where we were provided free WiFi
Very good location, specially if you plan on going to Disneyland. The Anaheim Gardenwalk is also a very nice option for entertainment.

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel with an aggressive restaurant onsite
Summary: Attended a trade-show at the convention centre. ART made it easy to commute on the convention days.  20min walk if preferred, with sidewalks all the way and pedestrian crossings.  I also rented a car and had easy access to the I5 for longer trips and local driving a breeze.  Hotel right next to Interstate but I heard no traffic from my room and was able to see the disney fireworks from my window.  Room was clean except for a carpet stain by the TV.  Bathroom clean and ample bedding.  Room was serviced timely.    I found the restaurant service was at times carefree.  Menu was aggressively structured for max spend.  bar was friendly.  Room service was fast with delivery charge and gratuity billed in - indicated on room menu.  Front desk was helpful, warm, friendly and efficient.

This Holiday Inn was very clean, and a comfortable home for our three night Disney vacation.  The rooms are luxury for the economy price.  Upon check in we received a gift bag of water and snacks.  The bath products are Bath & Body brand.  The king room is well appointed with good linens and great pillows.  A big comfy chair to relax in.  The pool and jacuzzi area are beautiful with plant life and music is playing above in the speakers.  Stays open late.  So perfect after a long day of walking around Disneyland to relax in the jacuzzi.  Our six year old loved it as well as the Mickey Ears shaped pool.  This is a wonderful place to stay.  The restraunt in the lobby is good for breakfast and less expensive than many of the eateries in the resort area.  Walking to Disneyland is not

Hotel was very nice.  Staff were friendly.  Expected freeway noise, but heard none.  Convenient access to Disneyland.  The restaurant wasn't great -- service was slow and the food wasn't that great.  Not bad, just average.

Decided to try the holiday inn resort area hotel on our recent trip to Anaheim/Disneyland.  What made me stay here was the family room that had a double bed along with bunk beds and a day bed(kids get their own tv).  With 3 children ages 6, 4, and, 2 it worked out pretty well especially for the price.  Advance purchase was about $85 a night.  The kids beds are partially walled off so we get a bit of seperation but the rooms are not huge and they are not a 1 bedroom style set up.  Because we were at disney all day we didn't really mind the set up too much because we basically would come back to the room and crash. The resort is less than a 5 minute drive to Disney.  We prefer to rent a car and pay the $14 parking fee instead of waiting for the shuttle service.  You are right on

All the negatives first:  Reserved a 2 bdrm-2 bath suite for 5 days.  The suites are located in a separate building and the only way to get to the second floor are via stairs.  The place is run down, door knobs are loose, whirlpool baths are moldy, toilets have very loud fans.  No flat screen TVs, flimsy doors.  One night, people across the hall were making so much noise between 10-12pm, we had to call security twice before they responded--most of the noise was coming from non-guests.  And their wifi is a disgrace.  They say it's free, but I could not connect 99% of the time with either laptop or iPod Touch.  Called up the internet service, but they supplied no assistance.  When I went to print out boarding passes, it's 69 cents per sheet bw and no duplex, six boarding passes

Stayed here for the recent Namm show convention. The hotel is situated just off of the I5, on  Manchester. Although close to the major amenities and night spots of Anaheim, it's actually quite difficult to walk anywhere due to it's location on major road junctions and intersections. The location will always be subjective in these reviews, so as we were based at the Convention Center, it wasn't ideal (or the closest), but it served our needs well.  Check in was painless. All reservations were correct and check in was efficient and I was in my room within 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel. There is plenty of free parking available at the hotel.  Being a smoker, I was located on the 4th floor. My room had two doubled sized beds, with a large TV and a selection of popular cable

Stayed here for a few nights in December.  On arrival I found staff were really pleasant and chatted away as we were checking in.  Rooms were very nice and out of all the hotels I have stayed in while visiting the U.S,  i would def say this was the nicest so far.    Had breakfast in the hotel a couple of mornings which was good and there was a lot to choose from.   Would def recommend and if I ever go back to that area, would def stay again.

Summary Heading: Don't bother internet best rate guaranteed
Summary: Spent 20 minutes on the phone, first with hotel, then reservations, then with internet best rate guaranteed department. Was disconnected once, person at hotel was friendly but not very professional, did not discuss resort fees. Reservation department was not helpful at all, gave me separate number to call. Internet best rate guaranteed is a joke, first I was told that Cheaptickets.com was a bidding site and they could not honor the rate (incorrect) then the representative continued to "look into it" and waste my time trying to figure how not to give me the $25 overall lower rate. When I asked him about resort fees he flat out said he had no idea about resort fees. I finally hung up and decided they obviously did not want my business. Besides it is not walking distance to

Came here 12/24/09-12/27/09 staying 3 nights/4days.  Had been at this hotel 6 years ago for our last Disneyland trip as well.  It was great then, and we were glad to see that nothing had really changed. Rooms are NOT huge, but were adequate.  Bathrooms were decent.  We booked 2 rooms (for 6 people) @ $90 avg per night.  I know I probably overpaid, as you can probably get cheaper via priceline like sites...but I wanted to be sure I got the rooms I wanted (non smoking/2 beds).  I can almost swear that you end up getting a better room by booking direct with the hotel, as the rooms we got were on the top floor (9th fl), clean bathrooms, view of pool and disney fireworks, and ajoining rooms as requested. Anyhow, the rooms conveniently come with a minifridge, and you can always heat
We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights from Nov 14th - Nov 19th. Rooms very clean & tidy. Hotel in general clean & tidy. Service very good. Would recommend & would stay there again.

We stayed here for 3 nights from 12-15th November 2009.  This was prior to us goin on a week long cruise from LA.  The hotel was very clean, modern and airy.  The room and standard of cleanliness and linens etc was very high.  There is complimentary free WIFI in your room, which we loved.  The restaurant in the hotel was good, quite reasonable for dinner a bit more expensive for breakfast though.  The laundry facilities were excellent and allowed us to freshen up clothes for our cruise.  The transport links from the hotel to anaheim area is the ART system which pick up at the hotel every 20 mins.  This takes you to the disney transport depot and you can then access all the other routes around anaheim.  We did not have a car and this hotel was slightly more out of the main areas

We stayed in this hotel recently and the staff were very helpful.  after a long flight from Australia we were very tired with the time difference. and the staff got our room ready as soon as they could while storing our luggage.  the Hotel was clean and the room was too. it was quiet and everything worked perfectly and they had a huge pool and hot tub.  the restaurant was absolutely great for all meals there and we had quite a few over the 4 days.  the staff in the restaurant were great too and gave us great tips on where to go and how to get there.  would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of October. Arrived Saturday afternoon, and check-in was prompt and courteous, we had a room on the third floor, which seemed fine at first, then my wife walked round near the a/c unit and discovered that the carpet was soaking wet. We notified front desk who immediately offered us a different room, or we could stay there and they would send someone up. As we were pleased with the room, we said we'd stay there and see if it could be rectified. An engineer turned up within 5 minutes and attempted to dry the carpet, but it became apparent that it would take a long time, so we opted for a different room.  The new room was on the same floor and was just as clean. As other people have commented, if you're walking to the parks or

This hotel is quite simply the best hotel i've ever stayed in. 2 of us stayed in September this year for the second time.  The staff are unbelievably frieindly and so polite.  Rooms are cleaned everday and maintained to a very high standard.  Shuttle bus is only $4 which takes you to the disney theme parks.  Restaurant is reasonably priced with a good choice of food.  I just can't wait to come back next year!!

Summary Heading: Good Place To Stay In Close Range To Disneyland & Shopping
Summary: I stayed at the holiday inn on south manchester little over a week ago and it was fantastic. I will admitt it isnt close to disneyland for example accross the road but every 20 minutes from the hotel there is a shuttle that takes you straight to disneyland for adults from memory was $4.00 for the hop on and off all day but it is only for one day but if you have a 3 day hopper pass at disneyland you can puchase a 3 day bus ticket from around about $16 I think (dont quote). Not only is it in close range to Disneyland but it is close to the block shopping centre which is a great place for bargains and also close to garden walk, angel stadium and... the cheesecake factory (best resturant ever). I have nothing bad to say about this hotel all the staff is friendly they have there own

Stayed here for one night with my husband and toddler and it was convenient because there was a restaurant right downstairs.  The restaurant food was pretty good-sizable portions at a reasonable price.  Service was a bit slow because they seemed to be understaffed.  The hotel isn't super close to Disney but if you have a car it's a quick ride.  The was clean and comfy and basic.  We didn't get to use the pool or check out any of the amenities due to the short stay.  No complaints here.

Stayed at this hotel with my wife.  Hotel is a bit isolated but staff are friendly and rooms are clean. Only problem was with the pay to use computer in the lobby (the one nearest the window) it took my dollars gave a couple of blinks and returned to the home screen. I told the desk clerk but he said he was unable to give a refund and that he would place an out of order sign on it but he never did, so beware. Other than that no problems with the hotel.

Summary Heading: Good Value but Far from Disney
Summary: We stayed here for a Disneyland trip. My husband and I are runners so walking the distance wasn't an issue. It is a good 25 minute walk though, pretty far even for us since you are on your feet all day at Disney too. It is not a reasonable walk with kids. We took the shuttle once and it was easy and ran right on-time but it takes almost as long as walking given all the stops.   Rooms were comfy and clean. Pool was really big and not too crowded. AC was LOUD though, I agree with the other reviewers. Free parking was nice too. Overall, I would probably stay somewhere closer to the park in the future but the hotel itself is perfectly fine, very clean, and a great deal for the price.   No comment on food, we ate at the park.

My husband, 27, myself 25, and our daughter, 8 stated at this hotel for 7 days and had a GREAT TIME! Everything was clean and working,  everyone was nice and we just loved it. We shuttled to Disney 3 days without a problem. The front desk was so nice! They did what they could to help out with small tasks (postage for post cards, referring a good pizza place, etc)  I disagree woth several reviews ive read and simply can say "you get what you pay for" . Its not a 1000 dollar a night sweet, so you cant expect alllll that.  This hotel was about a 5 min drive from Disney, so I dont know how much closer you can get with out the rates changing! The pool was beauuuutiful, with palm trees everywhere, and a KING size hot tub. We seen the Disney fireworks at night from the room and the

Summary Heading: Great hotel, so clean and friendly
Summary: Fantastic pool, good resturant, great rooms and the staff are so helpful.

simply a great stay! my boyfriend and i had such a fun time touring around all the parks and found this hotel a great place to come back to at the end of long days in the sun.  comfortable room, friendly staff, and great location.

My family and I came to CA for a two week adventure.  We were going to stay one night in Anaheim, then go down to San Deigo for several days and come back to Anaheim for the rest of our stay.  We made our reservations at this hotel and stayed for the one night.  Upon checking in I had a feeling that this was not going to be a good stay.  The front desk employees were rude and acted like I was bothering them by checking in.  The lobby looked nice and the rooms were ok but the service was horrible and price was outrageous.  I have a medical condition where I have to take medicine that has to be refrigerated.  When I asked for a refrigerator for our room, I was told it would be $12 per night.  I fought with them about this.  It wasn't like I was using it for personal food and

Summary Heading: Don't let the upscale lobby look fool you
Summary: Don’t let the lobby fool you.  When you first walk in the lobby and pool area looks very posh.  Then you get to your room.  While it was fairly clean it was extremely small.  The beds were so close to the walls that an adult would have to hope over their bed buddy to get out.  In addition the rooms were EXTREMLY humid, even w/the air conditioner running.  My son’s swim shorts did not dry after 2 days of hanging in the bathroom due to the dampness.  Also the shower curtain smelt of mildew and was inefficient in keeping the water contained w/in the shower area.  Another small thing is that there was not a garbage can in the vanity area, which I really needed while someone was occupying the bathroom area, and one vanity light was broken. Think it cant get any worse, think

The windows and air conditioners of the second floor non-smoking rooms are within 30 feet of 3 ash trays and a major smoking pit, located by the swimming pool. There was second hand smoke coming through the air conditioner and it could also be smelled in the hallways. First thing in the morning, it even came into the bathroom through the walls. The management did not seem to care; the general manager refused to speak to us. There is also extensive smoking by the front entrance way. Also, beds were doubles, not queens, and cleanliness is not that great. The maid also neglected to leave soap or shampoo more than once. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, and although the shuttle is supposed to run every 20 minutes, we sometimes found ourselves waiting for 45 minutes or an hour.

Summary Heading: Very clean and well maintained, but far from the park
Summary: My husband and I stayed here one night before visiting Disneyland.  Our room was immaculate (we paid a little more on Travelocity for a "suite", although it was 1 room not 2), we loved the little video arcade off the pool, the pool itself was quite nice.   We knew when we booked that this hotel wasn't walking distance from the parks, and for our upcoming trips (we go often!) we're trying to stick with hotels that are walking distance.  If it weren’t for that, we would absolutely stay here again!

My wife and l stayed here for a week at the end of June 2009. The room was massive, with a very large comfy bed and a very effective air con, the room and hotel were very clean, but the whole place is just too impersonal, its difficult to explain, but it was like walking into a hospital, all very clean but no smiling faces, all the staff rushing about with no time for customers. The room was well equiped with Iron, Ironing board, hair dryer, free safe, coffee machine, clean towels everyday, a TV with around 20 channels, ice machine on every odd numbered floor and washing machine/dryer on the 9th floor. Nice clean pool and whirlpool area. There was free parking, always managed to find a spot in the car park and there was free wifi, that worked perfectly. We did order room service

Wonderful experience for 3 of us. New hotel, great rate, comfortable rooms and beds, awesome pool. Rooms not very big but sufficient. Easy transport to Disney (buy ticket from ticket machine outside). We shopped at nearby 7-11, eat at Del-Taco at the corner, and were impressed with the lovely new GardenWalk nearby. Easy wireless internet access. Reception is very helpful in booking your day trips.

Clean, and attractive hotel helpful friendly, professional staff, has a game room and a gift shop with snacks. Comfy beds and pillow, refrigerator and pantry were a added bonus. Management put together a wonderful and affordable gift basket for my daughters 3rd birthday. The only negative was that were were unable to utilize the pool & spa..to busy. (next time)  a hop skip & a jump to Disney. They offer ART transportation to the Disney Park, although we did not utilize this feature. Also you can purchase tickets to the Disney Park there at the hotel, they offer maps, and everything you might need for your Theme Park adventure.  I would highly recommend this hotel to  family or friend and would stay here again.

Our stay at the hotel was great - clean rooms, friendly staff and quiet nights.  However, it was upon returning home that we discovered that my husband had inadvertently left a couple of items in the closet when we checked out.  We called the hotel and left messages for three days in the hopes of having them shipped back at our expense.  Finally my husband managed to get someone to pick up the phone as no one seemed to be returning our phone calls.  Housekeeping said that they had no record of any lost items from our room and there was nothing more they would do about it.  We know that those items were left in the closet and either someone in housekeeping got a lovely new jacket (complete with key set) and leather shoes or the next guests to stay in that room did.

I unfortunately had to check in around 6am because my meeting started at 8am, bu tthe front desk associate was awesome. She was friendly and check me in quickly! Food during my meeting was awesome and always fresh. Attendant refreshed everything in a quick and quiet manner. Hotel has restaurant attached that had an awesome staff as well, they sat me quickly and checked to see how I was doing. The staff from the morning, afternoon and evening were all very friendly and helpful, an awesome stay!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Excellent Desk Staff in Busy Resort
Summary: Probably one of the best values in the Disneyland area, but I was there for a wedding in OC and business in LA.  The hotel was perfectly located for me near the freeway and ample restaurants in the area and nearby convenience stores. Onsite parking is abundant and safe.    I arrived early and room was not ready the friendly and accommodating front desk staff offered me an available room with a different bed configuration, but I decide to come back later.    I stayed at this property years ago when it was new, and it remains well maintained - better than most HI's I have stayed in. It is heavily trafficked by families and children so this is no small effort.  Amenities wise all the usual - a mediocre resturant, fast room service, pool, bar, overpriced in hotel convenience store

We stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort on Manchester Ave in Anaheim California.  I was very happy with the overall appeal of the hotel.  The lobby was the first thing we encountered when we finally arrived for our Disneyland Vacation.  We arrived late, around 8:30pm on  a Friday and found a receptive nice staff member who welcomed us with a smile.  After a 4 hour drive from Fresno, through downtown LA traffic and on to Anaheim, the first impression of our hotel was great.  I asked for the kid's suite but was told I would need to pay an additional $35.00 daily for the upgrade.  We were a party of 4, 1 adult with 3 kids in tow.  The hotel responded to my "Priceline" deal with a "standard" room.  All and all, I was happy with the standard room, but was told by Priceline that I

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families with small children
Summary: We had a kids suite and the kids loved it.  In fact, the other, more expensive, hotels on the trip did not match up (as far as the kids were concerned).  They really enjoyed the bunk beds and we enjoyed the separation of our bed from theirs.  Breakfast is also pretty good here.  Dinner was not particularly nice though.

Best 3 star stay for the price. Great staff. Breakfast buffett and kitchen staff are really nice and provide excellent customer service. My kids enjoyed the pool very much. Rooms are nice and cozy. My family had a blast. I have been lucky enough to stay here twice through priceline. Even when I stayed at the Hyatt I came here every morning for breakfast because of the price and nice staff. I will be returning to this place again.  Free shuttle to disneyland.

This is a new Holiday Inn with  comfortable  rooms, comfy beds and thermostat controled room  temperature. The restaurant/bar has limited hours and selections, but there are dozens of good restaurants just around the corner - within walking distance. Such as McCormick & Scnmicks and the Cheesecake Factory.  One thing to rembember. All restaurants close early in this area. If you want and open-late venue Bar Louie is the only thing open.  There are a lot of kids here, but there's nothing you can do about that - it's at Disneyland.  This is a good place to stay if you're doing the Disneyland thing, or an event at the Aneheim Honda Center (formerly The Pond).

We stayed only one night here in order to get to Disneyland early the next day. Our room was extremely clean and VERY roomy! It's quiet although next to the freeway and about a 5 minute drive from Disneyland.   The staff was very helpful, and the pool looked nice but we didn't use it. Very much worth the money, especially with low rates from Hotwire/Priceline.

We visited Anaheim/Disneyland at the end of February 2009 and stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. We got a great deal from our travel agent and the huge room cost us just over a grand, CDN.  We stayed in a KidsSuite and loved it!!  The kids (3 & 5) loved the bunk beds and us parents enjoyed having our own area in this spacious room.  The bathroom is huge & fabulous!  Loved the walk in shower although with little kids, a tub might have been preferable. The room was clean and had a huge closet, small fridge and a coffee/tea maker. A microwave would have been nice but with the restaurant having the "kids eat free" it was ok to do without.    The restaurant was just ok. The staff were wonderful and the service was great but the food wasn't as top-notch. It was definitely passable and

My husband, 2 year old, and I wanted to go to Disneyland on a budget and booked a room (blind) through hotwire.com for only $58/night.  When I called I found on we had a child's suite--great!  The room was spacious if not actually a suite--the kids' bunk was in a partioned area of the room.  The room was sparkling clean and the ARD shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient.  The restaurant had good quality (if slightly overpriced) food.  The staff wasn't overly friendly or helpful--we got confusing directions to the Baskin Robbins which ended up being just down the road.  A BIG plus was the hotel's washer and dryer when our 2 yr. old got the stomach flu (!).  Unfortunately we had to cut our vacation short, but we really liked this hotel and plan on staying here again.

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms
Summary: The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort is all a business traveler could ask for in accommodations.  The rooms are spotless, the staff is friendly and helpful and the location is fantastic!  I would highly recommend this facility to both business travelers and those traveling for pleasure.

Have stayed here four times in the past year.  Very nice hotel with a great pool.  This hotel caters to Disney patrons, but also has a good deal of business travelers.  Not walking distance to Disney, or any restaurants other than hotel restaurant. Rooms are updated and always clean.  My only issue is they have changed their TV package in the rooms and in the bar.  No ESPN or any other sports channel.   What's up with that??   The bar is a sports bar atmosphere, but only NBA games on TNT. This is minor to most - but to the business guy who wants to come back to his room and watch a college game, or SportsCenter - forget it. I did ask the front desk, and the clerk said I should contact managment, because they get several complaints.  Hopefully this will change before my next trip
I stay at many hotels, and I really enjoyed this hotel. The room was large, and very very clean. I loved how quite it was, and how great the desk staff was. Great hotel.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and close to Disneyland
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with the value for money offered by this hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious. Disneyland as nearby. The hotel restaurant food was more than fine. The pool area was nice although dominated by families with (plenty of) kids but you have to expect that with this sort of hotel. Although we will not be returning to LA as a city, we would be more than happy to recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a value for money hotel close to Disneyland.

I stayed here as part of a United Airlines package which included flights and accommodation to Las Vegas, LA, San Diego and San Francisco.  I really liked this hotel.  I have not stayed at a Holiday Inn before, but this one was comparable to a Marriott in my opinion.  The room had two double beds, but still plenty of space.  Very comfy beds, big choice of TV channels, large bathroom, useful fridge, in-room safe, excellent cleanliness and everything was new looking.  We had a handy connecting door to our friends next to us.  We ate in the restaurant for breakfast twice.  It cost about £10 each (including tip) which is a little bit expensive but the pancakes were tasty and it was convenient.  This hotel was part of a holiday package so we didn’t directly pay for it, but I heard

Well when we arrived, we arrived 4 hours before check in and of course they wouldnt let us get our room yet, but we made sure we were getting our 3 rooms and double beds in all of them (there was 14 of us) we then went to disneyland came back really late and the computers were down so they made us wait 2 hours before they could manually check us in! The rooms were spacious (we had to play pins set up and there was still room) The beds were comfy, I didnt like that the ice maker wasnt on every floor. The pool was big and hot tub refreshing. Our rooms had the connecting doors in between ....that was fun and nice. There was a fridge, not enough shampoo (my parents couldnt find it in there bathroom because the label on it says clean and I guess they thought It was something else :)

We were on a three city tour of San Francisco,Los Angeles and Las Vegas on our intinery this hotel was the standard hotel the other two were superior and delux.No way this was the best hotel we stayed in,it had everything fridge, coffee maker, hairdryer ,iron and ironing board there was even a laundry room that you could use for free,two double beds very comfortable,the hotel was spotlessly clean throughout,the staff were very friendly and helpful.A 10minute walk to the gardenwalk shopping mall,great italian upstairs there.You can get a shuttle bus at the door of the hotel that takes you to lots of places for $4 all day.

We booked this hotel through Travelocity around $92 CAD(not including tax) per night for 9 nights. We had 2 double beds. The beds were really comfy.  There were 4 soft pillows per bed. The room were super clean(especially the washroom) with a small fridge so we could store our drinks.  The staff was friendly and we felt the area was safe. A 10 minutes drive to Disney Land. The air conditioning/heater was a bit noisy when it turns on and off. We could hear the loud tick,tick sound but we had no problem sleeping, as a matter of fact we had great nights sleep. Our only complaint is the wireless internet connection. We could login to websites on our laptop but as soon as we click on a link it goes tick,tick,tick and then it just sits there. We had problem sending email through

Summary Heading: In general - a good hotel. We enjoyed.
Summary: I booked the hotel through Holiday Inn site. It was like $80 for Monday night in October.    Advantages: large hotel, large rooms, all appears clean and  well-furnished. The staff is well trained and friendly.     Disadvantage: breakfast is not included. Point. There is a good restaurant adjoined to the hotel, which serves breakfasts from early morning, but (obviously) it is pricey and service depends on waiter's mood. Another story is the shop in the hotel. Everything needed by family to visit Disneyland (from drinking water till sun protection cream) is on sale but quite expensive. No other shops in the area.      Notes. The terminal for different amusing bus tours is just here, so it is easy to get picked up. Shuttle to Disneyland goes once in an hour right from hotel's door.

I agree with a lot of the recent reviews - a lot better hotel than some of the reviews I read leading up to our stay.  Nice hotel, had 2 adjoining rooms with teenage kids in one room.  Rooms were clean and well kept, pool was terrific and the staff were super friendly and helpful.  Stayed 8 nights.  Had breakfast in the restaurant every day, good food and not expensive.  Was a 25 -30 min walk to Disneyland so caught the ART each day. $3 - bargain.  Glad we didn't stay right opposite Disneyland in the end.  Would go back there for sure

We really lucked out by booking this hotel through Priceline. The late night attendant at the desk was SO helpful when we got lost coming from the airport, and they were so nice over all. The rooms were very clean and accommodating, and towards the end of our trip we actually wished we could extend it. Anaheim was in the center of our week's destinations between Irvine and LA and everything else.   Late night snacks here were good, and the restaurant is very nice as well. I really really want to go back.

Summary Heading: Great place at a great price!
Summary: Got a great deal through Priceline and was very happy with this Holiday Inn.  I read the reviews on here and was a bit worried...all for nothing, it was great.  The room was sparkling clean, and had a refrigerator to keep cold drinks and snacks.  Four pillows on each super, comfy bed!  The hotel store was very small and very pricey...but that is to be expected at most hotels.    The restaurant had very reasonable prices and the food was okay.  Ordered room service and it was delivered within 20 minutes.    The pool was closed for remodeling or something...so that was a bummer.  Otherwise, everything was great.  As far as the ART shuttle goes, it wasn't as prompt on this route as other routes I've used it on.  I would drive to Disneyland if staying here again.  The ART only came

Summary Heading: Love the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort on Manchester
Summary: I travel frequently to the Orange County area and this property is absolutely my favorite.  They have upscale amenities with excellent prices.  Excellent location.  Wonderful personnel, clean rooms.  While I travel on business so generally leave early and get in late, the times I've stayed over on a weekend were delightful.  Their common areas including pool and workout facility are first rate.  I could not ask for more.

Summary Heading: Great place for a great price through Priceline
Summary: Location: It is not walking distance from the Disneyland resort area. You will either need a car or rely on ART to get to/from the parks (we had a rental car).
