The morning we checked out, there was a *long* line for the ART and I'm not sure everyone got on the trolley.  However, the ART stop is right at the hotel, so it is conveniently located.  I would not call the area 'sketchy' but definitely not central.  I-5 is across the street, on one side is another hotel and on the other side is a mobile home park.  There are no other services within a short walk (so again, best to have a car if you are staying here).  Room: We had a 5th floor room on the backside of the hotel, so a great view of the mobile home park ;-)  Furnishings in very good condition.  We were in a 2 queen bed

Summary Heading: 2 star not 3 air conditioner is filthy and falling apart
Summary: I would rate this at a 2 star also not 3.I got it from Priceline and very worried as we were there for 10 nights and reading the reviews here tried even to cancel with Priceline,no luck.  Well When we got there I was fairly pleased.Then we went to our room and it smelled like ciggarette smoke they changed us.The air conditioner was DISGUSTING in both rooms and the whole front cover kept falling off and unveiling things I would have been better of not seeing.We thought the house keepers did a very good job every day on all else.VERY VERY BUSY HOTEL.And I thought the male employees were very good.The woman not so much.   The restaurant is horrible and very very dirty we ate there the first night and grossed out and could not return.The store is very expensive But a 10 minute walk

I booked this hotel through Priceline (as usual when I don’t care exactly where I stay:) and got it for $40 plus taxes and fees. It was listed at a 3 star but I would put it more of a 2 or 2.5 star. That being said this was the tail end of a wonder week long stay at a beachfront condo in Newport and we wanted one more day to be close to Disneyland. I read these review after receiving this hotel from Priceline and I was very worried! When I got to the hotel I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the room and hotel in general and the room was laid out very well. We had 2 beds and plenty of room for my baby's pack and play. I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza in June and I must say this is a nicer hotel by far as far as room size, service and cleanliness go.  Pros: My

After reading all the negitive reviews here I was worried about what I would find when I got there. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm and were able to check in right away. The room was clean except for the front of the air conditioner. We stayed in the Kids Suite and my daughter loved it. If going to Disneyland you will either have to use a car or take the ART service, it is to far to walk. Compaired to the lines and waiting time at Disneyland the ART bus service is not bad. We never had a problem in the resturant getting our kids free meal. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The only comlaint I had is everytime we went to the pool there were no towels there. This was always fixed very quickly after telling them at the front desk. I enjoyed my stay here as the rest of

Summary Heading: Not as bad as all the reviews say
Summary: I booked this hotel from hotwire for $62/night for 2 rooms. We were visiting disneyland ..by the time we got to LA, it was either wait to checkin at 3pm, then go to the park, or go to the park (duh!) and checkin after the fireworks.. so, for 3 additional hours of mouse fun, we lost out on the good rooms obviously. That is how hotwire works, you get the best room avail when you checkin. We checked in at 11:40pm, and got 2 smoking rooms (sad but our fault). One room smelled fine, the second had the nasty smoke smell. So I sprayed it with enough perfume to douse it..lol Other than that, rooms are great...linens are wonderful...decor is at par with all other 3stars, in face even 3.5 star...spotless rooms, bathrooms...there's even a fridge and a coffee maker (yay) which we didn't

I went on Priceline and got the hotel room for 55.00 dollars a night. Priceline rated this hotel as a 3 star but it's a 2 star hotel. It was fine but everything seems run down. The front doors did not work the whole time we were there. We stayed for 3 nights and they had a caution tape up around the front doors the whole time. They didn't have the hot tub working. The a/c in our room wasn't working but they did get it fixed after sometime and everything just seemed dated.  The pool area was good but the hot tub didn't work but if it was working then it would be a fun pool area. The exercise room was small, and it had no free weights. It had one treadmill and one bike that had a broken chair.  Check in was easy and had no problems. I would say the hotel is worth the 50 bucks a

My husband and I used Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" and got the Holiday Inn Anaheim – Resort Area for $48.00.  (We were participating in the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend.)  I was pleased to get this hotel as the Holiday Inn does not charge a resort or parking fee.  Most hotels in the area add some sort of a fee or charge.   After reading many of the reviews, I was not expecting much from this hotel.  Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised.  We stayed in room #820 which was a king, non-smoking, wheel-chair accessible room.  It appeared that the room had been recently renovated and was very large (this may have been due to the fact that it was wheel-chair accessible).  The same can be said for the bathroom.  The bed was comfortable (lots of pillows) and the bathroom had

Summary Heading: Awesome Value but the Shuttle Service Could Be Better
Summary: First the good...the hotel is an excellent value for the money. Newer rooms, very clean, friendly staff. My son and I loved it. The hotel restaurant was a little on the high priced end but all of the Disney area tends to be spendy for meals. Now for the bad, the ART shuttle comes off as a bit disorganized. Posting a schedule would help for planning purposes. We did a lot of waiting both at the hotel and at disney for the shuttle. It is supposed to come every 20 minutes but sometimes we waited longer. A posted schedule would help matters.

We booked this hotel through Priceline and got a 20% discount off rack rates.  Our room was clean although some of the furnishings were showing a bit of wear and tear.  The room had a decent sized refrigerator and a coffee maker, but no microwave.  (You could use the one in the gift shop.)  Our room face the freeway, so there was a bit of road noise, but the air conditioner masked that well.  The hotel is a few minutes drive from Disney, but still a decent choice if you are going to the parks.  Interesting note - we only got one bar of soap that had to be shared between the sink and shower.

Summary Heading: Says Kids Eat Free, Should Say Kids Starve to Death,on baby portions
Summary: Family of 4, with twins age 10. Breakfast buffet is $12 plus tax and tip per adult.  Kids may only eat from the kids menu. WoW, are they ever cheap. My kids said " That was a good snack, I'm hungry". Since was around $30, and the kids were hungry, and we had buffet, I let them grab a muffin (size small), from the buffet, the waiter saw this and said with mean eyes, that will be an extra $2.75, plus tax.  Kids are not allowed any food , but what we provide.  So we paid, left, never ate there again.  Our plan was to stay 8 days, 7 nights, and eat all meals in this restaurant. Our plans had to change because I didn't feel comfortable there anymore. So we had to jump on a local bus everyday cost is $8 per day for the family, go to Disneyland, walk across the street to a very nice

Summary Heading: Awful!!! Very Rude Employees/ Worst ever/DON'T STAY HERE!
Summary: This hotel is operated by the rudest desk clerks I have ever encountered and I travel often. Never again will I ever stay at a Holiday Inn due to their lack of BASIC customer service.  They are obviously a very unhappy bunch.    On the positive, This is a nice enough property. Housekeeping was excellent and we left a large tip as a thank you.  It's unfortunate that this hotel doesn't have better management and front desk clerks because I believe business would be much better.  We were able to book this hotel somewhat last minute when the rest of the Resort area hotels were fully booked- Now I know why!  It has nothing to do with the property- cleanliness, comfort were surprising- on par with Hyatt and Hilton. The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable & double sheeted.

I am writing  becoz I saw some very good reviews about this hotel.I am surprised.I bet the positive reviews for this hotel is probably written mostly by the Holiday Inn Hotel management itself. This hotel really bad in every way.Basically it lacks the most important thing "cleanliness".Enter the hotel lobby you will smell it! Customer service is worst again.There are a lot of other hotels in the resort group, any one of them will definitely have better rooms and service then this hotel. Not recommendable for anyone!!!!!!

We arrived before 3:00 p.m. to check in and were told that the room wasn't ready yet and asked to return at 3:00 p.m. which is check-in time. We returned at 3:45 p.m. which should have been plentry of time to have the room ready and when we arrived we were told it still wasn't ready. By this time, we were tired and so were our 2 young children who were ready for a nap. I explained that were were told to return at this time. I was then told that the room should be ready in about 25 minutes and that whoever told me to come back at 3:00 was wrong because it is not their policy to give people confirmation as to when a room will be available. Keep in mind that just seconds prior, he told me that the room would be ready in 25 minutes! If you stay at this hotel - save yourself some

Summary Heading: will never be back horrible customer service & not too clean
Summary: First, it started off bad when we arrived early and called to check in only 15 minutes early and they refused saying they had no rooms cleaned and available yet.  I asked if something would be ready at the 3:00 guaranteed time and they said that there should be.  The customer service was awful the whole trip after that too.  When we turned down our beds that night we saw brown glops of something spattered about on the sheet.  We called 3 times and waited an hour before someone finally came with new sheets.  People were allowed to smoke at the non-smoking hot tub, the on-site restaurant staff ignored us, and housekeeping did a lousy job, we did not notice that they even came the last 2 days of our 4 day trip.  We are very nice people and have worked in the service industry

My wife and son had the great pleasure of staying at this hotel, as we have in the past.  Check-in was quick and friendly, and the agent was very knowledgable about the Disneyland venues and shuttle times.  Our room had all of the amenties we needed and was spotless.  From other experiences in the area, the room was well cared for and clean.  Breakfast in the restaurant was very good, again with friendly and speedy service. We will be back!

Summary Heading: Once was good but not anymore
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel before with our kids while going to Disneyland that was 4 years ago. When we arrived over this past Memorial Day weekend it was a different story. The first thing that was disgusting was mold in the shower I feel if you know you have mold at least caulk over it. If I don't have mold in my home I do not want to see mold in a hotel. The second problem was 2 out of three elevators were out. This was SO frustrating. There was bus loads of kids  on sport related trips there as well as families and 1 elevator working was so unacceptable for my whole stay. My last problem is the restaurant they have a breakfast buffet and also a breakfast menu  we ordered the breakfast menu and it came out in like 5 min which made us think it was not prepared fresh it was

Stayed here for 3 nights with Family in June 05. Hotel is great, Bright and Clean rooms, Comfy Beds, Friendly Staff, Great pool area.  No Resturant, its a bit of walk to the nearest shopping centre. We used the hotel for closenes to Disneyland and had a bus tour planned on the last day, So didn't spend to long in the hotel. But Good price and location for the park.

I booked with Priceline at 40% off per night Friday thru Wednesday stay. Hotel is clean, rooms were nice. Beds were comfortable, but it made noise. Free internet in room stay was very slow. There is no any public bus or restaurant there. They only have the Disney shuttle bus which was slow in coming and an American hotel restaurant which was very expensive.  It's very far to walk to Disney from the hotel.  Also the soda machines never worked on any floor I checked. Some of the desk staff was very rude, while others were very service oriented. Even though I got discount from Priceline, I did not feel it was very good price for their service.

We stayed at the Holiday Inn from May 7-14, 2008. We had a great stay.  I would recommend it for families out there who are in Anaheim especially for Disneyland. We had the kids suite and the kids loved the room. The hotel was not extravagant but it did its job for the 7 days that we were in Anaheim. Basically we were there to just sleep and to get up early the next day morning to head out to Disneyland.  As we didnt spend most of our time at the hotel, but it was clean when we returned and front desk was very helpful, and would recommend good shopping locations, movie theatres and clubs/lounges in the area.    The best way to get around was by taxi ($7.00 to get to The Block at Orange) But do take advantage of the shuttles.  We rent a vehicle and drove to Universal and to

I stayed at this hotel a year ago and was very impressed with the quality of service received for the price. The hotel is currently  undergoing a small facelift but nothing that would interfere with your stay. When you pull up to the hotel the entrance looks closed but the side doors are open for check in. I didn't like the fact that they didn't have registration parking but most everybody seemed to leave their cars in the turnaround. Also the Holiday inn is attached to the Staybridge Suites and you may accidently try to check into the wrong hotel like we did (we thought it was a side entrance because of construction). The only thing I can really complain about is the lack of blackout curtains. The natural light filters through and if you have had a long night it isn't

Just back from great 5 night stay and hotel was much more than expected. After we booked this hotel, we were a little worried by the distance to the obvious main attractions(disney), but aslong as you don't mind a little 15min walk then it's perfect and orange at the block outlet mall is also only 15mins away in the other direction, well worth a visit for any shopper. For any lazy day there is a regular bus service to anywhere in the anaheim resort area and taxi's are easily available. The rooms are suitable for both a couple or family of 4, big beds, fairly modern and very clean. The staff at recpetion were helpful, most of the time atleast, mayb 1 or 2 of them could know a little more about the area, but overall everyone was willing to help when they could. There's a good

Hotel was clean, staff courteous and room was nice.  Also, everything was fairly new which was nice.  The only thing is that this hotel is a self-serve hotel - something I wasn't used to having spent 2 weeks prior in full-service hotels in asia.  We had to unload our own bags onto a cart and cart it up to our room ourselves.  Liked the fact that the hotel had a fridge and a pantry space.  The crib provided to us was metal and not ideal as our 11 month old son whe is very active banged his head twice on the crib railing.  Location is convenient if you have a car.  We rented a luxury car for $20 a day out of Lax (Fox car rentals).  Parked at Disney (Mickey Mouse structure only$11/day) and they have a tram that takes you directly to the gates and downtown disney.  Less of a walk

We stayed here for three nights during our trip to California.  We were excited because we had stayed at their sister hotel for a couple nights and it was great.  We were disappointed.  First off, the location is kind of inconvenient if you're driving.  They have the shuttle to Disneyland so that works well, but if you want to drive its at an odd location and hard to get out of.  Check in was smooth and fast even though it was very busy.  We stayed in a Kids Suite which our kids thought was fabulous.  It was a great concept and it is very cool for the kids with the bunk beds and their own little room.  We were very disappointed and kind of icked out though.  The housekeeping left a lot to be desired.  The night we checked in there were two dirty wineglasses outside our door.

booked via priceline at $45 per night sun thru thursday stay. Hotel is clean, rooms were nice, beds comfortable. Free parking and free internet. The shuttles to Disney were slow in coming, and often could not get everyone on. It's a little far to walk to Disney from hotel. Also the ice machine and soda machines did not work on our floor as well on other floors I checked. The store in the lobby did not have a working fridge for the drinks they sold. Had to go to the pool area to find a working soda machine. Some of the desk staff was rude, while others were very service oriented. Kids eat free in the restaurant, only for select items on the kids menu. The food was expensive and bad.  Final impression was that for the price paid it was OK. If I had paid full price I would have

Why stay in Disneyland in a normal cramped hotel room when you can stay in a suite with lots of room and a small kitchen for less price.  We stayed here for four days in December 07 while visiting Disneyland.  The two room suite was perfect for us with two early teens. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful.  It has an outdoor heated pool and spa which was great for some down time between park visits.  There also was a video games room and internet PCs (rather expensive for internet access).  We had breakfast most days in restaurant.  The meals were huge so we ordered two breakfasts for the four of us.  There is a 7-11 around the corner for anything you need.  It is a good morning walk of tweny minutes to disneyland to get the legs going for the day.

It met our expectations.  Room was comfortable and I would give the shower head an A+.  Bath tub had a couple of chips in it but other then that the room was fine.  Had one meal in the restaurant and found it to be overpriced and the food was not that good.  Could not drink the water served to us in the restaurant because it had a fowl taste.  A tip: Instead of doing breakfast at the hotel or at one of the spots near Disney check out Hoff's Hut less then a mile from the hotel.  Fantastic breakfast at a better price without the crowds.

Rooms were bright, new, clean and comfortable.  However, I found the bed and pillows to be less comfortable than other hotels of this level (if you're a relative local and are driving you might want to consider bringing your own pillow from home!).  The bathroom was spacious and very clean - we actually really liked the different shower set-up without the bathtub - seemed more roomy with a nice stream from the showerhead.  Although our room overlooked the pool and spa area we didn't use it since we stayed only one night, but we found that the pool was quiet after 10 pm and still empty at 10 am.  Aside from the bed we slept well because it was very quiet - could not hear freeway noise at all nor noise of other guests.  Service is spotty - front desk was indifferent, but room
Great hotel, big spacious rooms, really nice bathroom.  Excellent door to door shuttle service straight to Disneyland as well as to the LA airports.  Great value for money!

I had stayed at the Staybridge(which is connected to this property) with my children the year prior. These two properties are sister properties of the Holiday Inn group. They share a beautiful pool/spa area with basketball courts as well. Since I was VERY impressed with Staybridge, I decided to give this hotel a go. This trip was without kids, so we really didn't need the spacious suite this time. We were there on an adults- only trip to Disneyland. This Hotel is more for a "business/convention" crowd which suited me just fine. The newspapers delivered to your room in the a.m. are a great touch and the rooms had irons and a fridge at no additional charge. Parking is ample and free. The only thing I kind of scratched my head at was the small size of the beds, Other than that the

The Holiday Inn-Anaheim Resort was great!! The hotel is beautiful, in a great area and the property is very well maintained. The room was very clean and modern, comfortable, roomy, soft bed. The refrigerator was a big, pleasant surprise. The bathroom was nice and clean too, but did not have a bathtub, shower only. Anytime we needed anything they got it to us. It was close to all the disney areas and the location was good (next cu Fwy 5). Recommend a co-pilot as the road split and it is confusing, otherwise it's a bit tough to locate and enter the grounds. We appreciate free wireless. We were there for 3 nights but didn't have time to enjoy the pool and hot tub. It was secure and quiet too, a big plus!!! Next time we need to make a specific request for king as they gave us double

We stayed at this Hotel and found It great, close to all areas of Interest like DISNEY, Downtown Disney, you have a free shuttle from the hotel parking lot which Is free, the time for a bus Is every 20 minutes but we had to wait almost 45 minutes one day but that didnt spoil the fun, also not too far away is Knotts berry farm resort which Is amazing too, the hotel Is very clean, all staff are very helpful aswell, the restaurent is pretty neat as if you hve forgotten breakfast and all you need is toast and a coffee, they actually give it to you to go, thats a first, toast to go, thats pretty neat, eating breakfast in the sun, cool huh, all rooms have a tea/coffee machine, no not all hotels gives you this, the food in the American Brassiere is good value for money aswell, well

We stayed here overnight on a trip up to Orange County for business/ pleasure.  Booked the room through priceline for $70.  The room was very well appointed and was one of the nicest smelling hotel rooms I've stayed at of late.  The pool area looked wonderful though we did not partake in it.  While it is near the freeway, noise was minimal.  We also had a car, which is highly recommended, for it is not near any points of interest within walking distance  One complaint is the bed.  Compared to Hampton Inn, the comfort at HI was nowhere near where it should be.  Bed was very small for a double.  Pillows were extremely uncomfortable.  However, given the price, it was an overall pleasant stay at a relatively new hotel.

Scored this place for $70/N on priceline. We had a car so distance (5 easy mins in car) from Disneyland was not an issue. Also cheaper to drive and park than use the tram anyway , and no hanging about!! [Got a great deal with Priceline too]  Breakfast was not included, and had all the usual suspects, and  was not cheap either.($11 buffet )  Pool area is lovely, and is shared with the Staybridge suites, right next to the I-5...though its noise in the room was minimal. The hotel beds were firm but comfortable and we slept really well.   One of the nicest holiday inns Ive stayed at, and I cant fault it, apart from having to drive to get places..I liked is peacefulness...and coming back to the pool was an oasis away from the chaos that surrounds Disney.   Staff were friendly, and

Summary Heading: This is a really nice hotel
Summary: We stayed at this hotel on a vacation to Disneyland.  It was great!  I especially liked the swimming pool and hot pool area.  It looks like a tropical garden and has soft lighting at night.  Management stocks the pool area with shelves of clean towels, so guests don't have to bring one from their rooms.  Our room was clean and smelled nice.  The only problem we had was that the hotel seems short on staff -- especially in the adjoining restaurant.  Our room had a fridge in it, but the only microwave was a small one we could use in the gift shop.  I was really impressed that there was a free laundry room for guests to use, but it only had 3 washer/dryer units, and one was broken.  The remaining two were in hot demand until late hours of the night.  If you plan to use the laundry

I absolutely would not recommend this hotel to anyone stayed here with 2 small children and didn't sleep the whole week lets just say the floor was more comfortable than the bed and near disneyland that is a lie unless 2 miles down a not so good neighborhood and busy freeway. Asked for extra pillows brought 2 when I more I was told I couldn't because there is a certain number of pillows they have to keep in their closet might not have this problem if the pillows weren't so flat  all in all a nightmare when you are tired from all day disney and just want to get a good nights sleep talked to priceline and they were willing to refund if hotel was. Hotel would not talked to manager about beds and no response didn't really care a far cry from being 3 stars I might give it 1/2 a star

I'm not going to write a lengthy review since I just stayed here last April and wrote a longer review then.  All I can say is that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and won't hesitate to stay there again.  We were on the freeway side and could not hear the freeway.  We could even see the Tower of Terror and the Matterhorn mountain out of our window!    This time we went with friends and had adjoining rooms which was really cool.  If I had any complaint, it would be the size of the "double" bed.  It's probably more about the size of a full.    The pool is great and the hot tub is even better.  Both are kind of shaped like a Mickey Mouse head which is cool.  Again loved the food for breakfast at the restaurant.  Tip - we were four adults who rented a car.  It was free to park at the

My family stayed here for our summer vacation and we loved this hotel very much.  As there are more than one Holiday-Inn in Anaheim, always quote this one as Holiday-Inn at Manchester Ave no matter to the airport pick-up or local tour agents.  I booked a kidsuite at $123 per night.  There is a small separated area with a bunk bed for my two kids and their own TV, they loved this kind of "privacy".  The room is very nice.   As the hotel is not within walking distance to the Downtown Disney / Disneyland, you have to take a shuttle bus which costs $3 (unlimited ride per day) for adult and free-of-charge for kids.  The bus departs every 20 minutes from early in the morning to midnight.  There is only one restaurant in this hotel.  The service is very good and they are very friendly.

We visit Anaheim every 2/3 years and when we do we tend to stay in this hotel at the start of the vacation. Some of the recent reviews had us thinking whether or not we right as the hotel seems to have fallen down the rankings a liitle since it opened.  However, we were glad that we decided to stay here once again. The hotel provided the ideal rest after a transatlantic flight (especially as we are familiar how to get to it - perhaps a problem for first time guests). We had no difficulties with front desk staff who were very pleasant. The restaurant offers consistently the best value with their kids eat free offer and the breakfasts are especially good. As regards the rooms we always prefer hotels that offer in-room safes and this hotel has those. As we were visiting Legoland

Our stay last week at the Holiday Inn was good for two main reasons-----AC and the beds.  If you want a kick -ss AC and a comfortable bed, signup.  Found the room to be clean and efficient, equipped with safe, refrigerator, and mini-bar area with plenty of drawers.  I liked the pool and spa areas but could not fine a dry towel in the house.  Sign on the towel bin indicated they had a limited supply.  Yup. Recommend bringing down your own towel.  You can always take a dry one back.  Only negative was the breakfast.  For $60 bucks we ordered up three breakfast specials but were very disappointed.  Recommend eating in the park or down the street.  Overall the Holiday Inn was good value if you want to visit Disney on a budget.  Will probably save up more Mickey dollars to stay at a

The room was average at best.  The air conditioner was very loud when it shut off.  Small space, view of the parking lot.  The service was average too. The front desk staff was at best disinterested, often rude.  I asked for a Holiday Inn plastic bag and they told me they were out, and gave me a large plastic trash bag.  They left us three bath towels for a family of four...we asked for another one and got it, but had to keep track of our towel count each day.  Wouldn't go there again.

Very nice place.  I was pleased with this place.  The pool and hot tub were the best of all the 10 nights we were out.  The room was clean and the price was not that bad considering the location of this hotel.  We have a great view of the fireworks out our window.  The negative I might say was the cost of the shuttle to Disneyland. 3.00 per person per day.  That seems a bit much in my book thank goodness we didn't need the transportation the night we were there.  I also would suggest the check-in staff speak slower and more clearly with the information they give repeatedly to guest who are hearing it for the first time.

Summary Heading: The Nicest Holiday Inn To Stay At
Summary: This was the 15th time i have stayed at this resort, I have never had any problems with the property, i luv the closeness to the freeways as i dont stay there because of DL. The outdoor pool area is very large and a has a great hot tub, Heaps of rear parking at the rear of the hotel and a rear entrance into the hotel,   There is a resturant in the front of the hotel, But have not a lot to say about the food there as i have had a couple of diners there  and were not impressed by there food, The block is only a short drive from there 2 mins, It has great food and heaps of choices, Movies, Games place, Great shopping and great place to hang out for a few hours each nite, before bed,   I am staying there again 1 week from now, With my wife this time, I almost did not stay here on my

We just got back from our trip. And our experience was a nice one. The hotel seemed to be fairly new. The big thing is that it was clean. Our room was pretty small but we weren't in it much so that wasn't a big deal. The staff was friendly and helpful, there is a free shuttle to disneyland and they have a restaurant down stairs that kids12 and under eat free. I'd give this hotel a 8 out of 10.

Summary Heading: Unfriendly staff, noisy room and a long way from anywhere!!!!
Summary: The hotel is quite nicely decorated but it is about a 20-30 minute walk from Disneyland making you reliant on the resort travel bus, which is quite good but sometime irregular (ie 60 minutes to get a bus at dinner time as all the drivers were taking a break).  The front desk service was very poor.  Staff appeared disinterested in their work at best and absolutely rude at worst.   waiting staff, maintenance (we had to call them to the room) etc were terrific.  The family rooms are very noisy.  Whilst refurbished they have old air conditioners that are very noisy and all of these rooms overlook the freeway and the cooling tower which goes 24/7.  The noise in the rooms was similar to the front rows of a boing 747 all night.    I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay in

This is the 3 time in 6 years that we've stayed at this hotel.  I believe it was relatively new the first time we stayed there.  It is starting to show some wear and tear.    Check in was smooth, no problems and the front desk staff was more than pleasant.  The room was nice enough, standard two double beds and full bath (not just a shower).  The beds were not the most comfortable but they were not bad.  Had some trouble regulating the a/c.    The room was clean and the halls smelled very fresh, like the carpet had just been cleaned.  Was nice to have the fridge in the room.    Bought Disney passes at the front desk to avoid having to wait in line.  Again, staff was helpful.    Easy drive to Disney.  Did not take the ART but noticed that they sometimes used the larger bus rather
This hotel was very nice.  The pool was filled with kids and we had a nice time.

Stayed here on the 3rd night of our vacation. We checked in on May 28th (Memorial Day) and only stayed one night. The hotel is a typical Holiday Inn hotel. The rooms were of decent size, had very spacious bathrooms. I didn't find the bed all that comfortable, but wasn't horrible. The only complaint I would have is the doors slam and trust me you can hear them slamming in the room. Its a newer hotel and it surprises me that the doors are designed that way. We booked this hotel through Onetravel.com and got a really great rate. I think this is a great hotel for the money and would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Stay away from this place!!  Bad front desk personnel means bad omen!!
Summary: Very hard to find main entrance ( you have to make a u-turn when you get out from Highway 5 exit.  Signs are above and look hidden after exiting).  After driving almost 6 hours to get there, my family and I got to the hotel, parked the car, and were very excited and relieved to finally see the beautiful hotel, only to find that what is beautiful on the outside, did'nt seem too well on the inside.  When I walked up to the front desk to check into our room, the UN-Gentleman working at the front counter was very rude and was very uncourteous.  After checking my reservations, he then informed me that they had no more non-smoking rooms available until the next day.  I was shocked and informed him that I called the day before to confirm whether or not these rooms would be available on

We booked this hotel via Priceline for $75 per night for three days.  This is the nicest Holiday Inn that I've stayed in.  The beds were comfortable and rooms fairly large.  The front desk was very helpful with directions and with accommodating our needs for a late check in.  There is also a store that sells small boxes of milk and has a microwave available for guests. Although we did not use the service, there is also a shuttle that takes folks to Disneyland .  The breakfast buffet was reasonable at $9.99 and kids eat for free off a pre-selected kid's menu.  As before mentioned, it's more convenient to have a car since the property isn’t walking distance to shopping and lots of restaurants.  We did visit the Block on Orange (about a 5 minute drive from the hotel) which is an

Myself and two friends stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of a package trip to Los Angeles and Las Vegas. The hotel is approximately a 45 minute drive from LAX. We arrived at around 9pm after a long flight and check in was straightforward. Our room looked out towards Disneyland and I was lucky enough to see the firework display from our window, which was a nice treat.  Our room was fairly big and meant that we weren't tripping over each other, with two double beds, a table and chairs, built in wardrobe and large bathroom. We also had a fridge and coffee machine, which was really useful. Milk and snacks are available from the shop next to reception. Each room gets a complimentary copy of the local paper, which is a nice touch.  The room was spotlessly clean and the beds

My husband and I have just returned from a 12 day trip to California - Anaheim was our final stop for 4 nights 6th-9th May 2007. We used the hotel as a base for Disney and to travel into LA including Venice & Santa Monica beaches. We booked via Priceline for £35 per night - a reasonable saving on the Holiday Inn rates.  First off - we loved this hotel. I should say though that, in my opinion, you need a car if you stay here. Disney is not within walking distance nor are any off-property restaurants or convenience stores - all of which we knew before we booked, so we had no issue with this. But if you need to have those amenities within walking distance, you might want to opt for a property on Harbor Boulevard.  If you do have a car and are happy to use it then the Disney parking

Just got back from a nine night stay and we were really pleased with the Holiday Inn Resort.  Our room was larger than some rooms we've paid three times as much for, and was nicely decorated and clean, but nothing too fancy. Like others have said, this is a Holiday Inn, not the Four Seasons, but it's a nice Holiday Inn, to be sure.  I had a sinking feeling of dread when I realized we'd been given a room directly across from the elevators, but we rarely heard anything from the hallway, and from the bed, we were never disturbed by anything outside the door.  My wife spent several days in the pool area and said it was great and family friendly. There was a large hot tub, also. Ice machines and vending are located on odd floors and small washers and dryers can be used for free on

My family stayed here for one night and had a great time.  It is not the Four Seasons, but it was very clean and comfortable.  Great location close to Disneyland.  I would highly recommend it to anyone needing a clean, centrally located, safe place to stay with the family.  Great Value.

My boyfriend and I with our two friends stayed at this property for 4 nights during our time in Anaheim. The check in went quickly and we both received a non smoking room with king bed as requested by our travel agent. The fridge was very convenient and the beds were comfortable. The only negative point of the rooms is there is only a shower and no bath, however if you book a kids fun room (with bunkbeds) there is a bath tub.  The pool was a good size and never got too crowded and the hot tub was awesome for after a long day of walking.  The restaurant was decent with very friendly waiters and an okay selection of food. The bartender on the other hand was miserable and gave terrible service.  The shuttle bus runs every 20 minutes and was so convenient.  I would highly recommend

We stayed at this hotel for a week.  When we got there they informed us that what we reserved was not avaible and so my wife and I had to sleep in seperate double beds.  The staff was not accomadating at all.  The rooms were newer but as other reviewers have stated  they were not insulated very well.   I hope if you are staying at this hotel you dont have plans to go to Disneyland, because the shuttle thats supposed to only take 20 minutes is a lie.  It really arrives every hour.  I have been to Disneyland many times and this by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  You will not get a good night sleep on the beds due to the fact that they forgot to put padding on the springs.    Do your self a huge favor and dont stay here.  Look for the Anabelle Inn or the desert inn at

This is a new Holiday Inn "Prototype" hotel located next to the 5 freeway on Harbor Blvd and Manchester Drive. The hotel itself looks nice, especially considering it is a Holiday Inn. The hotel has a nice gift shop with reasonably priced (what a relief!) drinks and a small assortment of food. The room and inside corridors are appointed well and much better than most hotels at their price point.   The staff was nice. I asked for a taxi to come at a certain time and it was there right on the dot...with no problems.   The problem with this hotel is with the soundproofing. I could hear people talking in the next room and I could hear doors slamming all the way down the hall. This was annoying (especially at 12am after a long day at the parks) but I did eventually get to sleep. If

The title says it all.  Our first experience to Disneyland as a couple with kids 11 and 6.    Our stay was very enjoyable, it's a very family oriented place.  * staff was very helpful and friendly * kids under 12 eat for free at the restaurant when parents buy full price meal (no problem there, this really helped our budget as we ate breakfast and dinner) * good size hottub, as we enjoyed the soak after a long day at Disneyland * the transit bus (the best deal for transportation to Disneyland) pulls up right out front just about every 20 mins) * our trip was booked by a family relative and I have already  recommended this place for future bookings. * the fridge came in handy for chilling our bottled water and soft drinks. * easy internet access * very convenient location

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights as his Disneyland birthday present to me.  I've stayed in a few 3* hotels, and this is by FAR the worst experience I've had so far.  I've stayed in lower quality Comfort Inns and had a much  more pleasurable experience.  We booked this room through Priceline for 2/27-3/1.  We checked in only to find that all they had for us was 2 double beds.  We're a young couple with no kids tagging along, so that definitely wasn't going to work.  We were told that all their kings were "sold out" and that they "didn't sell queens" at their property.  The woman obviously hated her job and was taking out her irritability on us with her bad attitude and terrible customer service.  I asked to be upgraded, and we were placed in a queen suite for $30 more

Got a great deal through priceline, stayed 2 nights. Room was great except for the noise. I could hear everyone's room doors shut within a 20 door radius. Why wouldn't they install something on their doors to make them shut more quitely? The doors naturally slam shut and it is very loud! I stayed on the 2nd floor with a pool/jacuzzi view. Unless you like listening to kids scream I'd suggest asking for a room far from that one.  Basically the room was clean and cozy but the noise level pretty much ruined it for me.

Summary Heading: Got more than I paid for:)
Summary: spent one night at this hotel on 2/8  as I got it at a great rate through Priceline....as a previous poster stated, it is hard to find this property...I kept getting lost...but when I finally got there I didnt have a problem getting back..my first impression of the hotel was very positive...grounds were very clean and lobby really smelled nice...the smell followed all through the hallways as well...check in went very quickly but as soon as I opened the door I was hit with smoke and it was a nonsmoking room...I called down to the front desk and they immediately changed us to another room...this time it was much better...there was a faint smell of smoke in the bathroom but not enough to constitute me changing again...it didnt come out into the room so no worries...beds were

Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 8 days, and I don't want to stay here ever again. We got to the hotel and ask for a king bed at the front desk, they said they don't have one unless we want to stay in a smoking room. We ended up staying in a double bed in a room right next to the elevator. The location of this hotel is so hard to find eventhough we brought a Garmin with us. The room smell bed, the heating unit in our room sound really loud everytime it started, it woke me up in the middle of the night. We have to sleep without the heat. The bed was so old, it make creaky noise. It was so bad I could not get a good night sleep for 8 nights of my vacation. The hotel is right next to I5 and a trailer park, so I have a room looking right to the trailer park. On top of all

Summary Heading: Great experience at a wonderful hotel!
Summary: This was our second stay at the hotel. We had such a great time when we stayed here for a week in the Summer of 2005, that we decided to stay here again when we visited December 22-24, 2006. The staff is very helpful, and the rooms are clean and big. I feel safe at this hotel and the pool and arcade are a nice touch for a family. My children enjoyed it, as well as my husband enjoyed the use of the fitness facility. The hotel is extremely clean. We were able to purchase Disneyland park tickets at the registration desk which was a great convenience. We took the shuttle to Disneyland even though we had a car. It was very convenient as it picks you up directly in front of the hotel restaurant. The restaurant food was great and the staff was extremely friendly. I would highly

We booked our room through Hotwire for 2 nights at the Holiday Inn.  We wanted to be in Anaheim for access to Disneyland with our 2 children.  When we arrived at the hotel, we were pleased to see that the facilities look updated and clean.  But when we approached our room, that's when the excitement ended.  The room had a strong smell (perhaps carpet cleaner?) that wouldn't go away during the 2 days we were there, even though we opened the window most of the time.  The traffic noise from I-5 is pretty loud with the window open.   We had 2 double beds in the room, and they were very soft.  My son and I both woke up with sore backs.  The food at breakfast is below average.  The scrambled eggs at the buffet had been sitting for a while when we ate the first morning.  On the second

Summary Heading: Great spot if you're heading to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed for 5 nights with missus & our 8 Y.O. to visit Disneyland etc, and very handy for that purpose. Reception staff very helpful & brasserie next door is very handy/obliging. Rooms are spacious, but can be a bit noisy with late business travelers and family traffic along the corridors. The walls seem thinner than most resort hotels we've stayed in, and cleaning staff starting shift early in the day (05:00) didn't care too much about who could hear their antics. Shuttle service to parks is good from right out front, and not too busy like some bus services. ART provides a great service right around Anaheim for any (other than Disney parks) sightseeing/shopping as well. All in all, a very handy and pleasant place to stay.

I stayed here with a friend in the month of September for 2 nights.  The staff at the reception were not friendly at all, not even a smile. The rooms were lovely and The restaurant staff were lovely as well which is a shame about the rest.  Like another review I was told the Shopping mall was "one block", not at all.  If you are staying to visit the disneyland theme parks I would stay somewhere closer.  I had a problem with some mail of mine that was delivered to the hotel and signed for, they told me time and time again they didnt have my package.  I contacted them again once I got home to Australia (as the package was vaulable to me)they then said oh we have it here, they forwarded the package to me and so I had been charged for shipping twice now when it was there when i was

My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 12 nights in July. The hotel room was very clean and the staff very helpful. The only problem was that the Bar/Resturant closed very early, they stopped serving food at 9.30 and the bar closed at 10.00. After a very long day shopping or at the theme parks it would have been nice to come back to the hotel and relax with a few drinks, while we where there we  noticed that alot of people where being turned away so it was not as if people where not  wanting to use the bar. The swimming pool stayed open later than the bar. They should think about the guests needs and open the bar a little longer even until 12.00. This would put me off going back as there was no where else near the hotel to go. I would recommend the food in the hotel as it was

We stayed @ this hotel on a fall break trip to Southern California.  It was safe, clean & the staff was friendly.   We used the Kids eat free plan (cannot eat off buffet) & food wasn't bad.  We ate most breakfasts here & a couple of dinners.   We used the Anaheim Resort Transit (Grayline) to/from Disney by purchasing our ART passes right @ front desk & buses stop right outside restaurant @ covered bus stop - weekly schedule @ desk as well.  The hotel is not w/n walking distance of Disney @ all. Also purchased Disney tix @ front desk as well (no discount on 2-day passes).   Did not visit pool but seemed nice & well maintained. Also - Grayline tours is two doors down from hotel for trips to Knott's, SeaWorld & Universal which was very convenient. Overall very nice hotel &

We made an instant decision to go to Disneyland and needed a hotel last minute. I booked this hotel online with more people in mind for check in, I had to call several times to adjust the reservations and the staff was very warm and friendly every call. They adjusted the original size of the room and the price without a hitch.  We've stayed at this hotel before when we attended an Anaheim Angels game. I think the location is more convienent to that than Disneyland, but it was still a short drive to Disneyland. Plus, if you don't want to drive to Disneyland, you can ride the Disneyland Transit. However, the day we checked out was the day we were going to Disneyland so we drove.   They surprised us with a wonderful view of both parks and Knott's Berry Farm. It's a far off view but

We stayed at the Holiday Inn with our 3 young children for 12 days.  I don't really understand the comments about the staff as we were almost always greeted and helped with friendly smiles.  There was one person that was rude to my husband though when he was enquiring about buying Disney passes but overall the staff was very helpful.  I thing the easiest way for this review is to do pros and cons as that is how I tend to look at reviews.  Pros:  Very nice and clean lobby, hallways, elevators etc.  No stinky hotel smell..smelled very clean all the time.  Two room suite was a nice size with cupboard space by the fridge for storing food etc.  FREE laundry machine use (see the con about laundry)...not many hotels offer that.  Nice size bathroom.  Carpets looked new.  Airconditioning

Summary Heading: Nice hotel at a nice price but staff needs polishing
Summary: My family and I stayed here for two nights during the second week of October.  Very nice suite for $88 paid in advance directly with the hotel chain.  Room was clean and comfortable, bathroom was very nice with the walk-in shower, and both televisions worked well and had a nice cable selection.  No coffee in the lobby, so be prepared to either go out, drink the watered down brew from the room packs, or bring your own for the room brewer, as we did.  The only downside to our entire stay was the check-in staff.  The staff took quite a while to both check us in and check us out.  I noticed that they were careful to finish up whatever they were working on both times before we were even so much as greeted and offered assistance.  Awkward when one is standing in line and the staff

Summary Heading: AN Average HI - Bit To Far From Disney
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights in August 2006.  Check-in was OK - our receptionist seemed a little grouchy but then the person behind us got served by another receptionist that was even grumpier so mustn't grumble! They weren't able to fulfil our request for a King Bed room; I guess they must have mostly twin queen rooms for families. Never mind.  The rooms are OK, standard Holiday Inn rooms; reasonable size and decent sized bathroom, with relatively noisy AC but at least you can’t the nearby Interstate over it.  The main problem is the location. However this was our mistake as we thought we were in the one (of the three Holiday Inns in Anaheim) that was nearest Disney. We should have checked properly when booking with our travel agent!   The location means you are a reliant upon

Summary Heading: I'm picky but would stay again
Summary: First of all, there are several Holiday Inns in Anaheim.  We bought a package from Flight Centre.  Upon arrival, we immediately found out that our travel agent had booked us a reservation at another HI on Walnut Street (which is closer to Disneyland).  Nevertheless, the male front desk staff was more than happy to call the other hotel to transfer our reservation.  When we got to the room, there were 2 double beds which was not what we had requested.  We were told that a room with a king bed would be ready for us in a few hours.  We were given a room# and left the hotel to visit the nearest shopping mall, "The BLOCK", about 'a mile away' the hotel staff informed us.  Without a rental car, and no public transportations nearby, we decided to walk.  Front desk staff estimated about

My husband and I had stayed at this hotel and loved it two times prior to my bad experience.  Since I had a good track record with this hotel I booked three rooms for a family vacation of eight people.  I reserved 3 nonsmoking rooms directly with the hotel itself.  When I called the night before to confirm they said it may be a problem getting the nonsmoking rooms.  I informed them that it was very improtant since we had a cancer patient, two babies and an asthma sufferer.  When we arrived there we were told they had overbooked and could only find us two nonsmoking rooms.  This was a huge disappointment and problem.  Otherwise the rooms are great.  But if nonsmoking is a priority be careful.  There were two people that I saw checking in at the same time that had the same

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a family reunion
Summary: Our family decided to hold our annual Reunion at Disneyland this year.  We were looking for a hotel where we could visit the Park, but also have family time.  We were glad to be close to the Parks, but then we got back to our room we enjoyed the fact that we were a bit removed from all the craziness and the millions of people around Disneyland.  The pool area is great, nice size pool, a place where we could get smoothies and snacks,  the basketball courts were fun for us as we like sports.  There was even an area for us to bbq.  Lots of parking (and it was free!)  Hotel was extremely clean and overall staff were friendly.  Our room was basic, but frigs were a bonus!  Also, very close to a major outdoor shopping place with loads of restaurants!  and hotel is near so many freeways

I got to this hotel as part of a pre contiki tour relaxation break.I arrived at the hotel hot and tired after a long flight from australia but the staff at check in were freindly and fast and i was in my room in no time.The twin room i stayed in was huge!Plenty of room for 2 people.Had dinner in the brasserie the following night.staff were quick and courteous.Used the pool and spa the following night.they were both huge and definately have a drink at the cabana bar!overall this hotel exceeded my expectations and i would definately recommend it to anyone who is thinking of staying there!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not close enough to parks
Summary: We just stayed here for three days in August. The room was clean, comfortable and had a safe in-room. The only poor aspect was the air-conditioning unit which sounded like a space shuttle taking off every 15 minutes.  The pool is adequate although there is not much of a shallow end for younger swimmers. Food and drinks are available in the pool area.  The in-house restaurant is well styled with a good menu, TV, darts, pool table and a good bar. The breakfast buffet is tiny and the food was poor quality. WiFi is available throughout the hotel.  The main reason people come here is for the location "near" the Disneyland parks, but this is not the Holiday Inn near the park. That is the Holiday Inn At The Park in Anaheim. There are also plenty of hotels closer to the park offering

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July 2006 and 5 nights in September 2005.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I couldnt find any fault with it at all. Its is close to Disneyland and has a frequent shuttle service to the park.

Summary Heading: Reception Staff a little abrupt but very clean
Summary: We stayed at the above hotel for 6 days from July 7. The hotel was very clean and the restaurant staff were very good. If you are an Aussie though you might find that the front office staff find it hard to understand you so slow your speech down a bit. Also don't bother booking 'wakeup calls' the phone is never answered.  The shuttle service is good and cheap. Remember to catch Route H. The towels also never seemed to be at the pool. Our room was very quiet. Also ask for a room away from the freeway. We required maintainence to fix our air conditioner and they were very prompt. All in all what we would expect from a Holiday Inn.

We stayed 5 nights at the Holiday Inn, and loved it.  I researched many Anaheim hotels prior to our trip and found that this one rated highly in many reviews.  We were not disappointed! The staff was very friendly and accomodating.  We requested adjoining rooms for our 2 families and they went out of their way to do it. The rooms were very clean, the beds comfortable, fridge was very useful, the air conditioning worked so well, and quiet.  Outside noise was never a problem. The pool area was large and visually appealing.  After a long day at Disneyland the pool was a comfortable place to be.  Towels at poolside were a problem only one day and hard to come by.  The rest of the time it was fine.  The cabana was nice as it served cold drinks and some food.  A good thing since the

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August and were very impressed. The rooms were clean, spacious and well equiped, the on-site restaurant was fine, the transport to Disneyland was crowded but serviceable. The hotel pool was slightly overcrowded, but that is to be expected at the height of summer. There was a Deli which was always open (great for buying drinks and snacks) and there was a gymnasium which was also very well equiped. Overall, I can't fault the Holiday Inn Anaheim.

We stayed at this hotel June 16 - 20th. I will have to say that this hotel compares to many hotels that charge twice the rate and its better than a lot if not most of them. Starting off it is extremely clean, I mean spotles. The hotels decor is much like you'd expect from much more expensive hotels. The staff was freindly. The room itself was great, especially the bathroom with its walk-in doorless shower. Another little extra is they stock an excellent shampoo ,not the cheap stuff most hotes have. It had an in-room safe which was good and the decor was modern and again the room was spotless. The beds were comfortable.The only little complaint I had was their aren't any queen beds, just doubles. That is because the rooms are a little on the small size.We had real  glass juice

I just came back from Disneyland. I spent 6 nights in this hotel with my family of four (me, my husband and my 2 kids - 5yrs and 2 yrs). I go to check the other's comments from trip advisor before I booked this hotel. Thanks tripadvisor!! As I know this hotel a little bit far away from the park, we rented a mini van from hertz and there's a GPS system. It's very convenience to us. The bathroom is so clean and I like their tile floor but there's no fan in.So you need to open the door when we had a shower. I was in one of the disneyland neighbornood hotel last year. I found they put the carpet on the sink area and it's so dirty. The room size is average but they had so many storage space such as a big closet and a storage cabinet. Our room is on 6th floor. We didn't turn on the

I spent 4 nights and then a single night at this hotel. Front desk staff friendly and it was nice to be remembered when I stayed the second time. Hotel foyer & rooms very clean. I stayed in both a King single and a double room.. the king just had a shower the double a shower and bath. Both with a fridge which was very handy. Newpapers available in the foyer.  There is a small gift shop that has snacks and drinks (great for midnight snacks) There are no shops near this hotel but without a car the front desk were more than happy to call a cab which arrived within 5 mins. There is a Target near by to stock up on bigger supplies. The shuttle to disney comes every 20 mins- the ''H'' shuttle and passes can be purchased at the front desk. From disneyland you can connect to the 'L'

Summary Heading: We picked this place based on the reviews and were very dissapointed
Summary: My wife and I recently travelled to Disneylnad for vacation. We booked a room at this hotel as a part of the vacation package, based largly on the recommendations on this website. Unfortunatly we were extremely disappointed with the Hotel.   Here is a brief summary of our complaints. 1) Poor Customer Service-  We made our reservation for a room with a King Bed. When we got there we were told that we could only get a room with two doubles. The staff of the Hotel treated us like we were idiots and did nothing to resolve the situation, We asked if we could be upgraded to a higher room and pay extra, but we were told that nothing was available. My wife was even told that we could not get a king bed because, "We were staying in the Hotel too long." (4 nights) We were very

This hotel was perfect for our Disneyland vacation.  The rooms were clean, the pool and hot tob were great, the fridge was really useful for fruit etc., and the staff were very helpful and accomodating.  When we had booked a double bed by accident, the staff at the front desk had no trouble relocating us to another room with a single for no charge.  From our room, we had a beautiful view of Disneyland in the distance, and the pool right beneath us.  The rooms were also very quiet, we never heard anybody around us.  My only advice is to be careful in what denomination you bring traveller's checks.  The front desk will only cash $100 per room per day, and this presented a bit of a problem for us.  Overall, fantastic hotel and I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

We were in Anaheim for a convention and the hotel location was great for anything we wanted to do in the area including Disney.   Clean rooms and common areas, nice pool and the staff were very helpful.  We will stay again if the price is right.

Over the years i have stayed in alot of hotels all over the world and most have been in hot countrys and these hotels have had pools (important in my opinion) and you come to learn that these wet areas go through a cleaning process were a member of staffnets up debri and scrubbs the sides, well that isnt the case hear, the pool and hot tub were disgusting with a build up of scum on the wall sides every day a man would come around and fill a cup up with pool water add some chemical to the cup and that would be that, we didnt once witness any cleaning of any kind for the 2 weeks we stayed, the reason i am telling you this is because mid way through the holiday my wife lost her hearing in the left side but we had heard of swimming pool ear before and thought that given a few days

We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in April and this hotel is the perfect base for your Los Angeles holiday. Located near disney, the Interstate 5 (for Universal Studio's & Sea World) you can't find any fault with this hotel. Nice size pool, basketball court & gym, this hotel has everything you need away from disney. Being our 3rd trip in 3years this hotel is a pleasant change to some older hotels that now could use a facelift.

Summary Heading: Great affordable alternative to the resort hotels
Summary: My family and another family spent one night recently at the Holiday Inn over a Saturday during Spring Break and thought that this was a great value for the money.  I am super picky about cleanliness and this hotel way exceeded my expectations.  It was clean, the service from the front desk was great,check in was smooth and they accomodated our request for non-smoking connecting rooms.  There is a good sized fridge in the room, tons of cable channels, including Disney, Nick, TLC, etc., and the bathroom was good sized and had plenty of towels.  Kids went swimming in the large heated pool and really enjoyed the spa. The food was really good at the restaurant on site and kids eat free.  Overall, we had a great time and for the money ($82 for a Saturday night), I'd take this any

Summary Heading: Adequate - Better for families with older children
Summary: We stayed at this hotel from Mar 19 - Mar 27/06.    Caution to parents of young children ... the water from the faucets is boiling hot.    1) Location - The location to Disneyland is not within walking distance for young children.  The ART system is not adequate for this hotel and the amount of people using it.  Although is says it comes every 20 minutes we once waited up to 50 minutes for service and part of our party had to wait for another bus because ours was so full.  This hotel is also the last drop off point for many of the Coach USA tours and Disneyland Express so be sure to add an extra 1/2 to hour to the length of your tour.  2) Food - The hotel meals are adequate since there are no other places to eat close by.  Great Kids Menu. However, it would be nice if they

April 2006 Member, Calgary, AB, Canada  Just got back from a vacation to Disneyland, Las Vegas and Palm Springs.  Check into the Holiday Inn Anaheim - Resort Area with wife and daughter.  Stayed for 4 nights on the 9th Floor.  Good, clean, frendly hotel.  Have stayed with Holiday Inn Maingate before but found it dated, crowded and old.    Although it is a little further away from Disneyland, it was good because it is more quiet and away from those busload of tourist that are always more stressful to deal with.  Considering the location, it is ideal as it is close enough but not too close for too many busload tourist (unless you like those crowd).    Did not try the restaurant as we were always having food at various locations.    Highly recommended and will stay again if I do go

Summary Heading: Clean, New and Quiet, But Know Your Buses
Summary: This was a 5-day, 4-night stay in late March 2006 for my 13-year old daughter and me. I'd been to Disneyland many times by car, but this was my first as a fly-in visitor over multiple days. (By the way, Orange County/John Wayne/Santa Ana all refer to the same airport.)   On a budget and knowing that some hotels in the area were getting old, I wanted one that was newer, clean and safe, and not necessarily adjacent to the park. Judging by Trip Advisor's photos and ratings, this hotel was the best value. We paid just $356 or $89 per night, including taxes, through ----.  The "Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area Hotel" is located about 2 miles SE of Disneyland on Manchester. It's a 9-story property, slightly upscale, with tropical landscaping and a large outdoor pool shared with the

Summary Heading: Adequate hotel but far from D-Land and ammenties
Summary: My family of 3 aged 5, 3, and 6 months just returned from Disneyland where we stayed at the Holiday Inn in Anaheim.  There is only one restaurant in the area within walking distance and it is the hotel restaurant.  Service was slow and unreliable.  I ended up tipping the busboys instead of the waiter or waitresses. For every adult meal order two children can eat free off the kids menu.  This was the only bonus of this restaurant.  Food was alright but not great.  A few times, I was questioned when claiming the kids eat free meals and needed to produce my Holiday Inn room key.  This was after spending three nights in the hotel and restaurant already.  During breakfast one morning, I ordered the buffet.  I had one plate and decided to grab a pre-packaged yogurt and as I was eating

We were at the hotel from March 25-Apr. 1st and it was great. We had a "Kid's Room' which was super as not only did it have bunks but a single bed so you could actually put 3 kids in there. We have two (11 and 12) and they loved having their own TV and access to Nintendo games!! We loved the jacuzzi as it was a bit chilly and warmed our bones!! The restaurant is quite busy on wkds. (understaffed) but it is a great deal!! The kids could eat from the kids menu or receive whatever the cost of a kids meal was off the ADULT menu. We ate there for breakfast but tended to eat near Disney for supper as we were on site (Denny's... Ihop.. Tony Roma's, etc..) Shuttles are never there exactly every 20 mins as they say but the wait was never too long. Bottom line... a good deal for a family

We booked a family Disneyland trip at the last minute and this was the last hotel available, which made me a bit nervous.  I consider myself a bit of a hotel snob as I have travelled a lot for business and stayed at some very nice hotels.  This hotel EXCEEDED my expectations.  It was absolutely spotless, so clean in fact that I had not worries about my 13 month old crawling everywhere and anywhere on the floor.  The hotel service was exceptional, we were able to easily change rooms to a kids' suite part way through our stay, and they were very accomodating when we notified them that the GameCube that was supposed to be in that room was not there.  The kids' menu in the restaurant was popular with our boys.  The only two neutral points I would make is that it's not walking

I booked this hotel with our Disneyland package.  Our friends stay there all the time and I'm glad we did too.  Friendly staff, the food was great in the restaurant.(I wish it was open longer in the afternoon)And the Anaheim transit came ever 20 to 30 minutes. The kids loved the pool.  We had a standard room.  It was perfect not too small.  and a great price.   thank you. We will be back.

We visit Disneyland often but had never stayed in the Holiday Inn Resort.  The reviews here were generally good, and the nightly rate I got was awesome.  The hotel is very clean, the rooms fairly large, the bathrooms very, very nice.  We got a "Kids Suite", which is basically a large room with a free-standing "fort" inside.  In this colorful fort was a bunkbed, a desk and a TV.  Our kids loved it.  I was disappointed that breakfast was not included.  When I asked about it, I was told that our room just didn't get the free breakfast!  I have no idea if it was because of the type of room, the rate, or what.  I did appreciate the small refrigerator; a microwave would have been a great, family-friendly addition.  The weather was quite chilly, so we never used the pool, but the

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my husband and teenage daughters.  The rooms were clean, spacious and nicely decorated.  The receptionists were always helpful. There is a shop next to reception which has a few essentials. There is a shuttle to Disneyland which costs $3 per person.  We decided to go by car just incase we wanted to leave early etc. ~ parking is $10. We didn't eat at the hotel, mainly because there are so many restaurants in the area where you can get breakfast specials etc.

My first impression of The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort was that it is probable the cleanest hotel I've ever seen.  Absolutely spotless.  Even the halls smelled good.  If only my house could be this clean.  Very impressed with the housekeepers.  The hotel was sold-out every night (we were there for 6 nights).  It was filled with young families, which was great because we have 3 kids of our own.  It was so quiet we could'nt even hear a sound from a room full of kids next door.  My kids loved the pool and the basketball court. This is a GREAT hotel for families.  It's definitely one of the nicer hotels in the Disneyland area.  Most of the hotels around Disneyland are dumps!  There were only a few things to warn you about.  Don't even think of checking-in early.  As mentioned, it was

Being from Texas, we size up everything, including service.  After reading a few bad reviews on trip advisor regarding hotels in the Anaheim area, I booked the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort.  I read it was fairly new and thought to myself "at least the beds won't  be wornout".                                  Well, guess what?  I have nothing but PRAISE for this establishment. I have to brag on the housekeeping staff at the hotel. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable,& the  sheets were changed as often as requested. All service requests were answered within minutes.  Everywhere I turned the place was immaculate.                                        The front desk personnel were superb. We were in and out at all hours and the staff were always professional & friendly

We booked this hotel on short notice when we got some cheap flights to LAX.  I figured the price was right and your usually ok at a Holiday Inn.  Rooms - big, clean, mini-fridge and coffee maker were great.  Lots of storage space.  Big bathrooms.  Restaurant - average, comparable to a Denny's.    Shop - small, but has some snacks if you got hungry, and a microwave too.  Location - about a 5 minute drive from Disney, but hop on the bus and it takes you right there.  For us, it was actually a great location as it was further away from the hustle and bustle of Disney.  It was also next to the Greyline Bus depot(where the tours start and end) and also a car rental company.  Service - This is where the hotel stood out for me.  We arrived after a long delay in Montreal, and our

Summary Heading: Good choice - would stay here again
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights in February 2006 as part of a tour group.  The hotel is great - good location (transport to downtown Disney from right outside the hotel, journey takes around 10 minutes). However there's not much to do within immediate walking distance of the hotel.  Rooms, althought slightly small, were clean and nicely decorated.  Staff were friendly and extremely helpful.  Pool area was great and there's also a good gym room.  For the price this is a really good choice.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again.

We stayed here from the 12th of Dec. to the 22nd and it was fantastic! We checked out all the reader reviews on here beforehand and we were prepared for a "less than great" hotel. We were amazed at how people could complain about this place. We paid 69.00 a night for a kids suite through AAA and were pleased to discover that the hotel charges 149.00! We had two of the kids suites as we were travelling with extended family and both rooms were clean and great. The bunks in the kids suites are narrow but were sufficient for our 4 and 13 year old. One suite had a tub in the bathroom and the other had one of the snail type shower stalls. Nice little fridge and cupboard area to store stuff we picked up at the local grocery store and saved a lot on eating all our meals out. There is a

The hotel is very appealing from the outside and inside 1st look is great as well--Room size is a little small and bathroon is a decent size with and interesting shaped non-bathtub shower....Mini Refidgerator was great ....Shuttle to the park was quick and efficent...Hotel front desk staff very personable...the resturant on site  had decent food but service was terrible...took forever to receive order, get check,  kids eat free is great if you decide to eat in the resturant.

This hotel was OK. It looks fancy. It is too far from Disneyland for our liking though.  We stayed in a kids suite. It was great to have bunkbeds, but they are smaller then twin beds. My kids are 10 and 7, and they found them really small. It was nice to have the tv and game cube though!! The blankets on all the beds were really uncomfortable. The bathroom shower had such high pressure, it hurt!  The shower curtain was also too short, so water always got all over the floor. Housekeeping was OK, some days better then others. There was a mini fridge, but no microwave. The restaurant here is really good. The breakfast buffet is great. Kids eat free, unless they get a buffet ($3) with the purchase of an adult meal. The food was really quick, really good, and service was good. The OJ

I booked this hotel on Orbitz because the rate was outstanding at $68/night, and because it received positive reviews from TripAdvisor, but I had no idea it would be this nice! I just got back from a 4 day, 3 night stay (Dec.15-18). It was almost four-star quality for what I think is a two-star price. We stayed mostly for business around Orange county, but with one day of fun at Disneyland, and found the proximity great. The hotel looks very nice from the street, which is always a comforting sight (especially for the wife who leaves the hotel hunting up to me). The lobby is sharply designed and welcoming. The desk help is professional, courteous, and quick. The room was the best we've stayed at in that price range by far! The bed was nice, and there was a stylish and comfortable

After reading all the reviews we arrived prepared for poor service and overall we were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel itself was great.  New property, crisp clean white sheets, towels etc...Great pool, ATS pickup right out the front door, Free laundry.  What more could you ask for $68/night??

We stayed here for 10 nights and had a great time. We booked a kidsuite which gave us extra space, and the kids loved their bunk beds and xbox with free games rental from reception. The pool area was clean, staff were friendly and the restaurant prices were reasonable especially with the kids eat free deal.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but we experienced poor service
Summary: Holiday Inn, Anaheim, Manchester Avenue. I was told my reservation was cancelled, and then offered a room at rack rate during the busy NAFEM show. After protesting and producing a confirmation, the reserved rate was (reluctantly) honored. The location is not bad, as it's a comfortable walk to both Disneyland and the Convention Center. Not too much nearby, as it faces a highway. The hotel restaurant always had a line, even though we noticed many empty tables. The rooms were clean, cozy, and efficient. Hallways nicely maintained. We consider ourself seasoned travelers, and are very loyal to Holiday Inn because of their strong Priority Club promotions. Frankly, we were never treated so unprofessionally by any staff at any time, in any other hotel.  The bad experience at check in

Concerned reading feedback on hotel before we left. Very, very surprised when we arrived. Nice rooms, good food, friendly staff. We stayed in three hotels on our trip including two very expensive five star hotels. To be honest this hotel was by far the best value for money!!!! £250.00 for six nights, fantastic.

Summary Heading: Great Room,Great service, Better than expected
Summary: We had a great time staying here ! The kids suites are nice ! the kids loved the bunk beds..The only thing was we thought the kids area was a little room in the suite but it was an area instaed. The Holiday inn was great in everyway they get you anything needed, we had a sick child on the night we got there and they helped get his clothes cleaned and us comfortable.

Stayed at Holiday Inn from the 17th - 23rd Sept, 2005 and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The rooms were very clean and cleaned thoroughly  every day, the pool was excellent, the resturant was better than we expected ( going by what some people wrote) which lead us to summize that some people are VERY hard to please.  (I wouldn't have the buffet breakfast though, for the cost and can get a better breakfast off the menu). We noticed that this resturant got an award in 2004 for Excellence which I don't imagine they give out just for the sake of it.  Our only grief was that not all the staff on the Lobby desk were welcoming and the cleaners ignored you. It is a good half hour walk to DL etc and they have "H" buses that run every half hour (not 20mins as advertised). If you want to go back
