Much in line with other reviewers, I think this is a good hotel - ideal for a few nights when you're either stopping in LA briefly or for a long weekend.  It's in a good location and has clean, large rooms, FREE car parking and helpful staff.  Considering you're normally in Anaheim for a full-on week of theme parks and shopping, what more could you ask for in a hotel?  Good - recommended.

This hotel is not fancy, however, we found our room to be very clean and the staff to be friendly and helpful.   This hotel is not within a comfortable walking distance to any of the Disney parks. You can, however, get a shuttle right outside of the hotel directly to Disney. Just be sure to get your shuttle pass at the front desk before you wait for 20 mins. and then be turned away because you don't have a pass.  We have read that many people have complained about road noise from a neighboring freeway. Yes, we could hear it, but we did not not find it to be overbearing. We slept just fine every night.

Stayed in 3 hotels overall on our trip to the States and I have to say that this was the worst of the three - however it was also by far the cheapest.  I guess you get what you pay for. Firstly the positives: the hotel was very convenient for the I5 - the main route into "central" LA it took about 40 minutes to get into Hollywood for example which considering the traffic problems that blight LA was very good; the staff were excellent and we had no trouble with the cleanliness of our rooms or the attentiveness of the front desk and finally the pool, contrary to other reviews, was never crowded or rowdy in the four days we stayed there. However there are a few negative points: the restaurant that is attached to the hotel is very poor and quite expensive - you need a car to check

We arrived @ 3:20 pm, room was still being cleaned, finally received keys @ 4pm.  Hotel lobby was filthy, room was filthy & smelled of kitchen grease from restaurant below, pool area again was filthy.  We actually had to clean a table prior to sitting down, meanwhile cabana employee sat there watching us.  Beware where you park your vehicle, sprinklers need adjusting, our car suffered horrible water spotting after being parked for three days.  Overall maintenance on this supposedly "new" hotel is very poor.

Our stay was ok. However, the maid service was lacking in our experience. We partially made our beds in the morning so we could pick up a little and get organized for the day. The maids never made the beds the rest of the way. Towels were hard to come by(family of five we need more than two-four towels). The bathroom didn't appear to get cleaned while we were there. The room was cleaned well enough before our arrival but not much service while staying there ( we stayed four nights). The carpets were stained. When I called for towels it took 2 hours to get them and a couple of calls. If you don't mind picking up after yourself during your stay this hotel will work for you. I didn't use any of the other facilities because we spend all our time at Disneyland.  The transit system

Me and my girlfriend visited this hotel June 18-24 2005 and it was perfect!  We had a room with a king size bed and the room was very large and so was the bathroom.  There was more than enough space.  The staff was very friendly and it only took us about 5 minutes to get checked in.  The maid service was excelent no matter what time we left the room for the day.  The room was very clean and very new.  I read all of the reviews of this hotel before going to it and the people that give it bad reviews must never be satisfied with anything.  There is no highway noise at all (the people who complain about that must have very very sensitive ears) and the air conditioners are not that loud.  I never heard anybody else through the walls either.  This place was great expecially for the

My family stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area June 11 - June 16, 2005.  The website says the pool is heated.  I don't think so!  The water was freezing.    Reviewers talked about the loud air-conditioner.  I didn't notice it was loud since I would fall instantly asleep in the wonderfully comfortable bed.  The pillows were also very firm and nice.  The sheets were so white and clean.  I know what the other reviewer was saying about mold in the shower.  There was line of mold that stayed inside the shower all week.  I waited it out to see if housekeeping was ever going to clean it.  The lighting in the bathroom was very adequate.  The Anaheim Resort Transit to Disneyland was extremely slow.  The trams were supposed to run every 10 minutes, but the three times we used the

My family stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area last year.  Because we enjoyed our stay so much then, we returned again this year in May.  The location is terrific, the staff is friendly, and the hotel is quiet and very clean!!  The shuttle to Disney is excellent so we did not need to bother with driving.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Anaheim.  Its location is convenient to the highways, and it is away from the noise of the Disney area.  It is a great place to stay for a comfortable vacation.

This was the best hotel for the price.  We got the 5th night stay for free and this included transit to Disneyland.  Our room was spotless.  I dont understand the picture posted with the mold since we had a large walk in shower with no tub and we were told all rooms only have showers.  The only downside was that we requested a king bed and we got 2 doubles.  The pool and hot tub were great with fun music playing.  The service was good, everyone was nice except they gave us wrong directions to the grocery store and we ended up somewhere "interesting".  The hotel is quite new and everything looks very nice.  We would stay their again in a second.  It is close to the freeway but we could hardly hear it.  It was a good time at the holiday inn.

we really like our stay at this hotel. our room was very nice, large bathroom with king bed facing disneyland so we could watch the fireworks every night. our daughter on the other hand had a room with the kids bunks and it was not worth the extra money it virtually looked at a brick wall a foot away and very noisey from large air conditioning units outside window, you could not sleep at all with window open,so dont recommend those ones at all. everything was very clean the pool was great although the hotel next door did share it, but it didnt seem to busy at anytime. we did not like the resturant at all because of the lack of good service,not once did they get our orders right and waited to boot, and found them rude when we would remind them for the third time that we had not

Family of 5 stayed at the Holiday Inn Resort for 8 days, arrived there at 10:00 am and were allowed to check in even though check in is at 3:00pm, room had 2 doubles which fit all of us,teenager,child and toddler. Bathroom was very spacious the new renovations are done excellently,the staff was extremely helpful re: shopping, taxi's, pizza delivery,other attractions such as beaches. The restarant was inviting, the breakfast is a buffet with a rather large selection, the staff was very nice and polite and attentive considering my children were full of adreneline and on the go all the time and it had some of the best pricing on menu items that we have seen.I am sad that I didnt get to spend any time in the lit pool but the hot tub was great and the children loved the pool, we only

After staying at several Holiday Inns around Disneyland, I have finally found one I will use exclusively. The hotel is new and nicely kept. We stayed in a two room suite which I would highly recommend for families. The Bedroom had a queen bed with the bathroom. The livingroom had a sofa pullout for the kids with a mini-fridge and coffee maker. No microwave though. Each room had its own large TV. The bathroom was large enough to be its own room! The hotel also had free wireless internet access. The restaurant was marginal as was the service there. I have yet to find a restaurant attached to a Holiday Inn that was very good, so no disappointment there. Really no major complaints on this stay.

-mold in the bathroom.  -asked for the manager twice and was told by desk staff that "in a meeting" -dining room very unorganized. food was very good though. had to almost always ask for cutlery to eat the meals

I cannot understand the adverse comments about this place.Stayed there for 6 nights in March and found it to be a great hotel.It is not the most luxurious hotel in the area but if you want luxury,pay luxury prices. Staff were very helpful,rooms very clean and well equiped.The pool and spa area were great for kids and the restaraunt was good value. Request at room at the back as they are quieter as the hotel looks on to the freeway(which makes it very easy to get anywhere quickly from the hotel). All in all a very enjoyable stay for the price.

I have stayed here twice and both times were enjoyable.  I was there on business and requested a quieter location in the hotel and was accomodated.  The rooms where clean.  I noticed many comments on the loudness of the air conditioning units.  I did not have this problem at all.  The units make noise but no more than any other hotel.    Given my tight travel budget this hotel was perfect.  I would definitely recommend staying here if you need to go to Anaheim and are on a restricted budget.  Keep in mind that you are about 1 mile away from the convention center & disneyland.  Thus, you most likley need a car.

We usually stay at the Hampton Inn Suites or Fairfield but made a quick and poor decision to stay at a hotel that we usually don't stay at. The staff was not very helpful. I asked whether we could take in any outside food into Disneyland, and the associate said only a water bottle. In fact, you may take a small lunch in, sandwich, chips, apple a drink (such as a Capri Sun, ie) in the park. They even have a designated picnic area you can have your lunch at. When you have a large family going to Disney, lunch can cost a small fortune. I was told also there was free breakfast for the kids, with a paying adult. (pancakes were $8.00) The hotel was run down, and the rooms were small. The only thing that the kids enjoyed was the free use of the Game Cube.

We stayed at this hotel from July 9th till the 17th, and had a wonderful time.  Our room was more than comfortable, we had requested that our room be in a quieter part of the hotel.  Our window faced Disneyland, so the days that we did something else, we were able to watch the fireworks from our hotel room.  We found the food in the restaurant was good, kids 12 and under eat free,  there could of been more choices on the kids menu.  The shuttle service to and from the hotel was excellent, the staff friendly and helpful, our room was always made up and clean.  It was our first time in Anaheim, and had the best time, we found the best place to eat, it was a couple of blocks from Disneyland called Mimi's, we went there for supper one night with our 11 year old daughter, and it cost

We have just spent a week at this hotel and thought it was excellent, far better than the three star rating it currently has. The only thing it didn't have was internet access, but really, a minor point. The hotel was near a main road but I didn't think the noise was bad, nor was the noise coming from other room. There wasn't a breakfast buffet on offer, but at $10 I didn't think it was worth the money anyway and as far as we were concerned it didn't really matter where the hotel was in the "resort" because the resort was virtually non-existent. Apart from spending every night at Downtown Disney, there was very little to do. Would we stay there again? Definitely. And I would recommend it to anyone visiting that area. 10 out of 10.

We stayed here for 7 nights at the end of Aug and were quite impressed with this hotel.  It was very clean and nicely decorated, and the room was a fair size.  We never found the noise of the Hwy or the neighbors a problem, but the air cond. was a bit noisey.  Its best to get a pool view as that cuts down on the Hwy noise.  The fridge and safe were a nice bonus, and although the laundry room was a mess and not in great working order, it was nice to get some laundry done and for free at that.  My advice is to do it during the day as it is very busy in the PM, and there is only 3 washers and 2 dryers for the whole hotel, and to take your own bleach!  The staff was very friendly and helpful but the resturant always cancelled the buffet breakfast without notice, which was

stayed here for a week in middle of august.beautiful clean hotel with an excellent breakfast.no complaints,thoroughly recommended. dont forget to visit the shops etc at the block complex half a mile down the road, a great place to spend your hard earned cash!
Manager Response: Dear Samab 11  I am so pleased to hear your stay with us was very enjoyable!  It is good to hear that we met your expectations and had a pleasant stay while staying with us.  Thank you again for choosing our Hotel for your lodging needs.   Happy Holiday from Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Sincerely, Christine Lovell

Summary Heading: Awful-dont stay if you want to sleep at night!!
Summary: VERY disappointed by our hotel and holiday - do not advise anyone to stay in this hotel due mainly to: 1.Location - hotel is on the side of the Freeway and therefore very noisy. LA has constant heavy traffic which means that you can not relax at the pool or open your window at night. Hotel is away from restaurants or any form of tourist attraction. 2.Air Conditioning is very noisy - far too noisy to have on! We have stayed in a lot of hotels in USA and have never heard anything like it!! (Obviously the room was therefore stuffy which again made it hard to sleep). 3.No Sound Proofing - walls were modern/ thin cardboard stud walls - we could hear conversations and tv next door all the time. People constantly banging doors shut certainly wakes you up through the night - EVERY

Summary Heading: nice place to stay but less than friendly staff
Summary: My family visited this hotel Aug1-6 It was nice and New , but it also said it could sleep 5 which we did with someone on the floor! anyways we managed. the front desk people seemed put out by special requests like extra towels although we did recive them. the laundry room is gross don't go there!! My kids loved the game room and pool and the maid service was wonderful. I would stay here agian but I would bring a cot.

We stayed here at the end of April.  The room was very clean and the staff was great.  The pool/hot tub area is very large.  We utilized ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) for our trips to Disneyland.  This was great.  The tram comes directly to the hotel, no hassles with parking, dropped off outside the ticket booths.  We ate at the restaurant in the hotel for Dinner and a breakfast.  The food quality was ok, prices were a little steep for what they had to offer.  The donut shop up on Katella was a better breakfast.  If you are in the mood for Hawaiian, there is a great place a few miles North on College.  Next time we go we will definitely put this hotel at the top of our list.

We also stayed here over the 4th, but for 8 nights.  Again, I was swayed by the claim of a "new" hotel.   Bads - Wire closet unit ends not all protected, wife sliced finger; air conditioning either high (very loud) or off; kid suite room was very small, basically regulary room with kid area in place of second bed; kid area frame broken by my four year old (made with staples); "shop" is a couple of snacks and soaps on a shelf; nothing else within walking distance; no microwave; lack of closet/dresser space. Goods - pool and hot tub nice and clean; exercise room looked OK (I was on vacation); kid's thought kid area was cool; kid's own TV; cleaning service was good; plenty of parking. Misc - This is not the easiest place to get to as its on a one-way street (basically an onramp)

We recently stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights over 4th of July weekend.  We chose this hotel because the website said that they are a new property.  When we arrived in town via John Wayne airport we were given incorrect directions twice by the front desk staff.  After an hour of confusion (it is normally a 15 minute drive) we made it to the hotel.  Upon arrival we were given a room right in front of the elevators even though we requested to be as far away from them as possible (not that big of a deal though).  Our room seemed small, cramped and old.  The comforter had holes in it and it looked and felt dirty.  The air conditioner was extremely loud and woke me up everytime it turned on.  The maid service was not the best either.  We had children in our room (which can get a

Returning home for a visit, we decided to stay at a hotel that was both close to the freeway as well as Disneyland. Being that this hotel was fairly new, we decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised by the clean room, spacious bathroom, nice pool area, Disneyland shuttle service, and great price. Compared to the older, smaller, more expensive hotels closer to the park, this place is the only place for our family to stay in Anaheim.

We stayed at this hotel for 7 days. I really liked it. The only problem was that on the non smoking floor which we were staying on, there was a person smoking in the next room. I had to request twice to move rooms, the first desk attendant sent a person to check it out and he said it was coming from the bottom floor. Not so. It was our neighbor.  Anyway, we eventually moved to another room and it turned out great. Plus the old room was facing the buses in the back, so it was a little noisy in the early mornings.  Overall I liked the hotel. I got free parking, newspaper, clothes washing (needed to buy soap $1) and the restaurant was very good.  The front desk was very helpful and very knowledgeable in giving good directions. I wish the location of the hotel wasn't on a one way

Summary Heading: Terrible service, less than honest, condesending attitude!!
Summary: The front desk service was really bad and actually short-changed me by giving me a standard room when my company booked a suite for me. When my other colleagues checked in and asked to see my room did we realised that I was alloted with a standard room. When I went back to the frontdesk to ask, they claimed ignorance. I threatened to complain to Holiday Inn International whereon they immediately reverted that I am entitled to an upgrade. I refused to take it and asked for the price difference to claim from my local travel agent.   They were also very condescending when talking to me on the day I checked in. As I was also advised that breakfast was provided for the stay, I asked if this was the case but they claimed that it was not in the package. Only when I read the hotel

Summary Heading: Loved the Stay @ Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area
Summary: This was our first time to Disneyland. Everything was great. The stay at the hotel was wonderful. Used Getawaytoday for our travel arrangements. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was very spacious. The room had a nice sized closet with a wall safe. It was nice to leave things at the hotel and not worry. The pool and jaccuzi area was very spacious and clean. The kids eat free under 12 helped save a few dollars. The food was good. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland. DON'T EAT THE PARK FOOD! at any Disneyland food places over priced and poor quality.....

This hotel is a great place to stay. Other than the one rude, and very unhelpful front desk clerk working late the night we arrived ,our stay was wonderful.The rest of the hotel/restaurant staff were excellent.The shuttle was convenient, and ran every 20 minutes.(It was free with our fun sun package).The kids also eat free in the rest.This was a bonus, but not a huge selection on the menu.The hotel is kept very clean.The pool area is nice and big ,and was never overcrowded in the evenings.Staying away from Disneyland park was a good thing for us,it was nice to get away from those thousands of people after a long day, and relax in the peaceful atmosphere of this hotel.The hotels by disneyland are almost built on top of each other.(looks very crowded)This was a great choice for

I stayed at this hotel with some relatives for 6 nights and I cannot describe how nice this hotel is. The front desk clerks were so helpful on a number of times I just could not believe it. This is a newly built hotel about 1 mile away from Disneyland with shuttle service to and from for $3 a person. Though I did not use the hot tub and pool my relatives did and were extremely happy with it. Well lit rooms, beautiful bathrooms, clean hallways, just very, very nice. All this for $85 the first thre nights and then at the bargain price of $62 the remaining nights. If you can make do without staying directly across from Disneyland and donn't mind doing some driving or taking the shuttle this is the place to stay. I just wish my stay at the Sahara in Las Vegas was this nice.

Stayed here from the 1st April to the 7th April. Hotel was very clean and well appointed. Great place to stay for kids. The Restaurant downstairs could offer more variety for breakfast. Would stay again.

We just returned from our 5 night stay at this hotel. The staff was excellent - especially Josh at the front desk! When we had an unexpected small emergency - he came through for us! The room was fine (kid's suite a little smaller than I imagined)and the shuttle service was great. I would stay here again.

We just stayed here this week on 4/16 2004 and were very happy with the hotel. Was confusing with all the Holiday Inns so near to eachother and we accidentally went to the wrong one first. But once we got to the right one we were amazed at how nice the hotel was for the inexpensive price ($64). We really enjoyed the pool area (nice pool, hot tub, and bar area. Also liked the shuttle service to Disneyland ($3/person for the day - kids were free) which came frequently and drops you off right at the entrance to Disneyland.

We read reviews on this hotel and actually cancelled our reservation at the Candy Cane Inn because this hotel looked good and was a reasonable rate....BIG MISTAKE!We checked in and unpacked and then headed to Disneyland. When we returned (at 10 p.m.) we discovered that the deadbolt on our door was broken as was the sofabed (my daughter sat on it and fell thru to the floor). When the maintenance man came to fix things, he wondered why we were even in the room since it was currently on the "do not rent" list because of its problems. We were promptly moved to the identical room one floor up. We repacked our suitcases and then unpacked them again in the new room. We pulled out the sofabed and there were no sheets on it at all. Also, there was a large dried up spill in the

Summary Heading: Service with a smile at the Holiday Inn Resort Anaheim
Summary: My husband and I stayed here on Aoril 7th, 2004.  After we checked into our room, we noticed that the flush lever to the toilet had been broken off so we went back to the front desk to ask for another room.  The front desk apologized and gave us an upgraded room which was much bigger.     At the time that we were there, their pool's heater went out, so a majority of the adults and children congregated to the hot tub.  I would advice guests to eat at an offsite food establishment because their food was not worth the price.    The shuttle service is great, taking us right to the front entrance of Disneyland.  I would stay at this hotel next time   we go to Disneyland.

Just finished my vacation @ Anaheim and we stayed at this hotel between April 3 to 6. The hotel is excellent in terms of comfort and environment. The room is new and its size is adequate. The room doesn't have bath tub but we won't use it anyway so shower is fine for us. We didn't bother much about the service but others seemed to enjoy the pool. Basically after whole day @ Disneyland we just became so exhausted and a TV with lots of channels (and it does) will put you into sleep quickly. Unfortunately they didn't have Internet access and you could either go to the Visitor Center near Disneyland or.. there's free access @ the hotel next to it. If you don't drive a car, you have to take the shuttle to get to Disneyland. But unless you just live opposite of Disneyland you may need

Stayed here 4/3 - 4/5/04. This is the hotel on Manchester - not one of the two (older HIs) closer to Disneyland. THIS hotel is new and next to the Staybridge Suites. Manchester is a one way street and this is a little hard to find if you don't know the area and have a less than great map like we did! Nevertheless, it was worth finding and is only a 5 minute drive to Disney. Front desk staff were a little less friendly/enthusiastic than I'm used to, but got the job done. We had a regular room with 2 doubles, quite fine for 2 adults and a child.  Anymore than that and we would have felt cramped and needed a suite.  Staff honored our late sleep in one morning and even though we did not leave the hotel until 2pm, we came back to find our room cleaned. The hotel has room service and

front desk was rude and impatient, bathroom had holes in wall and brokn shower racks, smoke detector was broken from wall hanging out with wires sticking out of wall, shower head not working either...definitely would not recommend this hotel

Nice place. Everything is new and very clean. We stayed in a kid's suite which had a walled off area with a kid's size bunk bed, small bed (i.e. sleeps 3 kids) with their own TV. Adult bed was a full but we're small folks so that was no problem. Shuttle stop to Disneyland is right in front. It's about a mile to Disneyland. We got to check in early (room available) which was a bonus for us. I'd definitely stay here again.

My family spent two days at this hotel for visiting Disneyland from San Diego. I booked this one because I heard it is new, clean and comfortable from the reviews. It is ture. It is new, clean and convenience. It provides free wash/dry (you have to buy detergent $1.00), but the laundry room is stink. Because it is so close to I-15, it is quite noise to me, but my wife thought it is ok and my son has a good sleep too. Overall, it is a good hotel to stay given the good price ($59).

My husband , myself and two children stayed at this hotel in Jan. 2003.  We loved it! The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The fridge was awsome for keeping beverages cold and the bathroom was huge. The pool area was spectacular for a holiday inn and the hot tub was very big therefore not overcrowded. Staff was excellent and recommended good shopping areas and things to see. Also the free transportation to Disneyland was a bonus. I am a travel agent and have travelled alot and I would highly recommend this property.

The Holiday Inn is a very nice and clean hotel!! The free shuttle to and from Disneyland was great and convenient. The free use of the washer and dryer was awesome. Although, if you decide to stay here be aware that check-in time is at 3pm and not 11am(the time we arrived at the hotel). They did offer to keep our luggage in storage, so that was good. Also, the nearest store is about a 10-15min walk and the hotel faces the highway. Overall, the hotel was great but the location was so-so.

I stay at quite a few Holiday Inns during the course of the year and this one is by far one of the very best.  Excellent staff, very friendly and helpful, above average food for a Holiday Inn, and very clean rooms.  Only negative comment is the bar by the pool was not open once while I was there.  If you are visiting Disneyland...it is quite a walk, however, shuttle service is offered for a very minimal fee.  Highly recommended!

This is a great hotel to stay at.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful.  All anemities were clean, and in working order.  It is very handy having an in-room safe.  The staff offered to hold our luggage until we were ready to leave in the evening, Our only complaint is that the 1 block description is deceiving.  They are VERY long blocks.  It took a 15-20 minute shuttle ride to get to Disneyland, but at least the shuttle was offered, and they were always courteous and on time.

We chose the Holiday Inn because we read it was a new property and I am after clean sheets especially when travelling with kids!  The hotel was nice.  However, for a hotel with 200 plus rooms it was odd that they only had one microwave (at the ground floor) and only one floor (9th floor) has washing/dryer machines (free though).  But I ended up staying till midnight doing the laundry since a lot of people were using the machines and one wasn't working (there were only 2 washers and 4 dryers for the whole hotel!). The Alamo restaurant had good food but pricey. Bkfst though was average (eggs, cereals) buffet for $8/person (kids eat free).
